Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property In A Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DoctorHank
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! It's a cliche, but it describes this classic, luxury hotel. Close to the train station, shopping, restaurants, bars, parks, and gardens -- you can't beat it! This is a beautifully appointed hotel with a somewhat formal atmosphere, both in decor and service. The rooms are a nice size with appropriately deluxe bathrooms. Attention to detail is evident in the spotless rooms and bath. In general, the room was attractive and comfortable. In terms of decor, the lunch area near the bar is not to be missed. Covered by an amazing dome of stained glass, with a central area of flowers and plants, and beautifully furnished, it was a constant object of photographs. The bar itself is cozy, beautifully appointed; it is a bit formal in terms of service, and was on the expensive side. Nevertheless, it was a very comfortable place to relax at the end of the evening. My only disappointment was the staff. While efficient and helpful when engaged, there was a lack of warmth and friendliness that I enjoy in a fine hotel. Interaction with staff can be the extra touch that can make a hotel stay memorable for me. I missed that at the Westin Palace. In summary, this is a beautiful, classically decorated and run hotel with a superb location in Madrid. You can not go wrong staying here, especially if you enjoy a subdued, formal atmosphere. I imagine I am just more of a W Hotel oriented guest.

Reviews.Title: “City opulance”
Reviews.Author: AYHS
Reviews.Content: Good location-walking distance from main Plaza,park,shops & many other attractions. Fabulous entrance & amazing atrium area for sitting & eating under the stained glass dome. Premium King size bedroom was clean & spacious but lacked any sort of view as it was on the inside of the triangular shaped building-all you see is walls & other peoples rooms. Staff were friendly & courteous. Good choice of different foods at breakfast, bar extremely pricey-best to go out for dinner & drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Does it get any better than this?”
Reviews.Author: Yellow_Mzungu
Reviews.Content: Does it get better than having a view of the Neptuno Fountain Plaza to wake up to and to go to bed to at night, changing colors on you? As well, there was a parade and a fireworks display in the city. Across the street is the Museo Thyseen Bornemiza, and across the other street is the Prado. If you've been a little exhausted by all the museum walking, take a quick nap back at the hotel. The hotel itself oozes of royalty. From grand rooms, to having wonderful buffet breakfasts inside a copola that must have had a few grand balls many years ago. Afternoon tea brings out world travelers and Madrid's elite in a bit of wonderful star gazing. We saw a number of movie stars having a drink while we were there. The wine store inside the hotel is absolutely incredible, and a place for wine lovers to delight in. They have the full gamut of Spanish exclusive wines at cheap prices. The only single disappointment was that the roof top bar was closed while we were there, probably because it was a little cold (for the Spanish, not us Canadians), and there really wasn't a spa per se that was functioning. The service in the hotel is amazing. They accommodated many little extra things that makes this a typical Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, would definately return.”
Reviews.Author: redpeter_10
Reviews.Content: As a central location for a cultural city break it would be very difficult to top the Westin Palace in Madrid. It sits right in the middle of the cultural triangle of the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia Museums/Galleries. The hotel has lots of tapas bars and restaurants within a very short walk, some of which are exceptional (try Estados Puros for great, unusual tapas) but the restaurants within the hotel itself are excellent (if not a little pricey).The Plaza Santa Ana is only a short walk away and is buzzing with bars and restaurants, especially in the evenings. Our room was overlooking the busy main road/roundabout but the traffic could not be heard, except for the occasional police siren. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable but a little too soft for my personal liking. Staff were very friendly, helpful and polite and everyone spoke such good English that I didn't get chance to practice my Spanish. Altogether an excellent hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: taxidiataltys
Reviews.Content: What can I say, ALWAYS Starwood!!! It never disappoints... the beds are heavenly!! Don;t miss the Sunday Opera Brunch, a little pricy but well worth it. Great location, wonderful staff and impeccable service!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel to stay in while in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: boddicker52
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Westin Palace Madrid, and the property lived up to the expectations. The location is outstanding, the property oozes history, and the rooms are very nice. They have 6 free computers to use off of the lobby, and the staff are very helpful. We used the Metro to get there from the airport, though in hindsight, the airport bus is the way to go (due to having to switch trains twice with the Metro). I don't know if I would have been thrilled paying the rack rate, but using SPG points and cash was a wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: islamanare
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our two adult children from the 11th to the 16th of April. The most attractive quality of the hotel is definitely its location in front of Plaza Canovas del Castillo or better known as the "Neptuno fountain" plaza. As you step out of the hotel you find Museo Thyssen Bornemiza to your left across the street and the Museo El Prado to your right two blocks away. Very close to the hotel is a Starbucks and a convenient store "VIP" where you can eat -breakfast, lunch or dinner - shop for fast snacks, buy a book or grab some toilletries if you left anything behind before you left home. The kiosk that faces this two establishments sells the best street map you´ll ever find to tour Madrid on your own. The rooms we reserved were one with a king size bed and one with two twin beds. Both rooms were very comfortable, beds are awesome, save box, mini bar, complimentary bottled water every day,flat screen tv with channels in spanish, english, french, german, arabic. Bathrooms are also comfortable. The staff is very nice, helpful and hard working, rooms and bathrooms were spotless. The only complaint would be that there is no free wi-fi in the rooms; connection is charged by the hour or by day (16,50 euros per day; 1,50 euros per one hour). They do have an open connection in the lobby. The restaurant is beautiful, the service is superb and the food is ok (around 42 euros per person). We had a great time and felt as vip guests all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in a great Madrid location”
Reviews.Author: Brandie_in_Boston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights here in Madrid in early April. The hotel is in a very good location in downtown Madrid near the Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum (among others). You can also easily walk up to Sol and many of the main tourist attractions in Madrid. We arrived around 10:30 am and were able to check in to our room right away. Our room was quite large and a big bathroom with a double sink and separate tub and shower. The room was also very clean and quiet It was admittedly a little run down - and that was surprising to me given the class of the hotel - but nothing that really bothered us. Our room type came with free wi-fi and free bottled water everyday which was great. Another plus is that our room faced the street where the Good Friday procession took place. We were able to hang out in our room (or rather squeeze out a seven inch opening onto a french balcony) to take photos of the procession. It was so crowded down below that we never would have been able to see what was going on if we hadn't been willing to wait a few hours in the cold for the procession to begin. Lastly, on our last day we in Madrid we took the Renfe train to Barcelona and it is an easy 10-15 minute walk to Atocha station. All in all I am pleased that we chose this hotel and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: vbailey2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Easter week 2012 and could not have been more satisfied. The location is excellent, the staff are extremely helpful and pleasant, and the rooms are amazing (especially if you get upgraded to a suite, like we did!). It was clean, comfortable and just lovely. The hotel is close to the Prado Museum, just a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream”
Reviews.Author: MaineDish
Reviews.Content: My experience with the Palace far exceded my expectations. The hotel is lovely and the atrium is so beautiful that I never wanted to leave. The hotel staff was exceptionally courteous and went out of their way after we missed our flight home to accomodate us and even sent us a fruit basket and lunch. The food in the hotel was fabulous, especially the breakfast. The location is perfect and so much is within walking distance. Love love love this place!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location but expensive breakfast and expensive wifi”
Reviews.Author: gardkarlsen
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Madrid during Easter of 2012 and to stay at the Westin as it looked like a good location and I hoped to get some advantages as I have a SPG (Starwood Preferred Guest) card. After some price comparison, we booked plane tickets and hotel in one go using travellink.com and we had to pay 16.000 NOK (2700 USD) for the flights and 6 nights at the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at about midnight – the hotel is located between the Prado museum and the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum so very well positioned. The taxi ride in from the airport only takes no more than 20 minutes and costs about 23€ - additional costs for airport, day of the week and time apply. The Westin is an elegant historic hotel built in 1912 and the sign still says Palace hotel outside. Check in was fast and we got room 630 on the top floor (6th floor). The problem with old hotels is that they are not necessarily equipped to handle modern expectations – like there are stairs leading up to the reception, steps leading up to the lifts – not that practical when you are dragging along a big suitcase. Although there are staff on hand to help carry luggage to your room. The room was pretty inviting when walking in. There are light tiles on the floor and a huge mirror on the entrance wall. From the small entrance the room opened up and here there is beige/light carpet and light yellow/cream colored walls. The view was not that great as we had windows facing into the courtyard – looking down on the large glass dome on top of the dining room. If you stay here during Easter, try and get a street view room so you can catch the Holy Week procession on Good Friday. The room was equipped with dark furniture – a desk and chair, a cabinet for the 32” flat screen TV and mini bar (where a coke cost something like 7€), a small table and a bigger chair and a bed. The queen sized bed was firm but quite comfortable. Along one of the walls there were three doors which revealed the wardrobe with enough hanging and drawer space, an iron and ironing board and a mini safe (which included space for a laptop and a plug to charge it while storing it). The TV had quite a variety of channels but the menu system seemed to make it a lot slower to start, change channels etc. We had some problems with the air-con when we were there. April in Madrid was quite cold in the evenings. When we had the air-con on it got too cold in the room (there is no display for choosing the temperature) and when turning it off the room got a bit stuffy. The rooms are not very well sound insulated either – we could easily hear people talking when walking past our door. The bathroom was impressive– quite large with a combination of wall paper and tiles and with two sinks in marble finish. There was a bathtub with a shower option which worked out pretty good. I normally don’t like shower curtains but this had a curved pole which prevented the shower curtain from sticking to me when taking a shower. There were also two shower heads with good water pressure and hot water. There were standard amenities like shampoo, conditioner, lotion, mouth wash but no shower cap (which baffled my wife). There was a small separate room (separated from the rest of the bathroom with a frosted glass door) with a toilet and bide – separate toilets are quite a good solution in my opinion. We had some issues with the telephone and it took 4 different calls to reception to finally get a technician to fix it – he ended up replacing the phone. As I mentioned earlier, the location of the hotel is very good. It is located right next door from both the Museo Nacional del Prado and El Museo de arte Thyssen-Bornemisza and it was only a bit more than 500 meters to walk to Puerta del Sol and just over 1 km to Plaza Mayor. Let us talk about some of the stuff that I was not that happy with. When I booked the hotel I was hoping to get some perks with my SPG gold card but that was not the case. When checking in I knew that breakfast was not included so the receptionist said that they had a promotion for breakfast for 22€ and I said that I would think about it. My wife and I talked about this and next morning we decided to use this “promotion” but it turned out that it was 22€ per person and we could not only do it for one day – we had to do it for the entire stay. Charging 22€ for a breakfast is totally over the top, in my opinion – I normally just have some cereal and fruit in the morning and I think it is annoying that you still have to pay for the entire buffet. That said – the breakfast is great here. You have an excellent selection of cereal, fruit mixes, good quality juice, eggs made the way you like, healthy options – and even some local specialties like churros. My recommendation is: go around the corner to buy your breakfast at VIPS or Starbucks. The breakfast area is also mentioned in guidebooks and we saw a number of tourists stopping by to admire the dome. There was no coffee/tea option in the room but there was a note saying that you could get this by calling room service – and they would only charge 4.50€ as a delivery charge! In other words: it is cheaper to walk around the corner and get your coffee from Starbucks. Another thing that annoyed me about the hotel was the internet situation. Having access to the internet is getting more and more important as it is a great tool for planning a stay in a new city, booking restaurants, looking at maps etc. More and more hotels are offering this for free (e.g. Traders and Shangri-La chain that I also stay at) but this is not the case for Westin. They wanted 16€ per day for access to the net which is totally insane in my opinion. I think it is one of the perks you can choose when you have a SPG gold card but I think the rules states that as I booked it through a third party, they didn’t offer this to us. SPG also argues that they have free wifi in the hotel lobby but this is a 256K internet connections and who wants to sit around the lobby whenever you want to check something online? I have stayed at Westin hotels in Asia too and it has been the same there – even when staying on business levels the internet is not included. I usually end up buying a local SIM card to get online (you will need your passport to get one in Madrid). I hope that SPG hotels soon realize to move with the times and introduce free internet. I don’t want to seem petty and complain a lot – but the internet and breakfast issues actually annoyed me quite a bit. I guess they figure if you can afford the hotel you can also afford to pay a lot for these services? Conclusion It might sound like I’m very negative to the hotel based on what I have written above but all in all the Westin hotel is a great traditional hotel with reverend façade, ballroom etc. The location of the hotel is great as you can walk to the most important museums in minutes and you can also easily walk to the most important squares of Madrid. The room was pretty well laid out and it is a nice mix between the traditional and the modern hotel. I have given feedback to Starwood about my annoyances – it is great of them to respond to Tweets. If you are going to Madrid and need a 5 star hotel with a good location you should look into staying at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: jogrine
Reviews.Content: Good location close to central Madrid sights. Warm friendly staff, always helpful. Good concierge service. I was here with my two teenagers who were unhappy no wifi in rooms, but access in lobby area. Good restaurant and bar

Reviews.Title: “Conservative luxury”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Dates: 30 March-2 April 2012 Webb: www.westinpalacemadrid.com/ Internet: Not free and very expensive Style: Classic large Luxury hotel Situation: Excellent location next to Thyssen and Prado museum. 5 minutes to Retiro park. Plaza Mayor about 10 min. Service: Top quality although a little stiff Room: 442, Executive   Description: Large (29 sqm), belle epoque style and tasteful, desk, table and chair, TV, minibar (expensive), small balcony but door only opens 10 cm, iron/iron board Bed: Excellent as well as pillows Bathroom: Good size, bathtub with shower.  Amenities: Very good Restaurant: Gourmet but very expensive Breakfast: €35. Plenty of nearby alternatives including a Starbucks around the corner Bar: Beautiful but prices 4 times more expensive than other bars Facilities: 24 hrs modern gym. Terrace (balcony) with sun loungers (not open during our stay) General: A traditional classical Gran Luxury hotel. It's very well maintained and service top notch. It’s a conservative atmosphere. Due to the very high prices in bar/restaurant it is not crowded. But it's a very large hotel. Our room was as far away as possible from the elevator so quite a walk. To get to gym/sun lounger area bit complicated and a walk. If you like the belle epoque style it's great choice. Stayed here with Starwood points which was an excellent and very comfortable deal, but there are many modern/design hotels in Madrid which style is more to my liking (i.e. ME or Hospes).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: medicalalert
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at the Palace for four nights ( wish it would have been more!). Gracious and attentive welcome from the front desk staff who accommodated an early check-in with an upgraded room. Housekeeping was already moving an extra bed into our room by the time we got upstairs. The room was large, very quiet and luxurious (super-soft sheets, comfy mattress, and high end bath products). We had several meals in the hotel - every meal was above-average. Breakfast at this hotel is without question, the best breakfast experience I've ever had. A beautiful space rich with history staffed bt attentive, gracious and sophisticated servers make the experience. The food was great, but the experience is one that will always be the standard for others to try to meet. It's very expensive, but well worth it! The hotels's location is perfect for tourists. It's a 2 minute walk to the Prado, 10 to the train station, and the many plazas are within a few minutes walk. Perfect for experiencing a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a pleasure or business trip to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: drosen85
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two-day trip to Madrid where I stayed with a number of colleagues at the Westin Palace. While not a luxury hotel, it is certainly every bit first class. I would absolutely recommend the hotel for either a business trip or while on vacation. I reserve five stars for only the very, very best luxury properties and this is a solid four using that scale. Here are some things that might help you decide to stay at the Westin. Check in was easy, my room was ready (at 8:00 am) and was upgraded to a bigger room with a top view – I am a SPG Platinum, so I’m sure that helped. One thing that we did do at check in was request to add breakfast to our rate. At 22 Euro, it was significantly less than if we would have gone to breakfast without the add-on. (Do it!) My room was very nice. King bed, very modern bath, flat screen TV, plenty of plugs. Very large by European standards. Advice – ask for a room with a fountain view. It’s faces the street, but I did not hear any traffic noise. The location is fantastic. A short walk to the Prado, the Museo Regina Sophia (definitely see that) and the Plaza Mayor. Everywhere we wanted to go, we could walk. Finally, that 22 Euro breakfast. Worth it – especially if you are hungry in the mornings as not open in the mornings in Madrid. NB, there is a Starbucks around the corner if you need a taste of American coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: MargaretBarber
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, the staff were very accommodating. The rooms were nice and clean, and the hotel was very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: mattw1960
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace was perfect, great location, fantastic service, nice comfortable room and terrific buffet breakfast. We arrived Saturday am non stop from Dulles and went right to the Westin Palace, got in our upgraded room on the 6th floor @10am. We walked every where and went for runs in the park both mornings....just terrific! Thanks CJ at Amex Travel for recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: traxnyc
Reviews.Content: Gracious hotel in a great location close to everything. room was comfortable, well appointed and service fine. Concierges knowledgable and friendly. Food and drink in hotel somewhat pricey, not unexpected, but atmosphere is nice. Our breakfast was included and the buffet is fresh and expansive. I would recommend this hotel to others..one complaint... Internet is pricey if you're not spg. Otherwise, great hotel, great service and a location that can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Town”
Reviews.Author: anksharma
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice, once on business and once with family. Simply put this is the best possible location for Madrid as a tourist. It is across the street from the Prado and the Thyssen Bornezema. 5 minutes to the Atocha train station in a taxi or metro. 12 minutes to the Puerta Del Sol, and 15 minutes to the Plaza Mayor and Mercado San Miguel. It is maybe 20 minutes to the heart of La Latina. It is a grand old hotel with fully updated rooms with great bathrooms and plasma tvs. Wifi works well here. The buffet breakfast is pricey but elegant and great for choice. The ballroom they have it in is spectacular and a great way to start the day. There are many great Bars and tapas joints within 5 minutes walk. There is even a Starbucks built into the front side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “The best most comfortable stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSergio
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, well equipped rooms with outstanding service. Great restaurant in the hotel too. Housekeeping staff goes well above and beyond. Loved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable, traditional hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: MCCCO
Reviews.Content: Great location for museums and a short walk to the central shopping area. Clean and comfortable with great food. A bit pricey for a holiday hotel but an excellent choice for business.

Reviews.Title: “Pure class with central location”
Reviews.Author: Doug161
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March to celebrate our wedding anniversary. On checking in we asked for a room with a front view and we were duly obliged. The bedroom was a decent size but the best thing of the room was the view to the front and amazing beds. For $4000 you can buy the full bed and bedding! Breakfast was a treat in an amazing room with huge coppula . Everything you could want to eat they had . The hotel is so central , literally minutes from Prado Museum , shopping , parks , squares . All very easily walkable from the hotel. Concierge were helpful and organised a cycle tour through the local tourist information centre in Plaza Mayor. Only down side was drink costs and snacks in bar . We paid about €80 euros for 2 sandwiches and a few drinks , seemed over the top.All in all though I would recommend this hotel to anyone staing in Madrid who is looking for a 5 star hotel. If going back I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: kht53
Reviews.Content: This palace just celebrated its 100th year... and it's still grand and elegant and clean and new and very, very nice. The restaurant under the huge, ornate glass rotunda is an incredibly lovely setting... an incredible place to start the day with an impressive breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and upgraded rooms”
Reviews.Author: UHredneck
Reviews.Content: For SPG members this property seems to always have at least a Jr suite upgrade available. The bathrooms are updated and the furniture is in good condition. Typical Westin bed set up

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for visiting Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Roseweb
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for museums and restaurants. Lovely beds, fair but expensive breakfast. Free business center web connection and free spa usage. Overall a fine choice, better location than the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: balkanmomma
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early March for several nights. I had used the SPG points and cash option to give me a nightly rate of $60. When I checked in, the lady at the front desk said, "We are upgrading you at no charge." I couldn't believe it. You can imagine my dismay when I went to the room and smelled cigarette smoke. Someone had definitely smoked in that room. I went back downstairs and the woman gave me an equally nice room on the same floor. She apologized profusely. I still couldn't believe I was getting a super nice room. The staff is lovely, especially the staff on the SPG floor where I stayed. I couldn't justify spending money on the expensive breakfast so I missed out on that. (I stayed here two years ago and splurged on the breakfast once back then.) The hotel is near everything I wanted to see: Prado, Queen Sofia and Thyssen. Plus it's a quick walk to Sol and almost anything else you want to see in Madrid. The restaurants on the street where the guest entrance to the hotel is are great for the most part. I will stay at this hotel again without a doubt and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AJ0nes
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel's location. A short walk to all the interesting points in Old Madrid, including the Prado. The hotel itself is old fashioned grandeur, done best in five star hotels in European cities. The lobby area is surprisingly small, but the staff are courteous and helpful. We did not eat here (I thought €75 per person for Sunday brunch was a little steep) but we did drink in the bar. Again, prices are not cheap, though the staff were helpful and attentive. The room itself was well appointed, although small. Our room overlooked the Thyssen-Bornernisza museum, but we did not find it too noisy, even on Saturday evening. I would not hestitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, yet double standards”
Reviews.Author: sr4cr9
Reviews.Content: I am a long-time SPG member with a vast track record of staying at many Westin's worldwide. This specific reservation I booked thru Priceline as it was a last minute trip I managed to procure at a price much cheaper than the SPG sight was offering. Upon arrival they did not allow me any of the perks I would have received as a Platinum member and they must have given me the smallest room in the hotel, treatment I have never been shown at any other Westin or SPG hotel in my life. In general the treatment I was shown throughout my stay was not at all up to par for a Westin by any means. There were others being shown the red carpet but the minute the girl saw that my reservation was thru Priceline it was as if I was a second class citizen. Strangely, when I pulled out an American Express Centurion card to pay my bill when we were leaving the girl checking us out suddenly became really sweet and started to ask me ever so politely if i enjoyed my stay and if it was my first time at the hotel. I ignored her question, took my purse and promptly left with my carry on. I rather stay at the Mirasierra where they treat you like you are the only one in the hotel, even if I am not in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “A little taste of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Lily099
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palace hotel on a short city weekend break at the beginning of March. We found the Hotel easy to find and as we drove up to the front, the concierge arranged for the car to be parked for us. Check in was easy, but the room that we were originally given was not prepared for us - in fact I think someone was still using it! However, they could not have been more apologetic and upgraded us to the most beautiful suite. What a fabulous room - massive bed, beautiful fixtures, dressing room, large bathroom with toiletries and luxurious towels etc etc etc. The bar and lounge area are just beautiful ! Jolly expensive and so I would recomend that you only have a drink here as a taste of luxury or if you really cannot muster the energy to walk out to the city !! Breakfast was probably the best we have ever experienced - you could not ask for more! Massive choice and range of food. We bought the hop on hop off city tour bus - this is definitely the best way to get your bearings and see the city - we then used it as our transport around the City and saw most within 2 days. We were surprised at the value for money of Madrid. An evening meal of Tapa's and wine and beer and coffee came to £30 - brilliant! The city does not really come alive until gone 10pm and then it is buzzing. The bars and restaurants are all of good quality and most of the people very accomodating to our lack of the Spanish Language. The Hotel is very central to everything but do get a good City map to help you find the best places to eat / drink. The concierge was brilliant and gave us good advice as to where to eat and shop. We loved the food and drink market, but did not enjoy the Sunday market which was full of cheap rubbish - probably made in China / Taiwan! There are some not so nice areas in Madrid but do see them during the day as it is quite enlightening !! I would recomend a weekend visit to the City - it is exceptionally good value for money. The Palace Hotel is reasonable - we booked with Easy Jet for the flight and Hotel - 2 nights including a car, for 2 under £400. It was lovely to stay in such a beautiful, luxurious and historic hotel. We did feel as if we were in a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKonthego
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is second to none - moments from the Museo del Prado and the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum and a short stroll from Puerta del Sol, where some lovely tapas bars can be found. The room was small but very elegant and was lovely and quiet. The Heavenly bed is perhaps a little too soft for my liking but that is obviously a question of personal taste - I nevertheless slept well. Breakfast was really tasty and varied; especially the coffee and the staff was friendly at all times. Check-in and out staff was also polite and very friendly. Overall a great stay and I will certainly stay there again should I go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to perfect in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Rich1984
Reviews.Content: The Palace Hotel is located a short stroll from so much in Madrid, from the museums to the Royal Palace and Madrid's shopping area. The front desk was helpful with directions and requests, and when a routine maintenance check left us without water in our bathroom for two hours, they promptly sent plenty of bottled water. Overall, a great experience. Note: The rooms are pretty small; we were upgraded to an "executive" room which was still pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but let down by avoidable faux pas ...”
Reviews.Author: Londonsense
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located very close to cultural attractions like the Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza, close enough to the nice Parque del Retiro (very convenient for a morning jog), and relatively close to the bars and restaurants around Plaza de Santa Ana. I was upgraded to a premium deluxe room, which was spacious and nicely furnished. On the less positive side: a few of the handles were missing from bed cabinet drawers, the door of the armoire did not shut properly (so the inside light would remain on) and the flushing mechanism of the toilet worked only so often. A proper maintenance of the room must not be a priority. Slippers are not provided (only on request) and the bathroom amenities are well below average for this kind of establishments. The acoustic insulation is not great, therefore you will easily hear your travel companions returning to their rooms after their festive night out. The hotel provides a decently fast internet connection, buy you will have to fork out an absurd amount of money to sign up (€16.10 per day is not really a “nominal fee”, as claimed in the hotel documentation). Additionally when trying to connect my iPhone I was offered the choice to buy a second access. It might be that when you enter your details you can connect without paying a second time, but I did not want to push my luck. There is only one power outlet at the desk, therefore you will have to decide if it is more important to keep the lamp on, charge your PC or your iPhone. Finally the room service offering is outrageously expensive, and a €5.50 delivery charge on top of that is simply crazy. There are two nice places less than 100 metres away, Taberna de la Daniela and Cerveceria Cervantes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: La_D0lce_Vita
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace Madrid is a gorgeous hotel in an excellent location. Within walking distance are all the main sites: the Park, the famous museums, various bustling plazas for shopping, eating and enjoying an ice cold cerveza or delicious roija. The hotel itself is gorgeous inside; especially the atrium with a stained glass dome ceiling. The front desk was helpful as was the concierge service that we used several times. I had a restaurant recommendation from a friend and asked the concierge to make the reservation on our behalf. They did so and sent me an e-mail to confirm. I would definitely suggest staying at this hotel for your next trip to Madrid whether it is for business or pleasure. The price was right too. The rooms are nicely appointed. The bed is extremely comfy with lots of puffy pillows. The bathroom was large too and there were also robes provided. This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and would gladly recommend it. Only negative would be that the Wi-Fi is not free. Good restaurant for tapas is Lateral. Make sure you go to the market past Plaza Mayor- it is crowded but all the various tapas stands are incredible. Viridiana is a wonderful place for a fancy dinner out on the town within a close walking distance of the hotel. It is expensive but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Madrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigDogDaddy31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights this past week - an absolutely amazing hotel directly in front of the Fountain of Neptune (Plaza de Cánovas del Castillo). Virtually all of the other reviewers have been spot on with their comments. I will echo two points, though - the first is that the hotel lobby is (surprisingly) small for such a grand hotel, and the elevators do not reach it (they come down only as far as the 2nd floor - the 1st floor to non-Europeans). Therefore, if the bell staff is not assisting you with your bags, they need to be carried up about 15 steps to the room elevators. This can be a challenge after a long flight and/or with heavy bags. Also, while the rooms that overlook the Fountain have a great view, it gets VERY noisy late into the night and also very early in the morning, due to the traffic and the fact that the local Starbucks is here. If you are a light sleeper or wish to sleep in (past about 6am), you might want to choose a different room location. All in all, still an excellent choice for a luxury hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: arlupo43
Reviews.Content: Since our arrival, front-desk staff was attentive and kind, trying to give us the best room possible. Great hotel, nice room. Very good breakfast buffet. Just consider that this is a very big -although quiet and private- hotel, so corridors are long and you have to walk a lot. Arriving to the gym is also very far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rain_in_Spain30196
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location. We really loved Madrid and a big part of it was the Westin Palace. It was an amazing hotel. I highly recommend the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Clemsongal42
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here, you can't beat the location in Madrid. We were able to walk to amazing places to eat plus see everything we wanted to see in Madrid in a short amount of time. The room service was great, they have an all night menu that is a life saver for those of us suffering from jet lag. The bar was a great place to start and end the night. The rooms are very comfortable and you can always count on the Westin bed to be comfortable. The only reason I took off a star is I do feel it is time to update the carpets in the hall and in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Madrid hotel in great location: outstanding restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Gato188
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Palace four nights at the start of an 18-day self-drive holiday in Spain in late January 2012, choosing it on the basis of its location and our expectations of a Westin. The location is unbeatable for anyone who wants to be at the heart of old Madrid and within walking distance of major sights. Mere minutes away, literally across the street from the hotel, are the Prado Museum (a 650m walk); the Navy Museum (450m); and the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum (250m). The Palace of Communications (550m); Reina Sofía Art Centre (1km); and Royal Palace of Madrid (1.7km) are slightly more distant, but easy and interesting walks. Our room was basic and unremarkable by our experience and expectations of Westin and of five star hotels generally. It was well sound-proofed from Madrid traffic, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom adequate. We were surprised that no tea or coffee-making facility was there when we arrived, but this was swiftly provided when we inquired. The gymnasium was adequate. Staff throughout the hotel were courteous and efficient. The standard of cleanliness was high. Promotional room rates were acceptable value for money. The one outstanding and most memorable feature of the Westin Palace, apart from its location, is its Rotonda restaurant. This is not only a beautiful restaurant venue, centred on an elegant colonnaded stained glass dome, but it also has the best buffet breakfasts and lunches we experienced anywhere in Spain. Sunday brunch was phenomenal. The quality and presentation of tapas alone in the Rotonda's buffets puts many specialist tapas bars to shame. The Rotonda's waiters are consummate professionals who with genial courtesy maintain the highest standard of unobtrusive service. We like the Rotonda so much that on our return to Madrid in February, when we chose to stay in an apartment, we walked back there every morning for breakfast. We looked at the Ritz across the Paseo del Prado from the Palace as a breakfast option - and went back to the Westin's Rotonda.

Reviews.Title: “Woww!!!”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights in early January while on a business trip. First, the staff is top-notch, from the bellmen and reception staff, to the housekeeping team. Everyone bent over backwards to help us with every little request. Second, the lobby and small bar area are beautifully appointed and very comfortable. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but it looked lovely from what we could see.

Reviews.Title: “Feel being a king”
Reviews.Author: CoolPilot
Reviews.Content: It is not a hotel, but a king palace. Everyhing is excellent and luxuous. Design of interior is very rich and beautiful and it totaly matches old times king atmosphere. Breakfast in grand hall is amazin, besides od perfect food there is classical music. Rooms are big, comforable and of course made in great style. Location is central, there is Musem Prado near, Opera and many others objects to visit. I was totally happy staying there, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMBcn_12
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the hotel but it was great. The room was fantastic and the lobby is just great. I love the location as it is so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: atw100
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace has a fantastic location, across the street from the Prado and Thyssen museums, and an easy walk to major squares in the center. The rooms are large and tastefully done, and the bathrooms are spacious and modern. The hotel treats its guests with great care. If you are more used to Four Seasons hotels than Westins in the US, you will not be disappointed. Try to get a junior suite, which is really more of a suite, with pocket doors closing off the nice living room from the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: Acwtall
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good, room clean but could do with an update. Major reason for hotel choice was location and it didn't disappoint - more or less everything is walkable

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, old world hotel with charming service to match”
Reviews.Author: NoMapNoWorries
Reviews.Content: Had a delightful three night stay here last weekend. Staff were attentive and incredibly friendly - from the man at the door, the dining room staff, to the cleaners - everyone was amazingly helpful. Had a twin room in the third floor. Well furnished, clean and comfortable. Shower was amazing, beds were perfect, and all thoughfully designed. The gym on the top floor is the best hotel gym I've used. Well-maintained cardio machines with tv, new weight machines, full free weight sets, plus magazines. Great view over madrid when doing cardio. Makes a workout seem to go quicker! Buffet breakfast is great. Well cooked warm offerings, plus great fruit, yogurt and pastry selction. Also had indian/asian options and deleicous chocolate and lemon tea shots. Well worth the 34€ in my opinion. The bar serves only classic drinks, but they are spot on. Fantastic way to wind down after a hectic day in madrid, sipping cocktails under the hotel's stunning domed glass ceiling. There is also a good business centre with six computers and free printing. Location is fantastic. Right across from Prado, 2 mins to Thyssen, less than 10mins to Reina Sofia. Also good walking distance to Plaza del Sol and walkable to La Latina, Palace and Plaza Mayor. Madrid is a compact city. Definately reccomend this hotel. It has a lot of character and charm

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: mckenzie99
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. Granted, we used our Starwood points and didn't have to pay for our room, but even if I was paying, I would have been pleased. We stayed over Christmas Eve and the hotel looked so beautiful. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (more so than most). Our room was roomy and comfy. We also had a little balcony that looked over the Neptune fountain. When we walked in, we were pretty overwhelmed by how beautiful the lobby was. It's a grand old hotel, but updated nicely. We didn't eat in the hotel at all, but got snacks and sodas from the VIPS in the bottom floor. There was no need for us to spend time at the hotel restaurants and bars when there are so many great places within walking distance. I used to live in Madrid and found this location just about perfect. It was a short walk through the great old neighborhoods to the Plaza Mayor/Puerta del Sol, or to the museums, or even Parque Retiro. I would highly recommend this place, especially if you are there for a short stay and want to have everything close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very very over priced”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel on the 14th to the 16th of february 2012, We found the hotel to be clean and Food at breakfast time very good, That unfortunately is when it ends, The lunch and evening menus are very poor, The bar is very very expensive 1 x beer (in the UK it would be deemed a half pint) is 10 euros And a small bottle of coke cola Is just shy of 8 euros,

Reviews.Title: “Grand old charmer”
Reviews.Author: pwplatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace for three nights and were upgraded to a room looking over the wonderful Neptune fountain because they lost our reservation - turned out to be lucky for us as the view is spectacular and I recommend paying for it if you can. The room had the comfort of a classic, solid, slightly dark grand old dame of a hotel. The lobby and its open restaurant is also a step into history. I could have done without the motorcycles and life-sized girly cutouts in their historic bar, but the drinks were good and the macronas were bottomless, so what's to complain about a little modern schmaltz? All in all, not a five star grand hotel. I hope to try the Ritz next time I go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Classic solid but a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Voyageuse54
Reviews.Content: The MadrId Palace is a great central place to stay. Breakfast served in the beautiful rotunda is great. Rooms are smallish unless you get a junior sites. Facilities are good but ... The rooms are cleaned so that all dirty glasses, used bottles and eaten up complimentary berry plate ( great idea) are not cleared away for days. There are no Cotton buds and very few cotton pads for female guests. Toiletries are generic and bottles small. Towels a bit on the small side. Avoid rooms far from the elevators that require a long walk to get to. It is near impossible to get a newspaper unless you luck out at breakfast. The hotel is busy and big but service staff is up to he task.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: AlanZB
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at lots of good hotels and at the Westin Palace previously but this weekend was my best ever hotel stay. We were given an upgrade by the lady receptionist who could not have been more helpful and we spent the first twenty minutes discovering the extra rooms in our suite. Our reception room was like the Oval Office but more comfortable and possibly more spacious. We had an amazing view of the Paseo del Prado with the fountain and the soundproofing was excellent. The word 'exceptional' does not do justice to this hotel, it's location or the breakfasts. My wife now thinks that she somehow married into royalty and her expectations may have been raised by a notch, or ten.

Reviews.Title: “Sherry loves me”
Reviews.Author: passiveagressive
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace truly does live up to its name.From start to finish this is one fine hotel.When we drove up our baggage and car were whisked away and we were treated to a wonderful experience in the heart of Madrid.The rooms were superb,well appointed and comfortable.The breakfast buffet was second to none and the lounge super relaxing.The Oriental restaurant was a little over rated but I suspect had an off night when we dined.The major problem with this establishment is that it was a little too comfortable so I had a hard time convincing my travel mate to get out to see the sights!!This property has hosted many famous and important personalities,which adds to the ambience, but none more so than my little buttercup,whom I might add did not threaten my well being in the dead of night due to some oversight by hotel staff.Thank-you Westin Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Great”
Reviews.Author: MontVentoux2011
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location close to the Prado, Reina Sofia and the Atocha train station. I read most of the TripAdvisor reviews on this property prior to arriving. The manager allowed us to check in early after an overnight flight. Our room was upgraded and was very nice. The "Heavenly Bed" was extremely comfortable. The reception staff were helpful as was the concierge, Ricardo. We were very happy with our dinner under the rotunda our first night. The concierge recommended the restaurant, Viridiana. I was torn trying to find a great restaurant on my own and Ricardo solved the problem. This restaurant was great! The Westin's breakfast buffet was good, but not a great value. Our room was not worn. The bathroom was very nice and very clean. The maids on the fourth floor were extremely helpful. Last year I stayed at the #1 TripAdvisor hotel in Madrid and this was much better. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas Ever !!!!”
Reviews.Author: martin_9191
Reviews.Content: No words to express how this Hotel made my Christmas the Best ever. Just Great. The best Starwood Property I have stayed at. From A to Z this hotel scores 5 stars in all departments. Highly Recommended for Couples !!

Reviews.Title: “A Must stay!”
Reviews.Author: JaJa_LuRVeS
Reviews.Content: You'll definiely look down at other hotels once you've stayed at the Westin Palace Madrid. This is a gorgeous GORGEOUS hotel and the most luxurious hotel I've stayed by far! The staff are really friendly and speak good English. Some don't speak that well but still try their best to give you the best service one could hope for. Concierge is wonderful and able to help you out in almost anything! Reception is veryinformative and makes you feel welcome the moment they see you. Definitely a must stay! The room is gloriously like a palace!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: PortoSilva
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and located near parks and Museum. I stay 2 nitgh in dicember, ervery think so good, staff, service, room...Tks

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Salome P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace as part of a Travel Agent Booking. Unfortunately it was only 1 night! We arrived late the afternoon and only had time to walk around a bit and visited a few Tapas Bars. Food is excellent, and everybody is so friendly and helpful. The Hotel is beautiful, and the bed was the MOST comfortable we EVER slept in!! We did not even go out that night, just got into bed early to read and enjoy the soft, fluffy pillows! Unfortunately I cannot comment on the Breakfast or any of the Restaurants in the Hotel, but it IS a 5 star Hotel and obviously the prices match. Still a good, comfortable, beautiful Hotel. Next time we will stay in Madrid longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful breakfast in the rotunda”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. The rooms are quiet and comfortable, the service is friendly and knowledgeable, and the location near the Prado Museum is ideal. We especially enjoyed the spectacular breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smiles4miles
Reviews.Content: I loved the Westin Palace, inside and out! From the moment we arrived I felt like I was part of a special experience. The check-in procedure was flawless, cordial and informative, and the hotel was gracious enough to let us have our room even though we arrived at 10 am. The Heavenly beds were indeed heavenly....so, so comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful with nice toiletries, plenty of hot water and comfy robes. Our room was on the third floor and beautifully quiet: no outside or inside noise at all. A prior reviewer mentioned the room being far away from the elevator but that's exactly what I always request: always! The farther away from the elevator, the smaller the number of people passing your door which gives me the extra peace and quiet I want. The fitness center was well-equipped and I wish I had been able to experience the Asian restaurant at the rear of the hotel. I heard the food was delicious but they don't begin serving until 8:30, which is later than I like to eat. The location of the hotel is absolutely unbeatable: in sight of the Neptune fountain, walking distance to Plaza de Cibeles, across the street from the Thyssen-Bornemisza (great Impressionist/post-impressionart art) and the Prado, and a very, very short walk to the Reina-Sofia museums featuring art by Picasso, Dali, etc. The Thyssen was my favorite of the three and you can grab a bite to eat there too if you are totally enthralled with the art as I was. The Edward Hopper masterpieces alone are worth the price. We purchased Madrid tourist passes online prior to the trip that saved a lot of money but primarily lots of time since you get to skip the lines. This included numerous attractions but one we particularly enjoyed was the Palacio Real Madrid with its fabulous collection of stringed instruments for my musician husband to ooh and aah over. (Madrid Card holders enter in a separate entrance).The palace was close enough to the hotel to walk and enjoy the sights and sounds of Madrid along the way, including Plaza Mayor. Since we stopped so frequently, I'm not sure how long it would take to walk to but probably around 30 minutes or slightly more. Plaza Mayor was fun and believe it or not, Elvis Presley is alive and well in Madrid! We also enjoyed the Parque de Retiro, a very short walk from the hotel as well. The park itself is beautiful and if you love to watch people, this is a great opportunity to see a little bit of family life in Madrid, particularly around the water. If you're interested in flamenco, tap as fast as you can to Corral de la Moreria. (We took transportation since the show starts late at night). I did a huge amount of research on which flamenco show to attend and came up with this one, bought tickets online before the trip and was so glad I did. The talent at this show is unbelievable and not to be missed. When I mentioned to the concierge that we were going to see flamenco, he immediately stated that the best in Madrid was Corral de la Moreria but unfortunately they were sold out and would be unable to get us tickets, so I was ecstatic that I already had purchased the tickets. The place was indeed packed but what a fun experience that we will never forget! The area close to the hotel seemed very safe and we felt very comfortable walking around. There are numerous restaurants close by. If tapas are your pleasure, you will be in heaven....and that's just the way we felt at the Westin too....a perfect stay in a fabulous location!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Nam S
Reviews.Content: Westin Palace is a luxury hotel located walking distance from every major attraction in Madrid. Most of the reviewers have already said everything to be said about this hotel and I would just like to say - if you are planning to be in Madrid, book this hotel now!

Reviews.Title: “Stay for luxury, wow'd by the locale.”
Reviews.Author: Shiva M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is luxury, the name makes that obvious. The staff was super friendly, knowledgeable, and a mix of all walks of Madrid - able to point you to places where all the locals go food, shopping, night life. The locale of this hotel is by far the best crowning achievment. The available cervasrias, musumes, metro, bistros, etc. A definate stay for someone on looking to explore a city.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: susiev8
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, comfortable hotel in a great location....walking distance to the Prado and Reina Sofia and a great selection of tapas bars in the surrounding streets. We stayed on the fourth floor in an executive room which was comfortable and spacious. Best beds! The concierge desk was extremely helpful which is so important in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury (for a price) with a Wonderful Location (for a price)”
Reviews.Author: stacey s
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times so far. While pricey (thus my title) it is well worth it. The staff is European courteous and speaks a multitude of languages, including Chinese dialects and that is not just the front desk, but throughout the hotel. The rooms are spacious under European standards including two wardrobes and double sinks. Views are a little iffy. Many of the rooms have no view, so if you are going for the first time you may want to pay for a view facing the Prado, which brings me to my next point; the location. Whether for business or pleasure nothing is further than 15-20 minutes away and there is much to do within walking distance or a 5 minutes cab ride. There are numerous museums in the area as well as some fantastic food. Surprisingly, some of the best Chinese food my companions and I have eaten anywhere was inside the hotel itself. I recommend the Peking Duck. But, if you are willing to walk 5-10 minutes then leave the hotel entrance and start walking straight and slightly to your left up Calle del Prado. It will take into a sea of restaurants, including some great traditional Spanish food eateries. we loved Taberna La Delores which is in Plaza Jesus. Frankly, we didn't have a bad meal anywhere nearby. we also felt very safe. As we walked around past midnight and the place was hopping. Take note, if you like to run you will love this location. Across the street from the hotel is Parque de Retiro which has some very wide paths. I mapped a run at mapmyrun.com if you want to see a roughly 4 mile run in the park. Lots of security and broad boulevards, or, you can do trail runs through the park. Getting back to the hotel, if you ask, there is a plan that includes a breakfast buffet each day with made to order omelets. Prices are high, but even higher if you eat a la carte. there is also a data plan which I again recommend unless you have your own internet service as the prices for this are also high. The plan includes some additional tv/movie options. The beds are very comfortable and at night there is a turn down service. Complaints: Some rooms are very far from the elevator, so request one that is closer to the elevator. Also, the television system is far more complicated and finicky than it needs to be. If you are looking for a clock, its in the tv. My room did not have a clock radio to set an alarm. Some "American" hotels offer dual power, but this one only offers standard Europe two prong outlets. I bring one adapter with me and an extension cord with multiple outlets.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City -- Greatest City in the World
Reviews.Title: “Very nice property in great location”
Reviews.Author: talent_guy
Reviews.Content: A very well done Westin property in a historic (1911) building in the middle of downtown. Grand public rooms at the entrance give a nice old world feeling. My room was an upgraded king with a great view of the fountain -- spacious with a large bathroom. Everything felt recently upgraded -- no wear and tear was showing on carpets, furniture or walls. Room service was excellent, with relatively broad choices and extremely well prepared food. The only challenge was the pricing, which even if the euro wasn't high, were a bit steep. 25 euros for a burger -- even from room service -- tops what I'd typically pay at a Four Seasons or St. Regis. Doormen to front office staff was great. Room service woman remembered my order from the previous evening and asked me if her recommended dish worked for me (it did!). Overall, a very nice property that's a must stay for Starwood SPG members and highly recommended for everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Old Generation Luxury”
Reviews.Author: HARCal
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! I would definitely stay again the next time I am in Madrid. Great value for the money. Staying at this hotel is like stepping back in time to old world luxury. The rooms are very well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. This is a great place to visit just to have a drink in the bar or the "dome" room!

Reviews.Title: “Fake caviar that tastes like MUD and is sold at extortionate prices”
Reviews.Author: Travelodocus
Reviews.Content: Having a romantic weekend with my partner at what is supposed to be one of the nicest hotels in Madrid. Well, it clearly isn't. Where in the world would you get ripped-off with fake fish roe served as Caviar? We ordered a bottle of champagne and (real) Caviar pretty much at our arrival and before going out for a walk and dinner. To our surprise, we found that it wasn't Caviar at all but some kind of local produce that by all means tasted like MUD. I honestly had to spit it out in the toilet before it got down my throat. I didn't even let my partner try the horrible stuff. I have been lucky enough to have had real Caviar (yes, the stuff that comes from the Caspian Sea, be it Russian or Iranian) pretty much since I can remember, so I had to find some proper produce so redeem myself with my partner (thanks Westin Palace Madrid for making me look like a pr¡ck!). Anyway, it wasn't long before we found ourselves at ElCorteIngles and surprise! We found the real deal and gave ourselves a proper treat well away from the Palace. Not only that but I told of my nightmare with the fake fish roe and we were told by the man at the store that real Caviar is readily available in Spain and especially in Madrid. So it is truly shocking to see that this supposedly high-class hotel serves fake caviar in a country with such a vast 'cuisine culture' like Spain. Appalling! When we asked the staff, they couldn't really bother and were quite arrogant and impertinent and kept insisting that it is the real deal but "produced in Granada" which just added to our frustration - it tastes like Mud so I don't really care where it is produced, it's simply fake, not Legit. What a shameful experience really, being ripped-off and having to explain to them that what they are selling is not Caviar at all while they stare at you with a 'insulting expression' on their faces. Disgusting. Everything else in the hotel is average 3* or 4*, but I simply don't like to be ripped-off like I was so I ain't going back.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: mdculpepper
Reviews.Content: The Westin hotel chain is one of my favorite and this is hotel is on my short list of favorite hotels. It truly has a "Palace" feel to it, a beautiful hotel. Great location, small but comfortable rooms, accommodating staff, nice restaurant (I enjoy the breakfast there the most), Atrium lounge and bar (super place to relax and enjoy tea or coffee). It is very expensive $$$$

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel, six star prices”
Reviews.Author: Feeber
Reviews.Content: We had five nights here recently. They upgraded us to a suite, which was really nice. It's quite a big hotel and the decor is very ornate. The room was kept very clean, although we did have a terrible smell in the shower one day that I called guest services about and no-one came to fix (a plumber could not come for “at least two hours” but then never came anyway!). The cleaners put some sort of liquid down the drain which helped a bit. The bed was very comfortable with crisp linen. We ate in the hotel restaurant a couple of times and the food was nice but in small servings and very expensive. Around EUR100 for two with two courses, one glass of wine. There are a few restaurants around so it’s probably better to go out to eat unless you have a generous budget. There is an Asian restaurant in the hotel too and the degustation menu there was much better value and terrific food too. Having a coffee in the rotunda was expensive at EUR7 and a milkshake at EUR12! The rotunda is worth a visit though, especially in mid morning when the sun lights it up beautifully. Breakfast was around EUR30 pp for a pretty good assortment of hot and cold foods. Kids under 12 are half price. Car parking was expensive at EUR35 per day and you don't really need a car to get around. If you have a hire car, I’d suggest offloading it when you arrive then rehiring one when you leave if you are staying more a few days. The location is great with many places like the Prado, and the Park in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “classy and nicely located.”
Reviews.Author: jinw4672rx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the museums and tour bus routes. It is also a few mins walk away from the busy shopping areas of Madrid. The rooms are classical design with victorian style furnishings but not tacky. I would recommend rooms that are not on the main street as it can be pretty loud in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but very elegant”
Reviews.Author: macalif0rnia
Reviews.Content: We had not been to Madrid in 20 years and decided to over load our senses at this city's magnificent museums, which led us to stay at the Westin Palace. This is an old, perfectly maintained jewel of a hotel located a very short walk from the Prado. Management has maintained the world charm and aethetic such that one can wander the halls or sit and gaze from the antique furnishings and transport oneself back to 1912 or so when the Palace first opened. The ambience was quite conducive to romantic mood-setting. The hotel is within walking distance of numerous excellent places to dine and sights to see. The staff with one exception is very courteous and helpful, especially if your Spanish is not perfect. The exception was a surly and decidedly unfriendly concierge; we negotiated our way around his rude behavior by waiting for the shift change at which time we received assistance from his colleague (Alejandro) more than made up for his lousy attitude. If your stay extends through a Sunday, we would highly recommend the Sunday brunch, which we were told is always accompanied by music. Ours was an hour or so of excellent Broadway hits; earlier, opera was the theme. The food at this buffet was exceptional and more than worth the 75 euros apiece. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro D
Reviews.Content: The Palace offers great location and a fantastic service. Great attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: shinyredcar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located slap bang in the middle of town. You can see that by the amount of coaches and city bus tour buses that are around. The taxi from the airport is 35-40 euros and took us about 40 minutes on a Friday night and 20 minutes on a Sunday morning. The hotel itself is decorated beautifully and the staff were all very helpful. We had breakfast there, which was 34 euros a head, drinks in the bar – 36 euros for a beer and a vodka with orange, and dinner which worked out at about 70 euros a head. It certainly isn’t cheap, but it’s about what you will normally pay in a good, well located hotel. The bus tour is 20 euros per person for one day and you can get tickets at the concierge. We were given a suite, which was outstanding, and the rooms are well appointed and very clean. I was bit disappointed that they didn’t have any non-news English speaking TV channels, but that’s not a huge point. One thing to consider – the roads are probably the widest I’ve ever seen and crossing them, albeit with the plentiful pedestrian crossings, can take quite a while. The hotel is in just about the worst place for having to cross roads and deal with traffic coming at you from every direction. Having said that, I’d thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natalija D
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at this hotel. This hotel has the most amazing, would recommend. Very clean, staff friendly and helpful.The rooms are nice, spacious and clean.The location is fabulous.We really enjoyed our stay at this place:)

Reviews.Title: “Why is the Westin Palace a Westin?”
Reviews.Author: MOZBOB
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Junior Suite, upgraded through my SPG status. The hotel is very well maintained and the Junior Suites are actually proper 2-room suites of decent size with beautiful traditional furnishing and a large bathroom with separate shower. Everything works..............including evening turndown etc. I'm just really wondering why this hotel is flying the Westin flag.........Starwood should really make this a property of the 'Luxury Collection', as that would be much more appropriate! Would have preferred coffee making facilities in the room, instead of having to call for coffee with a delivery charge.

Reviews.Title: “Westin does it again”
Reviews.Author: Zippy22
Reviews.Content: We always appreciate the superior qualities of Westin hotels and this was no exception. Recently renovated, the accommodations and public areas are impeccable, complemented by excellent service and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “We will do it again!”
Reviews.Author: MariaSvenOlovSoneby
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Palace with my husband, was immediately uppgraded by a very nice reception staff. The room was outstanding, the service immaculate, the breakfast delicious, have not enough words to praise the staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid and the Palace”
Reviews.Author: fattyboob
Reviews.Content: If you ever want one of the most special memories of your life, try to stay at the westin palace in madrid...very near the prado which is open every nite FREE from 6-8 pm...you will be amazed at the breakfast buffet each morning...it is spiritual, really...looking above your head at the stained glass windows and enjoying the magnificent food...what a wonderful way to start your day of sightseeing while in madrid...and the concierge is fabulous for setting up day trips...so very much to see and do...a truly magical place...both the westin and madrid...and spain!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: brfk86
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace, a heritage hotel, is located across from the Prado Museum and is walking distance to many sites. The rooms are beautiful with comfortable soft beds. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful, and their recommendations were excellent.Make sure to enjoy a coffee under the stained galss rotunda!

Reviews.Title: “Of all my 2011 travel experiences, I still remember my shock”
Reviews.Author: Jacksmack
Reviews.Content: My greatest memory of last year's experiences was my shock at 25 dollar (US) martinis and $17.50 Miller Lite (imported from U.S. you know) at the bar at the Palace Hotel. Just wanted a little taste of Hemmingway. Got a VERY expensive taste! Lovely bar, beautiful hotel. Drink elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2121212121
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in the Westin Palace in late December with my family. I am a Gold Member and had requested an upgrade when I made my reservation for 2 rooms. We arrived in the late afternoon, the doorman took our bags and directed us the check in desk. We were greeted and given 2 upgraded rooms that were adjacent to each other. Very nice clean rooms and baths with TV that had Pay Per View ( our treat on vacations). The hotel is across the street from the Prado and walking distance to everything else. Great location! All of the service was good. If we asked for extra towels, they were delivered ASAP. We asked about the train service to Barcelona, expecting to have to get our tickets at the station, and the concierge arranged to get them for us. If I were to return to Madrid, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “How could this hotel be poor???”
Reviews.Author: DomandPerry
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night break in this hotel and found it to be one of the best we've experienced. We had a lovely room, the service was first class and the food was lovely. The hotel itself is spacious and welcoming and the staff were very helpful and efficient. Wherever we were - bar, restaurant, reception, concierge desk - we received nothing but courtesy and excellent attention. Madrid is a lovely city, but our break was more enjoyable due to this delightful hotel. The location could not be better as it is across the road from the Prado museum and very close to the main shopping areas. The concierge made a mistake with a tour we had booked and could not have been more apologetic, to the point of providing an expensive bottle of wine by way of compensation which was unnecessary, but greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shile7
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hotel, the service and of course the location right in the city center of Madrid. Just 7 min walking to Puerta del Sol. And the Hotel has the Spanish Congress building right in front. What i like the most is the main room - bar with the big glass cupola, that is just amazing. The room was a bit classic for my taste, I usually like modern style. But can't say nothing bad about it. It's just a matter of taste. I will certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “How "the-other-half" lives in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: D0nTravel
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace is not only a top hotel in Madrid, but a destination place on its own. Its famous "Rotonda" dome lounge has been a staple of Madrid life for over a century. I had been there before for business meetings and dining at the superb Asia Gallery inside the hotel, but never as a guest. So this time I stayed several days and I was lucky enough to get an upgrade as a SPG Platinum member to a suite. WOW! It was larger that my first apartment, and nicer too! My suite was right in the center of the building and had direct views to the Spanish Congress building. A separate living room with dining area, a guest half-bathroom, a large bedroom with en-suite bathroom and a huge walking closet with vanity space. I wanted to move in! The decor is traditional (check my pics) and I understand that they are renovating floor by floor and I was in a non-renovated floor but still looked pretty good, although some of the wall paper was a bit worse for wear. The service was excellent throughout and the only but was that check-in took a long time as many people were waiting and only 2 front desk people in attendance. I saw the same thing happening other days, but I gather that they were very busy. This is a large hotel with over 450 rooms, but it looks and feels smaller. The Rotonda lounge is perfect for having breakfast in luxury surroundings, meeting people, and generally people-watching. Concierge service is not what I am used to in other hotels of this caliber and rather more transactional than informative. But I use Tripadvisor for my recommendations anyway. Room service was very reasonable for this type of hotel and the quality was good and well presented. Location is perfect, you are in the center of Madrid, by the Thyssen museum and the unique and magnificent Prado. You are also in "el Barrio de las Letras", so you have all the amenities you may want nearby like Calle Huertas and Plaza Santa Ana for tapas and restaurants galore. Theatre, parks, shopping and all the bustling of Puerta del Sol right in the centre of Madrid. Best location in Madrid (Hotel Ritz is opposite) Everyone smiles and are there to help you. I felt special. I know that being a platinum member has its benefits but still, I felt the love. I'm going back soon. Highly recommended Don Travel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Old Madrid but..”
Reviews.Author: jno2011
Reviews.Content: First let me say this is a stunning section of Madrid, a city that really surprised me, just a really elegant place with incredible architecture. The Hotel itself is beautiful but understaffed. We had to wait about 30 minutes to check in, and the line wasn't very long. They kept suggesting the rooms with a view of the fountain which sounds nice but was really noisy- there was a drum core practicing for the presentation for the new PM to the royal family on the morning we arrived, needless to say we quickly asked to be moved for the interior courtyard rooms, no views, no big deal. Best decision ever, it was really quiet and restful. Food is expensive, 24 euros for Breakfast per person. No thanks, there is a VIPS and a Starbucks in the same building! VIPS is like a Spanish Denny's but better. I would stay here again there is something to be said for arriving in a really nice hotel with a comfortable bed after an long night of travel packed into an Airbus 380. Yea, that was a whole other issue..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Madrid!!!”
Reviews.Author: friaz
Reviews.Content: We visited Madrid in December 2011 (around x-mas) and I would like to comment how pleased I was with the service provided to me by your team members, Alfredo, Lisandro, Yan Ting and Ernesto and of course everyone in the Business Center. During my recent trip I was fortunate enough to stay at Palace Hotel. Even being a Starwood rate customer, Alfredo made sure everything was good at the time of check in helped us with acomodations at the hotel. Lisandro and Ernesto in Concierge always sugested great places to visit and restaurant and very fluent in English to help us understand and guide us through. This hotel was fantastic! Not only was it an extremely clean and well-maintained hotel - it actually has a lovely interior. The guest rooms were very very clean - they actually even smelled fresh which scores big with me. Plus service all across the board was exceptional. Really friendly and flexible management and staff who made our executives and our corporate guests feel attended to and taken care of. From management, to front desk and banquet/kitchen staff - up the bell boys... this Hotel delivers on service all across the board. Will be back and highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a palace!”
Reviews.Author: bucsonice
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here (December 26-30), and were a little put off by the crowd in the lobby upon arrival at 10:30 a.m. However, the wait was only a few minutes, and check-in was friendly. The best part was that we had been upgraded to an executive suite--I am a Platinum member of Starwood Preferred Guest--and it was ready for us! The suite was spacious and furnished with items that looked as though they might have come from a palace. Yet, the seating in the living room and the bed were comfortable. The wired and wireless internet were both fast and reliable, and the bathroom was beautiful. We did not eat in the restaurant. The lack of a coffee/tea pot is a minus, but there is a Starbucks around the corner if you need morning coffee. The location was also excellent. We were no more than a 15 minute walk from anyplace we wanted to be in Madrid. If you are able to get this hotel using cash and points with Starwood Preferred Guest, grab it! It's still a great value using points, and worth the splurge otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of madrid”
Reviews.Author: aepple_01
