Reviews.Content: My wife and i had a great 4 night stay here. My absoulet favortie thing about this hotel was the concierge got us bull fighting tickes for around 350 euro that were 5 rows back from the ring, it was amazing. its right in the heart of downtown were you can walk to anywere you need to be resturaent shoping etc, we took the subway and it was easy to navagate. the ritz in nere by which looked spotless on the outside so i imange it would also be a nice pick. we went to the park,the measuem, a bullfight, and severy places to eat and had a a great time. we also walked to the train station and took the bullet train to barcelona it was a great experence

Reviews.Title: “Glorious place”
Reviews.Author: Wayne J
Reviews.Content: This was a business stay for me and I wasn't paying (actually don't know what the cost was), but I thought it was perfect. Perfect location, brilliant breakfast, fabulous rooms and ambience within the hotel, and very helpful staff. Location is close to the cervicceria bars, and to the park and galleries.. Loved doing a morning run in the park there, it's a cracker. Planning on going back with my family this year.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury French Inspired Hotel in Cool Madrid Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mgeolina
Reviews.Content: This is a classically designed (ala St. Regis) hotel. All facilities nice, neat and well maintained. Oddly, steps in the lobby require bell service if you have more than a carry-on to lug up. I got an SPG Platinum upgrade to a suite on the inner circle of the hotel. The room was beautifully appointed, although there was an outdated audio system inside. I spent a lot of time on the room, working etc. and being on the inside atrium was nice and quiet, even with the windows open. Add a nice breeze with open windows. Room service was priced as expected for the hotel type. Food quality, selection, service/delivery and presentation all great as it should be. There are many restaurants, touristy and street type shops in the immediate area/walking distance. Walk up the street a bit to get a better price on the taxi. As mentioned in other reviews, I also observed the concierge staff seem aloof and unhelpful. The recommendations I requested of the concierge staff were bad, and seemingly inappropriate for a hotel projecting this level of service. Restaurant recommendation bad, transport to from hotel disorganized as I was delivered a different car than I paid for on the trip to the hotel from the airport, Recommendation for an outside business center with printers were inaccurate and unthoughtful. Sort of like saying "Find a Fedex Office, MAYBE they can help you." I noticed the lead concierge was wearing a gold concierge key on his lapel. He didn't deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but sub-par staff”
Reviews.Author: Luke O
Reviews.Content: Great location, 3 min walk to the Prado Museum. Rooms are okay, maybe a 4 star. Good size for European standard, Concierge is not helpful at all, and sometimes even rude. The Asian restaurant is way over priced and not very good. They charge you for Wi-fi, even in the lobby! Not acceptable for hotel of this standard (almost all hotels at least has free wi-fi in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Best Palace in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TheEvaluatorLondon
Reviews.Content: Classic "great dame" of a major european city, full of history, beautiful lobby spacious rooms,helpful staff - got us football tickets. Excellent for a couples romantic getaway - but my pal would have prefferred a 'hipper' boutique hotel. Madrid central very limited on hotels with pools /spa that to me was biggest drawback Other minor moans no coffee in the room - they will bring you 1 free on room service - which is embarrassing to ask for - & you'd feel obliged to tip if you did, and having to pay for internet access Great location to explore Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Updating needed, good service”
Reviews.Author: JAB2011
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to utilize points and cash for our stay at this hotel (about $80). We would never pay the ridiculous price for this hotel. If I had I would be extremely disappointed. Upon our arrival, we were treated very nicely (I am a SPG Gold status member). I had emailed them in advance that were staying only one night at the hotel which also happened to be the last night of our honeymoon. As she read the note on my account (which is great!) she asked if I would be willing to wait for an upgraded room. We were thrilled. Left our luggage and headed out for lunch. Once we returned we were given the keys to our room, which was on the second floor (a bit of a disappointment as I prefer higher rooms) and not on a SPG preferred floor . The room was basic, nothing special being that it was a Westin (yes, I have high expectations of the Westin) and we had waited for an upgraded room. However, the view of the Neptune Statue was stunning! I understood the upgrade was the view. The room was average size, suitable for one night. The wallpaper was peeling in many areas and the bathroom was not as clean as I would like it to be. Noticeable hair on the tub and the bathroom floor and the granite in the bathroom had several chips in it. Again, we only paid $80 and utilized points, so I did not ask to be moved rooms. However, had I paid the $300 plus this room usually goes for, I would have been very upset. The hotel did redeem itself in customer service. After enjoying a wonderful dinner nearby, we returned to enjoy the last night of our honeymoon with a bottle of chilled champagne and chocolate truffles, on the house.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cx123
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great location. Service is not great, but correct and polite. rooms are nice and classy, but in some areas need some upgrading. room service food, poor. is a classic destination in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wvillegasv
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Madrid, the service was really good, and the rooms were large and comfortable. We arrived from the US early in the morning, and although could not be accommodated right away, I know they tried their best. By 1 pm, we were resting in our rooms. The location is ideal, close to El Prado and walking distance to most landmarks in Madrid. Yes, it is an expensive hotel, however it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Well located. Iconic”
Reviews.Author: GalHappy
Reviews.Content: It was a combination business and leisure stay. We stayed in the suites. Service was impeccable. Location cannot be faulted because it is a walking distance to the main central areas and transport. It is an iconic hotel which lived up to its impeccable reputation.

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jen508
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about the Westin Palace Hotel in Madrid. Our room was just beautiful, very spacious and immaculately clean. The hotel is in a terrific location, within walking distance to just about anywhere you'd want to go in central Madrid. What made our experience, however, was the service. Upon returning home to the United States, I realized I had somehow forgotten several items of clothing in our room. Upon contacting Marc, the manager of Westin Palace, he told me they had found my items and offered to ship them back to me... for free. I received my clothing articles in the mail yesterday, just as Marc promised. I am overwhelmed by this generous gesture, and it just serves to mark the Westin Palace hotel as one of our best hotel experiences ever. When we return to Madrid in the future, we will absolutely stay at this hotel- what an incredible experience!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in central Madrid. Prado, Puerta del Sol & Plaza Mayor within walking distance!”
Reviews.Author: CJMarbella
Reviews.Content: A grand hotel of days gone by still offering a personal and attentive service. As an SPG member used my points but was offered an upgrade at check-in, which was welcoming and speedy. I took advantage of breakfast deal which was well worth it and such a great setting under that spectacular stained glass dome from 1911! Consierge very helpful and was taking my elderly mum to the Cirque du Soliel so arrange private town car with them - it's expensive but worth every euro if you want to avoid long late night line ups un the cold to get back - just spoil yourself and enjoy the personal service! Hotel offers a great Chinese restaurant too which is well worth trying and they also recommended a short walk away the Roncon de Esteban which was super! Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply charming - exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Rodney17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the thorough pleasure of spending five nights at this historic iconic hotel over a six day period with a one night break in between overnighting in Toledo. The hotel delivers handsomely for the Westin Brand and as a long time Platinum member of SPG characterise myself as a somewhat savvy guest. It's location is unbeatable whilst the rooms are charming and of generous sizing. Most impressive for us were the team particularly at reception notably Maria, Beatrix and Estefania and Alejandro on the concierge desk. During my stay I lost, erroneously I initially believed it was stolen, my new iPhone and the front desk jumped to my assistance including making calls, offering to review CCTV footage, assisting with a police report etc. It was hardly an emergency however the team at both desks proved the quality of their training. If I have two minor criticisms of the hotel they are firstly the bathroom products do not adequately reflect the general quality of other amenities and secondly some of the less than enthusiastic female staff at the very good breakfast buffet could take a lesson in service from some of the obviously experienced and thoroughly professional mature male staff. In summary however the hotel would unquestionably be my first choice when next in Madrid and its attributes reflect exceedingly well on management.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best EVER stays”
Reviews.Author: eye4travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very frequent travellers and have been fortunate to have stayed in some great hotels. This was a truly special hotel experience. The service was first rate and we were treated like royalty from the moment we stepped in until the moment we left for the train station. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was tastefully decorated and newly renovated. The staff delivered on every level and left us complementary Cava, fruit and chocolates as they found out that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. They even went as far as finding us a humidifier to ensure that the air in our room was perfect for sleeping. Nothing seemed like it was too much for them. The location of the hotel was perfect for exploring the city and the recommendations of the concierge were always spot on. We cannot recommend this hotel enough. As the front desk staff who checked us in said, "Your vacation stays now"--this is completely true. You must stay here--FLAWLESS.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: aimboxer
Reviews.Content: Our room was ready when we got to the hotel around 11 pm. Since my husband is Platinum we were upgraded to a Junior Suite. The room was perfect for us...separate living space from the bedroom. In a city as wonderful as Madrid, I didnt want to leave the room! The bed was super comfortable and had the best nights rest. The lounge / lobby bar was complete luxury as well. It was nice to have a relaxing nightcap after a long day of walking around. And the location was perfect..right across from both the Prado and the Thyssen museums...and such a close walk to Sol / Barrio de Letras! Definitely would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveler2wong
Reviews.Content: Was in Madrid over the Thanksgiving holiday. Hotel rooms was spacious and well equiped. Staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Truly a Palace”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of the Palace Hotel 20 hours ago. The building is most immpressive in itself, and immpecably maintained and spectacularly lit at night. Front desk is friendly and fast. Check in from Maria, was extremely courteous and really went out of her way to give us an excellent room with a view to the fountain at Paseo del Prado. The room itself was large, beautifully appointed and had a splendid bathroom. Room service is very fast and well presented. The Rotonda, which is the bar and restaurant in the lobby is a very beautiful area with a spectacular dome. Concierge is very helpful and gives very good recommendations. The elevators do look a little bit tired. Beds are comfortable and luxurious but not the best. I have stayed at the hotel before and have always liked it. It is great to see that through the years it is still a great experience to stay there. Always luxurious and "Grand".

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: czlms
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful and comfortable hotel. I highly recommend this place to anyone. It met and exceeded all of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ctjddealer
Reviews.Content: Centrally located near the prado...room was very nice...walking distance to train station.staff were very helpful....would staybthere again.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty”
Reviews.Author: ROTCHKO
Reviews.Content: I have been invited at the Palace for an event in the dome. The location is excellent, facing the park, Prado and other important sopts, but the room are very old style (smell of dusty) and noisy. Breaksfast in awful, there is nothing that gives the idea of freshness and luxury. It seems more a 4 stars hotel rather than a 5 luxury

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, great location, excellent bar, and wonderful restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: RichWSanFrancisco_CA
Reviews.Content: The Westin is in a superb location, across the street from the Prado and the Thyssen museum, and walk able distance to the Palacio Real. Th staff is friendly and knowledgeable, referring us to a local restaurant for a late-night meal. Rooms are large and well-appointed. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 18th wedding anniversary at the Westing Palace Madrid”
Reviews.Author: folaman
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two day stay at the Westin Palace and i must confess it was a truly amazing experience. The hotel is in the financial district of Madrid with the Pedro Museum across the road. The attention to detail from check in to the luxurious surrounding of the hotel was to die for. We were allocated a room on the third floor and we could hardly believe the luxury and superb quality of the finish and decorations. The room was modern yet it retains some great original features. The concierge service were incredible, they gave us a complimentary wine and chocolates for our anniversary. Every request we made were attended to instantly which made me think if they were human computers - lol. Breakfast was not much to my taste compared to other high end Sheraton hotels i have visited, however, restaurant staffs were great and they worked really hard. There was a wedding show during the Sunday brunch and we really enjoyed that too. Overall, this is a great hotel and we would definitely visit again if we are Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much perfect ...”
Reviews.Author: BusLeisTravler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in a month I stayed at the Westin Palace Madrid for 2 nights on both occasions. Also in both instandes I was placed on the 5th floor (there are 6 in total). This historic builidng does an excellent job of maintaining its significance and grand presence while accommodating for the expectations of a modern business traveler. The rooms are well-appointed, and in high quality - bathrooms extremely spacious. The commons lobbies and bars of the hotels are also outstanding and the service I experienced was awesome, both in the bar and the emergency tailor sent to my room with 10 mins of calling! Near perfect because again ... internet (wi-fi or cable) is 18EUR ... ridiculous! Even in the public areas. And depending on your room location your mobile phone coverage can be quite spotty. Finally, they provide a coffee service in the mornings direct to your room (as there are no coffee / tea facility in the room itself) - however you still must pay the 5EUR room service charge ... annoying. As a business traveller, I work in my rooms at awkward hours and a fresh coffee is also appreciated ... but really ... service charge for a coffee service you advertise in the room?! How about a 50% reduction on the service charge? Obviously not really an issue for the leisure traveller who is probably sound asleep at 5am when i am looking for a hot brew! Don't hesitate to stay here ... these are the ramblings of an over-travelled consultant ... most of which won't bother most guests at the Palace! Oh and the apples are a nice touch in the floor lobbies!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Spain's capital”
Reviews.Author: shimmer25
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel! The surrounding area was perfect, considering it was my first time in Madrid - close to all the museums, Retiro Park, and the Puerta del Sol area. The rooms were large for an urban hotel and very well-appointed. Service was great overall and every person we encountered was pleasant. The only negative was the food pricing - very expensive! We did the breakfast buffet one day and for three of us, it was nearly 100 euros! However, the dining area was beautiful and the food was great - so I remember the experience fondly as a "splurge" :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel – but can you trust them”
Reviews.Author: Franzdorette
Reviews.Content: Westin Palace We Stayed at the hotel to start our vacation in Spain. At the end of our vacation we returned to the hotel and were most dissapointed. Leaving the hotel I left an item in my room. I made two attempts to contact the hotel and request them to keep it for when we return a couple of days later. On our return there was no trace of the item. According to the hotel the procedure is to record such items and then tput it in storage. As the item was nowhere to be found when we returned, it is obvious their systems failed. Although I did receive an email the next day stating the item was located and now in staorage, as well as how the incident wa smanaged by the Hotel staff, the incident affected our positive experience The reception hall is beautiful and stylish. The rooms are spacious. Comfortable beds The bathroom is neat, clean, and well arranged The cupboards are spacious. The mini fridge was well stocked Noteworthy is the security measures to get to your room. The dining area is pleasant and the stained glass dome renders a beautiful atmosphere. The chairs are comfortable. The breakfast items are tasty. However, one morning the beacon server was empty and was refilled after a long time. Staff in the dining area are friendly and helpfull. The hotel is located within a 20 minute walk to Plaza Mayor and shops.Leaving the hotel to this sight one has to walk up hill The "lost item" incident and how the hotel staff dealt with it left a very bad impression with us. I will think twice before I return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Donald S
Reviews.Content: I stay with my famili two weeks ago and enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It is a very good hotel and it is old fashioned. The room is great and is near the center, on the neptune place. The service is very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel : classic and chic !”
Reviews.Author: MAC_1979
Reviews.Content: At walking distance, you have the museum Thyssen-Bornemisza that is on the other side of the street, the Museo del Prado that is about 5 minutes, the Plaza del Sol and the Parque del Retiro that are about 10 minutes and Plaza Mayor that is 15 minutes. The nearest metro is Banco de Espana, 5 minutes walk. The room was spacious, clean and the bed was very comfortable. Service was very good. If you are SPG platinum, you may get a room upgrade, but that's about it. We had in-room Wi-Fi, very convenient. We did not have breakfast at the hotel since it costs more than 30 euros per person. Note that if you want to go to Toledo for a day trip, you may take the train (runs at least 8 times a day, takes 35 minutes to get there) that leaves from Atocha metro station which is located 15 minutes walk from the hotel. If you buy the Madrid Card, then you go by bus (runs at least every hours, takes 45 minutes) and it leaves from the Plaza Eliptica metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: AJRUK1
Reviews.Content: Went with mates for a 30th bday - we tended to stay around the Chueca area which was within walking distance. The hotel is nice - as expected from a Westin in a Euro capital. Maybe a little stuffy for some - but then i didnt hang around it much. Staff were very helpful. My room wasn't particularly large... but it more than sufficed for a weekend break. The gym was adequately equipped - treadmills and low weight dumbbells but no barbells, pull-up bar or squat machine - things that would be easy to install you would think!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: TiggerMeow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located right by the Prado Museum and convenient for sightseeing in every direction. We booked on Starwood hotel's website and got a great price. The bed was very, very comfortable and it was nice to have that after a long flight. The standard room was pretty spacious by European standard. The closets were roomy and the bathroom had a nice marble finish. Our requests for various items were promptly answered. (Tip the first person and you tend to get a good service for the rest of your stay.)

Reviews.Title: “Stunning building but stunning prices”
Reviews.Author: Bobleponge216
Reviews.Content: Clearly a lot of thought has gone into this hotel. They have thought very hard about how to take the most money from the client, whilst giving them the minimum in return, The building is well situated in the centre of Madrid, with public transport and local taxi's right on the doorstep, and the building itself is fantastic. Once you enter, the inside matches its exterior, with the cupola in the lounge area being worth a trip to the hotel on its own. Our check in was fairly slow, took well over 20 minutes from arriving in the door to being given our room key. We went up to the room and were initially impressed, a good size, with a fantastic bed and the standard toiletries available, as well as a decent bathroom with good shower. However a closer inspection showed that there was nothing else, not even a complimentary bottle of water. When I am paying the sort of money I paid for the room, in a hotel that prides itself on its service, to not even have a bottle of water in the room is unacceptable. Yes, there was water in the fridge, but over €6 for a tiny bottle of still water is excessive in the extreme. I recently stayed in an SPG hotel in Budapest, and there was quite simply no comparison. Having paid roughly the same amount of money for a room, and to have found slippers, water, coffee and tea facilities in Budapest, I was extremely disappointed to find nothing in Madrid. On reading the hotel blurb (carefully hidden away) I found I could ask for slippers as well as a large list of other things, but even in these austere times such basic items should be provided as standard. The things that cost nothing were well represented at the hotel. Although the check in was slow, the young lady that dealt with us was incredibly friendly and helpful, allowing us to check in a couple of hours early as the room was ready. All members of staff were attentive and ready to help with any questions. We came back to the room on the first full day after having spent all day out in the city, and someone had placed a Do Not Disturb sign on our door. This obviously meant that when we entered, our room hadn't been cleaned. A brief chat with reception and the room was sorted very quickly. In a city where I can buy a 2 litre bottle of Coke for less than €1.80, it quite simply cannot be justified that a small glass of the same in the hotel bar costs over €7. Everybody knows that to eat and drink in a hotel is expensive, no matter what hotel at whatever budget, but a mark up of over 700% is surely ridiculous. I came to Madrid for a short break with my girlfriend, to meet up with a couple of old friends, to watch Real Madrid play football and to view the city. All of those things were fantastic experiences, but the money grabbing frugality of this hotel left a very nasty taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, classic style, mediocre rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: danmiller3
Reviews.Content: For a five star hotel, much is lacking. The lobby and main public area are quite nice. Very classic and open for meeting people. Upon check-in the front desk person offered me a discount if I was willing to purchase breakfast for the next morning in advance. Really? At a high end hotel? The wi-fi was overpriced and worse didn't work consistently. It dropped my connection about every two minutes before reconnecting. The bed had Heavenly sheets but was definitely not a Heavenly mattress. The room was missing an ironing board and iron and trying to call Service Express resulted in a continuous busy signal. While the rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable, overall, this was only an average stay for an above average priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Substance”
Reviews.Author: Leftmid9
Reviews.Content: This was a points stay, so I can't really comment on the value, but if you can swing it, we loved this hotel. We had two nights at the start and end of our trip and the rooms were very large and comfortable both nights. The staff, especially in the lobby was always ready to help with directions and luggage. The check-in was fairly painless and we were able to get a room before 11am on both stays. The location was walkable to the museums and the Plaza Mayor. Another bonus was the short distance to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelman1370
Reviews.Content: Lots to like with the hotel. The lobby is impressive. The check-in process was somewhat slow but the staff seemed to be genuine in their desire to be helpful; English is spoken. Since we’re Starwood members we were “upgraded” to the Starwood floor on check-in. I also have to say that we were able to check in before Noon without a hassle, which is nice. Our room, 608, was very pleasant. The room is not big but it is comfortable. There’s a queen sized bed, a good sized writing desk with lamp, TV in a cabinet, reading chair and lamp, end tables with lamps by the bed. There is a plentiful amount of closet space which is great. An in-room safe is included in our price. The bathroom is decent size and the toilet is in a small room off the bathroom. While our two windows were on the small size and somewhat high up (and will only open four inches by design) the view is pleasant. With the windows closed there is no street noise except for the occasional siren. There is only moderate noise from the hallway and from the adjoining rooms. The bed was comfortable. It was hot while we were there but the air conditioner worked great. The hotel is very well located to the city sites that we wanted to see and not too far from the train station. Now to the issues: first, there’s no free wi-fi. Wi-fi is something like 19E per day, which is ridiculous. However, there is a business center where you can use the computers for free (there are six or eight of them). If you time it right there’s no problem getting a computer, however one day I went down there twice and they were all occupied both times. Not surprising for a big hotel. It would also be nice if the hotel would put an extra chair or two in there; a couple of times when I went down to use the computers there were computers available but no chairs as couples had pulled chairs over so that they could both sit down and read the computer monitor. Maid service: it’s a little thing but I am surprised that we didn’t have turn-down service, especially on an “upgraded” floor (we were there four nights and it didn’t happen any night). Not that I can’t turn down my own sheets but I would have appreciated getting fresh towels. While we were in Madrid it was HOT and we went through our towels. One day we didn’t get fresh hand towels and our soiled face clothes were taken away and not replaced. If towels aren’t going to be replaced during the day then it would be nice if the maid service would leave an extra towel or two in the bathroom (we each got one towel a day, which seemed stingy for an upscale hotel). As to the room itself, there are two issues that I’ll mention: first, the pillows. It has to be hard for the hotels to deal with the pillow issue: too hard, too soft, too small, etc. And pillows must regularly get worn out. We had two pillows on each side of the bed: a good sized one that went completely flat when touched, and a decently firm one that was about the size of a sofa pillow (small). The other issue is that our carpet could have used some help. Not dirty but tired; it’s obvious where it has been stained and cleaned over the years. Neither of these were a big deal for us. The other thing is that the cost of breakfast at the hotel, if not included in your package, is ridiculous. So, unless you’re comfortable with spending what you’d normally pay for dinner on breakfast, you’ll be going out every day. There’s a Starbuck’s around the corner. There’s no coffee maker in the room, however there is a notice that they’re happy to bring you up a cup of coffee in the mornings, just let them know; there a 4.50E delivery charge! In reading some of the other reviews I was surprised by the comments about the staff, as we always found them to be helpful and engaging with one exception (see below). Do find time to at least have a drink under the rotunda, which is stunning. I did find the staff in the rotunda to be unfriendly verging on rude but I have to say that it’s worth enduring them to have a drink there. The rotunda is stunning. Bottom line: really great location, you should be able to get a good night's sleep here; I really liked my room; I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in a landmark property.”
Reviews.Author: jjhpdx
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides exceptional service in a great location. The location is perfect, steps from the Prado and other major museums. Most major plazas are an easy walk as well. The rooms are large and well done in a belle epoch style. I was amazed at the attention to detail with the design finish. This was especially evident in the domed piano bar which was quite dramatic. Unlike some reviews, I found the staff to be very helpful and attentive. All seemed ready to provide assistance or suggestion and the concierge helped with not only dinner reservations but also day trip recommendations. I will returen.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in best location let down by service.”
Reviews.Author: desktopfan
Reviews.Content: This really is a great hotel in the best location. The hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are great, but it falls down on service, which is perfunctory. We were checked in by Daniel. No welcome, no smile, no eye-contact. Just “Name, passport, sign”. He then pushed a room key over the counter and did not even give us a clue as to how we might find the room. At breakfast on the first morning we were taken to a table by a waiter who just pointed at the table and walked off. No explanation about how the breakfast worked. In the bar my wife ordered a glass of wine at 5 Euros but on the bill it said 22 Euros. The waitress insisted it was correct. Eventually she agreed to double check and came back and said “someone had pressed the wrong button on the computer” Indeed. These aspects let the hotel down. There does not seem to have been any emphasis on training or maybe it is just the culture of the hotel. But if you can put up with the service it is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe_ZC
Reviews.Content: We originally stayed at the High Tech Hotel (Hotel Petit Palace Savoy Alfonso XII) when we first arrived Madrid, thought it was a bit modern design, nice park view, etc. Until someone was trying to break into our room at 4am, and there was only 1 staff on duty in the whole hotel, not to mention how dismissive there were the next morning when we tried to report the incident......... So! we transferred to the Westin Palace. With our Corporate discount, it's only $40 more per night, we had a worldly different experience. It is a beautiful classic hotel, very warm and professional staff, a better location (almost next door to the Thyssen and Prado Museum), and the rooms are 10 times better. It is what you would expect in a 5 star hotel in the US. If I ever come back to Madrid, this is the only place I will stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Columbus_OHAngela
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 7 nights at the Westin Palace in Madrid. This Westin is one of the top hotels in Madrid. It will be celebrating it's 100th year next year. It has a gorgeous dining room with a historic and fabulous stained-glass domed rotunda, and delicious food (and wonderful buffet). A nice, clubby bar. We had what I think was a standard room, and it was very nice, with king-sized "heavenly" bed. The service of housekeeping, room-service, and the concierge was very good. There's a Starbucks in the hotel, although you have to walk outside and around the corner to access it. The location could not have been better. Literally right across the street from the Thyssen museum. About a block to the Prado musuem and the Retiro Park. Near the train station. We were able to walk nearly everywhere. I highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay there again some day.

Reviews.Title: “business meeting”
Reviews.Author: laura-pozuelo
Reviews.Content: i have recently attended a meeting there and spent several nigths. hotel staff is a bit rude and impolite(specially when talking in spanish in front of foreigners and thinking they cannot be understood). the exeception was the porter and concierge. the location is superb and the common areas are beautiful. food is very very expensive (7euros for a coffee) but in general good quality ( although not very impressed with the room service). meeting rooms are old and noisy so they had to move us. despite these things after a few days i felt like at home and really enjoyed my stay, so i have mixed feelings about it! a place to see and to be seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephheel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel very recently. It is beautiful. Across from Prado and Thyssen and maybe 10-15 minutes to Puerto del Sol. Rooms are comfortable. Concierge was extremely helpful with maps, ideas, and restaurants. Enjoyed immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Spacious Rooms, Excellent Service but outdated”
Reviews.Author: Dbarashi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 nights in October 2011, as gold member we got upgraded to an executive room which was nice and spacious. the rooms are clean and quiet with good light even facing the courtyard. the staff members are very friendly and helpful and the business center is equipped with what you need. the interior is quiet outdated and bar prices are high compare to great restaurants in the area. new gym! I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in the past 10 days on my recent visit to Spain, and I wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting this city. Staff is extremely friendly and beyond helpful, hotel itself is beautiful, and it is centrally located to all major attractions in the city. It has great energy, and old world library bar makes it a Madrid hot spot. Bed's are extremely comfortable, and rooms are very quiet, and hotel is very secure. Don't miss the brunch!

Reviews.Title: “No match for the Ritz (across the stret)”
Reviews.Author: IndianPoloPlayer
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time in hotels, but seldom more than one night in any single hotel - so whats most important for me is that the hotel gets it right the first time around - and the Westin let me down a few times in the 12 hours that I was a guest. 1. patchy wireless internet that would work for a few seconds and then shut off for a few seconds. When I highlighted the problem to the person at check-out, he just shrugged his shoulders. For an issue that caused me to waste a lot of time, I expected more than a shug of shoulders. He didnt even note the problem, which leads me to believe that it wont be corrected the next time I visit Madrid. 2. forgetful egg-maker - I asked for some eggs at breakfast and came back a few mins later to discover that my order had been ignored. So I reminded the man and came back again - still no eggs! I was in a hurry and in no mood to beg for eggs so left slightly hungry. To forget once is human - to forget twice is simply negligent! Other small points were that there seemed to be only one towel set and only one bottle of shower gel in the bathroom - irritating if you shower at night and in the morning. I could have called and asked for more but my focus is to maximize sleep time rather than wait around for house keeping to deliver towels! To be fair, its not all bad - the hotel is well located, the rooms are new-ish and the bed very comfortable. But thats simply not good enough for me. I stayed at the Ritz on my previous visit and felt it was better all around despite being the same price!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: YingYang08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in the museum area, walking distance from the airport express stop. Beautifully decorated, antique style. Room is spacious. Staff is helpful and friendly. This is our first trip to Madrid. Really happy with our choice of the Palace hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Donjo_ms
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, clean, comfortable spacious rooms and the staff was top notch. The location was exceptional, a short walk to the Prado or most any other key site in Madrid. You can't go wrong staying here. We made a tradition of havng our evening cocktail in the library bar downstairs.... great times.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great city”
Reviews.Author: akumar25
Reviews.Content: Madrid is an amazing city, we have been touring Europe this year and clearly Madrid is in one of our Top 3 choices. The city has unending things to offer, 3 days tour cannot do justice to it. We stayed in Westin Palace which is very close to many "sites" so very conveniently located. The hotel is also extremely comfortable, with good clean room, great staff (who try to speak English and help), very good breakfast - we were very impressed to see some asian selections in the breakfast at reasonable price. The hotel is very close to Santa Ana plaza, which is a great place to watch people and have Tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location! Ole!”
Reviews.Author: milerunner
Reviews.Content: No need to add much here to what's already been said. The location shares with the NH and Ritz for the best of the city, within walking distance of major museums and government buildings in a nice part of town. There aren't many restaurants within walking distance, which is a slight negative, but in a city like Madrid it's worth taking the taxi or metro and exploring. The service was excellent with one exception--when my family and I ate breakfast in the gorgeous restaurant, they all had the buffet and I didn't. The waiter didn't seem to realize that I wanted to order something so he ignored me. I laughed it off and ate very well later in the day. The rooms are decent sized for Europe, plus large bathrooms, which is good to know considering the high room rate. But, you pay for location, service, and quality--and you get it. There are great places to stay in Madrid and this is clearly near the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: fcworld
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel for around 15 years, and have always enjoyed my stays here. The staff never change, and they all remember you, even if you have not been in the hotel for a year or two. Carmen the concierge is wonderful, her recommendations are always good, as are those of her colleges. From the moment you arrive, until you leave you feel like the staff care about your comfort. This is a traditional luxury hotel built in 1912, and has all the features and luxury of this period. My only complaint is that you have to wait too long to check in and out, and there a so many weddings held here in the season, that the hotel lobby and famous cupola can become very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: mari k
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel at a good location to see around. We stayed fo twom days and enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property and great service”
Reviews.Author: nmd76
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at for our European trip...and it ruined all the hotel stays after. It was so amazing and beautiful that no other hotel compared. I normally like a more contemporary and modern type design for hotels but the opulence, cleanliness and beauty of the design won me over and I was very pleased. You won't be disappointed if you stay here. Especially if you're a Starwood Hotel Member...and get a great deal with your Starwood points.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location - just excellent”
Reviews.Author: nycbornuk
Reviews.Content: We spent a great couple of nights in this fab hotel. The staff were more than helpful and advised us on our entire agenda. Easy easy walking distance from most of the sights we were after and it's helpful that all the taxi drivers know the Palace so if you wander too far it is easy to return. The rooms are quiet and the beds are - well the Westin class of bed - good sleeping here. Don't miss the breakfast in the Rotunda - or the hotel display on the history of the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Randy W
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this classic hotel in the past three years, and a disappointing one.The hotel is an old world classic that is showing wear. The carpeting on the stairs in the lobby area is worn thru to the threads in spots, and when I paid for the upgrade to an executive suite, room 123, it was architecturally beautiful, but with the wallpaper peeling from the walls in a number of places. It needs serious refurbishing to what was and still should be the top hotel in the city. Also, in a country where the costs of travel and meals are comparable to the US, it should not cost me 34e ($45US) for a hamburger and fries from room service. The internet service in the rooms constantly lost a signal, to the point I could not complete my flight check in without constant refreshment, a processs that should have taken 5 minutes took 20. Fortunately, I was not there on business. If I was, I don't know what I would have done.The check-in was smooth, but checkout had long lines. Overall, not up to Westin standards, which is a world class chain I use regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott919
Reviews.Content: The Palace is an architectural masterpiece located in a very convenient location. Its easy to walk anywhere in madrid. The staff is always attentive and professional. The rooms are on the smaller size, as expected in a hotel of this age, but are very nicely done and the beds are super comfortable. The Palace is fairly expensive but if you want to treat yourself its certainly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury In Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: laurenjoshtravel116
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Westin Palace! The staff was amazing. So friendly! We arrived early, way before check in. We were exhausted from taking the train from Barcelona and the Westin Palace had a room ready for us. It. Was. Amazing. They were so accommodating. We were able to nap before venturing out into the city. We were on the top floor and it was beautiful! The room was perfect! The bed was so comfortable. We came back from sightseeing to champagne and chocolates - so great! The location is perfect! Not exactly city center, but not exactly out of the way. We walked EVERYWHERE! Even to the palace. We truly enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Palace in the city.”
Reviews.Author: silversuns
Reviews.Content: This classic building is located in the heart of the city. The room was luxurious, spacious and well appointed with a very comfortable bed. Staff were friendly from the moment we checked in and throughout the three night stay. The only complaint, which speaks to the high efficiency of the modern amenities, was that the ventilation system in the bathroom worked TOO well. The fan system vented the warm air from the room so well that it was rather chilly after a hot steaming shower. However, fluffy robes and towels made up for that very well.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Midst of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sobaytravelguy
Reviews.Content: I was welcomed warmly when I checked in, and given a lovely room on the top floor. Everyone knows that the Heavenly Beds are just that, and I had a great sleep all three nights. The hotel has a very good fitness center, which I used daily. I had booked the room with buffet breakfast (taking advantage of a wonderful deal for about $200 a day). It was delicious, although I think it costs about 35 Euros if paid separately. Breakfast is served in a lovely space with stained glass ceiling. The hotel is centrally located, sharing a plaza with the Prado Museum, the Ritz Hotel and the Thyssen Gallery. I was very pleased. My only complaint-- the doorman gave my taxi driver incorrect information on my air terminal, so I had to scramble on a shuttle bus to get to the proper terminal once I was dropped off at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc51
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few years ago over Christmas/New Year. The building is a landmark in a perfect situation for visiting Madrid. Built in the early years of the 20th c with no expense spared and it shows, so much better architecturally than many pretentious hotels of today. Our room was very spacious, not particularly luxurious but there are more de luxe rooms if you want to pay more, we didn't and were perfectly happy. I had booked (so I thought) a table for Christmas eve at the Ritz hotel but when I enquired they had no record of my reservation and of course were fully booked. When I enquired at my hotel they said likewise but as we were guests they would manage to get a table for us nevertheless - that's what I call service!! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would, on our experience, highly recommend this hotel. Our stay here was before Nov 2010 but this is the earliest date this site provides.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: M30001
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest "Westins" I've ever stayed in (believe this was an independent hotel before Westin purchased it). Very grand. Rooms were spacious and well appointed. Location was great - very close to a few key museums and good nightlife. Excellent service. Frequent business traveler but was in Spain on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Netpopular
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast. Right across from Prado Museum. I will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, high end Westin property”
Reviews.Author: kyle34
Reviews.Content: Fancier than most Westins I have visited in the US, this historic property is a little worn around the edges but still an excellent option. The location can't be beat - across the street from the Prado, close walking distance to the park and old town Madrid. The restaurant, while pricey, is lovely underneath its tinted glass dome. The service is friendly and businesslike - clearly most travelers here (including myself) are not on vacation. The gym upstairs is sufficient, and there's a nice if small balcony on the top floor to look out at the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Elina999
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everyting and more you would expect out of a Westin. First of all, the hotel is really beautiful. It truly is a work of art itself. Everything inside the hotel was amazing and luxurious. The rooms were very comfortable as well. The staff were all very helpful and spoke English. The location of this hotel was excellent too. It is very close to the Prado musuem, 10 minute walk to the main square with the all night life, and an easy walk to most of the other tourist attractions. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at it's best”
Reviews.Author: DGSSpeedyCreek
Reviews.Content: A beautiful 100 year old hotel. The elegance of this is par none. The dome stained glass lounge is unlike I have ever seen in a hotel. The marble throughout is beautiful. The staff were excellent and the english speaking abilities made it easier for us. As a Starwood Platinum we received an upgrade to a suite that was over the top!! Centrally located to many sites well worthnseeing. Room service and food was very expensive however.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Rarora25
Reviews.Content: A stunning property in the perfect location for a visitor! Its walking distance to the Prado, Thyssen, and the metro stations as well as the Retiro park. Great places to eat around the area-if you just walk a bit. helpful doorman/porters/staff. we had the luxury executive suite being a platinum SPG member and it was just heavenly!!!! save for a kitchen it was like a complete apartment! the views are lovely! the neptune fountain is beautiful to look out to from the windows. The rotunda restaurant is just marvelous! the food is delicious and the staff very polite and not snobbish at all as one would expect. We would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat-esp if you're an SPG member. the only thing I would suggest they change is to actually prioritise the SPG members' check in-s. there is a priority desk with the sign but you stand in line with everyone else or have to go through discomforting looks from people who think you are breaking the line. That is the whole point of trying to get platinum membership-by choosing to stay with one group of hotels-for superior service and priority in such things. Special mention to David who made sure our needs were met and exceeded. Thanks so much! :) Muchas Gracias!

Reviews.Title: “We got upgraded to the Suite - be aware of the Extras which are eye eyewatering!”
Reviews.Author: pinkilly2
Reviews.Content: A difficult evaluation - on the one hand, the location and the building are fantastic and the Westin Brand would expect something special behind it - on the other hand we had to do quite some work with the Front Desk to get to the point that we are not fully disappointed - After some rooms we finally made it to a suite upgrade - my boyfriend is very special in his taste and does not compromise on quality - The suite on the first floor 123 was fantastic - 3 balconies, 3 rooms, very imperial but there are things which are not ok: - Minibar is far too expensive ~ 7,25 EUR for a 250 (!) ml can of one) - Laundry for a shirt ~ 16,49 EUR (I pay for them tailor made in Shanghai 15 EUR (!) - We negotiated free Internet (it's a commodity nowadays), but the most funny thing happened when we checked out. We have have been complaining about the prices for the 'specials' and the guy at the reception said only: 'And you have not tried the telephone yet!' - which made is really lough but it's a bit sad as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ruth_wLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a birthday weekend and it was lovely. The room was spacious and tastefully furnished ad we found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel was good for the Prado and the other museums and all the other main attractions were walkable. Overall a very good weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Wonderful rooms in a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travbud1
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what else is needed in a hotel so I would be happy to hear about the higher ranked hotels in Madrid. The name of the hotel should explain what it is, a former Palace. It even has a small museum devoted to some of the former treasures from the palace. You must also see the dome in the main dining hall as it is spectacular. There was a wedding happening while we were there and it would have been a perfect place. The location was perfect as well and walking distance to everything (the main museums are directly across the street). The rooms themselves were large and spacious with everything you are looking for in a hotel. Breakfast is not included and slightly expensive, but there are cafes and a Starbucks right next door. The staff are well trained and while not outwardly friendly, will respond to any request you have with great efficiency. This is the place to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Rob V
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel very chique, their treatment of guests is excellent and they will go the extra mile to make sure your stay is that much more enjoyable. Even though we spent only one night, the hospitality and service they provided was top-notch. The in-house restaurants have incredible food and service is excellent. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to my friends and family as a "must-stay" in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and unwelcoming staff, it seems that smiling hurts.”
Reviews.Author: Tunera
Reviews.Content: The location is great however we did not feel welcome. We took the metro to get here from the Madrid South Bus Station and got off at Banco de Espana stop. Walk along paseo del prado or follow the signs to Thyssen Museum since it is across the street. We booked a two bed room and the beds were rather small. No free WIFI. We had a good check in, however the majority of the front desk staff was not friendly. Does it really hurt to smile or be polite. I used points to stay with them and regret it since I did not feel I had a good experience. I would have stayed at NH Paseo del Prado next door instead for a lower price. The area is very touristy and the area on El Paseo del Prado is dirty and filled with people. There is a VIP store/restaurant next door where you can have a decent breakfast. We took the city bus back to the airport at Cibeles street right in front of the post office building. This was less that 10 minutes walk along Pase del Prado. The concierge at night Aljejnadro who was an exception recommended this option. I runs every 20 minutes and costs 2 euros. We got to the airport in about 30 minutes. We had mentioned to a front desk person that we were going tot take the metro to the airport and he was apalled and gave us a dirty look.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, beautiful property and some great memories”
Reviews.Author: Vivmodi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located. Museum, historical monuments, parks and amazing restaurants all located around the hotel. The bulding has a very ethinic look. Room are very spacious and a warm feel. The staff as can be expected is well trained,courteous and helpful. The hotel is very live and buzzing with activities. Choice of good restaurants available at the hotel. I enjoyed our 2 night stay and would wish to comeback with family

Reviews.Title: “Classy historic hotel perfectly situated for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Koukat
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here in an executive room looking in onto the internal courtyard. The room was spacious and quiet. The bathroom was of a good size with good hot water & water pressure in the shower (in bath). There were some minor problems with the room: peeling wallpaper in bathroom, bulb in desk lamp needed to be changed and the lovely antique wardrobe door didn't close easily (only a problem because the robe had an auto light inside when the door was open). The breakfast room, food and service were a delight, so much so I didn't mind the 35 euro charge. The next day I walked around the corner on to Calle del Prado and had a 2,30 breakfast at DOC, as a contrast. The bar was also good. Service was always friendly throughout the hotel. I think that the best thing about this hotel is it's location: right in the heart of the museum triangle. Its also a short walk from Plaza St Ana and it's cafes, bars and restaurants and a slightly longer walk to the shopping in the centre around Puerta del Sol. This was my second stay in the hotel and I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, pretty architecture, but Eh service...”
Reviews.Author: royale10
Reviews.Content: We were led to stay here for a night b/c we're Starwood preferred, and b/c the pictures of this 5-Star hotel made it look like an architectural dream. Pros: location, location, location -- the Prado, park, government center, and old historic areas are all really close by. There are a few subway lines t hat are within a 5 minute walk. Architecture was really special - especially the the rotunda with the stain glassed dome ceiling. Neutral: Room was decent. Clean. Had that Old World "glamor" look that needed some updating in my opinion. There were cracks in the wall, and the bathroom marble that really shouldn't be left untouched in a 5-star property...Maintenance could use a shake up here. But otherwise, it was just fine. Don't expect any stellar views or amenities. Cons: Staff was not helpful and downright rude. They were curt and unnecessarily snobby...We're not sure why that was the case, maybe it was our luck with the 4 concierges/check-in gentlemen we encountered. All in all, not worth your buck. If you happen to have Starwood points and can stay for free, go for it, but don't expect to be treated like royalty just because you're at the "Palace"....

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel. Very elegant. Comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: emq14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great spot. We could walk to a lot of places...and there was Starbucks right down the street. Silly, and not, of course, reason for a review, but I had been staying in a tiny village in Mallorca previous to coming to Madrid, and was so excited to get my Starbucks fix. Anyway, the hotel was beautiful, staff was friendly and accommodating, the room was comfortable. All around a beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: furryangels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Palace in Madrid for a week in February. It is a wonderfully elegant hotel, with great service and amenities. The staff is trained and courteous, and helped immensely with everything I needed. It is also located in a very centrai and safe location in Madrid, close to many places to see that are well within walking distance. Remember to wait outside the front entrance at the eight pm hour for the wonderful show the clock tower puts on next door.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: Audrey B
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Spain started here. This was definitely a "Royal Treat" before heading into smaller hotels for the rest of the trip. Our first and only night we had drinks in the hotel bar. Wow was that spendy! I'd suggest venturing out right away to the tapas bars. This hotel is walking distance to everything! There's a travel agency just behind it where you can get maps and informations for trains, etx. While on our flight from the USA to Spain I sat next to a Spaniard who informed of a Autobus Express from the airport. It was 15 minutes and 2 E each. The walk fromt he drop point was about 1.5 blocks. Great savings! I would recommend this hotel, though on the spendy side, it was a great start to a wonderful 10 days. (Only gym we had on the trip, 2 days of lifting before 8 days of walking!)

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RotherhamDeano Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic and we had the added adventure of a demonstration against public spending cuts finishing its march at the bottom of the street. Noisy and lively but no trouble. Democracy in action. Spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...will go back”
Reviews.Author: jsarbak
Reviews.Content: Right near the Prado. Walking distance to Royal Plaza and Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional and Opulent !!!!”
Reviews.Author: RishiDhuper
Reviews.Content: A must stay for those who would like the combination of traditional and luxurious properties.....Staff know English which was a lefe saver for those who dont know Spanish Excellent tapas joints at walking distance !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: flyboy228
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out was a great experience. Staff was friendly, attentive, and eager to help. I'm OK, not great at speaking Spanish. The staff was very patient with me as I stumbled through our conversations. Only there for 1 night, but everything was top notch. Breakfast buffet was great. Cannot comment on other meals as we ate at off the beat and path local places. Within walking distance to the major tourist attractions (Plaza Mayor, etc.). Close to the Atocha train station. About a 20 minute cab ride to the Charmatin train station (if going to Segovia), and about 20 minutes to the airport. Some might consider this hotel pricey. But you get what you pay for. If you want top notch service and quality, skip the Four Seasons and stay here. Will definitely stay at this hotel on our next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for the first time, after having stayed in a number of other hotels in Madrid including a couple of stays at the Ritz. The hotel is very well located within easy walk to many attractions and close to the Plaza de Santa Ana with several restaurants located there. The rooms were nice enough with large bathrooms and plenty of closet space. The hotel is not as elegant as the Ritz and with it being so large it defientley does not feel as exclusive. Howeve pr the rates are less and the location is justbas good, so it is a viable option. I did not try any of the eateries in the hotel since there were so many tempting options nearby. Finally, I want t emotion that if you are driving to the hotel, it can be a bit of a hassle to find the front door, so make sure you get very detailed directions.

Reviews.Title: “well done”
Reviews.Author: anerlli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June, in a suite, on Starwoods points. The location is excellent-near major attractions, train station; restaurants and good shopping are a 10 minute walk away. The room style is standard old-fashioned reproduction with lots of fabric . There are excellent sheets, towels and shower. Lighting is good. Housekeeping was well done and frequent. The wifi works great. The concierge was helpful in arranging tours, restaurants, taxis. A few times there were lineup to access the front desk staff and concierge but guess that's par for the course. The only complaint was that the restaurant was not very good, however, there is lots of choice within walking distance, This is a well run, mainstream property. If you are looking for a personality, this may not be the best selection, however I would totally recommend the hotel based on efficiency, location, professionalism of the staff. This is a very well run property.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business & Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dcjay64
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a business trip but then stayed on for a vacation with my partner. I thought the hotel was wonderful for both parts of the trip. It is in a perfect location. We walked everywhere. It is steps from the Prado museum and many other things you would want to experience in Madrid - restaurants, shopping, etc.. The hotel itself is stunning. The lobby and restaurants are out of the world - at least to look at. We never ate in the hotel. Sometimes when the lobby of a hotel is soooo beautiful the rooms are a disappointment - but not here. Our room was large, clean, nicely decorated. For the little time we spent in the room, we were happy. I think my only "problem" (and that is an overstatement) with the hotel was that the desk always seemed extremely busy - so there was always a wait to speak to someone. Not the worst problem. Otherwise, the staff were all very good. I also can not speak to the price. I did not pay for the rooms. My work paid for the business part of the stay and I used my Starwood points for the vacation part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfutransky
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, great staff, great stay. Near museums and easy walk to palace. Service was excellent. Breakfast is pricey, but there are options around the corner. Only problem with location is that protestors congregate in the area because of proximity to government buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: R H
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 1/2 days in Madrid during our vacation in Spain... the hotel staff was very friendly and provided the service requested and expected. Our check-in process was a little slow but after that the trip was flawless. The business center was very helpful when I asked to connect to a hotel in Barcelona and arrange for my transfer from the train station. The hotel is centrally located to many attractions. We loved our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meghan429
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights through Starwood on cash and points. For cash and points, this was an amazing deal. The hotel was in a great location, right near Plaza Santa Ana (great square with outdoor restaurants, bars, etc), and walking distance to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, the Royal Palace, Retiro Park, & the Prado (basically almost all of the main city sights as long as you like to walk). I preferred being here over closer to Puerta del Sol which seems to be a magnet for demonstrators which I didn't really like. Madrid is a great taxi town, too, though. The 2 times we took one it was cheap. Our hotel room was nice and comfortable, but it did seem like the hotel was in the middle of doing some renovations/updating in the rooms (could hear it during the day and see some evidence of it). The public spaces were very nice, as well. We found the breakfast to be too pricey, so I can't say how that is. The one negative comment I would have would be check-in. First, it took forever (not waiting in line, I mean once we got to the counter). The woman in charge at the desk seemed flustered, confused, and I saw at least 2 different guests come up irate during our time waiting for her to take care of checking us in. One seemed extremely angry that he had requested a towel 3x now, and they apparently weren't sending it up to his room (if I was paying the regular rate for this hotel I could see that angering me, as well). Even after he said he would stand there and wait for it, she told him he would have to go back to his room and wait for housekeeping and seemed to blow him off. Then, someone came and asked about if something had been taking care of (not sure what), and when she said not yet, they stormed off (seemed like this had happened more than once already). Also, she kept disappearing to do other things and not checking us in while we were standing there 1/2 checked in! That was not a good vibe to begin with at the hotel, but we didn't have any issues ourselves other than this. We asked the concierge for advice on some things and he was very helpful, and check-out was very quick (not with the same person). Some Madrid Advice in General: Plaza Santa Ana is very nice at night and has some nice bars and tapas places. The Royal Palace is worth touring, we really enjoyed it because it had furnishings (unlike a lot of European palaces). Retiro Park is a good place to visit on a nice day. We rented a row boat on the lake which was fun. Also, seek out fresh churros con chocolate while in Madrid (churros with a cup of a warm chocolate pudding for dipping). We had pretty good paella at a restaurant called El Caldero (also on tripadvisor) and great 2.50 Euro calamari sandwiches and papas bravas (potatos with a spicy sauce) at a little place on Plaza Mayor called Casa Rua. The Prado museum is free after 6pm, after 5pm on Sunday (open until 8pm, closed Monday). We got into a long line at about 5:45 to get in, and were in about 5 minutes after 6. Definitely worth saving some money--8 Euros each. Also, we covered the main things we wanted to here (the museum's map plan is very helpful with pointing out the most important works), and then headed over to the Reina Sofia for a glance at Picasso's Guernica. The Reina Sofia is free after 7pm (open until 9pm) on weekdays (closed Tues) and from 2:30pm to 9pm on Saturday, and from 10am until the 2:30pm closing time on Sunday (will save you another 6 Euros each). We took the high speed train to Toledo while here for 1/2 a day (33 mins each way) and enjoyed that a lot. If you go there, be sure to have your taxi at the train station take you out to El Mirador (the viewpoint over the city) first (make sure they wait, you will not find a taxi out here) , take a few pictures, see the view, and then have him take you into town (Plaza Zocodover is probably a good drop-off point). I think there is a bus that also goes out this way, but we didn't look into it as we had a limited amount of time in Toledo and wanted to be able to be on our own schedule. The Cathedral in Toledo is the main must-see sight, but the town has several other sights, as well (the entire place has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Sight).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here and everything was fantastic. The rooms were very, very clean, amenities were great, staff was very friendly, concierge was knowledgeable and breakfast was amazing. Understood that it was the Westin Palace, the prices were a bit steep for certain things. Internet was around 20 Euros a day (free in business center), breakfast was 34 Euros (I believe) and things in mini-bar were a bit overpriced for hotel prices. It is centrally located and is a walkable distance from the the Plaza, Prado Museum and metro.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !”
Reviews.Author: NyFrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Palace for four nights and loved every minute. The staff was friendly and very professional, the hotel itself beautiful, and the room was perfect...great king size bed, lovely bathroom, in room safe, etc., etc. The location could not have been better.....walking distance to some of Madrid's finest museums and restaurants. The hotel restaurant was marvelous. We would definitely stay there again if we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: tmaland08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at this hotel. Took a day trip to Toledo via high speed train. Train station is walking distance from the hotel. Hotel is also well located for the Prado and the other famous art and history museums, all walking distance from your room. Service was 5 star, but the prices are as well. But Madrid is easy to walk to restaurants, bars, etc. One added plus is the large Starbucks beside the front door. I love my coffee so that was wonderful in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience in a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manyarna
Reviews.Content: We sayed here for my wife's 50th birthday and going on tripadvisors recommendations I am so glad we did. The hotel could not be better positioned with everything on the doorstep and from the moment we stepped out of the taxi the staff could not do enough for you. We arrived at 10.30am and even though it was early we were checked into our room on the first floor which was wonderful. The bed was comfortable the bathroom was spacious and the whole feel of the room was calming. We did have a slight problem with carpets being laid on the third floor during our stay but the way the hotel handled this as soon as they were aware of the problem, and in particular Alvaro on the reception desk, showed the way that this hotel regards its customers and its reputation. The meal in the rotunda on my wifes birthday was wonderful with the staff all very attentive but also discreet and this was a true dining experience!!!!!!!! Overall, even with the slight problem, our stay with the Westin Palace was as enjoyable a stay as we have ever had and we look forward to going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JennyKiz
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - very luxurious through and through. A little difficult to find the front entrance by car though as the area around the hotel was full of small, one-way streets. In any case the location was awesome - right next to the museums, parks and great restaurants. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Classical elegance in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CriteriousTourist
Reviews.Content: Classical elegance in a fantastic location. Good service, very nice decoration and very good dinner. The breakfast is ok, but the price could be reviewed (+- $30 euros pax), considering its own standards as we had a fantastic dinner for 3 with excelent wine for $170 euros and paid over $90 euros for breakfast. The internet access is also very expensive 17 euro/day, on the other hand the business center of the hotel e very well equiped with no service for internet or printing. In general is a gorgeous hotel with reasonable prices expect for especific service. The concierge service is also worth mentioning

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: wineglobelovers
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel did not disappoint. While we didn't get an upgrade (Platinum status at Starwood) because of the Barcelona-Real Madrid game, the room was finely appointed with plenty of space for us and our two young children (2 years + 6 months). The staff was very friendly, location was great, and it felt like a grand experience. The only slight downer was having to navigate two flights of stairs with a baby stroller, but the staff were usually there to help carry the stroller. One thing to note on transit to/from the airport. We had a very difficult time getting a taxi large enough for us which added a bit of stress to our late night arrival. We did discover an express bus from downtown (maybe eight blocks from hotel) to the airport on our way out which was much cheaper than arranged transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sh345
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Palace our last day in Spain. After a week of business travel we wanted to treat ourselves. Our stay here was perfect. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and friendly, the room was elegantly appointed and the hotel is conveniently located - near the Prado museum and just a few blocks from several other museums and parks - you couldn't ask for more. As others have indicated there are several restaurants nearby so we did not try any of the hotel restaurants. We will definitely stay here the next time we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but a bit overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: travelcat26
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a gorgeous hotel. Everything about it was luxurious. I was sick for a large portion of the time I was there so I really appreciated the extremely comfortable beds. Our room was beautiful, and the hotel is in a great location, especially if you are interested in the museums. The Thyssen-Boremisza Museum was right outside our window and the Prado is on the other side of the roundabout. The business center was very nice and allowed us to stay in touch with everyone at home. All of the staff we encountered were very helpful. The main downside of this hotel is the price. We stayed at another Madrid hotel later in our trip. It was also very nice, had a great location, and the price was much more reasonable. I would return to the Westin, but only if I could get a good deal on a room. Otherwise it is just too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRWDuke
Reviews.Content: This was a gorgeous hotel, located within walking distance of the Prado and Retiro. We also found it perfect for navigating the public transportation. The service was 5-star, with the employees being very helpful. It was pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection !!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2812
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply royal and grand. We stayed there just 2 nights and wish we were there longer. Both the nights we stayed there ...there were major events happening at the hotel.... its like the main reputed hotel in Madrid. The first day there was a band dressed in traditional attire welcoming guests for a conference. very tastelfully done The second day, the president of real madrid soccer club was planning to watch the match from the hotel. There was a red carpet laid out waiting for him and the hotel was swarming with paparazzi ... The location is also perfect ...there is a really cafe just nearby and of course the hotel is like 2 minutes from the Prado Museum ... We would highly recommend it and will stop over one night in Madrid just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: sydneyflitter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Madrid and was unfortunately sick (nothing to do with the hotel) which meant I spent a lot of time in the room and using the hotel services. The staff were very helpful (even arranging a very helpful English speaking doctor for me with an hour!) and despite the hotel looking like it may be a stiff stuffy place it was actually quite cozy. Beds were the very cosy Westin Heavenly Beds which are just great and so comfortable! The only downside is that every hotel service is extremely highly priced. $50 for a room service hamburger and coke (which tasted great), $20 for Internet, $50 for Internet and movies (but not HD) for a day. The lack of English general entertainment channels drives business to the VoD system. However as a hotel near to the tourist centre and museums, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: rekarajna
Reviews.Content: Just left after an enjoyable 5-night stay. Perfect location in the center of the city w/n walking distance to many great attractions.Good staff and nice atmosphere.I hope be back sun.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: Irish964
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many hotels throughout the USA and Europe but I have to say the Westin Palace Madrid ranks right near the top!! Upon check-in my complimentary upgraded Suite was not ready but the lady checking me in offered me another room so I could shower and rest after my long flight from the USA. WOW!! Are you kidding me?
