Right there I was hooked! I do not EVER, EVER recall a hotel in the USA ever offering this and this was my first time EVER being offered this in Europe. I could not have thanked her enough. When I came back later that day to get my room key for my Suite the lady said she moved me to a different suite but with a better view. The Suite was gorgeous! I had a great view of the fountain from my living room and bedroom and it was fabulous. I do NOT speak any Spanish but wanted to see the city and once again, NOT A PROBLEM. The concierge assisted me and hired a driver and English speaking guide for me so I could get a true sense of Madrid and what it offered. What a great City!! If anyone is looking for a Hotel in Madrid this is where it should start and end.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winelvr83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in May and we were NOT disappointed. From the helpful English speaking staff (although we spoke Spanish) to the lovely room to the central location it was wonderful. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Sheer brilliance”
Reviews.Author: Lonnie3
Reviews.Content: Loved it here, rooms were beautiful, staff did everything they could for us, and the restaurant food was delicious (and quite reasonably priced for this calibre of hotel!).

Reviews.Title: “Opulence and Location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCDN_travlr
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Westin Palace and enjoyed it immensely. It is one of the best hotels in Madrid location-wise. A quick walk to all the museums, shopping, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, tapas restaurants etc. In fact, it was so well located we didn't take the metro/taxi once! The hotel itself is nearly 100 years old so it carries an old world charm. I'm more used to contemporary hotels but appreciated the grandeur and opulence of this place. The cleaning staff did a great job servicing the room and amenities were great. Wifi at the hotel was very expensive so here's a tip for getting around it: go to the Starbucks downstairs. Make a purchase and ask for a wifi code. You get 45 minutes of free wifi with every purchase so that was quite handy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wl88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Junior suite - the largest room we got during our trip to Spain and Portugal. Great location, friendly staff. You cannot go wrong with the Westin Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay but no pool”
Reviews.Author: HelenS2866
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a room on the Starwood floor (6th floor - top level). The room was immaculate and ready early. The beds were very comfortable. There is an in-room safe. There is an iron and ironing-board in the room. It is a very well-positioned hotel, the Thyssen museum is basically across the road, and the Reiner Sofia and the Prado are only 5-10 minute walks away, which in Madrid's hot weather, you will very much appreciate the short walking distance. It is also a 10 min walk to the Retiro park, which I highly recommend walking later in the evening, when many locals go out for a run, for exercise, roller-blading, skate-boarding or just to stroll around. The park is beautiful - a lake with hire boats, the Crystal Palace, and a free art exhibition connected to the Reiner Sofia was being held when we were there, which was wonderful - we saw Leon Golub, but the exhibition space listed about 6 artists to be exhibited over the year. There is a convenience store around the corner where you can buy beers, fruit juices, wine and snacks, as well as books, magazines etc. Gift stores are around the corner as well. It is a 10-15 min walk into the central part of Madrid where the main department store is and many other retail outlets. For non-EU residents, if you are shopping at El Cortes Ingles (main Spanish dept store), make sure you go to the 2nd floor to get your 10% discount voucher to be used for the day - 7 days of vouchers can be used over the year. (You need to show a passport or ID with country of residence on it). Depending on the purchase price, you are also eligible for the VAT component to be credited back to you when you leave the last EU destination, so purchases from here can be well-priced. The only negatives for the hotel (which cause me to give it 4 stars instead of 5) relate to the stairs guests are required to climb in order to get to the lifts to go to their rooms - (approx 6). This presented only minor problems for us as we had heavy bags, and there was no-one to help us when we checked out at 5.15am. I had to rap on the desk to wake someone up in order that we could check out. I imagine the stairs could also be an issue for disabled guests. Similarly, there were about 5 stairs to climb down into the business centre, where there were 6 computers available for 1 hr complimentary use (per day, per room - not per guest). We booked this room on hotels.com and were happy with the result. There was no pool, which was disappointing. The wonderful cupola rood complete with stained glass in the foyer area was beautiful, but drinks were not cheap. A swimming pool in a 5 star hotel is almost a must. Other than these small issues, we were happy with the hotel and happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional...too bad they don't have”
Reviews.Author: MariaVillaevic
Reviews.Content: Madrid was our last stop in our two week trip. We had three bedrooms. Two Executive rooms and one Executive suite. This is our third stay in this hotel and the service and attention to detail are very consistent. Well appointed rooms, great decor, extremely comfortable beds and great service. We requested a DVD player for our younger child, there was a little bit of confussion at the begining as they went to the wrong suite, however the DVD player was complementary. Very attentive and helpful staff. Our older kids were dissapointed as the hotel doesn't have a pool. Madrid could be very hot in summer time. Breakfast is really good you have a lot of to choose from: fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, jamon serrano, real fruit juice. Treat yourself to real orange juice or zumo de naranja. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Palace!”
Reviews.Author: dany
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Madrid and spent a long weekend at the Palace. Unbeatable location, great bedrooms and a sumptuos buffet breakfast. We really had a blast, and we would like to thank el senor Louis at the Reception Desk for his kindness - he allowed us a later check out and was extremely helpful. In the past I have been to the Urban Hotel and to the ME Reina Vitoria but the Palace is absolutely the best in all aspects - we can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great service”
Reviews.Author: resakille
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Westin Palace. The people at the reception are very nice, especially Jessica. She is wonderful. The hotel has a lot of history in it. It is very charming. The room was spacious and comfy. The AC was powerful even in 36 C weather. The breakfast is wonderful with quite a lot of choices. I do see some minor things that need improvement. For example, the edge of the wall paper in the bath room is peeling off. But it's really minor. The location is perfect. It's located right across from the Thyssen Museum. It's closed to Prado as well as Reina Sofia Museum. A 5 minute walk will take you to the Sevilla metro station. There's a Starbuck around the corner as well. I like the location since it's not right on Gran Via, which could be quite noisy. Yes, the gentlemen at the front entrance needs to be a bit more friendly and helpful, like another user mentioned but it's just minor. The hotel has a pretty well equipped gym on the 7th floor as well. Overall, it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvrn84
Reviews.Content: On our trip to Spain my husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Westin Palace in Madrid. We were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful room and the great location. I highly recommend this hotel to whomever is visiting Madrid. We stayed in the Junior Suite, which was huge with a living room, a 1 1/2 bathroom, a huge bedroom and a walking closet. Our view was of the Church across the street and a pretty alley. When we walked in I was so in awe of the beautiful decor and the complementary plate of fruit waiting for us. The bathroom was big with a separate shower and tub. The hotel is gorgeous in the best location in town. The Prado museum is 2 minutes away behind the building, the Nuptune Fountain faces the building and all tourist spots are walking distance that we never needed to use public transportation. The staff was friendly and very helpful, we never got to use room service, but ate at the hotel restaurant and the food was amazing. I recommend trying the Minestrone soup. The only cons is that internet was not complementary and there was some construction or remodeling going on so we heard odd noises in the morning, but not loud enough to wake us up. One bonus tip, if you do not want to use the laundry service in the hotel (which is outrageously high in all hotels in Europe) we found a laundromat 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Take Calle del Prado to Calle de Leon and turn left and you will see the sign on the right hand side. It is 4 euros for washing and as many euros for the dryer.

Reviews.Title: “A really well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnthropologistAbroad
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel literally a block frm major museums. Excellent Internet. And when they had some electrical problems, they moved us to a giant multi-bedroom suite --and apologized for it.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Grand Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: FFFanatic
Reviews.Content: This is one of the mainstay hotels in Madrid, located close to the best museums, including the Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza and the Reina Sofia. Rooms are comfortable and elegantly appointed. If you are a typical American, the Starbucks on the first floor is a great find. Big negatives are the cost and the fact that almost everything is a la carte. 19 euros for daily Internet is ridiculous and the buffet breakfasts are astonishingly pricey. But you can't beat it for location and comfort so fill your piggy bank before you book and enjoy a very spectacular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lv2shop
Reviews.Content: Great location. Excellent fitness center. Very nice lobby. Free computers to use in the lobby with high speed internet. Next to the hotel, there are Starbucks and VIPS restaurant which has reasonable foods. A few blocks from the hotel there is a small vegeterian food to go called Comioda Vegetarian Buffet. You choose the foods and they weigh them. We walked accross the street and catched Hop On and Off bus that goes to the Old Madrid and another bus goes to the New Madrid. Coming to Madrid we took a taxi from the train station but leaving Madrid as we already knew the way, we just dragged our luggages through the park for 10min to the train station. You also can do the same thing to go to the airport, as the Airportbus (aerobus for 2 EU) stop is in front of the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Hemingway Landmark”
Reviews.Author: Jacksmack
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay in the Hotel but found it quite beautiful. Along with several other places in Madrid, Earnest Hemingway was known to hang in the Palace Bar. One of the prettiest and most relaxing bars in Madrid. Practically empty. Might have something to do with the price of drinks. My wife's and my two martinis came to a total of 53. US. Beer is 17.50 US apiece. Be forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc1958
Reviews.Content: Staff very courteous, great location, near the Prado and Sophia museums which had great exhibits. The food was out of this world at the restaurant, especially the Gazzpacio. Also had nice breakfast included in the room rate. Good restaurants nearby as well. Walked from the train station (about 20 minutes) after day trip to Toledo which is a must. Very nice rooms, very good value. Highly recommend. Because of the political/economic situation there, do not be surprised by large but peaceful political demonstrations such as the one outside the door of the hotel. The hotel is located very close to the Congress building.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location and helpful concierge, but very large with spotty housekeeping service”
Reviews.Author: SaraMB
Reviews.Content: We had a restful stay at the Westin Palace Madrid. The hotel is perfectly located in the city, so we were able to walk everywhere. Plus, since it is so large, our room was ready for us when we checked in at 8:30am after our transatlantic flight. Although the room was on the small size, it was very nicely appointed and brightly lit. The Westin beds are extremely comfortable and their sheets are of the highest quality. The concierge was very helpful every day with our itinerary of sights to visit and all lunch/dinner reservations had been made as promised. The only down side of the property is that because it is so large, housekeeping was a bit spotty, and one day when we returned at 6pm our room had not been made up at all. The housekeeping carts are left in the hallways, so we were able to gather a few more towels, etc. One other item to note for our Trip Advisor readers - Pre payment arrangements. I had prepaid this hotel since they offered a 30% discount on their rate. However, when we checked out, they had the incorrect amounts and I spend almost 20 minutes speaking with the front desk to resolve the situation. Luckily, I had brought my AMEX statement which showed the pre-pay charge. So, if you prepay any hotel in Spain, make sure that you double check the final bill and bring your credit card statement.

Reviews.Title: “AAA++++ Hotel. Great location, great interior decor. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: buslonjj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 days during my birthday and was overwhelming happy with my stay here. Upon arrival, we were put in a nice large room on the top floor with views of Neptune´s fountain! The room was clean and the room temperature was just about right. The showers were ¨heavenly"!!! Concierge service (although busy at times) was very helpful in terms of recommending places to eat for my birthday party and excursions to attend, etc. The business center had 6 Windows PC workstations and two printers. Unlike other hotels, this was free and there was no limits on how often/long you can use the equipment. Another benefit is that the business center is open 24 hours 7 days a week! The location of this hotel can´t be beat. We are across the street from Museo De Prado and within 5 minutes of several restaurants, bars and tapas bars. The hotel is 5 minutes to the train station which we promptly took on our way to Barcelona Spain for the last leg of this trip. The breakfast buffet had several different food options and unlike other hotels was open from 6 am to 11 am (I´ve been to other hotels where the breakfast buffet was open for just 2-3 hours). The breakfast buffet was included in our hotel stay. The gym was on the 7th floor by itself with no other rooms on that floor. There were 6 treadmills and other cardio machines...more than enough to go around. Tip: If you are in need of more towels, you can find plenty of them in the men´s or women´s locker in the gym. Cons: I actually don´t have anything negative to say about this hotel. I HIGHLY recommend it if you are going to stay in Madrid. The hotel location can´t be beat. The hotel is classy and elegant! jb

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: JoanMarietta_GA
Reviews.Content: We were here for 2 nights during our 20th anniversary trip. The place was beautiful, and our room was well appointed. It is conveniently located for walking around to various points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_75
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Westin Palace about 2-3 times a year. The hotel is always perfect as it is. Friendly staff, beautiful building, classic but extremely comfortable rooms, location can't be better and well, Madrid just rocks. Last time I forgot my sportswear and they sent it to my home adress without any hassle. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel, with some minor points to improve”
Reviews.Author: mrtourne
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the center of Madrid's museum row (across the street from the Prado and the Thyssen, so very convenient for that), the Westin Palace has become my de facto staying spot in Madrid (and I visit very often for work - I know, cry for me...). I find that the combination of location, beauty of the hotel itself and quite good service is hard to beat for a city that has its share of middling hotels. The Westin is definitely head and shoulders above most of them. The first thing that strikes you is how gorgeous and well preserved the common spaces are (the hotel is 100 years old next year, and has been maintained and refurbished to preserve it's splendor). The glass domed central tea room is gorgeous (it's also the location of an outrageously expensive Sunday brunch service - almost 80 Euros per person), and so are the lobby, american bar, and the Asia Gallery restaurant in back (which is, by the way, very reasonably priced and serves great food) The rooms themselves (and I've stayed in my share of them) are very spacious and nicely appointed. I've stayed both in the SPG floor (6th) and some other floors, and the rooms are fairly comparable (except that rooms on the 6th floors seem to all have bidets and the one I had on the 4th floor didn't, nothing major). I rather like the courtyard view rooms which actually have more light on the 6th floor (as the outside view rooms tend to have smaller windows, being the last floor) and are a lot quieter (traffic noise can be an issue on the surrounding streets, plus there's been extensive construction of an underground garage in the nearby plaza and lately demonstrations against the government a block away...) As far as other amenities, there's quite a nice gym with fairly new machines including sauna upstairs, although the solarium area is not currently open due to renovations. Service is par for the course for a 5-star hotel. The Service Express people are very attentive and come to your aid quickly. The front desk staff is very courteous and professional, and so are the baggage handlers and front door staff. Whenever I've had issues (such as an ongoing internet / tv issue one time) they've gone out of their way to fix it or compensate me for any inconvenience. Room service comes within the estimated time, and the food is good. That's not to say it's flawless, as there are some minor service glitches that keep it from becoming absolutely top notch, specifically around the housekeeping staff. It's probably a factor of how big this hotel is (it takes an entire city block), but some days some of the minor amenities seem to pass you by without explanation: some nights the maids show up for turndown service, and some nights they don't; sometimes they forget to bring the complimentary water bottles (2 a day), some days they forget to replenish the washcloths or the bath gel in the bathroom (on the other hand, it's one of the few hotels in Spain to even provide washcloths, so...). Maybe they should have some sort of checklist process, not sure... Also, the Wi-Fi access is incredibly spotty even on the same floor, which considering that it also comes at a steep cost is pretty annoying. There is a cable connection in each room, so that minimizes some of the pain, but if you are using an iPad for example, it can become quite vexing. All in all, those are minor quibbles, and I always look forward to staying here...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with terrific service”
Reviews.Author: cmmnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 7-year old daughter here in mid-April. The hotel is beautiful, the staff excellent and the location is perfect. We also went to the Sunday opera brunch which was really good with very high quality selections. The room was a little small but immaculate. We payed with Starwood points so that could account for the small room. But that would not keep me from staying here again

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Huuhu
Reviews.Content: Debated between staying here and the Melia Gran Fenix. Opted for the Westin and was very, very pleased. Absolutely perfect location (far better than the Gran Fenix) within easy walking distance of the major squares, Prado across the street, Retiro within blocks, and the Atocha train station within minutes. Beautifully decorated and some of the largest rooms I have seen in Europe. Great bedding. Staff most pleasant. The perfect choice for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel with immaculate customer service”
Reviews.Author: msmkb
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler with an average of 250+ hotel nights per year. I say this not to brag, but to provide a context for this review. When I compliment hotel staff, it's not just because they comped me a nice room or gave me some freebies (although it usually doesn't hurt, I admit), but because I feel that they deserve the recognition in comparison to my many interactions with hotel staff at many other properties. My husband and I stayed at this property during our honeymoon. Two days before our stay, I emailed the hotel (to the generic hotel email address provided in the pre-stay welcome email) to ask if they would consider our special occasion and comp us a room upgrade. Within 24 hours, we got a personal email from the General Manager of the hotel congratulating us on our honeymoon and informing us that an upgrade may be difficult as the hotel was sold out during our stay. I was impressed with the the GM's personal attention to my email, regardless of the potential lack of availability of a room upgrade. Upon check-in, a very courteous and friendly front desk associate congratulated us on our honeymoon (evidence that someone made a note on our reservation based on our email), and told us that we got a room with a beautiful view of the fountain. It wasn't a suite, but we appreciated that the hotel/GM did their best given their sold-out situation. As we arrived early around 12:30PM, our room was not yet ready. They asked us to wait an hour, so we went to lunch and came back, but the room still wasn't ready. The front desk apologized for the delay and comped us two drink coupons for the hotel bar while we waited. I thought that was a nice gesture and we got to enjoy a drink at their well appointed bar while we waited. Once our room was ready and we were checked in, the GM sent up complimentary goodies (champagne, snacks, and beautiful chocolate tray) with a personal note, again congratulating us on our honeymoon. Needless to say, we were thoroughly impressed with the GM's personalized attention to detail. During the rest of our stay at the hotel, we continued to be impressed by the friendly professionalism of all hotel staff we interacted with, including the maids. I think that is a great reflection of the GM's leadership, and based on my limited interaction, I would say he definitely leads by example. As far as the rest of the hotel, it is very conveniently located for most tourists' interests, and we were able to walk to most of the Madrid's sights and restaurants that we wanted to visit. Oh, one thing I remember is that when we asked the Concierge for lunch recommendations near the hotel, they sent us down Calle del Prado to Plaza Santa Ana. Although it was a nice plaza with many restaurants with terrace tables, we felt that area was a bit too touristy and later discovered more excellent bar/restaurants for tapas that were full of locals on Calle Medinaceli/Jesus and C. de las Huertas. And if you don't mind walking 20+ minutes or taking a taxi from the hotel, there are even more amazing restaurants on Calle Cava Baja. If you're shopping for a luxury hotel experience in Madrid, I feel that Westin Palace Madrid is an excellent choice, and I hope your experience with the hotel and the city is as good as mine was!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: beth_e_b
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and great location. Close to Prado and many restaurants but not too close to the craziness of Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StateEmployee1948
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a luxury hotel, rooms are large, with the large bath area, separated into a toilet and bath area. The rooms are not only large, but clean, and beautifully decorated.. It is right across from the Thyssen, and around the corner from the Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Billionaire, Stay at the Westin Palace!”
Reviews.Author: radworkers
Reviews.Content: I love being critical; critical is in my nature. Having nothing but extraordinarily wonderful things to say about Westin Palace Madrid (WPM) makes writing this review very uncomfortable for me. I’d never previously experienced the level of service, luxury and opulence as I had on my recent five-day stay at WPM. I booked a junior suite and I was upgraded to an executive suite (I suspect it is because I am a Platinum SPG member). The fancy hotel suite that the wealthy billionaire had in the movie “Pretty Woman” (played by Richard Gere) is the closest that I can think of for comparison. A large foyer opens to an extremely large bedroom and a large living/dining area with a chandelier and exotic living flowers. There was also an extra bathroom off of the foyer. The bathroom off of the bedroom had separate shower and tub and a separate toilet room that included a bidet. The shower had the best adjustable water pressure AND VOLUME that I’ve ever experienced. I also booked a junior suite for my kids and the junior suite itself was the largest of this type of suite that I had ever seen. Both suites had large bowls of fruit (9 different varieties) in the living areas. There were large bottles of complimentary water provided on each of the days of our stay. The views from the rooms were spectacular – the enormous Neptune Fountain was directly out our large spacious windows. The hotel has both housecleaning and afternoon turn-down service, of course. Certainly the most inspiring thing about the trip was our interaction with the General Manager. Upon our arrival late on the first night, our driver had dumped us off on the street with our luggage (not a very smart person), and I had felt that the hotel porter/doorman could have done more to help secure our safety. I emailed the General Manager about my concerns that night and the first thing in the morning I had an emailed response as well as a greeting card under the door from the GM, asking to meet with us about the experience. I did not call to make an appointment but rather wandered downstairs late (we slept-in) and within two minutes of asking for him at the front desk, he had concluded a meeting that he was in and introduced himself. He spent a good half-hour or more discussing the events from the night before, and he described how he had already reviewed the video of the entrance from that night. He got to know each of my family members individually and has done so much for us during our stay, it is almost unbelievable – so I won’t even bother to go into details. Suffice it to say, he is a genuinely personable gentleman who clearly puts his guests’ interest at the highest level of importance. Once again, the movie “Pretty Woman” comes to mind, where the billionaire has the highest level of service that you could ever imagine. I have read the few negative reviews from other reviewers on this site (there aren’t many of them) and I find their complaints extremely trivial. For example, having to pay for reliable internet is a wonderful thing. Any time that I’ve stayed at a hotel that had free internet, I could never get any work done because every youngster in the place was hogging bandwidth with their youtube.com downloads and social media and whatever else they use it for. It is very important for me to have reliable bandwidth; having a cost-threshold to keep the bandwidth reliable is great, because the time wasted waiting for unreliable internet is much more valuable than the cost of the internet. (BTW, ALL Starwood hotels clearly advertise that internet is an additional cost.) The complaint about the cost of meals at the restaurant is also nonsense. The hotel is clearly a high-rent building and the food and waiters are excellent, so you should expect to pay for it. If you want tapas for less cost, there are dozens of places to choose from within a block or two of the hotel. If you don’t like the exchange rate, ask the Fed to stop printing/dumping trillions of U.S. dollars into the financial system. I wish that there was something higher than 5 stars to award to a hotel, because The Westin Palace Madrid is far above the level of other hotels that I have rated 5-stars - and I rate extremely conservatively. This is by far my favorite hotel, ranking much higher than the Hyatt’s and even Four Seasons Hotels that I have stayed in previously.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too much of a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurie M
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel. Rooms a tad dated. We we're down-graded as the hotel was full and our Executive room was not available.The hotel did send up chocolates and champagne to make up for the mix up. Very busy lobby, looks like a lot of business being conducted. The breakfast room is gorgeous and the buffet quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and unlikely to repeat the mistake”
Reviews.Author: whiteworm
Reviews.Content: We chose the Westin over the Ritz (which is very nearby), because of the reviews on this site that suggested the latter was rather run-down and inferior; what a mistake we made. We had some problems early on in our stay (broken bed, inoperative telephone, an attempted break-in to our room in the early hours), but I realise that not every hotel, even one charging these rates, can be perfect; however, what stood out was the almost complete disinterest of the hotel management in dealing with these issues, and, worse still, the implication that I might even have imagined my encounter with the attempted thief (however ludicrous this might be). Not what one would expect of a five star hotel. On top of this, bear in mind that this is not really a high-end hotel at all (despite the impressive shell), but more like an expensive lay-over joint for traveling businessmen. The reception area is almost continuously overwhelmed by hordes of people milling about, and there are constant large and noisy events throughout. As a result, the service is more akin to that in a road-side cafe or busy small-town bar, than that of a grand continental hotel. The rooms seem fairly comfortable (although tastelessly decorated), and become reasonably quiet on the upper floors. In contrast, our visits to th Ritz showed that it was a much more sophisticated establishment, with friendly and helpful staff, and served food of significantly better quality. As the rates for both are similar, we know where we will be going next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: USCgirlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 for 5 nights as part of our Spain vacation. We were extremely pleased with this hotel. Our room was quiet (important for me as I'm a light sleeper), spacious, and extremely clean. I travel regularly for business and cleanliness is probably the most important factor that I look for when choosing a hotel whether for work or pleasure, and I was glad to see that the Westin Madrid was spotless. The signature Westin Heavenly Bed was comfortable and provided a great night's sleep. The dual sinks in the bathroom were convenient for getting ready as were the separated/partitioned toilet area. I was also happy to see that housekeeping respected the Do Not Disturb sign whenever we had it on the door, and didn't enter the room during these times (one of my pet peeves when staying in a hotel is when housekeeping disregards your request for privacy). The hotel location is also fantastic -- only about 10 minutes walking from the very heart of Madrid, Puerta del Sol, but enough aways so the hotel vicinity is still quiet. There are also several great restaurants just a few blocks away -- Taberna la Dolores and Terra Mundi. The Westin Madrid is an elegant, historic hotel with beautiful rooms -- I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but slightly claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: kojis
Reviews.Content: I left this hotel with mixed feelings, and wondering if the poster writing that the Palace is better than The Ritz after staying in the latter, where I had hesitated staying, had any experience with the Palace. Main issue, but quite important imo, is the Palace rooms lack light and air. You are in the middle of a mediterranean country, but end up in dark rooms with small windows and large frames ?!? which open only 10cms for security reasons. After asking to change rooms, I got an upgrade to an executive suite with fountain view connecting executive room also with a view for 200euros, which was comparatively a great deal ! Must thank the hotel staff for that move, but than the security wouldn't unlock the balcony doors... balconies are low and I suppose there have been some accident before, but the regular windows are at a standard high. Paying 800euros per night I'd expect not to be made so childish that someone else should tell me wether I can or cannot open the windows. Besides the hotel only offers inside bars and restaurants... the large terrace by the hotel on the Cortes square is instead occupied by a Starbucks... Across the street The Ritz has a great garden with bar and restaurants, where I ended up for drinks or meals everyday - it's Spain though, not a great gourmet destination, so even in The Ritz you will get food with too much oil and not enough veg - The central domed room in The palace looks great and it was a good time to have breakfast there with family and friends evey morning. The Suite was very nice and the service overall decent. It is an old building though and can become quite noisy. The area is great, I would definetely look for a place in the same district when going back to Madrid. Note as well that upon checking out before noon and trying to keep our luggage at the reception, the staff offered me to keep the room until 4pm, the time we had to go to the airport, and cancelled the internet bill, which i found a very nice unrequested move from from him.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Lakers2011
Reviews.Content: Location was very good. Concierges were very helpful. Excellent Service, free internet access in the business center and free printing.

Reviews.Title: “Superlative Stay”
Reviews.Author: OFTEN_HOMEBOUND
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 nights at this hotel at the end of May 2011, and I must say that we had one of the best times that we have ever had while staying at any SPG hotel for any considerable length of time (you will see why I say this later in the thread). Moreover, this was on a pure Starpoints stay = FREE, since the almighty Dollar is truly in the crapper right now. First, I would like to thank the management of the The Palace, as well as its exemplary service personnel who catered to every one of our whims and needs with a smile and without any delay. Second, to all of you above, who have posted your experiences while at this property, your insights were greatly appreciated! I will add that I believe that I was fortunate in that my wife and I had arrived on a Monday and we had left on a Saturday and this permitted us to obtain quite a nice suite upgrade as a result of my Starwood Platinum status for this reward stay. I believe we were also helped by the fact that there were no conferences at the hotel on the day of our check-in, otherwise, the suite that I had received, likely would have been unavailable to us, as it most certainly would have been reserved by a paying customer. In fact, the GM informed me that the hotel regularly has a 75% occupancy rate, and this is not solely due to its fantastic location for the tourists that regularly flock to Spain's capital. One might notice that the hotel is just down the street from the building that houses Spain's national legislature (Chamber of Deputies)and various governmental ministries -- so it is not hard to believe that politicians, their aides, lobbyists and all sorts of business persons also stay at this property due to its proximity to these power centers. In addition, two major insurance companies are across the street from the property, and it is the one that is directly across the side street from the hotel - Groupama -- that has this really nice animated clock/carillon with moving figures. See: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HkJuIZOcb6I The above video really does not display the whimsical nature of the show, which I believe runs every day at 12 Noon, 3 PM, 6 PM and 8 PM -- the bellmen certainly will know the correct answer should you ask -- so try to see it as it is right on your doorstep! We took the Aerobus into town from the airport (fare = 2 Euros p/p) and we alighted at the Plaza Cibelles which was about a 10 - 15 min straight shot to the hotel. The only problem that I initially had encountered was that I could not find the entrance to the hotel when arriving from this direction! I thought that it would have been somewhere on the street corner fronting the Neptune Fountain Plaza - somewhere near the Starbucks and the VIP restaurant, but instead, it was that side streets that passes the Chamber of Deputies. First of all, those of you who are seeking enormous hotel rooms, or humongous suites, this may not prove to be a suitable property for your tastes, as this is Europe, after all, and rooms are often smaller than those found in North America. Secondly, this property is located in probably one of the most exquisite positions in downtown Madrid and space certainly is at a premium here. Finally, the hotel will also be celebrating its centenary next year, and back then, a premium was just not put on large hotel rooms, and this property reflects that tradition. However, you should know that I found the rooms to be more than adequate as they were quite well furnished even if they are a bit compact, and they utilized their space limitations in an intelligent and efficient manner. Furthermore, although I personally am a fan of minimalist modern design, or modernist and comfortable decor found at most US Westin properties, the traditional furnishings of this hotel are quite appropriate and in keeping with the esthetic of the property. We were given Room # 636 -- The Palace Suite -- it even has a plaque outside its door -- that had a small entranceway leading directly to a living room, whereas the sleeping quarters were through a door off to one's left. There was a door to the right, but it appeared to be a connecting entranceway to the room next door and it appeared to be locked. Whether it was a powder room or something else, I do not know as we had no need of it. The living room was quite nice and was well furnished with period furniture and within each of the eaves (as it was sited in one of the magnificent cupolas atop the building) there was an inlaid glass panel with the hotel's logo etched in script. In addition to the full size sofa, there was an easy chair, a dining room table for 4, a work desk against one of the walls of the room, as well as the obligatory Flat Panel TV on what I guess was the mini bar. If one were expecting a huge room within which to throw a wild party, I guess one might have been dissatisfied, but if one had hoped to conduct a quiet business meeting or perhaps a romantic soiree, then this room would be perfect for your needs. The elegant surroundings for this vacationing party of 2 more than exceeded our expectations! The bedroom with separate door off the hallway opened into a well decorated compact bedroom with a lounging chair. However, the signature hallmark of this room was not what was within its walls, but rather, what was without, for there was a door that opened onto its own private terrace overlooking the Neptune Fountain and the Ritz Hotel! We often had drinks late at night savoring the view, but you should be aware that they turn off the Neptune fountain's lights at midnight. Further, The Palace has the better view of the fountain, as it faces its front, whereas the Ritz ,only has a view of his behind!! The room's en-suite bathroom again was appropriately outlayed with a separate tub, and as well a glass enclosed shower. The vanity was situated in the middle of the bathroom, the shower stall and tub to its left and the W/C to its right. The shower door, as well as the glass door leading to the W/C were each etched with the hotel's logo. Because the bathroom had both a tub and a shower stall, it actually might be a bit tighter than the bathrooms of the standard rooms at the hotel. In addition, two at a time at the vanity might prove somewhat challenging, and I think that my only other quibble would be that the shower stall ought to have door handles on both sides, so that can pull it closed to insure a tight fit when taking a shower. However, I do not recall any significant water seepage on the floor when exiting the stall, so in all probability, it is just my predilection for exactitude that notes this minor issue. Nightly turndown was provided 4/5 nights and was quite nice. Finally, as an American of now some girth (unfortunately), a well working Air-Conditioning system is a requirement for me, and the hotel came thru with flying colors, in this respect. In fact, of the 2 rooms I sampled, each of them had a powerful and efficient air conditioning system, and on the Queen bed that I had slept on, I received a direct, head-on blast from the A/C vent which was located on the wall directly opposite to my bed -- it was heaven and there are benefits to a compact room, especially in Spain's heat! Those who like to sleep a bit warmer can simply turn up the thermostat, but for those of you, who like me, appreciate a cool breeze on them when they sleep, while the wife sleeps warmer, you will not be disappointed. And, yes, I did mention a Queen bed in the suite that I had occupied. It did not matter to me, as I sleep on a Queen at home (yes, space is at a premium in my area, as well!) but it was the standard Westin issue bed which set the standard for beds in the hotel industry, so the smaller size proved to be of no issue to me and I had a restful sleep each night of my stay at the hotel. The hotel does have King bedded rooms, I believe, should you require a larger bed. The Green Marble and what appears to be dark Mahogany wood decor of the SPG floor that we were placed on, provides a striking interior design that bespeaks evident luxury without over the top flourishes, perfectly in keeping with the Old World tradition of the property. So too, does the lower lobby of the hotel with its grand upper steps leading to the upper lobby and the truly impressive and must be seen to be believed, Beaux Art/Art Nouveau domed dining room and adjacent bar. One can easily imagine well attired men and women at the very end of the Edwardian era, descending those magnificent steps, or more recently, American tourists flush with almighty Dollar, the only currency that really mattered in a post-war Europe ravaged in the aftermath of the carnage and destruction of WWII. Well, things certainly do change, but one must soldier on! For those looking for the health club, it is on the seventh floor and is reachable via a flight of steps near Room # 650. Just go thru the nearby exit door and ascend to the next landing. The fitness room is available by key card access 24 hours/day and is quite well equipped, but the view from there, alas, is not of the Neptune fountain, but of some other buildings and the nearby NH Hotel. It has dual adjustable A/C units and a cold water dispenser with free ear buds, as well. I did not dine at the hotel as a result of the rather forbidding breakfast prices, but had I been there for the Sunday Opera brunch, I might have partaken in the offering. However, I can recommend a nearby restaurant for lunch or dinner -- La Finca de Susanna, which is within a couple of blocks of the hotel. La Finca de Susanna is part of a mini-chain of differently named restaurants, all of whom apparently offer a similar type of cuisine at various locations in and around Madrid. Further, La Finca de Susanna would not look out of place on the Upper West Side of New York or in that city's SoHo or Tribeca neighborhoods, with smartly dressed waiters and crisp white linen tablecloths as I assume that the other restaurants are similarly decorated. I had been told by the wait staff that they all offer, for the value conscious, the approximately 12 Euro Menu del Dia for lunch, which was certainly the best dining bargain we had while in the capital. Alas, I also was advised that they do not offer a similar prix fixe for dinner, but given that I saw a number of regular diners ordering huge plates of mussels at lunch, and that entree was not on the Menu del Dia and its price was reasonable, as well, I can safely assume that must have a significant following at dinner, as well. Although my wife did not often require the services of the hotel concierges as my wife speaks Spanish and Madrid is easily navigable, they were invaluable to us for obtaining reservations on a moment's notice, for such restaurants as the Casa Botin, as the Palace name counts for something around Madrid! And I know that some of you may consider this restaurant too frequented by tourists -- and I was seated with many other English speakers -- in fact, one table we became quite friendly with and later roamed the Spanish Capital at night after dinner -- but the suckling pig was quite good, as well, and anyway, it is reputed to both be the oldest restaurant in the world, as well as having one Francisco Goya, as a former employee! As others have noted above, the Thyseen museum is across the street from the hotel and it is quite nice as it has a range of European art from over the centuries. What I was surprised at was that the Baroness only had started collecting in the 1980's and has yet amassed a considerable number of artworks! Additionally, a number of American artists represented, among them Childe Hassam, Winslow Homer, etc. In fact, all 3 major art museums are a credit to Spain, and they all should be visited if at all possible, and luckily, that is one of the strengths of the positioning of the hotel. As discussed, the Thyssen is across the street (you pass it on your way to the hotel if utilizing the Aerobus), and the Prado is across another street from the hotel. Finally, the Reina Sofia (the Modern Art museum that displays Picasso's Guernica) is housed in a former hospital/convent, and is no more than a 15 min walk from the hotel. Madrid's newest and the 4th major art institution -- the Caixa Forum -- one actually passes on the way to the Reina Sofia -- and this is the same route one would take if one wanted to go to the main railway station of Madrid -- the Atocha Station (also about a 15 min. walk from the hotel). By the way, I do not recommend you walk to/from the station with luggage, unless you only have a backpack, as the streets can be crowded at times. All of the museums presented their artwork in up to date, modern surroundings, with effective lighting on many of their respective masterpieces. My wife informed me that this was not always the case, and that when she last was in Madrid as a college student some time ago, the only game in town was the Prado, and that back then, the method of displaying the art was primitive, at best. The Reina Sofia and the Prado have free admission on certain evenings and some weekend days, and I believe that the Caixa is always free (I did not visit this museum), and the Thyseen, as a private museum, is never free, so pony up for that one! But, if you are staying any significant time at this hotel, you could visit a large chunk of the collections of both the Prado and the Reina Sofia without paying any admission charge as a result of the perfect location of this hotel. All in all, we had a superlative stay at the Palace which was made all the more so by the gracious hospitality of the GM and his employees. My wife and I certainly will return to this property, as we never even made it to Toledo or Segovia, instead opting to visit the royal palaces of El Escorial (by the way, I think the roundtrip bus services might be a better way to go than the train we took from the Atocha station), and the equally worthwhile Royal Palace at Aranjuez. I also mentioned above, that we had our best extended stay at any SPG property and the reason I had to caveat that statement was because we next went to Barcelona and stayed at the Le Meridien and received equally fantastic treatment from the GM and the hotel staff. Inasmuch as that stay was an all too brief 3 nights, this seemed an appropriate way to differentiate two equally excellent hotels that provide the best in terms of customer service, accommodations and location. My Le Meridien Barcelona review will grace this forum at a later date!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: croatia1960
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. Rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was amazing. lots of choice and dining area had great ambience. Location of hotel was very goof. Very close to Prado museum, parks and shoppinf district all of which we walked easily. Would stay here again. You wont be disappoined

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Tennis60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Palace on May 20 and 21 and I could not have been happier with my stay. I had contacted the hotel in advance about a personal problem of mine and they responded promptly and took care of my concerns. We took a taxi and were lucky with little traffic and the fare was 24 Euro (twice that on the way back as there was traffic, not sure if the driver took the long way). We arrived at the hotel at 9 am and were allowed to check in. This was great as we were able to take a 3 hour nap and then go out and enjoy the city. We asked for an interior room as quiet to me is more important than view, and the room was super quiet. I never heard any noises. Every one at the hotel, concierge, desk, bellman and maids were helpful and professional. The room while small compared to american standards but typical for hotels in Europe and was very nice. The bed was super comfortable and I am going to look for a similar mattress for my home. The location is great with a Starbucks right around the corner for my Starbucks addicted wife. The Prado a five minute walk. They have free internet in a business area and paid internet in the rooms. I could not recommend the hotel enough and did not find one thing wrong. I highly recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Palace Hotel. Loved the City of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: lmartos
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Madrid (5/24-5/26) from Barcelona and stayed at the Westin Palace Hotel for several nights before returning to the United States. The hotel is located in the middle of the city and is absolutely lovely. From the comfortable and elegantly designed room to the beautiful restaurant where breakfast is served. Everyone could not have been more helpful. When we arrived, we were upgraded to an executive room on a high floor. This allowed us to watch free movies and use the internet free of charge. We watched movies all night and saw the City of Madrid during the day. You can walk to shopping, museums, tourist attractions and so much more. Room service was excellent. The food (even the cheeseburger/fries) was amazing. My compliments to the Chef. Thank you Westin Palace for a wonderful & memorable stay. We hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a European hotel, not up to American 5* standards”
Reviews.Author: trenstar
Reviews.Content: Pros: Exceptional pre-arrival service, prompt response to all e-mail inquiries, accommodated early check-in request with 0 problem Free use of business center Excellent location, near all of the museums / Retiro Park / etc Fairly nice / spacious rooms for a European hotel Cons: Lots of small issues. I usually wouldn't care and nitpick about these issues, but for the price paid for what's supposed to be one of the best hotels in Madrid, I was surprised that the service was so negligent. - there were doormen but they did absolutely nothing. when we arrived we had to open the door ourselves, not once did the doorman open the door for us - no turn down service - we asked for a city map when checking in at reception, they said to ask the concierge. this is just inefficient - many people ask for city maps when checking in, I have no idea why they would not have maps at reception - turning on the TV was extraordinarily slow (it took ~2 minutes every time before we could actually switch to a station) - the air conditioning system is extremely imprecise, you can't set a temperature, there are only low/medium/high settings and you have no idea how warm/cold each of these settings will be - the room was starting to look a little worn, especially the bathroom seat which needed replacement - a bar of soap was provided for the sink but not in the shower/tub. they should provide two bars of soap - extra services such as internet are ridiculously priced - nickel and diming your customers who have already paid $300+ per night on average is a little ridiculous, especially as much lower quality hotels provide free wifi - the hotel is extremely spread out, if you don't get a room near the elevator it can be at least a 5 minute walk to your room - bed was comfortable (assuming you like soft beds), but it was small (perhaps a full sized bed) and not what I would consider to be the normal "Westin Heavenly Bed" - shower was good, but not what I would consider the normal "Westin Heavenly Shower" (i.e. shower pressure was good but not amazing) Overall it was a nice 4* hotel but not worth the price. Tip: If taking public transportation from the airport, the bus is more convenient than the metro. Get off at the second to last stop (Cibeles) and it's about a 10 minute walk from there

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Avishai625
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, great, elegant hotel with the best location and service. Their Junior Suites are huge and very well appointed. Their restaurant is located in a huge room with a magnificent stained glass dome, very much awe inspiring. The food at the restaurant was excellent. The location of the hotel is excellent. An overall great experience which we hope to repeat soon.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious,elegant hotel,with sumptious buffet in impressive dining room.”
Reviews.Author: lynnehuggins
Reviews.Content: Great Central location, close to main attractions, shopping and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: JeffK7882
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been travelling for over 35 years. We tend to stay in either 4 or 5 star hotels. We have taken several Tauck tours and when we do not, we usually stay at hotels that Tauck uses. We have just returned from 8 days in Spain. In Madrid we stayed at the Westin Palace, in Seville at the Alfonso VIII and in Barcelona at Le Meridian, three hotels Tauck uses. We loved our stay at the Westin Palace! We arrived a bit early but this was no problem - our room was ready! The room was very, very nice with all the convenience you would expect in a 5 star hotel. As we are Starwood Preferred guests our room was on the top floor, the 6th floor. The concierge was extremely helpful. There is a charge for internet service in our room (something that is offered free is less expensive hotels, but something we have come to expect in expensive hotels). However, free internet service is provided in the business center. Next to the Business Center is an ATM machine. The location is excellent: Opposite the Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza Museums; walking distance to the Puerta dei Sol, Plaza de Sta Ana and Plaza Mayor. We also took a day trip to Toledo, via the train. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Old Fashioned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It has the very rare knack of making you feel welcomed and special. It really feels a little decadent staying there. Very few hotels can manage to instill the feelings like this. It feels like a destination rather than a stopover. The staff were great, lots of smiles, the food wonderful and the location could not be better. We had a suite and it was just beautiful. Huge, with pretty much the most comfortable bed I have ever been in. Stay there, it is not cheap but it is worth the money Rich

Reviews.Title: “Good but standards have dropped”
Reviews.Author: CPKONE
Reviews.Content: We visited just this weekend and we really did have a good time and we were happy with the hotel, however for a 5 star, high priced hotel, I would have expected more and I have experienced better service in this hotel, in the past. The rooms could have been cleaner and (I will not go in to detail on specifics) there was evidence of the previous guests in our room, that would question the approach to cleaning. The reception area and conscirege were not occupied at times, which is amazing for such a large hotel. It took over an hour for our luggage to be delivered to our room. They also tried to charge us for Internet, that seems incredible these days - but we negotiated well and they dropped it. On a positive note, the staff were, without exception all very friendly and professional, the breakfasts were amazing and the location is very convenient. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from a lovely park that is excellent for a pleasant walk, jog or just to hand out. I was disappointed however to see standards dropping, as this is acually my 3rd visit to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: NightWhispers
Reviews.Content: I like giving credit where it's due. This hotel was one that pleasantly surprised me. Arriving 3 hours late from a delayed flight from Lisbon I was very happy to find that the reception had actually taken the time to call the airport and reschedule my car to meet me when my plane landed. Got whisked off to downtown Madrid to this hotel, arrived to find myself in front of a very charming typical Spanish Architecture designed palace. The lobby itself is amazing, not new or modern at all but excellently adapted without compromising the design. Not hard to navigate at all. The receptionist that received me (I could kick myself for forgetting his name) was I believe the best staffmember of any hotel that I have ever been to. As soon as he saw me, he told me "oh, you've been delayed, then I won't keep you, I've upgraded your room and sent you a fruit platter, and the AC is set to your preferred temperature". Less than a minute later, I was in the elevator on my way to a room which was facing away from the main entrance (there was some construction going on there which was sort of noisy). The rooms are MASSIVE and very comfortable, the westin bed... Words cannot describe how marvelous it is to sleep in one of those. ACs are controlled from within the rooms, it was very easy to change the temperature, internet works fine, and the bathtub - wow... I went down later on in the afternoon to thank that receptionist - he was gone and no one could tell me what his name was... There's security in the lobby that DOES actually differentiate between the guests and visitors... I took a nap in the afteroon to wake up to a second fruit plate from the hotel "we hope the delay did not inconvenience you too much, please let us know if there is anything we can do to make your stay better"... Now, that's service... Checkout the next morning was just as smooth, although with a different receptionist. What else is there to say ? A great hotel with great service and excellent staff. Well worth the stay, well worth the visit, highly recommended (especially the green apples by the exit of every floor...) An experience to remember. I am definitely going back there the next time I'm in Madrid. (and if management can find the staffmember that received me, please pass on a very special thank you)

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! Classic elegant Spanish Baroque style with all the modern conveniences. The location is superb, you walk right across the street to the Prado. Even the Puerta del Sol is no more than a 15 minute walk. The Atocha station is also about a 15 minute walk in the other direction. Staff is extremely pleasant and helpful. Everything is low key and tasteful. Internet is expensive and as other reviewers have noted, just go downstairs to the Starbucks or use the buisness center in the hotel and it's free. I also saw a breakfast buffet for "only" 45 Euros ( not including drinks)! We passed on that and ate next door at the Spanish Denny's ( called Vips), and had a gringo style breakfast for about 5 Euro each. It was fine. Also, if you want a good filling lunch close by, try Cervantes Cerveceria which is about a block behind the hotel. Great Seafood salad! One other word of advice, get to the Prado early, it gets packed!

Reviews.Title: “Incomparable perfection”
Reviews.Author: Pigeon78
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at this most luxurious hotel where everything thus far has exceeded even the highest expectations. The decor is sublime - although we are staying in the least expensive room every detail is immaculate from perfect wallpaper to the elegant art work in the lavatory! The bed is so comfortable, and even the rollaway bed we are using to fit three in a room is like a real bed. All the staff have been warm and courteous. The buffet breakfast in the much lauded domed restaurant is fabulous. We got a 4 nights for the price of 3 with breakfast deal, and the value is really outstanding. A particularly beautiful touch was the complimentary bottle of champagne and tray of exquisite chocolates on arrival as this is a special trip celebrating my parents´ wedding anniversary. For those of us who sadly cannot afford to stay in such places all the time, the Westin Palace offers a great opportunity to enjoy the finest of hotels for a few glorious days. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall experience”
Reviews.Author: voyageur1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights before Marrakech, and it was good. Check in was smooth, and we appreciate that our room's ready despite our early arrival at 0900 hrs. Room's spacious for European standard, heavenly bed and shower ensured our jet lag remedy. Location is the key selling point, with Museo del Prado and Atocha train station within walking distance. There are countless options for dining with tapas restaurants all around and plus there's Starbucks downstairs, which we used to get our morning Joe and free internet (high-speed internet in the room is, yup, not cheap!) and a convenience store selling ready meals, magazines and other novelties. Breakfast was a bit disappointing, not too many varieties and in general lack of presentation, but then again, you can always get your brekkie around the hotel. Concierge was helpful and seem experienced, so ask them for best dining spots or entertainment. Gym is small but clean and it open 24 hr. Despite our short stay, we managed to visit Toledo, which's an hour away by train. It's worth the visit as the town is listed as UNESCO world heritage site, with lots of charm in every turn. One last thing, make sure you visit Mercado de San Miguel, an indoor market filled with Spanish charms! We had great riojas, tapas and sweets, all under one roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAllister
Reviews.Content: Exactly the right location, exactly the right service, exactly the right price. They just get everything right - no waiting, no wrong charges, no having to ask twice. I like the way this hotel is run and enjoyed the bar and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “First class in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: F4monty
Reviews.Content: The Palace really is a class act - but then it should be for the price! It's perfectly located close to the Prado and the stunning Parque del Retiro, while all other sights are easily walkable. The shopping and nightlife of Malasana and Chueca are nearby too. Reception staff were friendly and professional - as indeed were all staff in the hotel. The bedroom and bathroom were spacious, spotless and comfortable with all the normal facilities. The only niggle was that the mattress felt as if it had seen better days - I kept rolling into the middle! The focal point of the hotel is the stunning Rotunda, its glass dome as impressive in the daylight as it is at night. A great place to have a drink, have breakfast or a meal. We only dined in the hotel once but the food was exceptional - and 150 euros for three courses. Breakfast was excellent too but 35 euros if you haven't booked in advance. So this hotel isn't cheap but we did resent having to pay for wireless in our room. Not everyone wants to go to a business centre to check emails and more and more hotels these days offer it free. Overall this is a fine hotel that deserves its reputation and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant hotel where the staff is pleasant and efficient”
Reviews.Author: marian0286
Reviews.Content: The Palace is elegant without being at all stuffy. We had a suite as well as another bedroom. The suite had sliding doors that closed off the bedroom area and "Juliet balconies". The double-sink bathroom also had a separate shower in addition to the bath and a separate toilet and bidet area with a translucent door that let in the light. In both the suite and the regular room the beds were covered in pristine white duvets that were very inviting as well as very comfortable. The recommendations given by the concierges were excellent and the Prado Museum is across the boulevard. It was a wonderful choice and I'd book it again without a second's thought.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: brightspice
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable: great rooms and facilities. The hotel is right in the centre of town and fabulously located. We had asked for interconnecting rooms and usually have to re-confirm this at check in. Not with the Westin - they had everything set up for us splendidly. We had booked a package which included free wifi and free movies which worked really well for our children. The bar was super comfortable and the food in the hotel's Chinese restaurant was very, very good (with excellent service to match). I definitely recommend this hotel and would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a King”
Reviews.Author: dupedtourist
Reviews.Content: It's fun to pretend that you're royalty now and again, and what better a place to do this than a hotel that was originally built as a palace by King Alphonso. From the fancy doorman in full Wizard of Oz guard garb, to the expansive lobby with marble floors and trompe l'oeil paintings, to the impressive rotunda tea room area with a huge chandelier and leaded stained glass dome, you'll feel privileged staying here, even if you're a commoner, like me. The location is both handy and prestigious. It's right across a fountain square from the Prado museum, and walking distance to several Metro stops and the train station (if you don't have loads of luggage) and there are many fun tapas bars and restaurants nearby. It's also only a 15 minute walk to the Puerta Sol and Gran Via but these are typical tourist haunts with t-shirt shops, chain stores and restaurants with pictures of their food in the window that spell certain doom all over the world. The double decker tour buses stop right across the square every 15 minutes or so. You can select an "old world" or "modern" route and you can get off and on at will. Some visitors think these are too "toursity" but I think they are a great way to get oriented or to use as your own semi-private transport system. One nearby place that may fool you, as it did me, is a chain called VIPS. It may look like a Spanish Denny's but they offer good, cheap food, in a nice setting, at any time. Keep in mind that many Spanish restaurants open for lunch at 1:00 pm, close for siesta and re-open at 10 pm. VIPS serves many Americanized variations (great for kids, fussy eaters or those with a jones for a burger), plus beer and wine and have a convenience store tacked on so you can take sandwiches and drinks with you as you tour the city, or pick up stuff to re-stock the inventory you took from the mini bar but are too cheap to pay for. Take a right out of the hotel door and VIPS is one block away. Of course there are many more dining options near the hotel and I would urge you to go exploring. Take your first right or left leaving the front door and follow the small streets behind the hotel (not in the direction of the fountain or the Prado) and you can't help but wander into a maze of tapas bars, jazz clubs, and pubs. Don't be shy, wander in, belly up to the bar, order a local beer or glass of wine and point to what you want to eat. Be aware that you may receive some tidbits "on the house" and that glasses are small, so ask for "grande". My assigned room was nice and it had a balcony with a view of the fountain square, but it was noisy due to traffic and a cop who blew his whistle with every exhale. There are motorized window shutters but I only discovered these after I requested a quieter room towards the back of the hotel. Both rooms were large (keep in mind, I get upgraded) with modern marble bathrooms. The rooms, halls and elevators are beautifully done with fine materials and have a solid old world feel lacking in your basic Sheraton or Hilton with their crack house security doors and Formica counters. The bed, as in nearly every Starwood room was plush with a slew of pillows. Although I ate like a pig for 3 days, I didn’t' sample the fitness facilities. There's also a very large park on the other side of the Prado that would be great for running or walking. The front desk staff and the concierge were quick to please and spoke perfect English. The Wi-Fi in my room didn't work (this is a common Starwood issue in Europe) but the wired ethernet connection did. I get internet access for free (Platinum status), otherwise it will cost you $18 euros a day, which is outrageous in a hotel of this standing and price. Would I stay at this hotel again? Yes, if I'm on an expense report. I have no complaints except for the price- $290 euros a night. But compared to a St.Regis you could call it a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best concierce in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jclsouthfl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 1 week stay at the lovely Westin Palace in Madrid. The hotel is located in the center of Madrid and you can easily walk to Plaza del Sol, Chueca, el Prado and so much more. You can catch a cab any time of day or night at the hotel (be nice and tip the doorman, who will call the cab for you). The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous and impeccably maintained. The Sunday brunch in the hotel's restaurant is an experience not to be missed. No, it is not cheap...but why should it be? This is a 5 star hotel and you get what you pay for. If you're looking for modern, stay at Hotel Urban (a couple blocks away). This hotel is not modern, but it is elegant. The concierge at this hotel deserves special recognition. Although there were 2 different gentlemen that helped me with various needs over my stay, I only remember one name...LISANDRO. He was truly a magnificent concierge (and easy on the eyes too!) If you like outstanding service set in a beautiful belle epoque Madrid landmark, this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, an experience in itself but mean over one essential so 4*”
Reviews.Author: jtwoodfield
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a history, it will be 100 next year, and is an experience in itself. It is a member of that small group of hotels which make it feel good just to arrive. Then even better when one goes into the rotunda which is used, amongst other things, for breakfast. The beds are excellent. The staff extremely helpful. The position perfect with really good places to eat nearby and the culture next door. EVen the carpets are works of art. The only reason I am not going to give it 5* is their - probably American - idea that you can charge premium prices and then charge again, extorionately, for internet use. I hope that others will get together and protest.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: kasumiga
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very elegant. it was centrally located and it was easy to get to everything we wanted to see. the beds were very comfortable and the windows really shut out the noise from outside. special shout out to alvero from front desk you was extremely helpful and patient. and to patricia at the restaurant who took time out to give great advice for shopping for me and my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Madrid !!!”
Reviews.Author: JulienF
Reviews.Content: Just WoW, one of the nicest Westin, I've stayed. The architecture of the hotel is amazing, it's a real palace, inside & outside, you won't be dissappointed. Perfect location in downtown Madrid, 2mins walk from El Prado Museum + 5 mins from Plaza Santa Ana + 5 mins from Centro Reina Sofia, 10 mins from Puerta del Sol&Plaza Mayor. You got small shops around the hotel as well as coffee shops+restaurants/bars. I really enjoyed this hotel and I will return for sure if I return to Madrid, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: kpapadop007
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night Starwood award stay here checking in April 2nd and checking out April 8th. We were assigned room 524. Overall, this is a great hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Location: The location is indeed great. El Prado museum is to your East and another great museum is across the street. You can walk easily to Plaza Mayor and to the Atocha train station. You also need to walk several blocks to get to the nearest Madrid metro station. And taxis are very plentiful and cheap in the city. The hotel is 100 years old and is just beautiful. Check out the small museum on the ground level before the restaurant and check out which heads of state & celebrities have stayed there before. Rooms: As Starwood Golds, we were upgraded to a room with Premium View on the Starwood floor. We had a nice view of the plaza. The rooms are very nice but they are definitely small compared to US standards. The beds are indeed heavenly! After walking for so long we slept like babies every night. The shower is also fantastic as expected. I tried to kindly ask for an upgrade to a junior suite from the hotel manager and was nicely shot down. I thought maybe we can get the suite as me and my wife are both Golds but it was again pointed out to us that G+G is not equal to P (Platinum) :-) Service: I think this is what separates hotels from the average hotels around. Everything we asked for was done fast. We asked for a few electrical adaptors, extra towels several times, a tea kettle...all delivered fast and with a smile. Check in & Check out was done fast and pleasantly. Concierge was used once and he was great. We even got a call from manager's assistant if we needed anything. Turndown service was done super fast and all maids we interacted always greeted us. Treatment of Gold Elites: Again, we were given a standard view on the Starwood floor with a premium view. A couple of waters each day. I do not expect much more from Starwood. And this is the reason I am still loyal to Hilton who treats Golds much better. For starters, Hilton Golds get free internet! Each 24 hr internet access will cost you 16.10 euros plus tax in the Westin. For 2 days of internet we had to pay 38 euros total! For example, we stayed at the Hilton Madrid airport the final night before our flight and, as Golds, we received free internet, room on the executive floor with lounge access including a full breakfast buffet for all 4 of us. As I said, I always felt in Starwood properties that I should just be glad I have the privilege of staying in their property while staying in Hilton I always felt more "wanted". JMHO. Overall, we loved Madrid and we really enjoyed our Westin Palace stay!

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Rooms Are Quiet But Lacks Madrid's Buzz”
Reviews.Author: Pablon
Reviews.Content: We checked into Westin Palace Hotel for 3 nights on Level 6 rooms facing the Courtyard after being recommended that they were quieter. The rooms were indeed quieter but the views were of the glass dome of the restaurant (boring) and you lack the buzz of Madrid. Depending on what's your cup of tea, facing the Fountain could indeed be a better option. The check in staff were ok, but lacks the warm Westin / Sheraton treatment we get in US and Asia. Maybe it's because lots of tourist pops into the Palace Hotel for a viewing on their way to the Thyssen or Prado. Location wise is excellent if you love the museums! Less than 5 minutes from Thyssen and across a park to Prado's main entrance. However, if you prefer the energy of Plaza Mayor or Sol and shopping in Salamanca, this hotel maybe quite a walk away. Internet is free by Starbucks at the opposite end of the hotel building. Most hotel chains in Spain provide free Internet, but they charge €6 for 1 hour access. Parking is a problem for this hotel, better off returning the car when you arrive back in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KPDenver
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a great location. Staff was very helpful. Hotel has been nicely updated and has a nice gym. Rooms were really nice and quiet. You can walk to all the key sites from here. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WandaTX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful. The service was great - especially at check in. Those who complain about the hotel not being sufficiently upgraded should stay at a modern, sterile motel. This is a grand property that has been appropriately upgraded. It is also in an ideal location in Madrid. We recommend it heartily and would gladly return. The stay was lovely and the breakfast decadent. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the Ritz for half the price”
Reviews.Author: miamiajp
Reviews.Content: Grand Dame of Madrid Hotels never disappoints. Very classic in the old world style. Good unobtrusive service and great location. Spacious rooms with great bathrooms. One small complaint would be the charge for wifi which most hotels these days offer complimentary and here costs upwards of 16 euros a day. Starbucks, right around the corner offers free internet acces with purchase. Breakfast under the glass dome is an experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: atrueblue
Reviews.Content: Fab location, amazing rooms, and food very good. Just what you would expect from a 5 star. (as well as the bar prices - 23 euro for a G&T!

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Madrid”
