Reviews.Author: vandelay09
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace Hotel is great. Great Location, great rooms, fantastic history and the best Spanish and Asian restaurants in Madrid. This is a very old hotel built in 1924 with many of the original appointments still in existence. To sit in the rotunda and have breakfast or an afternoon drink is really a treat. The front desk staff is great and always willing to help. The rooms are very well done with marble bathrooms and the best heavenly beds. If you are lucky enough to stay in one of the suites you are in for a special stay. The hotel can be expensive but its worth the money. It is simply my favorite hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Second great visit!”
Reviews.Author: HandAM2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our first trip to Spain in 2009, and this time started here for two nights following an overnight flight from the US. We had another beautiful and comfortable room and experience - and its in a perfect spot for the old city and museums. My special thank you to the hotel for accomodating our request for an early check-in after the overnight flight. After a few nice days in Madrid, we took the amazing AVE train to Seville and stayed in the Starwood Alphonso XIII. Another palace, in a perfect location, in a wonderful place! Both have great services, are somewhat expensive but worth it! (but not breakfast if not included in your rate).

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed or stay”
Reviews.Author: JackR46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights using the starwood points/cash option, as we do have a travel budget. We would have found other options if we had to pay the "normal" rates. We were upgraded to a "best view" category room on the fifth floor due to Starwood gold status (thank you very much). This non-smoking room was luxurious and elegant. We had no issues with any smoke smell in our room, through the air contioning or in the public areas as a recent previous review stated. Our room seemed pretty much sound-proofed and we did not have any issues with noise from traffic outside or adjacent rooms. Great location - across the street from the Prado and within short walking distance to several other museums, pedestrian streets with great tapa bars and the first stop of the 'hop-on, hop-off" bus. Prices for parking, wifi access in rooms (although they did have 6 computers available for free use in/near the business center), drinks and meals seemed quite expensive. Everything was first class. It was a very pleasant experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: robw48
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated with very high standards of housekeeping Rooms are spacious and the public areas are very impressive Staff helpful and courteous Not cheap but you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel - Couldn't Top It!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureWoman2010
Reviews.Content: Loved this grand classy hotel, so happy I chose to stay here. Flew in from Scottsdale and met a friend from Boston who loved it as well. Two single American women, visiting Madrid for 5 days. The location is perfect to walk to museums, shopping, best Tapas bars and more. I booked in advance directly online on the Westin Hotel website and got an amazing deal - stay 5 nights, pay for 3 nights in advance receive 2 nights free. Wonderful! The only negative was my room was one that needed to have a little bit of rehab. It was a clean, great room but some of the furniture was a bit frayed. My friend paid full price for her stay and I noted her room was in tip top shape, still not a problem since everything else was so perfect. The service was 5 star, especially the concierge - namely Ricardo! Brit Air 1st class lost ALL MY LUGGAGE - God bless anyone who transfers at Heathrow, please hand carry all your luggage on board with you. I arrived at the Westin Palace on a Wednesday and the concierges (mostly Ricardo) stalked Brit Air daily trying to get me my luggage, which finally arrived on Saturday! Thank you Ricardo for staying on top of the problem! It helped that Ricardo warned them that I had a much needed prescription in the 1st class luggage! remember that one next time, hopefully never will have a "next time". Upon arrival at the Westin Palace there was quite a hullaballoo going on as MTV was hosting the EMA Awards in Madrid and most of the stars were gracing their presence upon us at the Westin. The star guests at the hotel were Miley Cyrus, Katy Perry, Shakira, Kes$ha, etc. The policia were patrolling the front doors where fans waited at all hours, screaming when a star appeared. It was fun with the exception that I was wearing the same outfit (had it laundered by housekeeping several times of course) every time I came and went - sort of like walking down the red carpet! I am single and blonde and many times I have been called a Shakira look alike, so much to my chagrin I had to be seen by the fans wearing the same outfit over and over. Kind of funny. Anyway, another plus service story was the GM of the hotel. I had smartly bought travel insurance and when the luggage never arrived I called the hotel operator to find out how to call the USA travel insurance collect so I could go out and buy some cosmetics etc. I thought I had followed her instructions but upon checking out on morning of Day 6, found I had international phone charges of what amounted to about $500 USD!! With no time to waste at checkout as I was hurrying to catch an international flight to Morocco, I felt best to revisit the bill upon my return at the Westin for one more night the following week before I flew back to the US. When I did return to the Westin from Morocco, I made an appt. to see the GM about my hideous phone bill. He was quite professional and sweet. He went to confirm with the hotel operator the dialing instruction she had given to me, reported back to me that I had been one digit off for correct dialing and credited the entire phone bill - helping me to have sincerely warm heart felt memories of the Westin and Madrid after all. My room was much better quality on my return for the one night as I was paying the normal rate, no deal that night. Food was great, there is a Starbucks practically next door, great street full of tapas Bars beside and behind the hotel. I made sure to check out the only competitor, the Ritz Carlton across the plaza. No contest, stay there if you are retired, grey haired and want a very unhappening quiet hotel. What else can I say, you MUST stay at the Westin Palace Hotel, I will when I return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and public spaces. Fair service. Poor value.”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights for the new year. The rooms were very nicely decorated. They are very stingy with soaps and shampoos considering the prices. Service is very slow. The breakfast is good, but not great. Room service was ridiculously priced. Internet was ridiculously priced. The concierge staff was effective and efficient, but don't expect assistance with unusual requests. Book here only if you get a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you want to replicate a Westin hotel stay in the US”
Reviews.Author: avgold
Reviews.Content: This sparkling clean hotel is exactly like staying in any Westin in the States--same tolietries, same towels, same English language newspaper, same green apples in the gym. It is a very,very expensive property, and you are charged for EVERYTHING--internet in the common areas, etc. I needed some help on booking a train and the concierge was useless. The food offering was shockingly expensive, even by Euro standards. There are a number of super, high end, non-touristic Tapas bars around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Westin, but not exactly a Palace”
Reviews.Author: Joelsif
Reviews.Content: I wasn't incredibly impressed the first time I stayed here, but being an SPG member wanted to give this hotel a second chance, especially for its location. Yes, location, location, location, if you are going to Madrid and are planning to go to museums, walk and admire the architecture or have a bite here and there, this hotel will be close to many of your activities. It also represents a great hub to rest a bit during the day and continue your activities at night. Getting to the hotel is actually quite simple by subway from the airport (2 euros), train (5 mins from atocha station), driving (they have parking garage) or just take a taxi for about 30 euros from Barajas. As other reviewers have mentioned, this hotel will charge you for absolutely everything... I'm not against paying for services, but this is the first Westin/SPG hotel I visit where people at the reception desk didn't even try to make my stay the best possible after having issues with my reservation (issues I was not responsible for). Hard to imagine people working there having no sympaty for you at all, they just need your credit card. During my stay, I just felt like any other guest, quite impersonal treatment. Concierge is very knowledgeable and everyone in between is very helpful, so I'd recommend this place to other people, it just doesn't fit the bill for me anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about my four night stay at the Westin Palice”
Reviews.Author: margaret551774
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the westin palice to celebrate my 50th birthday.I emailed Marc Lannoy a few days before our stay to request a smoking room for us and a non smoking room with a view for my daughter and her husband who also stayed at the hotel.Not only did we get the rooms we asked for their was a bottle of champagne and a lovely card waiting in my room.We found the service excellent during our stay from start to end.The staff could not have done anymore to make us feel more welcome or catered for.The breakfast was excellent and so enjoyed under the spectacular dome .After a busy day and night in Madrid it was good to know we were going back to such a comfy bed.I would advise anyone visiting Madrid to stay here. We certainly will when next back in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kikijaz27
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an even better location. Close to some of the best museums and far enough away from some of the tackier sites to forget they're there if you want. We stayed here on New Year's Eve and it was only a 10 minute walk from the celebrations in Puerta del Sol, but once we got back to the hotel, it was quiet. Wifi was very expensive, but there are a few free computers. Service was generally great, however, we paid for a triple room and it took over 6 hours and 3 separate phone calls to get the third bed. The fitness center was also really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in a filthy dirty rude ashtray”
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all but... Be sure to bring portable oxygen. 35 euros a day for internet no wifi available even though they say it is available. Smoky chaos everywhere we ran around looking for the restaurant and it had been relocated to a small out of the way banquet room for the night. Staff was horrible, was delivered a piece of fish that you smelled on its way to the table. I am sure my cat would not even eat it. No upgrades to the starwood gold members and they looked at me like I was crazy for asking. Walls paper thin heard the next door couple having a realy good night if you know what I mean. We had to turn off the heat in the middle of the night becuase it felt as if we were getting gassed with smoke. When I asked in teh AM about the non-smoking floor I was told I was on one. Yeah right. The signage for the health club was horrible if you do decide to go to this hotel take a GPS to find the gym. You have to go into what looks like the service entrance to reach an elevator that will take you to a stealth location that leads to a door with the gym. The gym was nicely presented and clean I should have brought my blanket and camped out there for the night!!!!! Very quiet and smoke free!! Probably becuase no one can find it. DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU LOVE SMOKE AND ARE ON A SERIOUS DIET AND LOVE SPENDING $75 ON 5 COKE LIGHTS...

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel but okay staff...”
Reviews.Author: simplecity
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very spacious, ample closet space and lovely bathroom with double sinks and separate toilet area. Not a fan of the TV system and the internet is very expensive (19 euro per day). I'm a big fan of the Westin beds and was well rested and ready each morning to explore Madrid! Although I did not use the concierge service, I did not feel the most welcomed by the staff. The doormen and porters didn't open the doors or greet people as they entered or exited the building. They just stood there, so not sure what their job description is. I just expected a friendlier staff. But the design and comfort of the hotel and rooms is very elegant and I'd recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Onereallyniceguy
Reviews.Content: Well located on the Paseo del Prado across the street from the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum as well as the Prado, who could ask for more. Unlike most hotels, this gym is worthy of the name located on the top (7th) floor of the hotel overlooking the city. Elegant, sumptuous with helpful, attentive staff and great restaurants, this is one hotel that has it all.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: paulheight
Reviews.Content: I found the Palace Hotel to provide an exceptionally professional environment. The location is perfect, being equidistant to the old downtown as well as the higher-end Salamanca district. I will stay here during my next stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a luxury hotel but quite irregular”
Reviews.Author: JaimeAD
Reviews.Content: Nice and affable service, very clean rooms, spacious, plenty of cupboard space and large bathroom. However, sometimes room service takes forever even to pick up the phone and gym is quite basic and not well mantained

Reviews.Title: “Great location and old world luxury”
Reviews.Author: jakeandben
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Westin. We arrived after an overnight flight and were able to check in to our room at 9:00am, which we really appreciated. The room was lovely and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast was very nice with a tremendous number of choices and the room in which it is served is just gorgeous. The location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing and visiting the museums. My only complaint is having to pay for internet. Given that this is a 5 star hotel, internet should be included in the room rate. Having to pay extra is extremely annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Palace, great location”
Reviews.Author: scizin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on a trip with my Mom, the location is excellent and the hotel simply beautiful (check out the cuploa in the main dining area). The easy-access business center, with free internet and printing made staying in touch a breeze and also allowed us to plan our days (and check out last minute ideas on tripadvisor) quickly each morning. The only downside are the prices in the dining room, but there are plenty of other restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby room, no free internet despite booking conditions”
Reviews.Author: Pavlich
Reviews.Content: I am a gold member of Starwood/SPG hotels (of which the Westin is a member) which apparently entitles preferential rooms within a Starwood facility. In the case of the Westin Palace, I reckon the opposite is true: it appears they work on the principle that SPG members are loyal customers who will put up with a substandard product. The room we got was spacious and well appointed, but we immediately noticed the sheets not fully fitted. No biggie. Then we noticed the stained and peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, the door of which was pretty battered (possibly water damaged) and in need of paint and repair, and the toilet seat which was up, which suggested a bit of a rushed cleaning job. Again, no biggie, but for US$350 per night, you expect a faultless experience. What really capped it off as an ordinary experience was the clearly stained shower robe hanging in the bathroom - it looked like something you would find in a cheap motel on a major highway - and the check-in advice that the hotel does not offer free internet, despite being sure I booked such a rate. I didn't follow it up at the time because I thought I might have made a mistake, but after checking out of the hotel I came across the original booking which clearly stated "Tv Internet With Keyboard, Movies On Demand" compared with the other booking options which referred to "internet for a fee". Either I didn't get what I paid for, or the language used on the website was deliberately misleading. The location of the hotel is not bad, particularly if you wish to visit the museums, and the room was pretty quiet despite facing a busy street. But certainly wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barsuchok
Reviews.Content: The hotel imresses you from the moment one enters the lobby. You can see, that the staff do their best to take care of customers, for example, I was really sick when checking in so they offered me a kettle with a hot water (not supplied in the room) which was delivered within couple of minutes. Perfect location, luxury rooms, marble bath, great linen (mattresses too soft for me though), brilliant breakfast. I took out one star for the fact that on check-in I was said that the breakfast is included in my rate, but later on discovered it to be billed separately, also due to heavy price tags for all extras like: TV, Internet etc

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Classy Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: goodeboi
Reviews.Content: Friendly front door personnel Check in was easy. Approx. 20min away from the airport. There is a Starbucks adjacent to the property just around the corner. The proximity to the prado museum can't b beat. Literally across the street. Best to get there at 10a when they open to avoid lines. Room was old world grand hotel but nicely appointed. View from the room was of the top of the rotunda. Bathroom was big enough for two to occupy at the same time and not feel cluttered. Water pressure in the shower was great. Lots of great restaurants along paseo de prado. A favorite was chaparritos a Mexican restaurant just off of paseo de prado. Outstanding Mexican food and great drinks. Gym was small but adequate and overlooked the city. Adjacent to the gym was a terrace that allowed for sunning. Few free weights. Ample cardio machines Sauna Rotunda restaurant - decent food choices although no local fare (paella etc.) - good wine selection -received complimentary glasses of champagne -stuffy atmosphere -great for wedding or other big events as there were at least 3 events occurring at once. Hotel is close to plaza de Santa Ana that has lots of restaurants and tapas bars. Not far from la Latina area that has funky bars and tapas. Walking distance to train station on Alcala which is across the street from Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto”
Reviews.Author: madberna
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the hotel, starting out with the breakfast to the rooms and everything else. Some of the staff were not very friendly but some are really kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Featherfox
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Westin Palace Hotel very much. It is a big hotel but you don't notice that anymore once you are in your hotel. Very friendly and cooperate staff, excellent service. Great bar and breakfast. Wonderful rotonda restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: chernomorez
Reviews.Content: One of the best Westin properties I've ever stayed at. Rack rates are overpriced, but with SPG points it's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: rafamail
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel in a excelent location. The rooms are not big. No free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy070
Reviews.Content: Good location. Rooms small, Personnell rude. Offers a free internet, then @ check out bill you 90 Euros for internet use! and 34 Euros for a toll free phone call. A total rip off. Left the hotel feeling like you have been had! Ruined the vacation! Will not recommend

Reviews.Title: “Spacioous rooms, perfect beds”
Reviews.Author: luxurylady99
Reviews.Content: At the end of our 10 day Madrid and Barcelona trip, we returned to Madrid to fly home for one night. We cashed in our Starwoods points for a night here. We stayed in a fabulous room, 208. It had two twin beds and was a smoking room, neither of which we preferred, but the room was fabulous. The decor, reminiscent of an old-world palace, and the beautiful marble bathroom with double sinks was a treat. The beds were heaven, particularly after sufering through food poinsingin for three days! The only minuses were not enough people at reception, there was always a line. Also, the elevators are slow an tiny. If you are interested in art, the museums are all within walking distance, I much preferred this neighborhood to the area around Gran Via where we had previously stayed. I'm not sure I wuld pay 274 euros to stay here (the price I saw on booking.com) but it is a romantic and luxurious hotel. I also think for that price, internet should be included!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff came through with flying colors after we were pickpocket victims.”
Reviews.Author: b3l5tele
Reviews.Content: On the 3d day of our 2 week trip through Spain and France pickpocket thieves stole my wife's wallet with the credit cards. (Those thieves are good, really good.) The staff at the Westin Palace was tremendous in providing all of the necessary support to deal with the problem. When you are in a foreign country and you have the hotel staff going out of their way to make sure you have complete access to their phones and computers and they provide patient and courteous interpreter help, it makes all the difference in the world between a vacation ending nightmare situation and an irritating inconvenience. We can't thank them enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Vbjorn
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, cental location. very nice breakfast. Fantastic service!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable, upscale”
Reviews.Author: Febrazuca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, old school elegance. Not a place to dress casual, I felt awkward wearing jeans and sporty shoes. My room was spacious and very comfortable, the room had a TV with a fancy entertainment system. The location was good, a short walk to major sights and across the street from the Prado Museum. The nearest metro station is a 5 min walk. Great stay, recommend especially for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the hearth of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Transparente
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. Highly recommend this hotel after this very positive experience. The rooms exceptionally clean and far more spacious than we expected. Excellent central location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Well Situated, AVOID RM 248”
Reviews.Author: lilkimsobe
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace is a lovely hotel in the business district of Madrid; very well situated, close to the museums, Parque del Retiro, Plaza del Sol, Plaza Santa Ana, etc. The staff was very helpful and we enjoyed the Sunday Brunch (the best in the City, frequented by David Beckham and family when he played there). HOWEVER, we booked a Junior Suite and were given Room 248. Avoid this room at all costs. If you are given this room, immediately request another. Room 248 is located next to the Room Service staging area. Starting at around 6:30 a.m. you hear the clanging of dishes, glasses, silverware; you hear the staff talking and laughing, working generally. This goes on until about 11:00 a.m. But after about 10 mins of LOUD bangs and clangs, who can sleep any longer!?! After a couple of calls and a visit to Reception, we were moved to another room later that day. Housekeeping helped to move our things, as we were, of course, all unpacked and settled in. I would definitely recommend this hotel, just avoid Room 248, and perhaps any room in ending in "48".

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extremely friendly and competent staff”
Reviews.Author: yinyin_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Palace in Madrid from September 30 to October 5th, 2010 and was extremely happy with my stay. First off, as a person that enjoys walking in cities, the location was superb. Across the street was a little quick-service cafe for morning coffee, pastries, bocadillos, etc.. The hotel is approximately a 5 minute walk from Banco de Espana Metro subway station and 15-20 minutes walk from Plaza del Sol (a Metro/train hub and also start of a shopping area with El Corte Ingles department store). It is also extremely close to the Prado Museum (about 2 blocks away). For those that do not like walking around too much, taxi cabs are also readily available at the hotel. The neighborhood is a government district so there is not much character, but it is extremely safe, with police patrolling regularly in the vicinity (due to the need to protect the government offices). Now for the hotel itself: The hotel is a historic building, so the rooms are not as big as what you would expect in the United States. However, the room we got was nice, with one large King sized bed, a large bathroom (toilet in a separate little room, double sinks, nice bathtub/shower with round curtain bar). The room was well maintained, clean, and comfortable. The closet had a safe and was roomy and could keep all of our clothes as well as store our suitcases out of the way. The LCD TV was nice and had a few English channels, but not HD so it could have been even nicer. The computers in the business center give you 1 free hour of internet, which is nice for quick checks of email, Facebook, or just finding a place on Google maps. A nice touch for those that need a quick internet fix but are not constantly needing access. The concierge staff and reception staff were extremely helpful. This is the shining star of our stay. The airlines lost one of our luggage on a flight from Barcelona to Madrid and the concierge staff went above and beyond to stay in touch with the airlines and nag them for updates on the bag. This is in addition to being helpful in general tourist and restaurant information. The staff also speak English well, with some staff members also being fluent in other languages (I think I overheard French) as well. All in all, an excellent stay at an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why did we have to argue to get what we booked?”
Reviews.Author: Cecile21
Reviews.Content: We are members of the Starwood group, of which the Palace is now one of their hotels and we have stayed with them very happily in America. Normally in Europe, esp Spain we stay in boutique hotels, but decided to give this hotel a go. We booked 2 interconnecting executive rooms, which are I think, one grade below a suite. Having read a previous trip reviewer saying request rooms away from the building work when you book, because the noise will wake you, we did this too. Only to arrive and be told, pleasantly it's true and with an apologetic shrug that our rooms would be the on the building works side but we should be ok as they didn't get complaints. Oh well, if that's all they had. We were given the card keys and let ourselves in only to find our room was equipped for disabled guests :ie no bath or shower cubicle, but a shower "area." Why had I bothered to book in advance directly with them? I rang down and asked them that. Half an hour later they rang back and gave us what we had booked. We then had to wait another half hour for the luggage to be moved and housekeeping to open the interconnecting door. An unpleasant and delayed start to an otherwise good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAMSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in October and was upgraded to a suite (platinum). Hotel is near the three major museums and in walking distance to all the tourist spots. Behind the hotel is a good tapas bar if you don't mind the smoking. Room was clean and concierge was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: bremar67
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Madrid and the Westin Palace made the trip even more special. The rooms and common areas are beautifully appointed and the breakfast buffet was top-notch. Impeccable service - a real treat in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant royal hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCNRocks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and very expensive. It was built by the king of Spain. Our room was with a beautiful view to the fountain. The lobby is gorgeous, the interior of the room makes you feel like a true royalty. Choose this hotel is your prefer old antique etc. Very clean. Huge rooms, even huger bathroom, shower, tub. Internet was not for free, it was pretty expensive actually, around 16e/24h or 6e/h. Room service menu is extensive, but I didn't feel like paying 25euros for a Caesar salad. One thing I didn't understand could ever exist in a hotel of high class is a bed creeking with age with every single move I made:). When late night I heard the neighbour's bed making the same noise, I realized I wasn't the only one. Positive side is that the bed stoppes making that terrible noise once another person enters it. I understand the lobby staff have a lot of customers to serve, but it lacked personal touch, you don't get a warm smile from them, everything and everyone is very cold and posh. Looking at the other customers I felt doubtful about using my ordinary clothes to the breakfast. I could not relax seeing Gucci and Versace dressed women, in complete make-up etc. at the breakfast:). I also have festive clothes, but I don't feel like dropping morning pudding on them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoraNJtoLondon
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. The property has old world charm. It is, perhaps, a bit dated, but that did not bother me. The rooms were nice, and using a combination of cash and SPG points made the stay very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Grand Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Raoul_King_of_Spain
Reviews.Content: Classic grand hotel located in center zone of museums with walking distance to major attractions. Large room with killer view of Neptune Fountain, Prado and Ritz. Incredible dining under colorful glass dome with excellent service and staff. Active lobby area with much hustle and variety - flowing with middle east Prince's, AARP vacationers and businessmen. Incredible Sunday Opera buffet, pricey but impressive. Need deep pockets to eat and use wireless, but a history filled hotel that was a great home during a wonderful visit in a great city. Good value with Amex Platinum. **Note: Check bill for mini bar charges - in two separate stays over 9 days was erroneously charged over $100 and did not even see the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of phone charges!!”
Reviews.Author: KChaplinsky
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Palace Hotel but I wanted to warn everyone that they should be weary of telephone prices: I used an AT&T calling card while in Spain, but AT&T gave me the wrong access number. So basically I was under the impression my calling card would take care of the charges but instead I was charged the hotel's full rate for calls made to the US. The Palace Hotel charged me an obnoxious rate that was nearly $8/minute. I emailed other 4 star hotels in Madrid and discovered the average rate for calls to the US is between $1 and $2.50 per minute. I wrote an email to the Palace Hotel's reception desk and thankfully they extended a "goodwill gesture" and gave me a 70% discount. I am very appreciative of this. Highlights of the hotel: location, business center (I always found a free computer), and the gym (although it did take me awhile to figure out the kph to mph conversion on the treadmills) I'm a Starwood Preferred Guest cardholder and I chose the "cash and points" option to book this hotel. I used 4500 points and paid $90 each night. It was a fantastic deal that I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable stay”
Reviews.Author: minilie
Reviews.Content: Very nice bedroom. Comfortable bed. Amazing bar and dinner room. Very posh clientèle and so I felt a little bit uncomfortable. Extra fees(like internet) were not mentioned at the check in. Perfect location for a nice visit in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but needs a little attention”
Reviews.Author: PerfectThyming
Reviews.Content: Touted as THE place to stay in Madrid, with prices to match, my expectations were elevated. I'd call this a good place to stay, not an "OMG What a place!!" experience. Excellent location, more-than-excellent concierge services, very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms need a little updating and attention to detail (wallpaper peeling, burned-out lights, stained robes, for example). Had the unfortunate experience of being there during the 24-hour strike and I must say the hotel management took every precaution to ensure guest safety and comfort...except that the buffet dinner they strongly suggested for that evening was very overpriced and, while the food was good, not worth the price. Yes, that should be expected in such a setting and with the US$ in the dumps, but still...we were quite the captive audience during the demonstrations and marches with no other options. All in all, was very comfortable. Most impressed by the staff. First time to Madrid, so not aware of other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: caoh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and located near parks and museums. The staff was helpful, although when we requested dinner reservations, for some reason, we never got a message with a reservation. Must have been an oversight. Loved the location and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: bmarcott
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to explore Madrid. My husband and I stayed here with our young son as part of an extended trip to visit family in Europe. Our room was great and every time we needed anything (a restaurant recommendation, pharmacy location, etc.) the staff was wonderful. I would highly recommend the Westin Palace.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ezed785
Reviews.Content: this hotel is 5 star in every respect. not cheap , but starwood points and cash made this hotel the perfect place to have. the staff was remarkable . restuarant for breakfast was a vacationers dream

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I enjoyed our stay at The...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at The Westin Palace. Great location, wonderful people and a fantastic breakfast. You will not regret your stay there.

Reviews.Title: “high quality, good service with old school feel”
Reviews.Author: nyc82
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and would recommend to others. Clean rooms and good, efficient service. Location was great - easy walk to sights and restaurants. While the rooms were adequate, they were on the small side and had very 'old school' feel. We did not eat in the hotel and the one night we went to the bar to have drinks we decided to leave due to the extremely high prices.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill143
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin Palace for 12 nights, taking advantage of the excellent '2 nights in 6 free' on-line offer, which enabled us to afford a junior suite. The room was huge, and very comfortable; the bathroom had 2 washbasins, bath, and separate walk-in shower and loo. The decor was immaculate and the room faced inwards so was perfectly quiet. A huge bowl of fruit was refreshed halfway through our stay (we would have welcomed replacement of cutlery and plates when they had been used, but this seems to be a peculiarity of 5-star hotels that offer fruit; once you've used the plate, away it goes). Breakfast under the glass dome was very lavish and the staff could not have been more attentive. Indeed there seemed to be staff everywhere at all times, alert and ready to be helpful--I cannot understand those who say they had difficulty getting refills of coffee etc as in our experience you only had to blink to be offered orange juice, coffee, whatever. The bar staff were also very good--after a few nights, one waiter even brought our usual aperitifs without being asked for them. The staff were uniformly polite, friendly and charming. Marc Lannoy runs a tight ship, in our opinion, and we much enjoyed the buzzing and efficient atmosphere of the hotel. When we arrived our bags were immediately taken care of, and the doormen were always ready to get taxis etc. Check-in was swift and friendly; since we had come overnight on the train, we arrived before our room was ready and were offered an alternative but since we were keen to get the bed-size requested we opted to relax in the rotunda and read, with a cappuccino, until the room was ready. The food in the restaurant is good, if pricey, but no higher than prices at comparable etablishments in this city. We ate in the main restaurant, in the bar, and also in the Asian Gallery, all of which were good. My only plea would be for an omelette, or even a cold Spanish tortilla, on the bar menu! The breakfast chef cooks superb omelettes, and it would be nice to get one for lunch or a light supper. The location of this hotel is superb---right opposite the Prado in one direction and the Thyssen-Bornemisza in the other, and also in easy walking distance of Puerta del Sol and Plaza de Santa Anna, where there are many places to eat. It has the feel of a real 'Grand Hotel', and the rotunda is a delight to be in at any time of day, comfortable and beautiful, with room for all sorts of different activities. We have stayed in many excellent hotels but this one is among our top three--we certainly would love to stay there again and would not dream of staying anywhere else in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT OLD STYLE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the Pay3Stay3 promotion, that included free buffet breakfast and PayPerViex movies, at 295€ for an Executive room, fully prepais and non refundable. It sets us back 200€ per night, which we found was a good deal. We checked in on at 5.00 pm a thursday. Very busy lobby, with guests or tourists coming to take pictures of the glass dome. No one to help with luggage, and barely to open the doors. Our room was said to be not ready, and we were asked to wait. When I said that I had no intention to wait, the receptionnist said there was no other room available ; I became a little more offensive, and bim-bam-boum room 583 was immediately available. Up another flight of stairs to lobby level, and we were in our room, with street wiew on the 5th floor. Room totally redecorated, quite old style but nice. Quite smaller than we thought ot would be, but not SO small after all. Good bathroom, with separate toilet, but no separate shower stall (that's where the old conception shows). Westin style, include the curved drape rail on the bath, alas so uncommon in Europe. Usual Heavenly Shower (a joke if you ask me). Great Heavenly Bed, fine linens. The room has been very well prepared. I had requested reception to organize 4 bath towels at all times, but this was always ignored, unless I asked again to house keeping, either in the morning or for evening turndown. Breakfast is good quality, with great selection of fresh and qualitative ingredients. Great juices. We were lucky enough to be seated under the dome each morning, which made breakfast a lovely moment. I would however say that it is rather understaffed ; it is sometimes difficult to call someone's attention for an order of coffee, let alone a refill. This is a great place for either business or leisure. The promotions they are running on their website make it really good value. The location can hardly be beaten : convenient, cloqe to everything, yet quiet (double glazed windows are ugly, but very effective from a soundproofing perspective). But this is a huge hotel, with close to 500 rooms and suites. It is buzzing. Even if everything is well and works well, you can't expect to get the customized attention you might get from a smaller place, like probably the Ritz accross the street (which we tried for tea, with sky high price tags).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and we've stayed in some rippers”
Reviews.Author: Vern0n
Reviews.Content: having stayed in some of the worlds great hotels, our expectations are high. well done to the westin madrid, great rooms, great ambience, but best of all, fabulous beds. we have become Marriott junkies of late because of their beds but dare I say it, the Westin Madrid beds were the best I've encountered. Only mistake we made was accidently checking out a day earlier than we meant to (pre paid of course) Teach us to be more careful in checking our itinerary. The main dining area under the magnificent domed glass ceiling is worthy of such a wonderful city. So much to see and do and so comforting to return back every night. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Madrid city centre”
Reviews.Author: MayfairChick1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights. Booked the Executive Room. Rate was 275 euro a night but got the 3rd night free so wasnt too bad. We also got free breakfast and free premium TV, both of which we truly enjoyed. The breakfast room is amazing. Make sure u pick a table under the giant dome. We loved our stay and hope you all get a chance to try it too. :)

Reviews.Title: “Central, traditional comfort”
Reviews.Author: iznogood
Reviews.Content: Good size rooms. Good bathroom with baths and very good pressure shower. Large comfortable bed. Gym is large with good equipment although little hard to find. Location is good with shops dinner places museums all close by. Good for business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Palace Madrid - Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdrysdale
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 12-night stay at the Westin Palace Madrid. In one word, it was fabulous! The hotel is beautiful -- elegant and classy, but not stuffy. The staff could not have been more friendly. The location is excellent -- close to the major attractions, bus stop just outside the door, within walking distance to almost everything you would want to see. Superb service. We arrived early in Madrid after our overnight flight, and we were quickly checked in without any wait. This was at approximately 11:00am. Our room, which was lovely and very clean, was serviced no less than three times each day. The view outside our room was magnificent -- overlooking the beautiful Neptune fountain and the Madrid cityscape. The Prado museum is just across the street from the hotel. I am very fussy and not an easy person to please, but I must say that this hotel met my expectations. Nothing was too much effort for them. Madrid is a beautiful city that never sleeps. This IS the hotel to stay at in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: redsoxfan02
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you'd expect from a Westin in the US (including large rooms), plus it is in a beautiful building. We stayed using cash and points, which made it very reasonable. Staff is fluent in English, and business center with free Internet. Very central for tourists, with the Prado, Reina Sofia, Retiro Park and the Atocha train station all within 10-15 min.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about Reception personnel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGuruUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of girlfriends. Choose hotel as we were told it was one of the best in Madrid. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, especially the dome in the lounge/restaurant. The bedrooms are very comfortable. On checking in, the hotel reception double checked whether we had the right hotel and completely looked down on us as if a group of girls shouldn't be staying in their hotel. Hotel conceirge were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rochellec36
Reviews.Content: The lobby, bar, and restaurants are beautiful in this hotel. The front desk staff and concierge were friendly and helpful. It has a business center with 4 computers, but there was always a wait to get on one. The prices in the bar and restaurant were very high, but there were many places to walk to for a cheap bite to eat and drink like Starbucks which was right around the corner. The location was great, and in walking distance from bars and restaurants, museums including the Prado, and the Double Decker bus tour stop. The room was very nice and comfortable, but quite small for a Westin. The bathroom was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that changes a trip. Everything gets better.”
Reviews.Author: GustavoSette
Reviews.Content: On my third trip to Madrid, the city had never seemed so beautiful and pleasant... Staying in a hotel as the Palace improves everything. Phenomenal location, the best bed in the world, a breakfast plentiful and varied in a hall that has a stained glass dome that alone is "worth the ticket". We used the concierge service to get a table on Saturday night at the Corral de la Moreria and they managed to book the day before a superb table. The only downside is that Internet usage is charged at the apartment and the price is a joke, like 20 euros per day. The hotel has a business center with Internet for free (it has four computers and printer, sometimes you have to queue). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: teahna
Reviews.Content: enjoyed my stay at the westin. It is a great location one can walk everywhere the Prado is right across the Plaza. My room was comfortable and the service was perfect. we stayed for 2 days then went to valley of the gredos to ride. coming back to the westin for a day before heading home was like coming home!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with locationlocationlocation”
Reviews.Author: LAEWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is, by far, my most favorite hotel in Madrid. In my line of work, I visit a great variety of hotels around the world, and I have to say that this is among the top. I stayed at this hotel twice in spring and summer, 2010. The service both times was extraordinary. The property is very clean and very classic - just what you'd expect in a building created in the image of a castle. The room rate was affordable, and my guests loved it as well. I managed a meeting there, and overall the meeting space was large, spacious and more than adequate. The service was fantastic - what a friendly, helpful group of people. And while I have only mediocre Spanish skills, they were more than happy to switch to English simply to ease my discomfort. Beautiful gym - large but mostly quiet. Workout by Westin. You can't beat the location - it's within walking distance of Plaza del Sol, Atocha train station, the Prado and other museums, Plaza Santa Ana, and Serrano. I am sure that there are many other areas that you can walk to, but that's all I had a chance to see while I was there. What I found a bit inconvenient was the lack of a quick place to run to for bottled water and snacks - there was no store in the hotel itself. There was a Starbucks nearby, in the same building but with an external entrance - so this was fine for something quick to eat. There is also a VIPS that has a convenience store of sorts. Both are outside of the hotel. And, of course, abundant shopping and restaurants a short walk away - El Corte Ingles, anyone? I agree that meals in the hotel could get a bit pricey, particularly breakfast. But all of my meals were really wonderful, so I would say worth the money. If you're on a budget, this isn't where you'll save money. I also felt that there was very good security at the hotel, although relatively unobtrusive. As a female traveling alone, I never felt unsafe when I was at this hotel. All in all, a fantastic experience both times. I highly recommend this property for both meetings and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Five star, historic property, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: The Westin Madrid Palace is perfectly located, five star service and comfort at a good price. Yes, other reviews talk about expensive cocktails (which is true), but my experience is that mixed drinks are expensive throughout Europe. This is a five star property, but a 9 euro generous pour of wine is available beneath the fabulous stained glass dome, served by an attentive wait staff in starched collars. There is a price to be paid for the qualify of one's surroundings. Our room was great, with a double lav, separate toilet/bidet room, marble. The rooms are quite large, and ours looked out to the Neptune Fountain and the Prado. The beds and amenities were excellent. Problem with our TV? They fixed it within fifteen minutes of the call. Our rate was good, booked on spg.com, and offered free internet and movies. Internet coverage was good. Breakfast is expensive for what it is, but there is a Starbucks in the building and a 7-11 type store fronting the fountain. The white table cloth Asian restaurant was very very good, and recommended to us by our Madrid native friends. They were not wrong. The Peking Duck is as good as any we have had, the service excellent, and the prices a comparitive bargain to other places in Madrid we went. We recommend the Chinese restaurant (hard to figure, eating Chinese in Spain, but stay with me on this one....) Is there a better location in Madrid? I don't know of one. You are within a block of the Prado, across the street from the Thyssen, and two blocks from Retiro Park. This hotel has the advantages of the Westin brand, high consistency of service, great staff, great rooms and beds, and still offers the flavor and culture of the historic property that it is. Try it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best”
Reviews.Author: asora10066
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but worth the money. Old world style, centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for 5 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: fakeis
Reviews.Content: Maybe August is a low season and the prices are also low too, but the hotel was much better than what I had expected considering the price. Location is excellent. Hotel is renovated and everything in the bathroom, shower, tub etc worked fine(which is something you don't expect even at 5 star hotels in Europe). Concierge helped me before and during my stay and offered excellent advice and service. Room was kept clean. Breakfast (Euro20 per person) was excellent (especially when you have REAL coffee unlike in the US). It was a steal to have been able to stay at an excellently run 5 star for what I paid. I never had any issues with the front desk or any of the staff. All polite and eager to assist. I would have liked a free upgrade but that is asking way too much. I would come back again and also recommend to anyone. Especially if you are a tourist looking for a nice place to retreat after a hot summer day in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: shmagic
Reviews.Content: Was lucky enough to spend 4 nights in this hotel which is just as stunning in real life as in photos. It really is the perfect location for a visit to Madrid which is an amazing city ...loved it. The only downside was the prices of both drinks and eating there..just WAAAAYYYY too expensive for me..I mean come on if the drinks were even just a bit more than the top hotel norm but they were ridiculously high something like 15 euros for a G&T. So basically we slept there enjoyed the atmosphere but ate and drank elsewhere. The bedroom we had was an executive club room and was lovely but even so I had asked to upgrade cos using Starwood club points and the charge of 35 euros extra only gave you free apples in the so called coffee corner (next to the lifts) free wifi (big deal) and movies except LOL the movie channel didn't work so they refunded the extra charge which was fair cos for an upgrade you got very little extra IMO. BUT...if money no object then this is THE best hotel to stay in for star quality and just plain luxury..or do like us order coffee in the room then eat in the wonderful tapas bars just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location but Front desk staff are very RUDE and Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Spottelurcher
Reviews.Content: The Weston Palace has one of the best locations in Madrid but I do not recommend this hotel and find the Ritzt Hotel a better option in terms of service and higher standards that one would expect from a hotel of this star rating. On entering the hotel we had to wait ages to check in and the staff do not seem to care one way or the other , There is no "welcome to the Hotel Westin" Or "how was your flight " or any form of greeting in any shape or form ,The young lady who checked us into the hotel was rude and not at all friendly. First impressions are lasting ones and it set the tone for our stay,The rooms are very outdated and smell of cigarette smoke ! The only great thing about this hotel is the breakfast and the waitress who served us was lovely. I think she should be working on the front desk!My advise is to go to the Ritz Hotel across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: WBreskin
Reviews.Content: I used Starwood points for the hotel, so I can't comment on its value for the money, but both the rooms and staff were excellent. Great location, right next to the Prado, and walkable to the Puerto del Sol and other sites in Central Madrid. Business center was a bit small for the size of the hotel (computers were constantly being used; hard to get on). Rooms were commensurate with a hotel of this caiiber. Staff was excptionally helpful. If I had to pay full price for a room, may not have stayed there, but certainly if you have Starwood points that you can apply for the price of the stay, it's a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff-in-Laguna
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have traveled extensively in Western Europe, and this was our 2nd trip to Madrid. We don't mind less expensive places if we are traveling alone, but this trip would include our 20 yr old son and 17 yr old daughter. So we decided to cross our fingers and go for a more expensive hotel experience. We were rewarded! The Westin is a beautiful hotel, in a great location next to Museo Del Prado and Retiro Park. Its also a 5-10 min walk max to the happening Plaza Santa Ana and Plaza Mayor. The room was nicely appointed, comfortable and clean. The food, internet, bar, and mini-bar are all overpriced, but right outside the hotel is a Starbucks [kids liked that] and a small market for buying drinks, snacks, etc. for your room or day of sightseeing. We cant wait to go back. Plaza Santa Ana and the bars/restaurants around that entire area are fun. It didnt hurt that Spain was playing World Cup games at the time, and were winning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice quite rooms,staff ready to help,”
Reviews.Author: honestopinion43
Reviews.Content: This was a great location. Checked in the day after the celebration of the "World Cup" The staff was great and very helpful. The rooms are a decent size, comfortable and very quite. The curtains kept the light out really well compared to most hotels. The breakfast was excellent. I would stay here and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: SetTheJet
Reviews.Content: The outside and lobby are beautiful and the location is good. The issues were one elevator of the two available was out of service...terrible for a 5 star to only have two elevators. The rooms have carpet which looks old and should be replaced with wood. Upon checkout, the registration desk asked for payment even though we had already pre-paid. They requested we prove it by getting the receipt on-line and when we went back to show it, another person at the registration desk served us and said our account showed as paid. We asked for a receipt confirming no balance outstanding and he refused, saying that was not their policy. I've stayed at many Westons before and this was the worst in terms of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lobby, room needs renovation, fees very high”
Reviews.Author: jadrake_ta1
Reviews.Content: The common areas and exterior of the building are great, as is the location. Very close to the museums in a nice part of town. However, the room was in need of renovation, especially the bath, which had dirty, peeling wallpaper. I've traveled a lot and stayed in nice business hotels across the world, but the internet and other fees here are about the highest I've seen. Expect to pay almost $100 for a week of internet access. Overall, there are better hotels in the area at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegance in the Centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Vinzeph
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Madrid was highlighted by this grand old dame. It was everything we expected - classic elegance. Check in was a breeze and they were able to check us in at 9 am. The room is well-appointed, although a bit small for this price category and some of the wallpapers are starting to peel if you have a closer look. Daily breakfast is a delight. It is close to everything - museums, shopping, dining and public transport. Overall, it was a positive experience and will defineitely stay here if I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Heritage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samjo24
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked GRAND from outside. Location was fantastic just meters away from Spanish parliament... lot of cafes / eateries and street shopping places nearby... The baggage handling staff had a small tiff with driver of our vehicle for parking the vehicle at a distance and initially resfused to handle the bags.. however when i brought them to reception they took over quickly... check in was quick and effortless.. the lifts in hotel is definate problem though.. there are only 2 of them and they are small each can carry 4 - 6 people which meant a long waiting queue for the lifts.. i preferred to use stairs as my room was on second floor... The lifts also kept mulfunctioning and one of the group member got locked in for 20 mins... room was nice and comfortable... internet is free for first 30 mins only in room but there is business center where you can surf unlimited...Breakfast spread was good... however there was huge queue infront of cook making fresh spanish omlets... Had to skip that dish due to time pressure..my first impression was that it is good leisure hotels meant for holidayers and not a business hotel... things take time here.. however location being fantastic one can enjoy nice walk through bustling streets even at late night post 11 pm.. can have a coffee.. WINE in one of the numerous eateries with large crowd sitting on temporary table and chair arrangements made on pavements and soak in spanish fun loving cultural extravaganza...!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LAtotheWorld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an ideal location. It is just a 1 minute walk away from the Prado Museum. Nearby is also the botanical gardens and Jardines del Retiro both within walking distance. The hotel has a great exterior as the building itself is a landmark. The hotel lobby is very grand and the old world charm is obvious when you walk in. Obviously since this is an older hotel the rooms have an older feel to them as well and not necessarily in a bad way. Our room was on the top floor of the hotel and was very quiet and clean. The hotel always seemed to be busy while we were there and therefor the staff seemed overwhelmed with all the guests. The staff was courteous for the most part when we had a question, but it definitely wasn't the type of service that you would necessarily expect from a 5 star hotel. Overall the positives far outweigh any negatives that may exist at this hotel and I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neoklassiksoul-yahoo
Reviews.Content: Visited the Westin Madrid on business trip. Hotel is in a great location for walking through this magnificent city. Unfortunately at the time of our visit the hotel surrounding were being developed and thus the stay was extremely noisy through the evening and early morning. Hotel has a great entrance area and bar and serves great cocktails albeit to the expected prices. Room large and clean guaranteed a great stay however probably a bit pricey for my taste

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Conelectric
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nites, running everywhere in Madrid so did not use the facilities in the hotel, had no time to. Great location, both museums The Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza (dont miss this collection) across the street. Short walk to town. Personnel hospitable and gave us a great dinner recommendation, dont miss Restaurante El Rincon de Esteban. Owner was incredibly nice- on the house after dinner drinks, pastries. Walked out with a flower, a book, a shot glass with his restaurants name on it and a small bottle of olive oil.When u enter the hotel it is grand. Beautiful room with an incredible breakfast everyday, best we had in any of the hotels we stayed at. We had a triple room, sufficient in size. Our bed was a king, so comfortable with a choice of 4 pillows. Main floor including breakfast area (a huge lounge with beautiful gardens the rest of the day plus restaurant and banquet room at nite) was truly stunning. If I had time, I could have sat and sat and sat just looking at this room and its beautiful domed ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Overall”
Reviews.Author: getwhatudeserve
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palace before it became a Westin, one thing i like about Madrid is its people and hospitality. I can telll you that from a 4 night stay I didnt have a single negative issue to tell about this hotel. Although this is about a 400 room hotel, staff is very attentive to guest needs and always willing to help. For people wanting to go to Madrid for tourist or historic reasons this is a great location to be in, otherwise you may choose the more tranquil and classy Salamanca neighborhood. But back to the Palace I would definately recomend it if the price is right, in other words not at any cost, because i believe there are some newer ad better hotels in Madrid that for the same price would be a better option in my opinion. The only issue with the hotel is that some rooms require major renovation, but others dont, so i believe that if you manage to get a renovated room you will very much enjoy your stay. I arrived very late at night and everything was ready for me when i checked in and great staff. Congratulations for the staff attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Posh Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcteach77
Reviews.Content: Great bed, showers. Don't buy anyhting here! The prices are outrageous! Go around the corner to VIPS and put water and soda in the mini bar. Felt very safe. Four computers with free internet access. Close to museums. Very nice upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel, Great everything!”
Reviews.Author: ilove-europ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there just for 1 night at the start of a Spain trip. We used our SPG cash and points so I'm not sure the cost of the hotel, but I know that it was 20 Euros for 2 beers! They greeted us, checked us in fast, gave us a map and told us what we should do in our short 15 hour stay in the city. The doormen took our bags and delivered to our room upon arrival. The location is perfect. It's in a very safe area of town and there are alot of bars and restaurants behind the hotel. Check our the 2 beer bars on the small street behind the hotel. They had some really good and chep beer there. Tavern de Dolores was our fave. It was only a short 10-15 minute walk to Plaza Mayor and where all the action was. The room was by far the best we had on our trip. It was clean and very large (but we did have the deluxe room) and the bathroom had 2 sinks which is unheard of in Europe. There was counter space which is also nice. The shower and tub worked perfectly. The great Westin beds are always great. Overall we will FOR SURE stay here next time we are in Madrid. And we'll stay longer in this great city!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty at the Westin Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug12
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a five night stay in Madrid with my daughter who just turned twenty. I used Starpoints, so I can't comment on the price of the hotel, but I would say I that we both enjoyed our stay very much. It is a magnificent hotel that is in a very good location. We were going to buy the Madrid Card, but ended up walking everywhere, so we really didn't need it. The concierge was great and recommended restaurants nearby that were fabulous. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Pro's: Location, large rooms, nice gym; Cons: needs updating and wifi”
Reviews.Author: drmeb
Reviews.Content: The upsides of this hotel are that its rooms are large by European standards, it has a nice gym, the public spaces are beautiful, and the location is very convenient for visiting museums as it is on a major thoroughfare next door to the Thyssen museum and across from the Prado. The downsides are that most tourists will spend most of their time in the livelier neighborhoods around Santa Ana, Sol and Plaza Mayor, and these are a 5 to 15 minute walk. Also, the hotel's grandeur seems to be fading; our room had stained wallpaper and curtains and nicked paint on the doorways, and we were allotted a single bar of soap for 3 people to share for use at the bath and sink, and only a couple bottles of hair conditioner during our week stay. The staff are very nice but we made requests of the them that were not met. The TV is old and most important, wifi is available only at a hefty daily fee. The wifi thing is especially annoying as there is free wifi throughout most of the surrounding neighborhood. You can just take your laptop up to any cafe at Plaza Santa Ana and enjoy free wifi and people watching, however, one should not have to resort to this after paying so much for a room at the Westin. Breakfast at the hotel was terribly expensive - one can get a coffee, toast and juice nearby at one-tenth the cost. I realize that premium prices are the norm in top hotels, but there is a point where one feels that they are being taken for a fool. We stayed at the Westin while we needed enough room for a cot for a third person (at 50 euro + tax per night). We had a better experience when we stayed elsewhere in Madrid, in a livelier neighborhood, in a hip and modern hotel that offered free wifi - but others may weigh the pros and cons and find the Westin is right for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Snasha
Reviews.Content: The concierge gave us many good tips on local restaurants that would have been hard to find. Good walking location for a nice evening stroll. Very expensive hotel but you get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gerryoN_ireland
Reviews.Content: beautiful surrounds, great central location to shops, restaurants and museums. teenagers tell me the local disco was unreal. perfect service from hotel staff, one and all. breakfast was a pleasure to eat and the dining area made it all the better. only complaint is the prices in bar, the cocktails and atmosphere were brilliant but price is prohibitive. internet also expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBoss
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Like most Westin's - it had great service, great amentities and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing and royal Experience”
Reviews.Author: Shivang5
Reviews.Content: Near to the city and airport... with amaxing ambience and food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great Westin quality”
Reviews.Author: Away2much
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a great hotel in a superb Madrid location - within walking distance to the Prada, Thyssen, Plaza Major, the Royal Palace and great restaurants and shopping. You'll get the same Westin quality you get in the U.S. The heavenly bed, clean rooms, and polite staff. It does host a lot of weddings - I thought this was fun but I could see how others might be annoyed. I plan to stay at the Westin whenever I am in Madrid. Also, American friends - the Spanish enjoy lunch from 2 - 4 pm and dinner from 10 pm on. My suggestion is that you eat a good breakfast, a big lunch at 2 pm and buy a sandwich from a local shop for dinner. This will make it easier for you but if you want to enjoy Madrid then get on the local food schedule - it's tough but fun. Walking everywhere will help you avoid the extra weight from sleeping on a full stomach. Ladies definitely you'll want to shop for clothes and shoes - inexpensive but amazing quality. Drink the Cava - it's much better in Spain than in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Blood”
Reviews.Author: BeatenPathTokyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in total, and it was a huge disappointment. We were originally shown to a wrong room (double bed on smoking floor), even though reception staffs explicitly guaranteed at check-in it is a twin bed room on non-smoking floor. After long hour of complaints in my second language and even longer hour of waiting, we were taken into a right room but with a glitch on the mini bar door, which never opened. We spoke to the staffs on corridor and found a couple of bottles of water are supposed to be provided as compliments, which we did not find in our room, and we had to do another long hour complaints. We were treated like "gentlemen of the road" begging for water. Great location, but we would never come back. Now, so there will be no misunderstanding, ordinary Spanish people in the town are sweet (the staffs at Westin Madrid are the only ones who are bleak).

Reviews.Title: “Had high expectations, was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sankaps
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Westin Madrid, with high expectations. My experience: SPG Gold status did not seem to make any difference, was given a room at the far back end of the hotel, across the corridor from a service entrance, the door to which was either left propped fully open, or which would periodically slam shut throughout the night, making for interrupted sleep. Old fashioend room decor. Disappointed that there was absolutely no reading materials (magazines, newspapers, anything really) in the room at all. No SPG Gold amenities either. Breakfast next morning in the rotunda was disappointing. The rotunda was lovely visually, but food was mediocre, choices limited, and bill huge! Overall found it not worth the money, and have decided to try another hotel the next time I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommanded, also for business meetings!”
Reviews.Author: SP MD 2
Reviews.Content: I organized a conference at the Westin after comparing the Westin to a few other 5 star hotels in the area. It was a good decision. The meetings went well; all was taken care of as agreed. The concierge and the business center were always very friendly and helpful when we had questions or needed extra support. There is security and one cannot get to the rooms/floors without a room key. Taxis are available right around the corner of the hotel. A taxi to the airport costs around EUR 20-25. I noticed that when you order one from the concierge, the price is double or even triple. We stayed at deluxe double rooms. The rooms were large and very clean. The beds are truly heavenly. Bathroom is large too with good water pressure. Wireless internet is free for the first 30 mins. 24 hours cost 18.95 Euro. The complimentary water and fruit is a nice touch. The drinks and snacks in the minibar were pretty expensive. There is a small convenience store next to the hotel, and also a Starbucks. Our room price included the breakfast buffet. The breakfast is served in the restaurant La Rotonde - very beautiful! There was a good choice of warm and cold dishes and I have never had scrambled eggs as delicious as they are at the Westin Madrid! The orange juice and coffee are very good too! The 3 major art museums are all within walking distance of the hotel. We had wonderful tapas at the Cervezeria Cervantes, a 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Plaza Santa Ana is the ideal plaza for evening drinks and tapas. For a special occasion, you need to have dinner at the Restaurante Santcelino! And do ask the concierge to book you seats at the Corral de la Moleria for an unforgetable flamenco evening! This trip was for business but I will certainly return for pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old World Hotel that cannot be missed”
Reviews.Author: Terps37
Reviews.Content: Entering the Palace hotel and its corridors steps you into a different time in history when exuded grandeur and luxury. Our Jr Suite was decadent and very well furnished. Pictures attached are worth a thousand words (see attached). Breakfast in the glass rotunda is a one of a kind experience and gives a great kick start for the day. We stayed for three nights during a major corporate event. The hotel was a little hectic and you could tell the staff was stretched but were still friendly and willing to help. The only feedback I would have is that the concierge staff seemed a little too robotic with generic answers/suggestions for dining. Other than that we thoroughly enjoyed our time. I would like to also recognize the GM (Marc) as he was extremely responsive to some of our requests prior to the trip. It went a long way to making us feel welcome prior to arrival. We also appreciated the fruit plate and water upon arrival. All in all, a first class experience from end to end to be shared.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Palace Madrid - a truly 5-star experience”
Reviews.Author: Keepongoing
Reviews.Content: The warm personal welcome, complimentary fruit and water in our room, upgrade to a junior suite set the tone fro a wonderful 7 night stay at this beautiful hotel. Service is friendly and very efficient from the doorman to the room staff to the knowledgeable concierge staff. Situated in a prime location, the hotel is close to all three major art galleries and within comfortable walking distance of the cmain squares in the city. Taxis, subway and buses are easily accessible too. For lovers of outdoor dining, a short walk brings one to St. Ana square and its outdoor tapas restaurants. It is a pleasure to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old world classic, my type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: andres21st
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two night in May, was provided a corner 2 room suite with foyer, dining room/living room. Excellent views of the Plaza Neptune, especially my first night when Atlético de Madrid and 20 plus thousand fans celebrated winning the UEFA Europa League. It was quite impressive. The bed was marvelous, I am sure a Westin sleeper bed. The bathroom was quite large with a raised alcove for the lu and the bidet. Has the old world tub and modern 1 m square shower with dual heads, fluffy Westin towels and bathrobes. We ordered breakfast in room and the dining room was a nice civilized manner to start the day. Halls are long and traditionally adorned with wood and old lithographs. Really my type of hotel, service was quite subdued and refined, two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A Westin is a Westin they deliver what is promised and then some”
Reviews.Author: Laranacoqui
Reviews.Content: The good thing about some chains is they really keep their standards in all their hotels. This Westin is no exception, clean room and bathroom, spacious bedrooms (compared to room size in Europe Hotels), very good breakfast and excellent service, great location (very close to thyssen-bornemiza museum).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: omeeda
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Spain w my parents, and was looking to stay at a very comfortable/upscale place. The Westin didn't disappoint. First off, one word of advice is to try to look at the hotel's own website for special rates not found anywhere else, including SPG's website. I found a pay for 3, stay for 4 (breakfast included) promotion which was very helpful. Since I was meeting my parents at the hotel as we were traveling separately, I emailed the general manager Marc Lannoy to see if they could check in early since their flight landed early in the morning. He was extremely helpful and offered to put them up in a room until our suite (which was also an upgrade) was available. Our stay was very pleasant, and the staff very courteous and helpful. The location is great, right in front of the Prado. The price is a little steep, but if you are looking for luxury and can find a good deal, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: sweet_jeanny
Reviews.Content: I has a nice stay with my fried. The breakfast buffet is awesome, but the deco is a little bit old time. Either way everything clean and equipped as you expect it from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great beds, great breakfast, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Miasig
Reviews.Content: A family of six, two triple rooms, close to everything. We found concierge recommendations spot on and helpful. Rooms are nice but not outrageously nice.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming, over-priced but in very good location.”
Reviews.Author: AdsMan
Reviews.Content: The travellers: mid-20s travelling with work colleagues. Very happy to travel by foot/metro and loves to explore like a local. All expenses paid by my company. The location: on a busy intersection, the Palace Hotel is about 400m from Puerto de Sol (the heart of Madrid). Being such a flashy hotel, I really felt like a tourist (which I don't like) - there's a Star Bucks in the hotel building and there are beggars/street performers vying for your spare change. I also stayed at Hosatl Luz (a budget 2 star hotel, about 250m west of Sol) which was in a far better location. Having said that, this area was very safe and within walking distance of many of Madrid's hot spots. El Banco is the closest Metro stop, about 3 blocks or 300m away - very walkable. The room: I stayed in room 378, a premium deluxe room for about 270 Euro per night, including buffet breakfast. Having travelled extensively with work, I would expect to pay no more than 180 Euro for a place like this. The internet was a massive rip-off at 18 Euro per day, or about 15 Euro per hour!!! The decor was standard - nothing out of this world. The bed was super-comfy and bathroom was well appointed and spacious. There was an electronic safe but was small, and did not fit my 15" laptop. Bathrobe was available, but no slippers. Quality of the shampoo was poor for this kind of hotel. The room and bathroom were very clean, as you'd expect for a five star hotel. Like a previous reviewer, I'd expect an LCD TV in this day and age for a hotel of this class. The hotel: built in 1912, it is a grand old building with a beautiful facade kept in beautiful condition.
