This is not a hotel for those with wheelchairs/prams, as there are about 12 steps from the street to the lobby. There is a beautiful internal lead-light dome (see photos) where breakfast/meals are served - this was just lovely to sit under and gaze at. Breakfast was buffet and included in the room rate (once again, my company paid for everything), but for this kind of money I was not blown away - I have stayed in better hotels for far less. There was fruit, cereals, bakery items, salmon and eggs/sausages offered in the breakfast buffet. The coffee was average but the OJ was superb (freshly squeezed). The hsopitality: the service is what you would expect from a five star hotel. It's difficult rating a hotel when work pays for everything. Don't get me wrong, the Palace Hotel is lovely and grand and everything you'd expect from a five star hotel, except for a few shortcomings - lack of ramps from the street to the lobby (very annoying with lots of luggage -or if you're in a wheelchair), ridiculously priced internet/room rates and lack of some 'must-haves' from a 5 star hotel (e.g. LCD TV, slippers, etc). The only reason I am NOT recommending this hotel is due to the pricing - if you can find a rate under 200 Euro, then you may consider staying (forget about the internet charges!). One last thing - there were MAJOR road works about 50% completed when we were there. Not thas this influenced by review at all, but I wanted to let fellow travellers know what you may expect until about Aug/Sep 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Gozza
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel for 3 nights during our wedding anniversary. We booked a deluxe room fully renovated but we got a worn room. Very poor choice of shampoo, bath foam, no slippers. Mini bar prices very high. Internet connection very pricey. Great Breakfast choice, unbelievable breakfast room. Front desk not very helpful. Close to the main Madrid attractions. If you find a good deal with breakfast included is OK otherwise choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a 5 star - not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: LW23
Reviews.Content: Obviously this is a very good hotel and you would not feel uncomfortable when staying there. The rooms are clean and spacious, service is rather good, food is great and it has interesting, historic interiors. Fantastic location right in the centre of Madrid is another of its big advantages. Yet I was slightly disappointed due to some minor issues which when compared to other 5 star hotels made me rate it only as an average hotel. First of all I was surprised to see that in a 5 star hotel you don't get any toothpaste or shower gel in the standard room amenities. Secondly, it would be good to finally upgrade from the retro TVs and get some LCD or plasmas (same applies to the telephones). Remote control would need some repairs to allow the user performing basic operations with just a single press of the button and not in five or six attempts. Also, I still don't understand why in the year 2010, a hotel of this class would charge 20 euros per day for the internet - I think it is ridiculous. Cleaning services were a bit too loud and I don't know why when I first walked to the room, one of the paintings was laying on the floor instead of hanging on the wall - again someone should make sure that the room is really ready to meet another guest. Finally, I simply thought that this hotel needs some refurbishment as it is showing some signs of wearing down. I tried not to be too harsh when writing this review but when paying premium price I expect a little more than this hotel has to offer. For me there was really nothing spectacular in this experience...

Reviews.Title: “Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: ILTA
Reviews.Content: When in Madrid, we stay at the Palace. Great location, so close to the 3 museums. Excellent spacious rooms. Accomodating front desk and obliging wait staff. Best brunch in town . . . what more can you ask.

Reviews.Title: “More Palace than Westin , great stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TonyCardenas
Reviews.Content: Hi , we had a great 4 day stay at The Palace in Madrid, , hotel its in good condition and is really a Palace ,reception was good and recognized my starwood membership , beautiful lobby and impressing hall ways that lead you to nicely appointed rooms , with beautiful and large bath rooms .,amenitiews were ok , but not the best, and the only thing i could miss is the coffe/tea facility in the room . location its one of the best right infront of the Prado Museum and T. Bohemissa , and in walking distance from Atocha station and the Reina Sofia , also close to Serrano district (shopping) and Gran Via , there are theaters close by, the only thing i could not see much is restaurants bars and cafe are bot very common right next to the hotel. Asian restaurant in the hotel its very nice , and the main restaurant at the atrium its nice , but the buffet selection could be better . checking out the only disappiontment was two charges for the use of room phone to a local celular phone at 23 .00 Euro each (5.00min calls ). we all love to get back to Madrid and of course stay again at the Palace

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, grand and perfectly located.”
Reviews.Author: MissMartinih
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin last weekend as all my usual options such as the Ritz and some Room Mates, had no vacancies (probably due to Madrid's San Isidro festivities). I LOVED IT. It's as grand and beautiful as the Ritz and even though it is a much bigger building and has got quite possibly one of the most decadent and glorious lobbys I've seen, we found it very comfortable and warm. Also, guests seemed more diverse and the atmosphere was more relaxed. My partner pointed out that he'd never seen people coming back from jogging at the Ritz (which actually sounds like a great idea given the Parque del Retiro close proximity). Also, we found the late-night card entry very convenient. The room, in the third floor was an adequate size, the beds are VERY soft and I expressed some concern to my partner. That was until I woke up feeling like I had sleep for a thousand years! I have to admit that we woke up feeling rested and full of energy, which rarely happens to me in hotels. The Westin is perfectly located, close to El Prado, El Retiro and a 5 min taxi to Gran Via/Chueca/Sol/Opera etc. A few (small) negatives. The bathroom's wallpaper was noticeably peeling due possibly to humidity and there was an ugly stain on the bathtub. Oh, and most toiletries are available on demand but not in the room. Also, there were big vans and coaches parked just in front of the entrance which was strange and a bit of an eyesore. Overall, a magnificent hotel to which I will undoubtedly go back and recommend relentlessly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel over all”
Reviews.Author: tama_shiro
Reviews.Content: Good location, incredible food, impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to the Westin Madrid”
Reviews.Author: arnop
Reviews.Content: For my second visit in Madrid and after my perfect stay at the Palace hotel, going back to the same hotel was obvious. This hotel is fantastic, its location is perfect when you want to visit the several museums nearby and it is, as always with Westin, very comfortable. After a flight delayed due to the ash cloud we arrived at the hotel and the reception was perfect. They remembered that I've stayed there last year which feels very nice. The rooms haven't changed a bit and are very comfortable. The only thing is that, as I was traveling with my family, I would have preferred to have two double beds instead of two single beds. But I don't think two double beds would fit.

Reviews.Title: “Obviously good but a bit short to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Sinaloa237
Reviews.Content: We had a 2-night stay at the Westin Palace in Madrid in May 2010. The hotel is good overall. The architecture and arrangement of the place truly deserves its name of palace. Rooms are comfortable and of reasonnable size. The breakfast is magnificent both for the buffet itself and the room. And the location is absolutely perfect, in the very heart of the city be it for culture or leisure. Still there are two main areas for improvement for this place: * the service is not up to what it should be, in particular at the reception and in the dining room (for breakfast, as I did not have lunch or dinner there). At the reception, after a short queue, we were "welcame" by an employee just asking for my credit card without a single word or look at me - even though I am a Starwood private guest member. Nobody to carry your luggage. The doormen are even less careful: not a single "buenos dias" in the whole 3 days we spent there - not even a smile. And it was quite surprising to see that the door is closed at 1:30 am (late but still a fairly common time for Madrid in the week-end). Something you expect more from some sort of low cost hotel... However the concierge was very nice and professional and gave us good advice on places for dinner. * The room is lacking the small details that would made the place a real palace: no shower gel (just soap), very expensive mini bar and not a single bottle of water (or whatever else) offered on arrival, no free wi-fi (and ridiculously expensive hi-speed), half-working phone, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ahinsch
Reviews.Content: Really nice, top notch all the way in a great location. Did try to overcharge us on our way out the the second time but adjusted the rate as soon as I told them. Super gym with a little sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice location. Accommodating to families.”
Reviews.Author: hmarti24
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace is a beautiful hotel that is centrally located in a fairly busy area. There are many restaurants, tapas bars, sights and shopping within walking distance. There were eight of us in our party, including five children between the ages of 14 and 4. The hotel did a fine job of accommodating all of us in 2 rooms which is not easy to do in European hotels. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff was extremely formal and not overly friendly so we avoided interactions with them. The last day of our stay we ran into a kind doorman who seemed genuinely interested in helping us with directions. The hotel bar is beautiful and the martinis are excellent! I generally prefer boutique hotels in quieter areas, but I would go back to the Westin again if we travel in a large group.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from this revered hotel: perfection”
Reviews.Author: Traveller356123
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, the Palace made our stay in Madrid memorable and special. The location puts you right near some of the best sights--you have to visit El Prado, and beyond that, El Parque del Retiro for an afternoon stroll or rowboating, and you can't miss the Cerveceria Alemana on the Plaza Santa Ana. But besides that, some of the most memorable experiences can be found within the Palace--an afternoon cocktail in their domed room (learn the history of the beautiful stained glass artwork), or just taking the time to enjoy the views and the splendor of this place. Unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel but not ideal location”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatDane33
Reviews.Content: When Travelling with my niece from April 30th to May 3rd we had the pleasure of staying at the Westin in Madrid The hotel is from 1912 so if you are looking for a posh modern hotel this isnt it. If you are looking for a hotel with a history, good service, great breakfast and really nice beds AND if you can get a good deal (rack rates are to high) AND if you don't mind not being close to shops, main street etc. then you should consider the Palace Westin. The taxi from the airport was about EURO 35 and back to the airport EURO 30. The tour bus (red line) stops just outside the hotel. The blue line stops a few hundred metres away. The check in was quick - So was check-out as our room was prepaid.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at a great classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: srk123
Reviews.Content: Booked an award 4-night stay with Starwood points, although I have no elite status. Given a standard room, which was normal hotel rooms size, but was beautiful in layout and appointments. Bed very comfortable, bathroom very upscale. Very clean and many amenities that you would expect from a 5-star hotel. Didn't eat in the hotel as it was expensive, but the dining areas looked very classy. Great location, across the street from the Prado and Thyssen art museums, and within a mile walk (or taxi ride) of all major tourist attractions in Madrid. Plenty of restaurants and outdoor eating within easy walking distance. Metro about 1/4-mile walk. Internet actually free (for 30-minute intervals) in the business center all day and evening. Concierge services helpful. Only drawback was major road construction right outside of the hotel which is expected to last a few more months as they are adding underground parking for a nearby government building . Would definitely return, depending on price, since my stay was on points.

Reviews.Title: “This Fabulous Hotel Will Enhance Your Stay in Gorgeous Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Wes_SantaMonica
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a trip to Spain to celebrate her birthday in September. We stayed five nights at the Palace -- and wow, what a great decision that was. The staff was incredible -- especially Celia at the Reception and Lisandro the concierge. Can't say enough good things about these two (hold on to them, Westin!) The rooms are FABULOUS, light, bright, elegant and restful. The lobby and public spaces are very elegant. And the location -- it simply can't be beat (across the street from the Prado and Thyssen Bornemisza musuems, close to El Retiro park and, in the other direction, close to nightlife central of Plaza Santa Ana). The Palace's buffet breakfast? Don't get me started, I might start drooling ... it will certainly send you off on your daily Madrid explorations with a big smile (and stomach). The only demerit I'd give the hotel is I don't love the Westin "Heavenly" beds, which are like sleeping on a giant fluffy cloud. I prefer a firm mattress, but that's just me perhaps. Also: the hotel would benefit from a swimming pool and Jacuzzi -- where would they put it, however, in a historic 100-year-old hotel like this?

Reviews.Title: “calm and relaxing oasis in stressful circumstances”
Reviews.Author: paul026
Reviews.Content: It was not on my itinerary to stay at this hotel but given the circumstances of an unexpected few days in Madrid (due to volcanic ash) I am more than happy with both the comfort and service the Westin Palace offered me. I booked the hotel through an online hotel agent the night before my arrival. When I got to there the booking was not in the system. The young lady (Celia) who was checking me in went to great length's to help me solve the problem.I was offered free use of the business center and 2 free phone calls to the British agent who made the booking. After an hour or so the problem was solved the booking confirmed and i was in my room. The receptionist was totally proactive in helping me, reflective of the whole quality of service throughout this beautiful property. Internet was free for the first 30 minutes and after that a crazy €9 for an additional 20 minutes. However for the entire time I was there the hotel waived all internet charges which was a nice touch. The business center was constantly full of guests looking to find a way back home. It was a beautiful hotel to find yourself in in such stressful circumstances. The surrounds were calming and tasteful. The rooms were most comfortable albeit a little dated. The breakfast was fantastic. The Concierge more than helpful. The location unbeatable. The service first class. It was true quality. Housekeeping was a bit patchy. I am glad I found it and booked it and when I return to Madrid will most definitely stay there again. A gem.

Reviews.Title: “At the End of the Rainbow...”
Reviews.Author: Traphix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently needed to get back to the USA when the Iceland volcano cloud grounded all the aircraft. We were in Brussels and drove 1600 km to Madrid to catch a flight home. At the end of that long drive, we landed for one night at the Westin. Beautiful hotel! Wonderful service, especially from the female concierge who was magnificent to work with on the return of our rental car. The room was quiet and calm and clean and spacious -- what more could you ask in a busy place like Madrid? The dining room was peaceful and well managed and soothing to our road-shot nerves. We loved the hotel so much we want to return to Madrid for a week or two in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Palace”
Reviews.Author: JetErie
Reviews.Content: We spent our entire time in Madrid at The Palace and were glad that we did. The hotel is gorgeous, the service is terrific, the breakfast (included with our package) is top rate, the concierge is very helpful, and the location is perfect. The metro station is across the street, world-class art museums are within easy walking distance, cabs are readily available 24 hours a day, and the beautiful Retiro park is a few minutes walk away. Our room was lovely, had a pretty view, and was immaculate. The hotel's restaurants, although a bit pricey, are first rate, and the breakfast spread was the best we've had anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable place in centre of town”
Reviews.Author: love2travel4242
Reviews.Content: walking distance to sights,train etc,,very comfortable rooms, outstanding buffet breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Renovated old glamour”
Reviews.Author: SchwiizerTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room, but some equipment and installations are worn off. The TV set is not flat, in the bathroom you can see some installation which is probably older than 10 year. But the huge breakfeast room is a super location: under the glass semi globe! The food was also delicous there.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and annoying 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuStew
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. The perfection stops there however. When one walks into the hotel there is this feeling of snobiness that looms overhead, which has no merit because this hotel is nothing to get excited about. The carpets and decor look outdated and worn. The television in our room was a box television that was quite small, and the lining on the tub in our bathroom was chipping, so that when I got out of the bathtub I would have pieces of white chips in my hair. Apart from that there were constant fees. The fee for internet is 16 euros (20 US dollars) a day! Additionally, because of my husbands hotel status we were told that we could receive free coffee once a day. Of course I took advantage of this! However, when we checked out of the hotel, there was 15 euro worth of service charge for the coffee. They forgot to mention that it was an additional 5 euros ($6.50) for the free coffee to be brought to the room. As rated, the hotel was clean. Our rooms were well taken care of, however, if you decided to hang out in your hotel room, you better put the DO NOT DISTURB sign up, because you will be disturbed...a lot! It felt like we were constantly being bothered. Maid service, mini bar service, turn down service. At one point my husband and I were taking an afternoon nap and forgot to put the sign up and there was a knock on our door. The maid gave us a total of 2 seconds (if that) to answer the door, before we know it she's using her own key to get in, and were yelling "No, por favor!" Annoying! Finally, it is mine and my husbands habit to immediately check out our view when we walk into our hotel room for the first time. Our view was a complete let down. It looked out into the hotels courtyard which consists of pretty much nothing but the roof of a dome. All in all this hotel just annoyed me, and I assure you I am not a hotel snob.

Reviews.Title: “Good but no 'X Factor'”
Reviews.Author: terryatkins123
Reviews.Content: A friend and I visited Madrid for two days, especially to watch Real Madrid play. Checking in was simple and the staff were very accommodating, especially with our lack of Spanish skills. The Orangery is very impressive, shame the room was basic and did not represent the prices paid for it. The hotel had a very business orientated feel, with the restaurant dominated by men in suits with laptops working away, which did not produce a relaxing atmosphere that I expect from a top hotel. In summary the hotel is good but not worth the premium.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Comfy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnowNow
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much and would like to add my $0.02 on comments from other guests. The "dated" comment - we found one of the doors broken off the hinge and a piece of marble broken off the baseboard next to the bedat but I would call that normal wear and tear. Westin Palace does not have low maintenance like some old places that ended up with awful looking grouts, water damaged wall paper, stained marble, etc. The room looked elegant and has functional features. We are surprise at the noise that other guests have experience. The room enters in a hallway with the bathroom on the left-hand side, another door before entering the bedroom. With this double door feature we couldn't hear anything outside our room. We didn't like the high price tag on internet access but at least each room gets 30 minutes free at the Business Center. It also has a printer that didn't cost extra.

Reviews.Title: “Remember 'The Shining'?”
Reviews.Author: jasondarling
Reviews.Content: Creepiest hotel I've every stayed at. Comfortable enough but stodgy and old and just weird. Dont bother.

Reviews.Title: “just a Westin....”
Reviews.Author: JeremyNewYork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just ended a 2-night stay at this location, on the SPG cash and points promotion, and it included a preposterous situation unprecendented in our experience. Our double room on the 5th floor was adjoining to a suite where a large group of pre-teens were raucously playing. The room doors here are very heavy, and close very noisely unless extreme care is taken, and needless to say, the bosterous kids were not taking such care. When I stuck my head out to see what was going on, two room service carts were being removed, and I asked one of the room service waiters how many kids were in the suite....and was informed that there were 10 or 11! I called down to the duty manager to enquire about alternatives if the noise continued, and was informed that the large group of kids were assigned to 5 rooms on the floor, and had been in residence for 2 weeks....and that if the loud noise continued past 10pm that I should call back. It was an unprecented situation, that generated neither an apology nor even an acknowledgement from the hotel management that screaming 3, 4, and 5 year olds running through the halls, slamming doors, and singing/shouting/playing loudly in their communal room might be disruptive to our enjoyment of our accommodation (which had an adjoining door). The location of the property is outstanding, but current management has turned a luxurious property into a run-of-the-mill Westin. If you are able to obtain the SPG rate ($90 plus 4,800 SPG points), and don't mind putting up with loud parties until 10pm in an adjoining room, then this hotel might be ideal. If you're looking for something more luxurious or sedate, then we strongly recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “If you're in Madrid to visit its museums, this is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara6
Reviews.Content: Usually I try to avoid large business class hotels but after reading reviews of several smaller hotels (thin walls, street noise, etc.) I opted for the Westin. The location was superb and the room comfortable and quiet. The Prado and the Thyssen were less than a 5 minute walk away and the Reina Sofia was just down the street. Plaza Mayor and the Royal Place were also within walking distance, albeit a bit further. And Retiro Park was only a 10 minute walk. The major downside was that the charge of 19 euros a day for internet access! However, right across the street was Faborit , a small coffee shop with excellent lattes and salads, and free internet access. (Starbucks was also just around the corner from the front entrance.) I got a great deal on the internet that included the outstanding buffet breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Loved Madrid, Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loretta360
Reviews.Content: The Westin was a great location and comfortable base for enjoying Madrid. (We had never been to this city and were surprised by how much we loved it.) We had a room overlooking the Neptune Fountain. Hotel staff was very helpful. Breakfast buffet was great. By the way, eat all the delicious Iberian ham you can (especially the type where the pigs were fed only acorns). I priced it at an upscale grocer when I got back to the states at $130 a pound.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: spe99
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Westin Palace with my wife (part of a 10 day trip to Spain). The hotel has a very classic and elegant decor (you won't mistake it for a W) with an atrium that is beautiful and excellent for people watching. The rooms are comfortable, again with a classic decor. We had an executive king bed room. The bed was fantastic and really large which I like. Given its proximity to a number of Spanish government buildings a number of politicians appear to stay there. We noticed a number of secret service types and police milling about at all times while we were there. The extra security was never an issue for us and if nothing else it is nice to stay in such a secure hotel. The hotel's location is fantastic in my opinion. You are across the street from both the Prado and the Thyssen (and the botanical garden) and a few minutes walk from the Reina Sofia. It is great central location for walking the city. Moreover, the hotel is walking distance from the Antocha rail station which is great for taking the high speed train for day trips our of Madrid. The service at the hotel was professional and efficient though hardly the warmest I have experience. The hotel concierge was helpful and made a number of dinner reservations for us. I can't comment on room price as I used SPG points for our entire stay. We did have one (very) overpriced cocktail in the hotel bar. The bar is very comfortable with greens and dark woods. As is the custom in Spain we received a number of small appetizers with our drink. While the music and atmosphere were nice we did not see the need to have more than one drink there since there is so much to experience in Madrid. We never ate at the hotel as it was way way too expensive and again, there is so much to experience food wise in Madrid. After all, we did not come to Madrid to eat in the hotel. There was no free wifi in the room which surprised me a bit given how pricey the hotel was. Overall I think the hotel has a great location but could be a bit stuffy for some folks.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 68Aalum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had not been to Madrid before. My wife is very particular and the Westin Palace delighted her. Beautiful rooms and common areas. Lots of fresh flowers. A very attentive staff. We were within easy walking distance of the three great Madrid museums and of the plazas of Old Madrid. Lots of good restaurants and cervezerias nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: meleetyme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her during the second leg of honeymoon. The hotel is located in a very central area of Madrid. It is a historic buliding that is classy and well cared for. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are gorgeous. We would have loved to have a jacuzzi tub but oh well. The breakfast was included in the price of the room which was great as the Spaniards tend not to eat the large breakfast fares that Americans do and meals in Spain tend to be expensive. Hence the spread that they put together is outstanding. It even includes free champagne to make mimosas. Regarding breakfast, one word of advice, in general we found eggs to be made very runny in Spain. This sounds trivial but when we were at the hotel we had to learn how to tell them that we wanted the eggs cooked "hard". Once we learned how to say it there were many other guests asking us how to say the same. (Too bad I have already forgotten the phrase). The hotel is in walking distance to the major attractions in Madrid incluing el Prado Museum, el bario de Las Letras y el Gran Via. It is also close to the train line. We took a train to the airport when leaving. Although the hotel's front desk recommended that we take a cab, we found the train system easy to navigate and of course cheap. My only complaints about this hotel is that the cost of movies is ridiculously expensive and there is no free internet. I think it cost $20 euro to rent a movie. My husband and I were desperate to hear some English langague on the television and so we rented a movie but the cost was outrageous. Lastly, plush hotels need to realize that internet use should be free. After paying a hefty fee for a room, patrons should not be charged additionally for internet access. The lower priced hotels offer this for free. As a bonus, the hotel has a very modern gym that is located at the top of the hotel and adjacent to an outdoor terrace. Be sure to ask for a transformer from the front desk if you plan to use a curling iron. The hotel also has a wonderful bar/lounge area, a shop and also a museum that gives history on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a wonderful hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pepper99
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Westin and had a truly wonderful experience there. The hotel is a grand old building with lots of charm. It is in a really great location - across the street from the Prado and walking distance to many of the best sights in Madrid. The concierge staff was very helpful with good suggestions and they made several reservations for us. The rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Kirsti26
Reviews.Content: excellent location for all the tourist attractions and entertainment

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Upgrade to Jr Suite using points. Room 624”
Reviews.Author: slcsav
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a Jr. Suite using SPG points on arrival. Room very spacious. Shower was great with two heads and hand held spray. Separate soaking tub also with hand held spray. His and her sinks. Separate toilet / bidet room. Bed very comfy and seemed big for a queen size. Two TV's one in bedroom and one in living room. Two desks and dining table..also tons of space for room service table..they could bring in service and pullover chairs. Perfect for those late nights and early mornings. Free internet and movies with upgrade. Service was very good and prompt with anything you needed. Turn down service and free bottle water every day was very nice. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good service, great B'fast”
Reviews.Author: BarneyMalta
Reviews.Content: A very elegant hotel, situiated in a quit area of madrid although you ned to walk about 15 minutes to get to the centre. The only problem we found is taht it was too formal and sometimes we felt out of place going down in jeans or track suit for b'fast! We never had dinner in the hotel. The only downfall is that we had our 1 year old son sleeping in a playpen and not a cot and that to get to the elevators from the main door the porters had to help us carry the stroller a flight of stairs every time we went in and out of the Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Westin. It was Heavenly, like the beds.”
Reviews.Author: bpalm2424
Reviews.Content: Ok, i'm a firm believer in Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts Choices. They usually deliver. This was no different. A beautiful atrium- attentive service and we were upgraded to an amazing room (could of had a little better view but it was huge, so we didn't care). Loved the cozy side bar at night- and it was SO easy to walk to everything. You stay here because its very nice and the location is SO worth it. We went over to the Ritz bar and found it very smoky while the atrium restaurant and bar at the Westin was gorgeous. Really happy with the choice. Good value for the money- would stay again. Did breakfast twice- service could have been a little better- but overall- we REALLY loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibreak4coffee
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Westin Madrid multiple times on business over the past few years. There is nothing to complain about - this is a wonderful property that is very well known in Madrid and which Westin bought in a great decision. In my mind the best place to stay in Madrid. The location is amazing - near all the major museums, close to downtown, and close to the airport. The staff are professional and friendly and always helpful. There are tapas bars around the corner as well, which aren't bad. The lobby is beautiful, and so are the rooms. Was upgraded last time I stayed into a junior suite and it was spacious, well appointed, and great. And like most Westin's, the bed was amazing. The gym is also well appointed with modern equipment. I should add the food is also good and while expensive, about what I'd expect to pay in a luxury hotel. Overall a great property which will always be my first choice when traveling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a special treat”
Reviews.Author: CorkSculptor
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Westin Palace early in the morning but we were given immediate access to a room. It was a fine room but we asked if we could swap for one with an outside view and a bath instead of a shower. This request was immediately met and we were shown a new room by an extremely helpful member of staff (Peggy Joan Ziemann) and in the course of the move I mentioned it was my partner's birthday. When we came back from dinner that evening we found a cake with Happy Birthday Peter in icing, a bottle of cava and a card with best wishes. The expansive buffet breakfast was an excellent start to the day, beautiful food, beautiful surroundings and an attentive staff. The bed was one of the best hotel Beds I've experienced with fine cotton sheets and a choice of pillows. Thank God for goose down! The location was so good we walked everywhere and hardly used our travel passes. Getting there was very easy. We took the metro from the airport to a nearby station. Altogether a great stay. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: markluise
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel in Madrid. It has a charming and elegant atmosphere. The rooms are big and the beds are really heavenly ones.The hotel has a very good location and offers wonderful breakfast. It worths the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel - Lots of Construction”
Reviews.Author: TXScooby
Reviews.Content: Spent several nights at the Palace on recent trip with wife. Hotel exceeded expectations on all levels. Got really good deal on Priceline. The hotel is in a perfect location between the museums and tourist areas. There is lots of construction right outside the hotel involving street rebuilding. To towards the city center you have to deal with it. Did not cause lots of issues, but sure that lead to the good pricing. The airport is new and very nice but far from Madrid. Cab ride is was nice but be ready to spend about 35-euro. Check-in was quick and easy. Lobby is very nice. Small elevator (typical of European hotels). Room was good sized and very clean/neat. We did not spend much time in room, but all was good regarding amenities. We did not eat at the hotel but the Rotunda Restuarant was very impressive. Madrid is very easy to walk around. We spend one whole day exploring the city on our way to the Royal Palace. The streets were very exciting. Around every corner was something interesting regarding architecture, plaza, historical area, park, etc. It was a Saturday and lots of people and events including kids. Really enjoyed walking everywhere from Americans who love our cars! We were disappointed in the food. Nothing against the restuarants, just our sensibilities towards lots of fish and such. Once we got to the seafood paella, I was in fine! We did a dinner flamenco show. It was very interesting, entertaining and not what I was expecting. More to it than meets the eye on TV. Recommend it. Looking forward to returning to Madrid soon.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION.”
Reviews.Author: jphonduras
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon in Europe. London, Paris and Madrid. Also stayed in NYC for a few days. All other places stayed in Hilton Hotel chains. But the best hotel by far, with the best staff was the Westin. As soon as i got there i was upgraded to a better room, and had complimentary champagne and chocalates, for being on my honeymoon. The hotel is majestic, very nicely located, everything was perfect. TIP. for free internet head down to the starbucks in the back part of the building. Completely free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: sabisf
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect - Location, rooms, staff. We were able to upgrade to suite when we arrived for a small additional charge. The room was spacious with a huge bathroom and an walk in closet. The service is impeccible. Decor is beautiful. Great Location. Every night we walked down a block and had drinks and canapes before getting ready for dinner. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “The best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: mp1975
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best bed I've ever slept in and a quite amazing hot chocolate. I love the paintings on the walls. Located in the center of Madrid, it is within walking distance to la Puerta del Sol for shopping. I just want to go back to bed!!! Truly Heavenly!!!! Staff is also very nice and genuine. It is not far from the Prado Museum.

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: M_Teo
Reviews.Content: If you are a culture buff, this hotel is for you since it is well located within walking vicinity of many museums. Staff was professional but not exceptionally friendly though they can be extremely helpful when approached. One of us was pickpocketed and the staff provided the neccessary documents for filing the reports and then called in the police. We were indeed impressed by this act. The concierge also personally helped me to contact a Spanish friend when i was unable to meet him personally to hand over a gift. We were graciously upgraded to junior suites on the non SPG floor but it was nevertheless spacious with a separate bath and 2 shower areas and a living area. Bed and linen was very comfortable but the pillow was not so. They were generous with bath amenties and we also had complimentary bottled water. So, overall a well located hotel with great room and good service. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: CreativeExplorations
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin Palace Hotel in Madrid nine (9) days in May 2009 (a bit delayed in posting this review). The hotel offers transfers from the airport which we took advantage of and it was well worth it. The large airport is a good distance (approximately 30 minutes) outside of the city center. The Chauffer was there to greet us upon arrival from a long flight and drive us to the hotel – hassle free The location was absolutely perfect for exploring Madrid by foot and/or surrounding areas by train. The Westin Palace Hotel is located a short walk from the Prado Museum, Retiro Park, historic monuments, Plaza Mayor, Botanical Gardens, shopping, and countless restaurants and tapas bars. Access to the metro station and Atocha train station is also within a short distance from the hotel. The Westin Palace Hotel itself has been restored to its original grandeur (1912). It is elegant and the rooms are comfortable. We did not encounter any problems during our stay. In fact, the staff was friendly and attentive to our needs. Our accommodations included breakfast, which is served in the La Rotonda restaurant named for the beautiful stained glass dome. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and adequate. Overall, The Westin Palace Hotel was a great choice for our stay in Madrid and as a home base in order to explore El Escorial, Segovia, Toledo, and Avila. We made our reservation through booking.com. Therefore, we did not receive spg starwood preferred guest points for our stay. However, the savings outweighed the benefits of the starwood points. If you are interested in seeing pictures of Spain and other destinations, please visit my website: www.creativeexplorationsinc.com

Reviews.Title: “What an "over the hill dowager" with no regard for frequent guests”
Reviews.Author: shoepeddler
Reviews.Content: They close the best features of the hotel under a thin veil of preparing for a holiday festival. Eating in a meeting room instead of a restaurant at full price is a rip off. That for dinner and breakfast. The ambiance is what one is willing to pay for and it is unavailable. The concierge is a dunce only looking for tour commissions and taxi kick backs. The reception is only interested in swiping your credit card. Room preferences are ignored. Evening maid service in a large suite is unavailable. No manager is available after business hours and promised call backs are never kept. The Palace is hardly a good palce to enjoy Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AGross
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Palace recently and had a wonderful experience there. The hotel is situated perfectly, next door to the Prado, across the street from the Theissen and the Ritz. It is a tradiional "grand hotel" in the pure European style. Our room was spacious, the bathroom large with plenty of counter space and a separate commode and bidet. The concierge was unbelievably helpful with restaurant recommendations. The bar was a relaxing respite after a long day of sightseeing or dinner. We looked forward to going "home" every night!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Perfectly Placed for Sights and Nightlife”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Starwood hotels so when we planned our trip to Madrid we were looking forward to staying at the Palace. Luckily there was a good deal directly on their site, including breakfast so we booked that. We arrived at the hotel at 11am and had no problem checking in immediately. The hotel doesn't look big from the outside, but once you're walking around to find your room, you realise how big it is. There was also a lot of construction around the hotel so the taxi had to drive around several times trying to find the best way to drop us off. The room was nice, enough space for a couple of nights, nice decor, a pretty view and complimentary bottled water (but that could just be the SPG floor). The bathroom was spacious and there were 2 sinks which i always prefer. The bed was typical Westin and super comfortable. Had a few issues with the turndown service, especially since you eat dinner so late in Madrid, they would continue to knock/walk in and we would still be there. I think they need to do turndown later in this city. The breakfast was excellent and in such a beautiful room with a big stainglassed atrium. The selection was nice, cooked-to-order eggs, regular eggs, meats, cheeses, breads, even churros one morning. Sometimes the service was a bit spotty to get coffee though, but overall, great breakfast. The location is the best part. You're right acoss from the Prado, as well as the smaller museum (although still big!) that I'm now forgetting the name. It was perfect to just walk outside and just exploring. Madrid is very walkable in general and this was a great base. I also liked that the nightlife was 5-minute away, but not so close that you would hear anything noisy at night. There aren't restaurants right outside the door, but again, literally 5 minutes away there are streets of tapas bars and restaurants. Check out was easy as well and we got a cab right away. I would highly recommend this hotel for a city break. Had nice personality reflecting the city, but also very high-end and without the super-high price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stricky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed 4 nights at the Palace Hotel and loved every minute of it. Because we booked our "executive" room on Priceline we were concerned that it would be too small. But it was a nice sized room and we were grateful that it was located in the back of the hotel facing a quiet, small street since there was construction right in front of the hotel's entrance. (All of Madrid seems to be under construction!). The rooms must feature the Westin chain's famous "heavenly" beds because ours was soooo comfortable. The bathrooms are equipped with 8-inch round "rain" shower-heads with a water temperature-control dial; a magnified make-up mirror and hair-dryer. They also provide robes and slippers. The hotel is very well located near the major museums and Retiro Park and it has a wonderful lobby and restaurant/lounge area where you can enjoy an afternoon or evening tea in beautiful surroundings. The only complaint is a less than stellar concierge desk. Except for one gentleman who was very helpful in suggesting and reserving dinner reservations for us they tended to respond to our questions with minimal information so you'd move on. This is a superb hotel that's well situated for culture, sightseeing and access to the beautiful park.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: airlandsee
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a week in july. the rooms on the starwood floor are nicer and in better condition. make sure you select the free breakfast package, the buffet is great in the morning. hotel is in a perfect location. room and bathroom were nice size. lobby drinks are pricey at 45e for two. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: jkensicki
Reviews.Content: One of the most luxurious hotels we've ever stayed in. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a Jr. Suite on the top floor. They sent a bottle of wine and appetizers to our room. We also received a complimentary breakfast in their ballroom the next morning. The only downside is everything not included, is very expensive. Internet access was almost $20 per day. Aquafina bottled water in room was $10. We had two drinks at the bar with bottled water and paid $60.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: BellaRoseNY
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Westin Palace hotel in Madrid. The lady at the reception took great care of us upon our arrival at the hotel. As we had mentioned it was our 10th wedding anniversary, she satisfied our wishes to have a room on a high floor with a city view and even had chocolates and cava delivered to our room with a lovely note from the hotel's manager. Breakfast buffet in the magnificent rotunda was very agreeable . The concierge service was very useful as well. The location is great near Museo Thyssen, the Prado and Museo Reina Sofia. General note: Madrid is undergoing some massive construction work.

Reviews.Title: “Now that's a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rgerwitz
Reviews.Content: Finished our two week trip in Madrid and couldn't have picked a better place to stay. Beautiful, comfortable room, helpful and accomodating staff, really well located. Certain doesn't fall into the "charming" category, but if you're ok with larger, well run hotels, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler200903
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible stay at the Westin Madrid. The staff was amazing, at the concierge desk, Lisandro was right on for his restaurant recommendations and help make our stay at the hotel enjoyable. The rooms were comfortable but the beds squeaked a bit when you sat on the side of them, otherwise the beds were comfortable. It is a great location, quiet around the hotel but you can quickly walk up into the Huertas neighborhood where there is a lot of activity. We would stay here again on our next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: DP11
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor I stayed at the Westin Palace with some trepidation., howvever the $90 price using starwood points and cash won out. We stayed here for two nights and honestly don't understand most of the comments posted. The hotel is an upscale Westin in a perfect location for leisure travelers. Those complaing about breakfast/coffee/water prices amaze me, since there is a Starbucks and Spainish style Denny's/7-11 less than 100 feet from the entrance. We arrived at 9 am after our trans Atlantic flight and were treated very well and told a room was not ready, but would be around 10 am. Went to the Prado and at 11 am came back, the room was ready and we checked in. The room was on the SPG floor facing the courtyard, was an upscale Westin room with a good bed, and we never heard a sound from the streets or another room. Also never saw one example of bad wear and tear often posted here. Comments regarding all the construction are also interesting since it does not affect your stay. Based on walking around about the city, 20% of the Madrid streets in the general area seemed to be under construction. I see little the hotel could do about this, and it did not affect our visit in any way. Can't comment on the concierge service, since I didn't use. I have usually found independent guides, such as trip advisor, give better recommendations anyway. So my advice is that unless you are looking for an experience such as the Four Seasons or Pennisula Hotel this hotel will do just fine as long as the price fits your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It....”
Reviews.Author: alieneyes
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, good food...if you can get past the staff. I should have known it was going wrong when I got serious hassle for pre payment with the threat my reservations would be declined. The defining feature of the stay was truly appalling service - at any one time, 10 hotel staff evident and no response for assistance or help was answered. We were actually turned away from the restaurant by a member of staff that I was directed to by another member of staff and they had a row about in public! To add insult to injury, my credit card was fraudulently debited while I was at he hotel - by the hotel itself! If you speak Spanish you can hear the staff cursing the residents soundly! I witnessed a member of the restaurant staff, when asked for ice by an elderly American guest, take ice from the champagne buckets using his bare hand, put it into a glass and serve it at the table. Food poisoning anyone? Give this place a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: rmhayward
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We will definitely stay here again. The staff are all very pleasant and always smiling. Couldn't ask for a better location! The rooms are very clean and the hotel is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Near to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: VSS13
Reviews.Content: The executive room was clean and huge by European standards. The closet was huge. The bathroom the shower and bath tub are combined. Our breakfast was included in the rate. Else the breakfast for 22 Euro is not worth it. We also had a free internet included in the rate. There was a bug in the system. The internet had to be requested for a 18 Euro a day and at the end of the stay the rates were removed from the bill.The staff is polite by not very friendly. We ate one night in the Asia Gallery restaurant. .I would not recommend the restaurant. But overall the hotel stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we didn't pay $400 for our room”
Reviews.Author: sarahinbudpst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Palace using Starwood Points, so our room was free. Though the hotel is nice, and the service was very good, I would have been very disappointed if we had actually paid the list price for the room. Of course, the location of the hotel is fantastic. However, the room decor was a little tired, and the room was not appreciably nicer than the $150/night hotels we stayed in elsewhere in Spain. The biggest problem was the noise. We were awoken at 3a.m. by the sound of our neighbor's T.V. Oh, and they charged us 22 Euro for internet access, which seems outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Westin style but not really Spanish”
Reviews.Author: Giuliani_CO
Reviews.Content: Westin Palace Madrid, is very conveniently located just in front of El Prado and other museus in Madrid, very close to the Parco del buen Retiro, and in walking distance from Plaza del Sol. Rooms and service are just what you could expect from a Westin hotel. But just because of that when you are in the hotel, you just do not realize you're in Spain. If you are a traveler that wants to experience the taste of the country he's visiting in the hotel he is staying in, you sholdn't choose the Westin. You may be wherever in the world when you're inside!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of history but with updated luxury”
Reviews.Author: Gloucs
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a wondersful 5 night stay at the Palace and all the staff we met were very professional, courteous and helpful. It is in a wonderful location and with the advice of Ricardo the concierge we ate at some very good ( reasonably priced) restaurants and saw a great Flamenco show. We had already booked two day trips with Viator - El Escorial and Toledo one day and then Avila and Segovia another which were both fascinating. You learn a lot about a city exploring its environs. We had a very enjoyable and restful break from our busy lives - thanks Westin! PS There are major road building works around the city at present but what city does not have them! It did not deter us from our enjoyment of this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agents Opinion of Westin Palace Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TripGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this primarily business property in a perfect location in the city of Madrid. You are within 10-15 minutes walking from all of the major sites so the location is perfect - even better than the Ritz in my opinion. Breakfast was wonderful - make sure you buy a package that includes it. Room was nice but nothing special - what you expect from an upscale, historic Westin property. Many of the rooms face another building so make sure your travel agent puts in a request for a room with a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Westin is good to go!”
Reviews.Author: singtx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days this weekend as well. Busy hotel with people coming and going at all hours. Great check-in and scored a jr suite for the three nights. Everyone was great who we encountered and always helpful. Huge room and bathroom compared to other hotels we have stayed in. Close to great bars/tapas, jazz bars, restaurants, sights etc. The decor is tired and needs updating. Some mold issues in the restroom...The construction in Madrid is everywhere and out front of the hotel, but we never heard anything at night. Gym is huge and great...no bottled water to take. They replenished the water in the room daily and at night. free 30 minutes of internet use at business center daily. We had a good time, but with so many new hotels we would most likely stay elsewhere, but you cant beat the C&P rates and quality of this hotel. Los Gatos is 1 block from the hotel and they are the nicest people! Owner poured us free drinks all night!! We went everywhere to eat and it was all walking distance from the hotel. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “By no means a five star hotel, even if you stretched your imagination!”
Reviews.Author: cattykitty
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel this weekend passed based on the reviews here on tripadvisor. The hotel looks like a five star, lots of chandeliers marble everywhere. That's where it ends. The concierge was gruff, the service very slow. Really the only thing five star about this hotel are the prices in the bar. Extortion. Two biers for 21 Euro. It was close to museums and central, but for what we paid I was shockingly dissapointed. We would have been better off staying in any of the lower class hotels in the area. I've stayed in the Ritz and other five star hotels and this just doesn't compare at all. It's a pretty four star at the most, and shouldn't claim otherwise. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel with Westin touches”
Reviews.Author: lac14
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace combined the elegance of an old-world hotel with modern touches and comforts of a Westin. The bathroom is huge and modern, as compared to many hotels in Europe. And the heavenly bed is always comfortable. Great location next to the Museo Prada, Museo Thyssen, and botanical gardens. Walking distance to most other tourist attractions. The staff was helpful too. I stayed here for 12,000 points per night, which compared to other SPG hotels, is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: wewaltz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the tourist-center of Madrid, and yet inside, the hustle and bustle is gone. We selected a 'quiet' room, with no particular view, which was excellent for getting a good night's sleep. Our room (in the Starwood Preferred Guest floor) was equipped with lovely amenities - bathrobe, great toiletries. The buffet breakfast is massive, providing choices ranging from sweet pastries to healthy veggies. The orange juice was amazingly delicious. The location is perfect - right across from the Prado - and at a spot with public bus service. Getting to the Metro is a bit of a walk, but not an unreasonable one.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and restful stay”
Reviews.Author: IL630
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in September at the Westin Palace. This is a great hotel in a wonderful location. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The proximity to the museums allows you to come home in the middle of the day and have a short nap before you go to explore the next place - and there are lots of things to explore! We enjoyed their breakfast buffet and were very much satisfied with both the variety and quality of the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Dirksdonuts
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia for £200 per night for 3 nights because it was a special occasion. I emailed the hotel around a week before travelling to check the reservation and to let them know it was a special birthday treat for my wife. On arrival they made us feel very welcome and even wished her happy birthday. Once in the room we noticed they had put a bottle of Sparkling wine on ice and a small birthday cake including a candle. This made it more special for us. The building work outside of the hotel repairing pavements that another person spoke about on an earlier report has now finished. The hotel rooms are on the smaller size and we had booked a Superior deluxe. However they were very clean and well equipped. The breakfast was included in our price and the choice was endless including smoked salmon or trout and champagne if you wanted it. The chef stood behind the breakfast bar and you could ask him for most things such as how you wanted your eggs. This way you then got a bigger plate than what was on offer and then your choice instead of the scrambled egg on offer. (Try the poached eggs!!!) The prices of the lunches and evening meals were very high so we never ate there. We tried several of the recommended places by the concierge. A Tapas bar at the rear of the hotel and a Paella bar which was fantastic. Overall the concierge got most things right and was very helpful. The hotel was situated within a 5 minute walk of a busy area selling tapas and there were local bars around the same area. The rest of the city highlights were no more than around 15-20 max away from anything else you could of wished for. Shopping areas were within 5-10 minutes easy walk. All taken into account I would certainly recommend this hotel as a must.......

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Giacomo V
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Palace ( don't call Westin, mostly of Madrid's taxi driver don't know the hotel under this name). Our impression is extremely positive great luxury building in the center of Madrid in an old fashion atmosphere, small elevators, marble floor old stile TV are mixed together with a large restaurant built under an impressive glass dome. We book early and found an interesting fare with a delicious breakfast included. Our room, a de luxe one, was spacious and impeccably appointed, nice bathrobe too. Staff is extremely friendly and almost everyone speaks English. Concierge are great too. If it fits your budget is a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent classic hotel, beautifully maintained”
Reviews.Author: brandenburg5
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and had a great time. This is one of the great hotels of Madrid (the building itself is listed as a sight in the Eyewitness Travel Guide) and a fantastic place to stay. We loved the marble, the polished mahogany, the antiques in the corridors and the many old prints. The room was large and the Westin beds are indeed heavenly. There was no traffic noise as we were on the inside courtyard. Breakfast is substantial in the wonderful glass-domed restaurant. Only one point of improvement I would suggest: reception staff could have been more welcoming, especially as I presented an SPG card when I arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Madrid Elagance”
Reviews.Author: Bostonjewels
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel the moment we walked in. Staff was very accomodating, eagar to help with luggage the moment we stepped out of the cab. The location is superiour. You are within walking distance to all Madrid's attractions. We walked all over the city. I suggest going to Santa Ana Square for some dining. Also try the Madrid Vision bus tour, it leaves right outside the hotel and your pass is good all day. We hit lots of restaurants within walk of the hotel. None were disappointing. The room was very old world, not to mention spacious. We had an alove that opened it up a bit more. The linens were impeccably clean. The bed was comfy. We came in jetlagged from USA and were eagar to get a few winks in. One one occasion I had accidentally smudged a bit of cosmetic on the duvet, when I returned after the room had been turned down, it was replaced. The bathroom was spacious. The separate enclosed toilet/bidet was a good detail. The tub was deep and afforded a relaxing bath, even for my 6'3 partner. The room was very clean. No problems with noise in the halls or from adjacent rooms. The hotel was built in 1912 and very well I would say. Corridors still have original details. The lounge in the lobby was a great place to grab a drink after heading out. You must try the freshly cut proscuitto! We were only at the Palace for 2 days and thought it was one of the best hotels we've been in yet. Concierge offered great suggestions within our budget. Front desk staff very pleasant. This hotel is 5 stars to us!

Reviews.Title: “below expectations”
Reviews.Author: ebie1
Reviews.Content: Nicely presented breakfast. Convenient to Thysien art museum. Concierge is no help. Beds okay.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly on Par with the Ritz....Especially in The Renovated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: When staying city-center in Madrid, I always pick either the Westin Palace or the Ritz. The two properties are basically right across the Paseo del Prado from one another, and I personally find them quite comparable, so much so that I let price alone be the determining factor in my choice of stay. As has been mentioned in some reviews of the Ritz, my room there was slightly tired, but not enough so to be objectionable. I prefer the drive-up appeal of the Ritz, but prefer the common areas of the Palace. I am an SPG Gold and was staying on an amazingly reasonable promotional rate. The first room I was given was not a renovated room, so I asked the desk to move me up to an SPG floor where the rooms were renovated, and they gladly and quickly did so. The rooms are elegantly done up, and the baths are large and luxurious. The courtyard rooms have only a view of the interior common area cupola and other rooms, but I prefer that in central Madrid because traffic buzzes until almost dawn on weekends and the courtyard provides an excellent noise barrier for a good night's sleep. I've found the staff to be a bit more relaxed and casual than at the Ritz, but the care is excellent, with people making an effort to remember my name, which is impressive in a hotel of its size. Obviously there have been many reviewer comments about the Prado, Thyssen, and Reina Sophia, and all of them stand tall among the world's great museums. There are many things I love about Madrid, but I always recommend a late afternoon stroll through the Retiro Park on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon to enjoy the masses of elegant and happy citizens enjoying that tremendous city asset. For a luxury remembrance of Madrid, try the Loewe boutique in the Salamanca district. Loewe is essentially to Spain what Hermes is to France, but an item there can be more special because Loewe isn't widely distributed internationally and the quality speaks for itself.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but $25 hot dog?!”
Reviews.Author: BirdCatcher
Reviews.Content: Yes, the $25 hot dog pretty much sums up this hotel: it's magnificent, but you may not respect yourself in the morning. Everything about the physical nature of the hotel is perfect for a big city: great location, clean room, and amazing common areas. However, service could be a bit slow (1 hour to get our bags from the lobby to our room) and the hotel absolutely GOUGES you when it comes to food and beverage. To me, it seems like the perfect business hotel, but I may research a bit more if I'm paying out of my own pocket. Fortunately, using some SPG points brought the price of my room to under $100 dollars per night.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent belle epoque hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: panda267
Reviews.Content: within walking distance to a lot of attractions. The concierges were very knowledgeable on what type of restaurant we requested - we asked to go to non touristy restaurants and tapas bars and they were spot on each time. Stayed there 5 nights and on the third night I had to call for a doctor within 30 mins the doctor arrived and the concierge went to the pharmacy to get my medication - could not have asked for more. we went to a flamenco show and they reserved the front table for us - it was great. the glass dome in the dining room is a must to see and the bar had an old world feel. The room and bathroom were large and you could open the window

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hote, would stay at again. Construction going on outside the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: albutt27
Reviews.Content: As a platinum SPG member, we checked in right arter our overnight flight from the US. One note, if you take the subway to the hotel, it is about a 10 minute walk and there are no signs to the hotel. It's doable, just be patient! We were upgraded to a jr suite! Nice!!! It didn't have a view, but that didn't bother me because there was construction going on during the day. The room was awesome and very spacious. The location is about a 15 minute walk from the main Madrid district. It's very close to the museums and there is a bus stop nearby. Note, there is an AWESOME tapa's place that is behind the hotel found in Maribel's guide. It was one of the best places we ate at, and it wasn't that crowded that evening. The concierge is great, provided us detailed directions wherever we were going. They gave us helpful tips on how to get to the Real Madrid stadium. One note, to save money on water go upstairs to the gym where they have a water cooler. Overall, a solid place to stay at. Thanks for the upgrade as well! Finish the construction on the outside and it will be 5 stars and get a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last few years so that should say something about my opinion of the place. However, this time I found that standards have slipped but prices have risen. While I can forgive the fact that the hotel entrance resembles something of a bomb site apparently due to Spanish government economic stimulus initiatives which have resulted in much of central Madrid’s streets being overhauled simultaneously, it is what happens inside the hotel that is my primary concern. On check-in I was upgraded to a newly refurbished Executive Room which was surprisingly small. I wonder how much space would be available in the lesser Deluxe and Standard rooms. Anyway, the room was modern, comfortable and quiet. But the breakfasts were a great disappointment. Fortunately my tariff included breakfast, but anyone paying the exorbitant price for it separately would be doubly disappointed. Flavourless coffee, incompetently cooked eggs, fermenting stewed fruits, slow replenishment of buffet, and indifferent service attendants undermined my otherwise pleasant 4 night stay at this hotel. On the other hand, the fitness centre is surprisingly good – large and well equipped for a hotel – and was usually empty of other hotel guests. The Westin Palace is perfectly located across the road from the Prado and Thyssen Bornemisza galleries and within reasonable walking distance to parks, shops, and the old part of Madrid. The interior of the hotel is beautiful, particularly the main lounge which features a massive ornate glass dome reminiscent of the one in Galeries Lafayette in Paris. But I think the hotel is in danger of resting on its laurels and the management needs to re-assess its pricing policy and standards if it is to retain the loyalty of its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissO73
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace is a well-managed institution. Some may contend it's a bit business-like but I appreciate everything about them... Good service, food and great location. Can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that impressive”
Reviews.Author: jenneritt
Reviews.Content: This is a beatiful hotel that lacks anything special. It felt like a business-traveler's hotel, which is probably their main clientele. It was pretty, but soul-less. I booked using Starwood points, so I had two free nights. Kudos to the Starwood Preferred Guest program for making this so easy. Had I not used points, I think the room would have been about $300/night. That seems a little high to me. The location was good (very near the Prado Museum), but in a touristy area. The hotel was also under construction near the entrance, so that you had to wade through a mess to get to and from the hotel. The room was fairly large and had all of the special Westin touches - the Heavenly Bed and Showerhead. But I think our room must have been recently renovated, because it seemed sparse, as if it was missing some decorative furniture. We did have a window that opened onto the street next door, but it also looked out over a construction zone, which is not the hotel's fault, but it was noisy. One legitimate complaint is that this is a very large hotel, and as we exited the elevator, the signs indicating the direction to the guest rooms did not have our room listed, so we wandered around for about 15 minutes and then generally got lost each time we tried to return. We also had to wait 30 minutes for the doorman to bring up our bags, although he didn't appear busy. Check-in was easy, though, and the public spaces were beautiful. Stay away from the hotel restaurants, bar, and room service, though. It was ridiculously overpriced. No one should pay $15 for a glass of standard wine in a bar in Spain. And for the in-room breakfast, we would have needed to pay about $50 for eggs and toast. This makes me think that they're catering to customers on expense accounts. All in all, it's a very nice hotel in a good area, but for the price, I just expected a bit more, and the lack of character was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the classiest and most convenient place in all of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: mozartmara
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing with easy access to the museums, metro, restaurants, and within easy walking distance of so many major attractions and places of interest! It's worth the dollar value to have this amazing location and beautiful hotel - palace! I can easily see why Conde Nast rated it the number one hotel in all of Spain!

Reviews.Title: “classy hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Chic4
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel over the Ritz Carlton for a city break. Was pleasantly surprised. Lovely classy, clean hotel, great location and the bedrooms were tastefully decorated. I had read about the beds and can now truly say that the beds were the best we have slept in. The breakfast was superb with great choice; hot omelettes made for you, plenty of fruit, cereals and pastisseries. The drinks bar and the hotel restaurant prices are too high - so best to eat out. The only negative point would be that when we arrived, I found the reception staff cold and alittle unfriendly. No greetings, no warmth!! But the Conceirge were fantastic, very helpful and accommodating. Overall a lovely hotel and was glad that we stayed here and would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: E_S_Liam
Reviews.Content: We recently had an excellent stay at the Westin Palace for 5 nights. When we arrived we were greeted by Alberto at the front desk. It was immediately apparent that the staff at this hotel is well trained and knows what they are doing. We were upgraded to a starwood preferred room and Alberto made sure that our two year old was included as part of our hotel/breakfast rate. This is where I believe they go the extra mile as far as service is concerned. You don't have to ask, they already know what you're thinking. The hotel is beautiful. I looked at some of the pictures of the hotel prior to arrival and was concerned that this hotel would be a little too old and stuffy but I was wrong. The hotel is classic and modern. When you enter the lobby, there is a staircase that leads you to the elevators. I was concerned about taking the stroller up and down but not to worry, the staff was ready to help as soon as they saw me coming. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the back of the hotel because we requested a quiet room. The room as very quiet and the curtains completely black out the light. Now, let's talk about the bed, it was really, really comfortable as were the pillows. We brought our own todler bed for our son and housekeeping even made his bed everyday. This hotel is very accomodating to guest with young children. The hotel restaurant has high chairs and they brought hot water to our room when asked (free of charge of course). After snoozing and freshing up we headed out. The hotel location could not be better. You are across from the Prado and Thyssen, a 10 minute walk to the Reina Sofia and right in the middle of a neighborhood known for its old school tapas bars. Everything is within walking distance from the hotel, even Atocha Station (15 minutes). So, if you have to pay a little more to stay here, it's well worth it since you'll save yourself a bunch of cab fares. Overall, I would have to say this was our best hotel experience while in Spain for two weeks. The hotel stay added to our good impression of Madrid. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Majestic beauty and prices to match”
Reviews.Author: HonestCanuck
Reviews.Content: I had been to the lounge of the Westin Madrid a few years ago with a friend; she and I shared a bottle of great Spanish verdejo, nibbled some olives and almonds, and vowed to return to stay. I had the pleasure of staying for a few nights on route to Valencia and plan to use this info to make my friend envious. The Westin is beautiful, breathtaking in fact. The domed glass lounge is worth the visit alone - bright, elegant, and surprisingly intimate - a hotel lounge in the old style. The rooms are spacious and clean - the Westin king sized sleeper is wonderful as is the Westin heavenly bath – one of the best hotel showers I’ve experienced. Be wary if you are tired for you won't want to leave your room. To get some energy, use the Westin workout room; it too is spacious and clean and has above average equipment. Be sure to explore the area around the hotel - the Prado is close by as are numerous other attractions. Because the hotel is centrally located, it's a hike to the airport and there is a supplemental charge if you take a cab. The weather is wonderful - too hot if any complaint could be found. The Westin would be perfect if a pool were available. Be sure to visit the Loewe store in the hotel - it is up a short flight of stairs to the left once you enter the lobby. Many Canadians won't know this brand, but they should - great leather goods and accessories. Loewe is a brand from Madrid and a piece or two from the store will help you remember your stay. This is not a typical tourist hotel - be sure to have some extra euros saved for your stay. Sure, it's expensive, but it's well worth it. The granny smith apples - a signature of the Westin brand - were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time was as Charming”
Reviews.Author: jsthouston
Reviews.Content: Our second stay this year was almost as good as our first back in May. The room was almost as nice and this time we enjoyed a meal and a drink in the bar. The bar is expensive but the snacks were wonderful and it is a wonderful place to lounge after being out and about in the heat. As has been noted by others the location can't be beat and the rooms are large and well appointed with bathrooms one would expect in a five star hotel. Breakfast and dinner were excellent, if expensive, and I once again had the gym on the top floor almost to myself on both occasions i felt the urge to work off a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: tsktsk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Westin Palace in April. We arrived in Spain jetlagged and tired. We were able to check in right away and were happy with the quality of the hotel and our room. It was very clean and comfortable, as expected. We booked the room using Starwood points, and the Starwood level had a table with tea and apples set up for guests. Breakfast was not included, so we didn't eat (or have drinks) at the hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent, within walking distance of the Prado and the train station and is also walkable to Sol and the Plaza Santa Ana, though we did take the train a couple of times. The only hiccup during our stay involved transportation from the airport. I had called the hotel inquiring if they had a shuttle service from the airport.
