The gentleman I spoke with said they did, and he took our flight info. When we arrived at the airport, a private car picked us up. We were surprised, but the driver did not charge us. It was only when we checked out of the hotel that we were charged 100 Euros(!) The concierge had never mentioned the charge, and we were under the impression that it would be a complimentary shuttle, not a private car. Needless to say, it put a damper on our experience. Our stay was otherwise enjoyable (short but sweet) and made our transition into Spain very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but little things would make a difference”
Reviews.Author: DrSAH
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great position near the three major galleries. Large rooms, comfy beds, delux bathrooms. All of the staff were marvellous. Late check-out arranged without a fault. As a 5 star hotel it cant be faulted. As a place to stay whilst on holiday it can. The ludicrously high cost of internet access, minibar, bar drinks and food meant that although I could afford them I felt disinclined to use them and thus enjoyed the hotel less. If someone is staying at the Westin on holiday, I can recommend the Faborit restaurant chain across the street (San Jeronimo) - sandwiches, salads, freshly squeezed juice and coffee, all inexpensive AND free wireless internet access! Around the corner an opposite the Prado - the VIP store for drinks and snacks. A 3-4 minute walk along the road behind the hotel (Duque de Medinaceli) are a number of atmospheric bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly”
Reviews.Author: msk1001
Reviews.Content: Our few night stay was nothing short of heavenly. With their famous heavenly beds I never slept better. The breakfast was wonderful, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the concierge made great restaurant recommendations and reservations for us. I would recommend this hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nmb4010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last two nights in Spain. The location couldn't be better! We really didn't need the "hop on hop off" passes because everything was walking distance. The hotel is located between the Thyssen and Prado museums, with the Reina Sofia just down the street. The hotel interior was beautiful as well as the rooms. The staff was incredibly helpful and gave us great restaurant recommendations. This is a gem of a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient, but nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLori
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 2 nights at the end of July. We had two connecting rooms on the 5th floor of the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at about 11am after a long flight from San Francisco. The staff were very friendly and we were allowed to check into our room early. The rooms are spacious by European standards, with nice bathrooms and good closets. The hotel advertises that wireless internet is available in all rooms, but our room had no wireless connectivity at all. The only way to connect to the internet was a wired connection to a laptop (for which we were charged 15 euros per day), which meant no internet on IPHONES unless we connected via roaming cell charges (very expensive) Our room rate included daily breakfast, which was extensive and quite good. The waitstaff were efficient, but not very friendly. There is a significant amount of construction around the entrance of the hotel, which made hailing a taxi (or getting dropped off by one) difficult. The concierge was helpful in recommending restaurants and we had good experiences with all of their recommendations. Unfortunately, they were not very helpful on checkout. We needed to go to the Santa Justa train station to catch the AVE to Seville and they recommended leaving about 45 minutes ahead of time (the train station is just donwn the street - 10 minute drive at most). Unfortunately, they were unaware that there was a very large road race in progress and taxis could not make it to the hotel. We had to WALK to the train station dragging all of our baggage on a very hot morning. I give them low marks for this - not only should they have known about the race, they should have made arrangements to get their guests to a taxi stand.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: BurnsFamily05
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely visit in Madrid at the Palace and highly recommend it, even for the most discriminating travelers. We arrived very early, extremely jetlagged, and the front desk was kind enough to check us into one of our two connecting rooms even though it was only 10:00 a.m. Our rooms were large by European standards, with nice bathrooms and great linens. The location was perfect as a starting point for our daily sightseeing and there was twice-daily housekeeping. The breakfast buffet was substantial and well-done (and the staff in the restaurant was exceptional). We travel to Europe often and I would happily stay at the Palace again! Many thanks to management.

Reviews.Title: “Sophistication and Luxury near Museo Del Prado”
Reviews.Author: viajero26
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace Madrid is a perfect example of European Luxury.The rooms are not huge, but are beautiful with a hint of old and new. The decor is very european , yet it has a modern touch to make it more comfortable. The bathrooms are not like your "typical european bathroom" small and cramped that it. The bathrooms were spacious and luxurious. The location of the Westin Palace is perfect. You can walk to the Prado, hop on a Madrid tour bus, walk to the main gardens and many other places. And there is also a Starbucks and Vips right in front of the hotel, which are perfect places to grab a snack. Near the Westin are a variety of pastry shops, and the Puerta Del Sol is walking distance! For the ultimate Madrid experience stay at the Westin Palace !! Viva Madrid !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, though be aware of major street construction outside hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dusty-traveller
Reviews.Content: Having arrived by train from Zaragoza into Atocha, it was only a short taxi ride to the hotel. From the exterior, certainly a grand palace, but the inside showed this queen has seen grander days. I had read a lot of hype about the Rotunda bar and restaurant, and though it was all very nice, could not see what all the fuss was about. Our room was a deluxe twin facing outside on the back of the hotel, making it a very quiet option. The room was of an adequate size, though the beds were not nearly as comfortable as they looked. My mattress sagged to one side, only making my back condition unhappier. Clearly the mattress needed updating. And the airconditioning unit was a welcome addition to a hot Madrid day, but we were disappointed that in the 2 nights we spent there, it seemed to get warmer and warmer in the room and was not able to keep a consistant cool temperature. These little things one does not expect to find in a 5-star hotel. That said, the marble bathroom was well-appointed and with wonderful water pressure too. The two basins were greatly appreciated. as was the magnifying mirror and separate toilet/bidet area. Several other posters have mentioned the expensive internet fees and poor doorman services. We certainly ageee that if one is to pay 220 Euro for a room that the internet should be included in the rate. Heck, I'd rather have the internet than the breakfast, which WAS included in the room rate. As for the doormen, they seemed to be an on and off thing. Sometimes they were there, sometimes not. It should be noted that there is considerable construction to the street going on just outside the hotel (as it seems on just about every Madrid street), causing the pavements to be partially fenced off, and thus making it difficult for passerby and hotel guests to navigate the truncated sidewalk area. Certainly not the hotel's fault, but something to be aware of. There are a series of steps entering the hotel. There are 3 intial steps from the street, followed by a foyer area with another few steps. Reception and concierge are on this level. Then there are another 6-8 steps up to the elevators (lifts) and the restaurant and bar. For someone who is visually impaired, this is an accident waiting to happen. The location of this hotel simply cannot be beaten, as it is almost directly across the street from the Prado and one block from the Thyssen museum also. We would probably stay here again when in Madrid, but would hope to find a better rate next time, as for the value, we just didn't see it.

Reviews.Title: “Utterley wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandComfortseeker
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. We travel regularly and one of the biggest problems we find is cheap uncomfortable mattresses. This hotel has wonderful comfortable beds, the service is sublime, the bar and restaurant beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, But It Lacks The Requisite Luxury For a "Palace"”
Reviews.Author: TorontoWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18 month-old son and I stayed at the Westin Palace Madrid for four nights in early July 2009. This hotel has been reviewed extensively on this site so I won't repeat all the well-known details, but will simply provide some brief pros and cons. Overall, however, we liked the hotel and thought the location was great, but we felt that it needs a substantial "gutting" in order for it to truly be one of the fine hotels in Spain. As it stands now, it's simply a nice place to stay, but don't expect opulent luxury. PROS: (1) Location is wonderful. It's quite central and you can walk to pretty much every tourist attraction in Madrid. Most are within a 5-15 minute walk, and other further sites are about a 25 minute walk, but you can certainly walk everywhere if you like. We had an 18-month old child with us and even we were able to walk to everything. (2) Breakfast is included and was surprisingly nice. Large buffet with eggs made to order. Impressive for an "included " breakfast. CONS: (1) As mentioned above, our biggest criticism is that the hotel really needs a major modernization. I am an SPG Gold Member so was upgraded to a large suite. While I wouldn't categorize our room as "grotty", I don't think it has been renovated since maybe the early 80s. The washroom in the suite was very large but looked to be about 15 years old. Not a huge issue but certainly needs modernizing if this hotel would like to remain a leading hotel in Spain in the years to come. As an aside, we also stayed at the Westin Valencia while in Spain and that Westin was absolutely beautiful. Night and day with the Palace. (2) Bad Doorman Service. I would normally never knit-pick doorman service in a review, but I have to do so here. There are tons of steps to negotiate when entering the hotel from the street (about 15-20 steps). We had a stroller with us and the doormen only assisted us about 25% of the time. They were often spotted around the side of the hotel smoking. I only saw the doormen at their post about 30% of the time. Often, the front desk people would see my wife or I carrying a stroller and run out to help us (often looking back as if to ask "where is our doorman?!"). Westin - please have a chat with your doormen. Their service level was attrocious for a higher-end hotel. OVERALL: Nice hotel but just be aware of what you're getting here. I paid about US$175/night (all in) which I think was a fair price for what we received. But I would be very upset if, like many others, I paid more than US$175/night. It's not a bad hotel, but simply won't be one you'll remember during your life as a standout. Having said that, if the price is right, I would stay there again. But if I can find a newer, more modern high-end hotel in Madrid at similar prices, I think I'll try a more modern high-end hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: GordonGreenwich
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend with my wife. Luxurious in an old fashioned way, but more affordable than some of the other grand Madrid hotels. Wonderfully convenient postion, opposite the Prado (across a busy main road) and almost next door to the Thyssen; a 10 minute walk to Atocha Station and an easy stroll into the older parts of the City. Very comfortable and quiet bedroom overlooking the inner courtyard with a ''heavenly'' bed. Very slight drawbacks: bedroom furniture very slightly scruffy; no slippers; no shower gel; bed not automatically made up again in the evening.Very pleasant public areas, particularly the magnificent glass - domed hall for (excellent) breakfasts and (expensive) drinks. Concierge staff excellent and very helpful. Last time in Madrid we stayed at the Ritz but found it (though very beautiful) almost like a convention centre and now prefer the Palace - more affordable, more easily absorbs the functions, just as luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect of a Westin”
Reviews.Author: dru37
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently on business, but this was a vacation with my family of 5. I am Platinum SPG so was upgraded to a large 2 room corner suite, and we had a 2nd connecting room so we had a spacious 3 room suite. Rooms are clean and comfortable with flat panel LCD TVs, well functioning A/C, heavenly beds, etc. The hotel location is fabulous...right across the street from the Prado and Thyssen, on the tourist sightseeing bus routes, and a short 7-10 minute walk to Atocha train station...too far to walk with your baggage, but an easy walk for a day trip to Toledo for example. Taxi fare from the airport to the hotel was about 35 euros (including luggage supplementos) and a 15-20 minute drive at 12 noon on a Wednesday (ie. no traffic). The only real negative for me is the absurdly high prices they charge for drinks at the bar...10 euros for a domestic cerveza, 12-16 euros for a glass of cava, etc. Thankfully there are plenty of nearby reasonably priced options for drinks, breakfast (including a Starbucks in the same building), etc. Overall a wondeful hotel in a lovely city. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard_from_Dallas
Reviews.Content: Five star hotel with terrific location. Three great musuems, Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sophia, all within walking distance. The Prado and Thyssen were especially close, three blocks and across the street respectively...Great, friendly service from everyone...Particularly impressed by Ricardo at the Concierge desk, whose wisdom was invaluable- from internet cafe to great places filled with locals for Tapas. Rooms were very comfortable with every major amenity. I felt that we didn't spend enough time in Madrid- my enjoyment of the hotel was a major reason

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce”
Reviews.Author: abomb526
Reviews.Content: You will love it, great location, really nice people and the hotel was beautiful Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: kwcm
Reviews.Content: This is a top hotel. Everything is as you would expect in a 5 star hotel. The location is not bad with about a 7-8 min walk to Sol (the centre of the shopping area). It's about a 5 min walk to Plaza Santa Ana, and about a 5 min walk to Prado Museum and the adjacent Parque Buen Retiro. Would have been great if a metro station was right next to it but that's probably nitpicking (I only gripe about this because I'm still not using roller wheel luggage). The rooms and bed are comfortable. Bathrooms as you would expect in a hotel of this quality. Gym is respectable, but sadly, no pool. The up til late nature of Madrid's nightlife meant that I never got the chance to get up early enough to try the breakfast. Hotels really should start to extend breakfast times since most people on holidays like to sleep. Overall, this is an excellent hotel and is exactly as I expected from a 5 star hotel. At the price of about €170, it's a bargain compared to what you would get for the money in Paris, Rome or London (probably only a respectable 3 star). It's not got the feel of a boutique or trendy hotel, but it's the Westin and it's a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renery
Reviews.Content: I have traveled quite a bit, and stayed in many 5-star hotels. The Westin Palace has the top spot in my hotel experiences to date. We upgraded to a suite and were treated to a vast corner suite with 5 balconies overlooking the Neptune Fountain. The location near the Prado is fantastic. The staff were exquisitely polite and helpful. I will stay at this hotel the next time I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “OK but there are much better options”
Reviews.Author: LondonGlobalTravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in different in hotels in Madrid over the last years and have been a little disappointed with the Westin Palace. The location is great, so is the service and the glass dome in the restaurant but for me this is FAR from a 5* hotel. There is no pool, no outside space, the breakfast is just OK. All there is are the hotel rooms, restaurants and a little gym with a narrow, tiled roof terrace for sunbathing. You can get so much more for your money these days. Room service prices are beyond ridiculous: 2 eggs €20 + €4.95 delivery charge, 1 soft drink €8 + €4.95 delivery charge etc.... Thankfully i was on a corporate rate but even for that i would go somewhere else next time. Take your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: Sangria2009
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Westin Palace in mid-late June 2009. It was a great experience. The hotel staff all speak English, and are extremely helpful. The hotel itself is truly lovely, but not stuffy or pretentious. The bed had to be the best I've ever had at a hotel - wow - so comfortable! The breakfast was included in the price of the room, and it was a huge buffet with everything a person could possibly want. I had to use the internet in their Business Center, and was pleased to find that the first 30 mins was free. The hotel also has a fabulous exercise room. If there were any negatives, it would be the hair dryer. It didn't have a nozzle and was small & cheap. (But it did work.) In the big scheme of things that was NOTHING. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and public areas but dingy room”
Reviews.Author: nbm5b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Palacio for 3 nights in June. We ate in the restaurant for dinner and breakfast every day (breakfast was included). Food was very good. The main, public areas within the hotel were nice. However, the small room was dingy although the bathroom was nice, albeit a bit smaller than I am used to for a "5-star" hotel--and w.out a separate shower. I believe the 5-star "status" is debatable b/c of the room. The bed wasn't as "heavenly" as those in which I've stayed in the US or Caribbean. The concierge service (all of them) was very, very helpful, and the front desk very nice and accommodating to our request to check out at 2PM. Unfortunately, there was no free wireless (not even in the lobby) but the business center did offer free internet and computer for half an hour (enough time to breeze thru my email, but not enough time to do anything significant). Overall, I found the staff to be very, very helpful and nice, the main areas of the hotel nice, but the room itself was dingy. The location was excellent though for going to El Prado, the Thyssen, and the Reina Sofia (take the bus down to Atocha if you don't want to walk in the heat as I did w/ my 2 young children). I gave this an average rating b/c the room is just not up to par to be a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cjg1
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in room 255 after having traveled throughout Spain. This was the best hotel of the trip. The room was large with a substantial sitting area. The bathroom has a large tub and seperate shower with two shower heads. On the top floor their is a large gym with top notch equipment and a helpful staff. We had drinks in the American bar while while expensive came with all the nuts and other samples one could have desired. Did not eat in the dinning room which is attractive. Location is excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a first class place to stay in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Lovely...and the service!”
Reviews.Author: jjbenitez
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Westin Palace. TO be honest, we only stayed there because we got a great deal on HotWire (normally it would be out of our price range). We were really happy with everything. The room was nice and roomy (2 adults, 1 child and an infant). The staff was extremely helpful, 5 star!!! We were traveling with 2 young children in strollers and the main entrance has stairs (no ramp) to reach the elevator...the staff was always popping out from behind their desk to help lift the strollers up the stairs. The concierge was very knowledgeable and really listened and responded appropriately to our needs. When we checked in, they gave us a kid pack with outlet covers, a rubber duckie, a night light and a couple other comforts for our kids...nice extra touch. The location was great for us. Close to parks and the museums (though Madrid is so well layed out and compact that as long as you have a room somewhere in the center you'll be fine). I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Westin Palace Madrid. Everything I expected.”
Reviews.Author: GuercinoBrussels
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2-night stay at the Westin Palace Madrid. This was my first trip to Madrid, and I booked my room over the Starwood website for a pre-paid visit (which included breakfast and a double-basin marble bathroom). This is exactly what I received. I took the metro from Madrid-Barajas airport in the early afternoon (EUR 2.00 one-way) to get to the Westin Palace Madrid. After 2 connections, you'll arrive at Banco de Espana metro and can walk down Paseo del Prado (on foot, 5-7 minutes depending) to reach the hotel. Very busy street. The airport-downtown connection is a smooth one. If you are in Madrid mainly for the museums, then the Westin Palace is definitely the hotel for you. And it's a leisurely stroll down Paseo del Prado to the Reina Sofia and/or Atocha train station. Upon arrival, there were 2 people ahead of me in line. After standing in line for about 5 minutes and wondering what he was doing looking at his computer anyway when there were people waiting to check in, I was suddenly cheerfully greeted by Alberto at the front desk who apologized several times I had to wait a few minutes before he could help me as he was finishing up checking in a large group of guests for a wedding celebration and that the group of wedding guests was inordinately a large one. I could understand. It was, after all, a Friday afternoon. I was given a premium room on a higher floor, and while my room did not have a view outside, I did not find the view of the inner courtyard and the domed ceiling of the restaurant displeasing. I had, after all, paid a less expensive rate for reserving early and didn't need to look out the window anyway. And the room largely made up for anything. Large comfortable "heavenly" bed; meticulously clean bathroom; no peeling off of wallpaper in my room or in the bathroom, separate WC with bidet; water pressure was excellent; shower head and separate hand-held shower head. The room was very quiet, and I appreciated the turndown service each night when I got back to my room. Chrome and steel were polished throughout. The only thing I habitually notice in Europe is if you are a single traveller, hotels tend to hand out one (1) towel only. I never said anything, but into my second day, the maids started leaving me two (2) extra towels, so that was good. Plush hotel carpeting throughout the establishment. I never saw something dirty on the floor in the public areas. Beautiful lobby and hallways. Old world European charm. Splurge and have an aperitif in the bar/restaurant area under the dome. Check out the small hotel museum. My rate included breakfast (7am-11am each morning). (remember: Spaniards don't breakfast like the Americans or British do). Excellent service; choice of both hot and cold foods was varied. Bacon, Spanish sausages, small pancakes, eggs, all sorts of fruit, cakes, donuts, breads, cereals, granolas, yogurts of differing varieties, fresh salmon (overseen by a sous-chef), coffee/tea and fresh orange juice brought to your seat and attentive service. Pilar was a very helpful, smiling server, and she gave me some good sightseeing tips for which I am grateful (and told her so), warning me to stay away from Puerta del Sol in a taxicab because so many streets were blocked off for road renovations in the square itself. The gym is located on the 7th floor. Very quiet when I was there on a Saturday afternoon. Unisex (small) sauna; impeccably clean men's locker room and shower areas with an abundance of clean towels, washclothes, floor towels, hairdryers. Nice upbeat club music. I appreciate more old-world hotels rather than more modern places. It's not my taste to be in a hotel where the doorman wears a black t-shirt with a white "W" on it. I never have found the service to be any better in those types of hotels. Prime location to the Prado (literally across the street) and the Thyssen-Bornemisza museum (literally across the other street as well). There is a Starbucks on the side of the hotel facing the Plaza de la Cortes which gets crowded. Also a ZIPS store (a kind of Spanish soda fountain with counter service and you can purchase sundries, magazines etc. there as well). The hotel building is over 100 years old, and while I have read many postings of this hotel on this website where people complain so much and agree the elevators were a bit slow, that still didn't bother me (you use your roomkey to operate the elevator). Who really cares? As long as it worked (which it did). On my floor as well as on the floors above and beneath me, in the common area leading down the center staircase, two large platters held red and green apples (and those apples were huge). Not too inconveniently located from Puerta del Sol or Plaza Mayor. The hotel website says the hotel is 3 miles to the Royal Palace. I found it to be about 1.5 miles at the most -- I could walk it in 25 minutes at a leisurely pace; Puerta del Sol in 10 minutes past a myriad of buzzing bars and tapas places or taverns serving fresh Spanish jamon and wine; full of people. Concierge service: very pleasant and helpful. A younger concierge, Bart, was extremely helpful. The concierge has a good hotel map of the surrounding area; I purchased stamps there as well. I found the hotel to meet all my expectations. I did not partake of the minibar because I knew minibar prices are very high (to be expected, especially in Europe and even more so in a large, old-world hotel as the Westin Palace Madrid) anyway (and I had no intention of using the minibar even before my trip). Individual Siemens thermostats in the rooms. The thermostat was obviously quite new and worked very well and quickly (about 4 different comfort settings); no loud noises when the A/C was going. Double-glazed windows and heavy curtains. A/C cooled quickly and thoroughly. I have a little test for a hotel. I take the hotel stationery out of the desk and leave an envelope and several sheets of hotel stationery on the desk in plain view to see if the maid will notice to refill. While the maid failed my test by not replenishing the stationery, for the rest, I was very pleased with maid service. I even received a call late in the morning asking me if I needed anything since I had placed the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door the night before. Therefore, the staff does know when not to bother you, but just contacts you right in time in case you may need something (towards 12pm if your Do Not Disturb sign is still on the door). I requested toothpaste the night before, and it was brought up immediately to my room. If you don't pick up your phone, the maids will place a card on the floor in front of your room notifying you they noticed the Do Not Disturb sign and were just checking on you. Much appreciated. In sum, prime location, extremely clean, restful room, "higher end" prices surely, but I was not disappointed with anything. I am always pleased to stay in a Starwood property. For my first trip to Madrid (to visit the museums), I am happy to have stayed at the Westin Palace Madrid and would certainly stay here again just because I liked the hotel immensely. After having walked around the city center and seen other hotel establishments boasting 4 or 5-stars, I was not impressed (barring the Ritz across the Plaza de la Cortes) with what I could see those hotels may have offered for what I was getting. Knowing I had a nice room waiting for me after sightseeing was key to enjoying all that Madrid has to offer. You can walk to Plaza Santa Ana in about 10 minutes, Puerta del Sol in 10 minutes, Palacio Real in about 20 minutes; side streets do not have that many things at night, so you'll have to go elsewhere to eat, but I never once felt unsafe outside at any time of day or night. I recommend the Westin Palace Madrid and shall stay here again. And the personnel with whom I had come into contact were all friendly, efficient and approachable. Thank you Westin Palace Madrid. I enjoyed staying with you and shall be back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Property in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: Except for the fact that this hotel is not that close to a metro station, this hotel is ideally located for tourists visiting Madrid. It is a short walk from the Thyssen and Prado Museums as well as Retiro Park and the tapas joints in and around the Plaza de Santa Ana. In addition, old Madrid, including Chueca, La Latina etc. are no more than 15-20 minutes by foot. This is a large hotel, so service is impersonal and there is a lot going on in the lobby etc. That said, the hotel has managed to keep itself pretty well maintained. We had a room on the 6th floor, which is an SPG Guest floor and has recently been renovated. The rooms and hallways were in very good condition. The bed in our room, though outfitted with the standard comfortable Westin sheeting, had a mattress that sagged heavily in the middle and was actually fairly uncomfortable (the mattress should have been replaced long ago). In addition, a hotel of this calibre should have flat screen TVs, not the 25 inch CRT televisions it has today. This makes the room feel a bit dated, even though it was recently redone. The bathroom offered two sinks and ample vanity space. There was tub/shower combination with a shower curtain--I personally dislike shower curtains and strongly prefer glass enclosures. Again, this is an upgrade the hotel should have made when renovating the rooms. The rooftop gym is spacious and very well equipped, particularly for a European hotel. We did not make use of any of the hotel's dining facilities. The business center was well equipped and the first 30 minutes of internet is free, as is printing. I thought this was nice touch that many folks probably don't know about. We stayed on cash and points, so it was a particularly good value. I think that this hotel offers a bit of old-world glamour, an ideal location and comfortable, spacious rooms. At the right price, it is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suite with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Chuckus1
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG Platinum member on an award stay for just one night. I was upgraded to a deluxe suite. The room was huge. There was a large entry way and the double doors into a huge living area with several windows on a large circular wall overlooking the Plaza de las Cortest. The living room had a half bath, couch/chairs, desk and table with seating for 4 people. The bedroom was in a different room also with double doors and was incredible big too with 3 large windows. The bathroom had double sinks and seperate shower and bath plus a closed off toilet. The service at the front desk and bellstaff was just fine. Professional but not overly warm. The wired internet was expensive (EUR 18) and was a bit slow. I had room service dinner (burger and soup) which was over EUR 40 with service charges. Again I didn't expect cheap but I thought that was a bit steep. I also thought the breakfast buffet was a bit steep at EUR 30 plus taxes but the setting in the rotunda is lovely even if the food is just average. Unless you really love the rotunda or want eggs/smoked salmon from a buffet, you are probably betting off going to VIPS or Starbucks right outside the door. The location just can't be beat. Some of the best museums in the world are right outside your doorstep and the airport can be reached in 20 minutes or so too via taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Juv18
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed in the Westin Palace in March for the Real Madrid v Liverpool Champions League game and wow what a hotel!!! The location was perfect and Plaza de Mayor (the place to be to experience the football atmosphere) was walking distance. There were some lovely little bars in the back streets of the hotel that served tapas and were open til late. The hotel is very very stylish, not cheap but worth every penny. If you get on the tour bus the hotel is mentioned as it's full of history. Our room was spacious with a luxurious bathroom, we were in room 666 which was very funny as every time we went down to breakfast and we told staff our room number, they just laughed. Breakfast was superb, something for everyone, huge selection and very tasty. Talking of staff they were all excellent, in fact they even arranged our football tickets, not cheap but hey how many times will Liverpool play Madrid??? I would definitely stay here again when in Madrid.......thank you to all at the Westin Palace!

Reviews.Title: “great location - elevated price”
Reviews.Author: monsoondesert
Reviews.Content: the good: beautiful building. great location. impressive lobby. helpful staff. clean rooms. comfortable bed. place has a nice vibe. the bad: expensive (if not paying with points or business account) -- can find comprable hotels for much less cost. elevators are slow, primitive and need to be replaced. rooms facing courtyard have terrible view of hotel rooftop or equipment.

Reviews.Title: “marvellous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scientist86
Reviews.Content: People have told me that the hotels in Spain have different standards. It's not like in the States but thishotel in Madrid was awhole new level. I have never been treated so well in a hotel. It was almost like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Two separate visits to soak up the atmosphere of the La Rotonda at the Westin Palace Madrid! Splendid! More to come!”
Reviews.Author: Flyer007Dublin
Reviews.Content: During our stay at the Eurostars Tower Madrid ( rated 5 stars, located in the stunning new SyV Tower - the second highest building in Spain - see our review in our profile - at the time Feb. 2009 we stayed there we have written the first-ever english language review of the Eurostars Madrid Tower here at Tripadvisor! ) at the north-end of the Paseo de la Castellana in the new Cuatro Torres Business Area for 3 nights in February 2009 we used the opportunity to visit for our first time the Westin Palace Madrid to eat a late afternoon lunch in romantic and truly classical stunning surroundings in the heart of Madrid' s Museums triangle. The Westin Palace Madrid ( rated 5 stars Luxe / Lujo ) is a classical Palace in every sense beside the Ritz Hotel which is located opposite the Westin. The Entrance is a corner entrance crowned with a chandellier and doorman in classical attire and once in we had been greeted by a massive romantic mural on each side above the reception and the concierge desk plus in the middle are flower displays and an empire-style chandellier which looks like a hanging palm. To find the way to the famous La Rotonda just storm with bravado straight ahead the fine ways here along a Loewe Signature Store and finest carpeting - the same Salvador Dali has done with a very nice pet alligator on a liege! So we thought we had the right people in history to mingle with! Once there at the La Rotonda you will see at first sight the most beautiful glass painted cuppola you can imagine in fairytale surroundings with lots of superb seating and service people running around serving the guests! Quiet a sight to behold, Folks! After having found a nice hot spot to seat we ordered with the very nice waiter named Antonio the following items for our sweet lunch afternoon incl. warm applepie with cream, Pancakes with cream and strawberry plus chocolate sauce, Jamaican Coffee, Peach Juice, Vichy Catalan Water - sparkling and natural 500 ml - which all came in after 45 min. of leisure at 52 Euro and 19 cents incl. VAT and SERVICE CHARGE! All in all we had 1h and 15 min. at this masterpiece of a hotel! This hotel can only be highly recommended from us and we would also stay in future here when the time is right! By the way rooms starting from 271 Euros a night! Afterwards we had experienced the nearby Ritz Hotel Madrid ( rated 5 stars Gran Luxe / Gran Lujo - a member of the Leading Hotels of the World - owned 50% by Orient Express Hotels, Trains and Cruises ) which we thought at first would be even better, but our own experience told us somewhat else. We visited the Ritz Hall/Lounge/Bar which is the heart of the hotel and we enjoyed one Cafe Ritz signature coffee and one non-alcoholic fruit cocktail at cost of 36. 00 Euros incl. VAT and SERVICE CHARGE. Judging from our own views at the Ritz the public spaces, the value and the service - warmer at the Westin - the Westin Palace Madrid is the more superior choice. By the way the best price at the Ritz for a room was 295 Euro for one night Classic room. Had we the choice we would recommend the Eurostars Madrid Tower for the sheer modernity of it all and the Westin Palace Madrid for the sheer class of it all. The Ritz in our view is busy, not as romantic and does not particulary stand out between the other two. But in the end it is a personal choice! Our second visit to the La Rotonda at the Westin Palace Madrid occured more recently on the 31st of May 2009, our third time in Madrid, our fifth time in Spain, during our stay at the Hesperia Madrid ( rated 5 stars, One of the Leading Hotels of the World, Santceloni Relais and Chateaux Restaurant, Virtuoso - best Hotel and Resort Experience in the World Award Winner ), which can only be highly recommended from us , flawless Hesperia. We had been upgraded to a 3- room Business Suite at the Hesperia at a total cost incl. Breakfast and Welcome gifts for two nights at 240 Euros incl. VAT and SERVICE CHARGE. Total Design and Luxury in every sense. See our own reviews of the Hesperia Madrid at our profile on Tripadvisor! We stayed at the Hesperia Madrid from the 30st of May 2009 to the 1st of June 2009. On our second visit to the Westin Palace Madrid we had chosen once again the La Rotonda in the heart of the hotel and were pleasantly surprised by classical LIVE Opera Singers ( one soprano and one tenor ) and piano player - this on a hot 33C+ Madrid afternoon - superb! This time around beside the music we had incl. again the favoured Peach juice, Vichy Catalan 500ml bottle, 1 cappuccino and biscuits plus the always loved pancakes with cream and strawberry sauce to go with the fine music and a perfect setting in Madrid served by Javier this time around! The bill this time around came in at 33 Euros and 77 cents incl. VAT and SERVICE CHARGE. Once again superb Madrid, superb hotels, superb flights with BMI from Dublin and Iberia from London to Madrid. Please do not forget to read our other hotel reviews here at Tripadvisor just look at our Contribution Profile incl. stays at the Eurostars Madrid Tower, Intercontinental Madrid, Hesperia Madrid, Hilton Madrid Airport and our very fist view ( visit only ) of the famous Villa Magna Madrid Hotel which has recently re-opened to great acclaim and is now also a member of the Leading Hotels of the World. Many older hands remember the Villa Magna as the Villa Magna, a Park Hyatt Hotel, but it is now totally different in look and style and management. Please read on and travel and do not forget to FLY!STAY!EXPLORE! MORE! and visit and stay in different properties and learn something!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel in great location for Madrid museums”
Reviews.Author: cw691431
Reviews.Content: It is a bit hard to find at first, but is about a block away from the nearest metro stop at Banco de Espana. It is only steps away from the Thyssen Museum and Naval museum, which are both worth the time. The Prado and Parque Retiro are across the street, and the Reina Sofia and Caixaforum are a 10 minute walk. Puerta del Sol is also about 10 minutes away. The VIPS cafe is very close and a convenient lunch option. The hotel itself feels very upscale and has helpful concierge staff. The rooms are nice and have been modernized. Would ask for a non-smoking room if that is an issue. The central location means occasional street noise, as there are tapas bars close by.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Madrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MzLadybug
Reviews.Content: We loved Madrid, but the experience was really made wonderful by the Westin Palace Hotel!!!!! Madrid is a beautiful city. Just be careful as purse stealing is RAMPANT keep your purse on you AT ALL TIMES!!! Well worth the trip!!! The museums are gr8!! The metro system is SO CLEAN!!! Loved the sangria and was able to take a few day trips by Renfe train system....VERY NICE...would definitely reccommend to a friend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: bevchris
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Westin Palace. It was a very pleasureable stay. Our room overlooked the dome so was very quiet at night, we slept very well. Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring Madrid and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Westin Palace”
Reviews.Author: susanu
Reviews.Content: We spent four lovely nights at the Westin Palace in mid-May, and I don't think we could have chosen a better hotel. We were given a room on the sixth floor, where all the rooms were labelled "Starwood Preferred Guest". If you haven't joined SPG already, it is worthwhile to do so to ensure a room on this (the highest) floor. The room looked exactly like all the pictures of rooms in previous reviews. The room faced the interior dome, so no views - but no noise either. A great tradeoff in our opinion. I suppose the furniture is a bit dated...but a nice change from the ultramodern design in many hotels in Spain. It was a Heavenly Bed and we loved the two-headed Heavenly Shower too. There is morning coffee in the foyer on the sixth floor, and a great workout room adjoining a sunny rooftop terrace with nice views of the city. We had a great rate through hotels.com which included breakfast. It's an excellent buffet served under that fabulous dome...a terrific way to start the day. On Sunday, there was an Opera Brunch in the dining room. At 65 euros, we passed on the brunch, but did have a drink and listened for awhile...a fun change of pace. It is a fabulous location; just a short walk to all the art museums, the Botanical Garden and Retiro park, and the Atocha train station. For dining and nightlife, the Plaza Santa Ana is a short stroll in the evening. And the Hop On/Off bus stops at the corner, which is a convenient way to tour the city and get to sights on the other side of old Madrid, like the Palacio Real. And what a safe location! The Spanish president was addressing the Congress while we were there - right across the street from the hotel. There were a half dozen police on every corner for blocks. There was a metal detector set up in the lobby, though curiously guests didn't have to go through it. It's one of the only times I used an ATM on the street (and never felt uneasy with a couple dozen police with 25 meters). My only complaint was the boring and clubby-stuffy bar, and the rude attendants in the bar area. One woman in particular - Christine - was extraordinarily rude to us on 3 different occasions. Fortunately, we found the Plaza Santa Ana about that time and never went near the bar again. Hopefully the Westin will do something to correct this problem, as the rest of the staff was very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: asialoverR
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the westin in madrid for 5 nights, location is just perfect and close to everything, but here are few things that I didn't expect, and I'm comparing westin here with other westin in asia, the room location aws looking at the dome of the resturant so no view, receptionists not really friendly, rooms furniture are a bit old, the room had no bathrobe u have to ask for it, the slippers are not there u have to ask, shower gelwas not in the room u have to ask for it, one piece of soap and 1 bottle of shampoo, water not provided complimentry but u have also to ask for it daily, I asked for apersonal scale, i gota broken one, shame on Westin in Europe really,other than u have to ask for every thing in the room, I enjoyed the stay ,the food and the city, no way to compare this hotel to the high level of service you always get in asia, and I had similar experience in Paris westin as well , so I figured out that that is the European standard

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: KauaiLover
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the combination of the hotel's location and the actual hotel product. You can literally walk to everything....the three museums, the Plaza Mayor, retaurants and all the other sites. This is a huge convenience! Plus, if you want to take a day trip outside the city, the train station is a short walk away. The guest rooms were very spacious, up to date and immaculate. The Westin Heavenly Bed was a real treat. We got a great deal on Expedia that included breakfast, which is served every morning in their gorgeous Rotunda. What a fabulous way to start the day! One of the best hotel breakfasts we have ever experienced! I highly recommend this hotel for your trip to Madrid.....it's outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice with terrific service”
Reviews.Author: Joshdent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here over Memorial Day weekend. The room was lovely- it was fairly roomy (not too familiar with standard "European" hotels vs. American ones with a fabulous bathroom and a tub we could both fit in. The climate control system worked great. The location is perfect, especially if the art museums are your main focus as the Thyssen is across the street, the Prado is down one block, and the Reina Sofia is a 15 min. walk. The Metro is a 10 min walk (wish it was just a bit closer, but really isn't bad) and the city center is a 20 min walk or 2 stops on the Metro. The concierge staff was fabulous and really went out of their way. It is a terrific hotel- only downside is the steep price, but having got the room at a reduced rate on Priceline, it was more than worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel if you stay on the top floors.”
Reviews.Author: era2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Palace for 5 nights in May 2009. The hotel's location is unbeatable and the lobby and main restaurant are beautiful. The service is top notch, particularly the concierge staff. However, I do want to recommend that guests request staying in a room on the higher floors. We were initially given a room on the 2nd floor. We did go to the room and it was very dated and had some cleanliness issues (as some people have posted here). My biggest issue was that it was across from the beauty salon on the 2nd floor and the smells from the salon's chemicals kept coming into the room. We were given a new room immediately upon requesting it. The room was on the 6th floor and was beautiful, It was clean, very spacious, remodeled and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: rsm06
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently with a few friends and had an amazing experience. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was simply fabulous. The rooms were perfectly sized with a generously sized bathroom. Calls for extra towels were answered immediately and we didn't have to wait the usual 30 plus minutes for service. They were at our door within minutes of placing our call. HIGHLY recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Go Travel Europe
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel built in 1906. We were thrilled with our stay here and have many positive comments about our lovely, very well furnished room and the hotel itself. Room: The beds were covered with wonderful, high quality linens and were super comfortable. The modern bathroom was so pretty with an etched glass door separating the toilet area, double sinks, all marble floor, bath/shower, counter, etc. Three built in lighted closets hold drawers, safe, iron and ironing board. The furniture was mahogany antique reprodutions.Yes, there were a few little imperfections as in dents in the woodwork, or a scratch on the paint (this is a 100 yr old hotel) but nothing that took away from the pretty room. It was also very quiet. Hotel: The style of the hotel was very traditional so if you're looking for modern/contemporary this is not the place for you. The lobby was bright, colorful, pretty and smelled wonderful especially in the evenings when they put scented candles all around.There is a small room off the lobby with displays of memorabilia from the hotels' past.....old registers, keys, photos, famous guests, etc. Breakfast is served in a gorgeous room with a stained glass domed ceiling with a huge crystal chandelier. There are many, many food choices from pastries, meats, cheeses, eggs made to order, etc. The cost for the buffet is high but it was included in the great rate we got on Expedia. Breakfast is served from 7-11 AM. The hotel also has an Opera Lunch on Sundays including live Opera and costumes if you are into that. There is a computer room (four computers... at least one was always available when we went in there) with printers available free to each guest for 30 minutes per day and then for a fee beyond that time limit. Location: Great location across from the Prado. Also across from the Congress building so lots and lots of security around the hotel. Everything is within a 15-20 minute walk including the Royal Palace. There is a Starbucks just to the right as you come out of the hotel and a VIPS. This is a bookstore/convenience store/diner serving hot meals, salads, and sandwiches; it also has some grocery items, toiletries, etc. Outside Activity: If you're looking for somthing different, you can take a 3 hour Segway tour through www.madsegs.com. Very professional guide and so much fun!! The conceirge didn't tell us about it since we asked about a bike tour but this was a great way to see parts of the city we might have missed. Only negative is that the service (front desk, conceirge, waiters) could be a little more friendly. Also, we never had turn down service. No big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a location that can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: garygoogle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. You're not far from so many great museums, restaurants, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, train station...you can just about walk anywhere. The rooms were nice -- we were upgraded but the room didn't have our bed choice - got two twins instead of a king or queen. The lobby and restaurant are beautiful - truly grand. The one major complaint is that the concierge staff is not too reliable. We asked for reservations at two restaurants and one flamenco show. Never heard back on any of them and found out one dinner reservation was made at the wrong time on a different night! Gave up on their assistance. A hotel of that quality should have much better concierge service. We were also there on the May 1 holiday weekend and were told by the concierge that everything would be closed for two days....restaurants, shops, museums...which we found out not to be completely true. Also, internet in the room didn't work well at all and very expensive relative to what you pay in the US.

Reviews.Title: “some difficulties, but great follow up”
Reviews.Author: ExpatFamily_9
Reviews.Content: Easter weekend travel with kids and another family. Found out once we were there that the hotel wasn't able to offer babysitting services. Room configuration wasn't ideal. But the follow up I've received from the general manager -- weeks after my visit -- to let me know what they can and can't do and how they'll address concerns in the future tells me that it's a well run hotel and one I'd consider returning to on our next trip to Madrid. It all starts at the top, and its the best customer service, after the fact, I've received.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: HelloThereAgain
Reviews.Content: We think the best feature of this hotel is the prime location. In our opinion, there is nothing quite like stepping outside the lobby door of a centrally located hotel like The Westin Palace in an exciting city like Madrid and having everything within reach: museums, restaurants, transportation, parks, shopping, bars..... This is a big hotel, too, with lots of people and groups and meetings going on, so there is a bit of a 'buzz' in the lobby. The rooms are nice, large and quiet; bathrooms are done up in marble and are fairly spacious; linens and towels are soft; the combo shower/bath is large and full of hot, pressurized water. There are some deferred maintenance issues here and there, dust in some nooks, chipped spots in the paint and the wood molding, and not all of the furnishings are up to snuff, but not enough to be a bother for us.. Housecleaning and turn-down service is good, if not a bit erratic. We found as the week progressed that some toiletries were replaced, some were not, some we never knew about until they magically appeared. We had to laugh, too, when one day the a.m. maid who cleaned the room also did the nightly turn-down service at the same time. We loved the breakfast buffet and the stunning rotunda lobby. Otherwise, drinks and food in the rotunda lobby and the bar are very, very expensive. Service is good overall. Staff are uniformly helpful (though personally we did not find the concierges' recommendations in some regards to be helpful or accurate). The hotel provides currency exchange, but charges a whopping 5% commission. No one at the hotel is able to recommend a competitive currency exchange place and we never managed to find one on our own. There is a gym upstairs on the sixth floor which is decent with locker facilities for men and women and a shared dry sauna; a scenic terrace adjoins the gym and provides a wonderful view over the rooftops of the city. The room rack rate here can be steep, so it pays to look for promotions and shop around. Overall we were delighted with The Westin Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a perfect location with professional and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: annBahrain
Reviews.Content: I recently accompanied my husband on a business trip to Madrid and had the pleasure of staying in this beautiful hotel. I found all the staff we encountered friendly, professional and helpful. The hotel had a quiet ambience and a feeling of quality without being ostentatious. Our room was clean with a comfortable bed and good sized bathroom. Good sized bath tub with enough water pressure to quickly fill the tub or have an energizing shower. The breakfast choice was extensive with healthy options also readily available (no need to put in a special request for low fat yoghurt or soya milk) alongside eggs, bacon and champagne. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many places of interest without feeling as if you are in the middle of a tourist spot. I would certainly be more than happy to stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to friends. I have travelled quite a bit and stayed in a range of hotels from 2 star to 5 star in Europe, Africa, Asia and the Middle East. I would rate this as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “The best and only place to stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: bdjwc
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Centrally located to museums, Plaza del Sol and Plaza Mayor. The service is professional and friendly and the rooms are beautifully decorated. The breakfast is the best I've ever had and the breakfast room is a work of art.

Reviews.Title: “Most overrated Westin of all time”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: Just as the last person said, this hotel needs to "wake up and smell the coffee". Very overrated. 1) Gave me the wrong type of room. They had upgraded me to a room with the wrong number of beds, and the downgraded me several levels after not having anything available after that. 2) Very unattentive, uncaring front desk staff. 3) The most rude concierge staff at any hotel I've ever stayed at and I have traveled extensively. They were so incredible rude that when I asked them about tickets to a theatre, they said you can go over them and get them yourself, instead of helping me get them. They did not want to be bothered with helping with directions or to suggest a restaurant. I stopped going to them after I was basically slapped in the face 3 times. 4) Bathroom is very nice, room is oh kay. TV very old style. 5) It annoys me when travelers complain about high prices of hotel food, but this hotel is the most outrageously and laughably priced in terms of food and drink. I want to say that a cup of coffee in the domed lounge area was upwards of 10 bucks. This hotel, with nicer staff deserve a higher rating. I thought I was coming to a crown jewel, and there were lots of pretty parts, but this is not a 5 star hotel in any way. It has a lot of history, but same with many 3 star hotels. It is aging and the many of the staff are actually bordering on mean.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars...maybe in 1932”
Reviews.Author: orbas
Reviews.Content: The people posting positive reviews of this dump must be marketing shills or rubes who have never stayed in a hotel before. This place is an absolute sty. Don't believe me? Check out the photos. Pros: the lobby is beautiful. The location is convenient. Cons: The "deluxe" room was last renovated before Franco was in power. Peeling wallpaper, stained bathtub, chipped furniture, circa-1985 tube TV, disgusting frayed carpet...this place has it all. The "heavenly bed" had a nice pillow-top cover; unfortunately, it also had a creaky mattress that was so saggy and worn, we could have filled a pond in the middle. Service was bleh too. The man at reception was extraordinarily unfriendly. The maids failed to provide turndown service while we were out for dinner. The concierge, however, helpfully booked us a table at a nice non-touristy Italian restaurant (that we had located), so all was not bad. Another quibble, the "high speed" internet is 15 Euro/day - which is on its face a joke. The fact that its speed was comparable to a 14.4 dial-up modem made it entirely unacceptable. For the money one pays for this place (300+ Euro/night for us), you should get a first class hotel. This place barely qualified as a 3-star hotel based on the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: FirstTravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: Great three night stay at the Westin Palace. The location is excellent, a short walk from all the restaurants and bars in the old town in one direction, a few minutes walk to the museums and the park in the other direction. The lobby is grand and elegant and service good and efficient. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was nice but could possible do with a bit of a modernisation in places. The bathrooms, although very good, are slightly dated looking and I was surprised to find that there was no flat screen TV in the room, considering the rack rates of this property. This is a grand palacial style hotel, if you are looking for something trendy and minimalist, try the Hotel Urban just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for families with young children.”
Reviews.Author: SwissTraveller63
Reviews.Content: Website advertised help with finding babysitters, but not only was no help forthcoming, management wouldn't even let hotel staff babysit during their time off.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have made a better choice”
Reviews.Author: sejlriceRingoesNJ
Reviews.Content: Used a combination of my Westin SPG points and cash to stay 4 nights with my 16 year old daughter. Service staff was exceptional from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. Had I not used points, I would have found a cheaper place, however. The breakfast buffet is really expensive, but it's tough to find an American-style buffet in Madrid. So, you may want to check out breakfast options elsewhere before you plop down 35 euros for what should cost 3! It's walkable to everything, taxis are always in queue, and the housekeeping staff were warm and pleasant. Good workout room with a sauna, too.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChloeAthens
Reviews.Content: This world class luxury hotel, is situated right in the heart of Madrid. The rooms are elegant and clean, the beds very comfortable. Excellent breakfast. It doesn't get any better than this in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ArthurLondon
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here one night with my family. Great hotel. It has location, character, service and good gym. Big old hotel that is actually in very good shape. Free breakfast was best one I had throughout my week in Spain. Connecting rooms were perfect for family and concierge gave us a bunch of good recommendations. Ricardo did a great job. Central location next to Prado and close to old Madrid is perfect plus there is a Starbucks next door.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Palace…A Gem That Keeps Getting Better and Better!”
Reviews.Author: jakester20
Reviews.Content: I took a family trip over Easter week recently and the first part of our trip was at the Palace hotel. The hotel has a terrific reputation and from what we experienced this was deservingly so. It was fabulous and the staff and each and every employee could not do too much to make the stay terrific. I’ll touch on several high points as I put my review together. However, if you prefer the Cliff Notes version stop reading here. It’s impossible to go wrong staying at The Palace while in Madrid. Luxury Every element of The Palace is luxury, but not in an “in your face way”. What makes The Palace so terrific is that it says luxury in the most understated way possible, and keeps on saying and saying from the moment check in takes place until check out and departure. It’s 100% professional, first class, and fabulous. Location Can’t see how a location could be any better. The best attractions in Madrid are just a walk away such as Prado Museum and others, Old Town, Park Del Retrio and others. A car for the average tourist would be a tremendous hassle, so forget about it. We love walking and exploring and The Palace is terrific for that as it’s just as close to old town as to many other attractions. Could not be better. Our Room We arrived somewhat early around 930am or so after an all night flight from Chicago. They had a room, but it was not what we reserved. They did a terrific job finding us a perfect room when checkout occurred at 100pm or so. We were put into the Executive Suite on the 6th floor. This was a one bedroom suite with a tremendous view of the Prado Museum and the Ritz Carlton. It was perfect. Dining Room & Hotel Bar Our room package came with a daily breakfast buffet. Was a terrific additional feature. Like everything at The Palace, this was terrific. All sorts of options and service was impeccable. We also had dinner in the dining room one night and perhaps we should have dined there two nights. It was terrific meal and as mentioned before with tremendous service. We went to the hotel bar once or twice. It should have been more. Was a terrific place with great options and terrific appetizers during cocktail hour each and every afternoon? Terrific. Staff It’s impossible to say too much about the staff. They were both knowledgeable and courteous every minute they were on duty. There was nothing either too big or to small that the staff would not do. Enough said. Amenities Did not use much of hotel amenities. Used wireless internet daily and worked terrific. Loved fitness center. Did not use business center. Used concierge almost daily and they could not have been more helpful. Summary The Palace is a five star hotel and it does everything terrific. It won’t be a mistake to enjoy it and I’m certain that you’ll feel the same way as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: I love the Westin hotels (particularly the "heavenly beds") this one was definately up to par. Elegant, classic, good food, comfortable rooms. Its an ideal location for exploring the city and the shopping is to die for!!! I used the hair salon and although she didnt speak much English she did and ace job! I would return definately.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BearsFanChicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Westin Palace for 3 nights. As it was our honeymoon, the hotel upgraded us to a very nice room which was both spacious and comfortable. As other reviews have mentioned, the hotel is older, so there is definitely a bit of a worn feel to it -- some peeling wallpaper, etc. However, the people and the amenities at the Westin Palace make it a luxury hotel. One of the best things about the hotel is its location. It is perfectly situated within walking distance of a number of attractions and great neighborhoods. Additionally, the free breakfast is fantastic, the hotel bar is comfortable and serves great drinks, and the concierge provides great recommendations for sightseeing. On the negative side, it's hard to believe that quality hotels like this still charge for internet, but the Westin has a package that includes internet and on demand movies -- I recommend this. Room service was also little more than average. Overall, however, this is a great hotel that is ideally situated for vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: billymax
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in Madrid. Very glad we selected this fine hotel as we could and did walk everywhere. The location is simply fantastic. We booked a premium deluxe room with breakfast through Expedia which was amazing value. As SPG members we were also given a special SPG room with complimentary bottles of water. Very efficient and courteous service on both arrival and departure Breakfast was seriously good in the Rotunda and the service superb. The bar and bar service was particularly very good and as expected quite expensive. All the staff were very friendly and helpful - late check out easily arranged Fantastic common parts. Interesting little museum. A smart landmark hotel. Minor criticisms:- a) The queen bed was very comfortable but we would have preferrred a king. b) All the toiletries were kept in short supply throughout our stay ( very unusual for a hotel of this calibre). Cost cutting? BUT I must say within minutes of a call to Housekeeping everything we asked for was delivered with a smile . It was just irritating that we had to keep asking for something pretty basic items like shower gel, shampoo or slippers. c) TV was rather old fashioned and the BBC signal extremely poor d) No evening turndown or hotel chocolate or weather forecast. Didn't get a chance to check out the restaurants or the fitness room. All in all we had a fantastic long weekend in Madrid and this hotel greatly contributed to our feeling of wellbeing. For a busy city centre hotel it certainly exudes a 5 star presence in its common parts but perhaps just 4star in the bedroom department . Maybe that's why it was substantially cheaper than the Ritz and some other 5 star hotels that we looked at.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Ado37
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Westin Palace back in Januar 2009 for a long weekend. We could not fault it. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel in the city was excellent, close to all the museums and the shops. Everything was within easy walking distance. The interior of the hotel is amazing, the dome is something else. The breakfast were to die for. We even had afternoon tea in the dining room under the dome and it was very posh but quite expensive, however its worth doing it for the experience. We're planning another trip to Madrid in September and we'll be hoping to stay at The Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as it should be............”
Reviews.Author: berkshire_nomads
Reviews.Content: This review will be of limited use as I only stayed one night, made minimal use of the facilities and didn't even pay myself. However that said I was impressed with the Palace. So called five star luxury hotels in European city centre locations are hugely variable, but this place hits the spot. It's grand, impressive and luxurious, clean and well maintained but with just enough patina of age to feel authentic without being at all shabby. Location is great, near the Prado in the centre of town. My room was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated but not huge. I think it was one of the smaller ones so others may be larger. I didn't have dinner there, but breakfast was really good. I also have no idea how much it cost as the room was prepaid. There are rates on the net from €250 per night, which would be great value. All in, I'll definitely be booking here on my next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl905
Reviews.Content: Loved every minute of our recent stay at the Westin Palace in Madrid. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are lovely, and the staff was very helpful and could not have been nicer. We had many experiences while in Madrid with cabdrivers, restaurant staff, etc where they were rude to Americans, but not at the Westin. The hotel is also perfectly located for walking to almost all of the major sites in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for an effortless stay in classy Madrid”
Reviews.Author: umgeni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights using almost all our starwood points but did not regret our decision. The location is superb right near all the major art museums and grand boulevards that make Madrid special. The hotel itself is very grand if soulless although the rooms are the usual high Westin standard which we have experienced elsewhere around the world. Perhaps because of the size the hotel feels very impersonal with service quite clinical and stiff, and at times lacking. Madrid is a great city for sightseeing and shopping- make a bee line for Chueca for edgy fashion and food.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty is only skin-deep at the Westin Palace”
Reviews.Author: FollowThatBug
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-day stay at the Westin Palace, which - along with the people in Madrid's service industry I encountered - successfully ruined my family's first trip to Spain. For this review I'll share only my experience at this hotel, a grand property that does not deserve the *****L rating. Knowing we wouldn't arrive in Madrid until shortly after midnight, I called the hotel in advance to warn them about our late arrival and inquired about transportation from the airport. I was told it'd be easy to get a taxi easily even for a group of four with lots of luggage, and the hotel was "looking forward" to our visit. The first taxi driver in the cue at the airport quoted 50 euros to the hotel, doubling the meter rate even though all of our luggage could fit comfortably in the trunk. The other drivers claimed they couldn't take us because it wasn't their turn, so I called Westin Palace for help. Apparently the 5-star service didn't exist between midnight-6am at the Westin Palace. The concierge wasn't staffed, and neither the front desk nor the bell boy (they only had one during these hours) was capable of arranging a car in such an "emergency". I realized later incompetence wasn't the real problem of the hotel staff here, it was laziness and indifference. For many, if they could do nothing for the guests, they would. We managed to find an honest taxi driver but got to the hotel with 5 euros short for the fare. After waiting 5 minutes for a long-face staffer to unlock the front door, the longer-face old man at the front desk told me there was no chance the hotel could make up the difference in fare and charge it to my room. His exact words: "We don't do that here, lady." For anyone who's traveled around the world, stayed at the best of places, but happens to look younger than her age with very young-looking parents in tow, you would understand my frustration. Taking care of transportation costs is one of the given requirements of any true 5-star hotel. The Ritz, Four Seasons, even the Hilton does it, so why not the Westin Palace? Well, I'm not old money. I didn't come in with a fur coat and LV bag. Meanwhile my poor parents, whom I'd brought to Spain to celebrate their anniversary, were trying to keep the driver patient with broken Spanish. The bell boy (a pretty ancient one who spoke great English) just stood there without offering to help. Finally I squeezed the directions to the hotel ATM out of the front desk man and paid off the driver (who was very courteous and SMILED, unless everyone at the Palace). It was 2am. Check-in was very brief with no briefing of any kind on the services included in our room rate such as breakfast and access to the gym. When asked for a map of the city, the front desk man just pointed behind me and said: "I don't have it. Ask the concierge." Then he curved his lips for the the first time....from the stiff movement it was easy to tell he didn't do it much. Our rooms on the 6th floor SPG members floor were exactly what you'd expect from Westin, spacious with a very comfortable bed. Except our room had no toiletries, no soap, no shampoo, no slippers, etc. A call to housekeeping took care of this problem. We went to bed at 3am. Breakfast was a typical buffet affair under the stunning dome. The wait staff was either very attentive and efficient or completely spaced out and wouldn't refill your coffee or replace cutlery without prompting. The only consistency was the lack of smiles, oh, and very salty fried eggs. The hotel's location was superb: neighboring the Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums, a 15-min walk to Reina Sofia museum and Atocha train station, and 20-30 mins to Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace. The neighborhood was well-kept, felt safe at night and had some excellent bakeries and restaurants within walking distance. Opposite the Palace stood the Ritz, but the Palace had a better view of the Neptune Fountain in the Plaza Canovas. The daily complimentary water in room and the free apples/coffee/tea service in the morning on the SPG floor were pleasant surprises, though I wished the coffee/tea were provided throughout the day as at other Westin's Club Floor. The gym was on the top floor, clean and sufficient, had a tiny sauna but no pool. (I thought a hotel cannot receive a 5-star rating without a pool, or is that only the standard in France and Italy?) The hotel served my family's purpose well as a convenient base for exploring Madrid, and the Heavenly beds ensured us good sleep every night. We were entitled to one coffee or tea per person per day in room for the tray charge of 4.50 euros. A nice bonus. The housekeeping team was pretty stingy with the bathroom toiletries and would only replace them when the last drop was gone. However they were always quick to restock when requested. Once I started to ignore the hotel staff I was able to enjoy my stay in Madrid and see the hotel for what it could be. It was unfortunate that the staff continued to fail in almost every aspect. I knew I would not stay here again when I saw my father carrying one of our luggage to the front door when we checked out. Apparently the front desk thought 7 pieces of luggage only warranted an elderly bell boy with a 3-wheel trolley which he couldn't even balance. I was never so happy to end a vacation and leave this so-called luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DavidDC
Reviews.Content: This immaculate and well located hotel is a typical European "Grand Hotel." The fit and finish are impeccable, and the service is quite good. It is located steps from major museums, shopping and transportation. This Hotel is geared primarily for business travelers and those establishment types looking to see and be seen. The rooms are standard western size, and the amenities plush.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing...but oh so expensive”
Reviews.Author: Jesuisunfamilyman
Reviews.Content: All you could ask from a business hotel. Large room, large bathroom, quality service etc but you really do have to pay for it. A burger and Coke came to 41 GBP and the Kit Kat from the mini bar was 7GBP. I know the pound has plummeted but that's expensive even with the company's money! All else made for a relaxing trip....

Reviews.Title: “Lavish Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marie Jonathan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Palace Hotel in Madrid from December 5th to December 8th. We booked the room through Hotwire for 125.00 Euros per night. Upon checking in, we were informed that we were not entitled to a room with either a king size bed or two twin beds. We therefore had to pay an additional 50.00 Euros per night in order to get a room that had two beds. Our total price paid was 175.00 Euros per night and we were booked into an Executive Room. Our large room looked out over the traffic circle and fountain at Plaza Canovas del Castillo. It was very clean and in very good condition. The beds were extremely comfortable and had very nice sheets and down comforters. The bath room had a very nice shower with three shower heads to choose from, but there was no bath tub. During our entire vacation, this was the only hotel room that was nicer than our bedroom at home. That was important to us. The public spaces within the hotel are gorgeous. (However, please note that at the time we stayed there they we having a photo exhibit that feature photos taken within the hotel. While all of the photos well done and very tasteful, they all featured either partial or full frontal female nudity. That may or may not be an issue for you if you have kids in tow.) We arrived by car during the busy Friday afternoon commute. The doorman was very understanding and accommodating at our arrival. He allowed us to parking our car in the main drive way for over 10 minutes while we checked in. The hotel is in a perfect location. We did not have to take a taxi the entire time we were in Madrid because this hotel is within walking distance of everything that one would want to visit.
