Our only complaints were the following: The price of the food in the hotel restaurant as well as room service was the highest we have ever seen in our entire life. $25 for an ala carte hot dog is just simply outrageous. $43 for a continental breakfast is not justified. (Just around the corner and within the same building is the VIP Café that serves an entire meal for two with a bottle of wine for less than $50.) The staff of the hotel concierge needs to have some training in customer service. I am not sure of the reason, but they were curt in every interaction that we had with them.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but absolutely top class”
Reviews.Author: robw48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in a regular room double occupancy. Absolutely top class hotel with extremely high standards of housekeeping and attention. Staff are helpful and totally efficient without at any time being condescending or distant. The central lobby - the Rotunda - is a great place to watch the world go by - a big space but oddly , you feel as if you have a personal area to yourself. Room service is both swift and accurate. Rooms themselves are well furnished and comfortable with a lot more space than in most hotels Very convenient for the main galleries and the city centre The hotel is not cheap but here you definitely get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dal-n-lana
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Excellent!!! Perfectly situated in the middle of the city. We explored everything on foot. Prado is a 5 minute walk, Palacio Real was about 30 minutes on foot, and Parque del Retiro is 10 minutes on foot. HOTEL: Luxurious atmosphere, though parts of the hotel could use and upgrade. Very large hotel. ROOM: Got upgraded to a newly renovated room. Enough space and the room was clean. Upon checkin, there were no king sized beds available in newly renovated rooms, so they said they would put 2 twins side-by-side. (Typical in some European hotels and usually not a problem if a king sized matress pad is place on top). This room did not have the king sized matress pad. A little less comfortable, but not a big issue. CITY: Great architecture and kept very clean. Don't miss the typical sites. Spend time just walking around like the locals. October was a great time to visit. Not too hot, not too cold. FOOD/DINING: Hotel is very expensive. Find authentic Spanish food in the many restaurants throughout the city. Most restaurants are very good and prices are less then half than the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: gig11
Reviews.Content: Just spend 5 days at the Palace in Madrid. During the day there was hammering from construction, which was a nuisance. Insulation of the walls is bad, one can hear the next room neighbours talk (or the TV sound). I got a "Premium Room" through the Starwood Member Program, but since this room was located at the 6th floor with rather small windows (seemingly all rooms on that floor have these window sizes), I asked to be "downgraded" to a "Deluxe Room". I then received a room with a beautiful bay window and plenty of daylight on the 1st floor. This room was not renovated (the other was), but I preferred it and the difference to the renovated room was also marginal. Long corridors. Ask for a room close to the elevator. Not enough light for reading in bed, lamps on nightstands are not bright enough. Two lamps in the closet were broken and I asked for a repair, but that never happened although it was promised "right away". When I arrived, I saw, that there were two lightbulbs broken in the chandelier in the main lobby. These were still broken, when I left. Water pressure in the shower is not constant, it gets stronger and weaker in intervals. Breakfast was ok. The offerings overall were, what can be expected from a better hotel. Good service. Cheerful and most helpful concierges. Location is good, if you want to go to the Prado, Reina Sofia or Thyssen museums. The good days from the Palace are over. Now it juggles unsuccessfully conventioneers with aspirations for fabulousness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service during our stay”
Reviews.Author: orleyfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here fom October 29th to November 3rd in a lovely very spacious junior suite on the renovated 6th floor. The concierge staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, especially Aurelia, Ricardo, and Eline. We were Starwood guests on points. We highly recommend staying at the Palace and would love to return, especially if we didn't have to pay over 800 euros to do so. We ate breakfast out nearby, including VIPs around the corner, next to Starbucks. I preferred places in Santa Anna square or on way up the hill there. Also went there for Tapas. Prado is practically across the street. There is a wonderful carillon next door which plays frequently, looks old, but apparently, not.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: GoLo
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Walking distance to everywhere. The staff was very helpful. Ask for a renovated room. I’ve stayed on the 4th floor in a renovated room and everything was just prefect. The Gym is nice and open 24 hours. You can definitely impress locals by staying you are staying at the Palace Hotel..

Reviews.Title: “beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: ingerasti
Reviews.Content: The main attraction points are the location and the very nice building, entrance hall,bar,and so on.It is focusing on business clients, without any personal touch. Rooms are standard,ok but no immagination. You could be in whatever city ot the world. Rates are expensive but normal for the quality you get. Very good breakfast and friendly staff. WI-FI is not for free, which is totally not acceptable for the price that you pay for the room. In all the other hotels we stayed in Spain, internet access was for free! Also no car park; close to the hotel is a public car park, but you pay 27 euro a day.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Palace, Madrid - Delightful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tantetravels
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Westin Palace Hotel for 4 nights. It was a thoroughly delightful stay. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is friendly and helpful, our room was lovely and very comfortable and the extensive breakfast buffet (included) couldn't have been better! On top of all of this, the location is amazing. The Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum is across the street and the Prado is also very close. We walked on the charming streets to the Puerta del Sol, the Plaza Mayor and the Palacio Real. Be sure to take advantage of the Concierge Desk. The staff gave us excellent advice and recommendations; helping us make reservations for restaurants, shows and tours. Taxis are always waiting outside the door if you need one. Avoid the temptation to take advantage of the beverages and snacks in the small room refrigerator. Prices are ridiculous. There is a VIPS convenience store around the corner if you need something. Everyone we interacted with was able to speak English to us although they were patient and gracious as we tried out our Spanish! This is a hotel that is interested in making you feel welcome. Delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Palace, service even better!!!!”
Reviews.Author: punit
Reviews.Content: It was a chance decision to go to Madrid for a vacation and more over to stay at the Palace Hotel, as it is popularly known as locally --- but what an amazing experience we had for 5 days and nights there!!! Everything was absolutely top class and we were upgraded to an Executive Suite overlooking the Prado museum fountain roundabout. As I had got a great deal on the price, it was even more enjoyable!!! The breakfast was really something to look forward to every morning --- the staff was so efficient that sometimes they even removed the plates while you left your table to pick up a toast!!!! we were using at least 6 plates per person on an average and at times felt that it was a bit of a waste as it means so much more cleaning and washing of crockery and cutlery ---- but luxury is not to be compromised!!! The rooms were very nice --- a great fusion of modern facilities and old world charm --- one odd tile of the marble did click under the foot though but barring that everything was simply top drawer, specially the night service where they even kept a card about the next day's weather forecast and temperatures!!! Well done and keep it up!! Ole Ole Bravo!!

Reviews.Title: “Especially if you are an art fan, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: final_destination
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel...primarily because of its location. If you are an art fan, as am I, I wouldn't recommend staying anywhere else. You can get to any of the golden art triangle hotels in 5 minutes by walking. Plaza Mayor & Puerta del Sol was about a 10 minute walk and the Palacio Real was maybe another 10 minutes. I didn't use transportation at all while in Madrid, as the hotel was so well located that I was very easily able to walk wherever I needed to go, particularly the tourist attractions. We had reached there very early in the morning and the staff was incredibly helpful in ensuring that we were able to get a room. Of course, being a Starwood Preferred, I am sure that helped expedite the process. The concierge was really good in providing us any information we needed, making restaurant reservations and getting us travel service when we needed it. The only downside was that the beds were a little too soft and room service is a total ripoff (even though it was pretty good!)...but the room was a really nice size and the place was very clean. I would stay here again and I really recommend it... As an added bonus for those caffeine fiends, there is a Starbucks right around the corner. :)

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Palace”
Reviews.Author: He's Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Grand hotel with large, well-appointed room and impeccable service. Location can't be beat, just across street from the Thyssen Museum and very close to the Prado and Reina Sofia. On the opposite side of the hotel from the museums are the narrow streets of old Madrid filled with reasonably priced tapas bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klward25
Reviews.Content: While in the taxi cab from the airport, the driver told us that this was the best hotel in Madrid, and he was not exaggerating. Rooms are large, exceptionally clean, and beautifully decorated. The hotel is rated at five stars, and it is on par with luxury hotels around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: admg1963
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here at the beginning of August. Found the hotel to be excellenty situated, and very good value (got a great rate through an independent website). Despite that, our SPG card earned us an upgrade. Rooms were well furnished, and the bathroom featured double sinks. Our rate included breakfast which we found to be very good - plenty of choice and of good quality. Beware the hotel bar is very expensive, but that wasn't unexpected and there are plenty of other options nearby (we were to tired and hot to go any further one afternoon). Definitely recommended as a base for a short break visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, disappointing rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: Very big hotel, conveniently located in the heart of Madrid, very close to the Royal palace. Lobby looks good, restaurant/breakfast area, corridors and all open areas look great. However the rooms are slightly old fashioned for this hotel category, with used and dirty furniture (suspicious stains on the chairs... dirty windows...). Two nights after arriving, I've been upgraded to an Executive room (SPG Gold), and to be very honest I couldn't see any single difference with my previous room that was two categories below, except a better view, which is a bit disappointing (particularly if you paid for this room type!) The service is the bad part: -systematically 10/15 minutes wait at the reception and concierge, only 1 person usually at the reception and 1 concierge only for a huge hotel! (there is a SPG Gold/Plat desk but nobody behind it) - Limited services (no proper chauffeur service from/to airport, limited and overpriced night room service menu) - Staff not very friendly - Overpriced minibar and internet (mineral water 9€, 1h internet 13€!!) So basically a good looking hotel, but low value ratio for service/room.

Reviews.Title: “Westin went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: tradiggah
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just got back from a 3 night stay in the Westin Palace in Madrid. Unfortunately the last 2 days I came down with an intestinal infection. The concierge brought an English-speaking doctor to our room (after we had checked out already) and even got us a taxi while we went to the pharmacy. Their service was wonderful and I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “A little dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: scrsteve27
Reviews.Content: The hotel really is overrated and overpriced. The room was ‘fine,’ nothing more, nothing less, I had a ‘premium’ room and certainly the prices were certainly ‘premium’ at $400.00 a night. Furniture, although dated was kept clean and dusted, the fixtures and fittings are certainly dated. The carpets were stained, and in the communal hallways the wallpaper was coming away from the wall. There are no welcoming flowers, fruit or anything in the room to welcome you as a new guest, there is no night turndown service, so be warned, if you have a shower or bath in the morning, do not expect any clean towels for you in the morning. There was no bath gels in the room, just cheap shampoo and conditioner and a bar of wrapped soap which was not replaced throughout our 5 day stay. The prices of everything were very inflated, do not even think of taking anything from the minibar! For example a Kit Kat was almost $12.00, a small bottle of water the same price. There is no wifi in the room, only in the hotel lobby and at a cost of $28.00 for the day. The television only had CNN and Euronews for English speaking channels, you have to pay $12 to listen to a CD which will be played through the speaker system of the rather antiquated television. We were there when there happened to be some ‘VIP’s’ staying, which meant that the public seating areas were sealed off and only to be used for the security staff.. The breakfast buffet was nothing out of the ordinairy, lots of cellophane wrapped individual portions of cheese and butter and yoghurts, if you are lucky you may find some greasy bacon, but you need to be early to get it. The bathrobes were grey and well worn, the bath amenities were of inferior standard. The ceiling in the toilet had an old cobweb with its dead owner still in it. The staff were friendly and helpful, but unfortunately the surroundings that they had to work in certainly had seen better days. Some days you get a newspaper left outside your room, some days you do not.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: travelsny
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop during our recent Spain tour and we were underwhelmed with our room. The lobby, rotunda restaurant/tea area, and public areas were very nice but the room we had was, quite honestly, inadequate for the price. Old would be the best way to describe everything we found-furniture (broken chair!), bathroom (water damaged trim and doors), stained carpets/rugs, and even an old television (not even flat screen tube). It needed a serious renovation. Another couple we knew actually ended up with a room that turned out to be severely water damaged and mildewed. They had to be moved to a different floor--unacceptable at this level. Why even let your customer into a disaster like that?? We know that other rooms in the hotel were recently renovated and much better so we had to ask ourselves why did the management even let customers stay in old, dirty, inadequate rooms. They should have just closed these rooms for a total renovation rather than taking our money. Find somewhere else to stay for now or make sure you get one of the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room Beautiful, Dinner mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Nikko4Me
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace, Madrid – The Westin Palace was built at the direction of King Alfonso XIII in 1912. The location is great, near the Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, and Neptuno & Cibeles fountains. The rooms had been recently renovated. Our room (311) faced the inner courtyard, so traffic noise was not an issue. The one downside was that the internet in the business center was not free. The Starwood hotels in Barcelona and Seville at least had access to free internet. The breakfast buffet was excellent, offering made to order omelets along with all the typical breakfast foods. Dinner was disappointing, as some in our tour agreed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but bad service”
Reviews.Author: SeverusAlexander
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the hotel. It is a beautiful hotel and close to everything especially the Prada but the service at the hotel was terrible. Going to either the front desk or the concierge was a challenge each time. No one wanted to help you with anything and they spent more time trying to figure out how not to help you than helping you. Thankfully we were with a group so we didn't need their help too much.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: myhotels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend at the Westin Palace with a great offer via our travel agency. Surprinsingly, even though we looked around in numerous interntet travel pages, we found the cheapest rate on the very last moment, the day before. It went down from 370 to 200 euros per night for the same room breakfast included! Lovely location near museums, the retiro park, and the historic part of the city. We asked for a room upgrade upon arrival as it was our wedding annivesary, and they did give us a room with a backstreet view, being the rate for a room giving out to the hotel patios. The room is a good standard for a luxury hotel, and room service was prompt and effective. Our only surprise is that they have changed toiletteries policy and they only provide "the basics": shampoo, gel and conditioner, which we thought was not a nice gesture for a hotel of this category. Buffet breakfast was nicely served at the hotel´s most emblematic part of the hotel, the great glass central dome. Drinks at the bar are also a nice experience. Excellent for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, elegant surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Suitdude32
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located opposite the Prado Museum, and less than 5 minutes' walk from the Parque del Buen Retiro (Madrid's Botanic Gardens). Lobby not as dramatic and impressive as I would have expected for such a grand exterior, but I simply loved La Rotonda, where light meals/refreshments can be partaken under an enormous and spectacular stained glass dome. Breakfast spread typical 5 star hotel spread. I paid extra for an exterior facing room, with a view of the surrounding streets, but you have to cough up even more $$$ for a view of the fountain and roundabout in front of the hotel. My room was very comfortable and elegantly furnished, although the old-fashioned TV (i.e. no plasma or LCD) was surprising for a hotel of this standard and considering the prices charged. If you're lazy or unfit, request for a room near one of the 2 banks of elevators, as the corridors are LONG! Service overall was ok, not overly friendly. I appreciated the gym on the top floor, which offers great views of downtown Madrid, and for a hotel, it was decently equipped, although the dumbells were rather limited. I had booked and prepaid my accommodation via a third party website, yet the hotel still billed my credit card, and, 3 weeks after my stay, is still dragging its feet in refunding me, in spite of my providing all evidence showing that I had prepaid it. The 2 staff with whom I dealt (prior to checking out) about this issue seemed disinterested, and were very insistent that the hotel had "done nothing wrong", and that it was obviously the customer's mistake. No effort made to check with the website through which I had booked, they simply stared at their darn computers and told me that I was wrong. Hey, how about some customer service and goodwill here? Aside from the debacle above, I highly recommend this hotel, for its location and elegance, but service a bit iffy,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: detraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace three times during our visit to Spain and found the rooms to be quite different depending on the location. We were on the SPG level twice and were happy with the rooms. The first room on the SPG level was on a courtyard and very quiet with comfortable beds. The next room was upgraded to a city view on the 4th floor with a step out balcony with a view of the fountain. It was not as quiet and the bed was very soft and uncomfortable. We did not realize until late a night and were given a bed board (who knew these still existed?) and it was ok after that. The closet and the fixtures were also not as nice as our first room. The last room was what they considered to but an upgraded “city view” room on the 6th floor. If I paid up for windows that were above chest level I would have been disappointed but it was a fine room with the better beds and fixtures. The front desk staff was very nice but quite slow at times and we were happy that twice we got express check out forms so we did not have to wait (perhaps only for spg since we did not get it on the other floor). The breakfast was fine but when it was not included in our rate it was not remotely worth 28 euros for each person when you are paying in USD. I know it is because our currency issues but still it seemed high for what you were offered. We visited the VIPS around the corner a few times for snacks and drinks. It was very convenient. We loved the location for proximity to the museums, Retiro, Plaza Mayor, and Atocha but did not think the concierge was very good. We got bad information from them on 2 occasions regarding opening times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesL.
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip from Spain and had a great time. We started at Madrid and the Westin Palace. Right away you realize you are in the heart of the city and as an art fan, you are right where you want to be to enjoy the city's amazing museums. The Palace has a beautiful lobby and the service is excellent right from the front door. The rooms are larger than expected, especially the bathroom. While the style isn't what we usually go for, preferring a modern feel, The Palace has a warm inviting feel. I'm not sure if there are more updated rooms as ours was a little worn in spots, not bad condition, just dated. My biggest recommendation would be to try and get either a front view or a high floor in the back. We were on the second floor facing the back and the commercial vehicles (garbage trucks, some kind of truck with endless kegs) was very loud in the morning. It kind of became our wake-up call each morning :) We had the comp. breakfast each day and it was very good. All in all a pleasant stay. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again but would probably look for a more modern hotel if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dblack2
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a weekend in feburary, 2008. Every facet of the experience was excellent (and also expensive). The service was courteous & professional, the rooms were large by european standards and very well appointed. The grounds of the hotel were elegant yet unpretentious. Next time i go, i will splurge on the extravagant champagne opera brunch (70 euro/person) in the dining room, which is featured on the cover of Time Out Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: MelbaLalala
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using Starwood "Cash and Points". I only paid $90 per night using this system. When I write reviews about hotels in which I do this, I try to write them based on the average rate of the room because that is what I assume people will pay when they go there. I will assume most people pay $300-400 for this hotel per night. At that rate, it is definitely NOT worth it. The rooms are ok, but nothing special. The hallways are the same way. Our bed was a little saggy and we were given a smoking room even though we asked for non-smoking. The rooms are pretty big for Europe and the bathroom is FANTASTIC. Very quiet, too, but we faced a courtyard. You can't beat the location. Perfect for tapas hopping through all of the alleys of Madrid, and perfect if you are going to hop on a train as the Atocha train station is a 10 minute walk away. My biggest complaint with this hotel had to do with the front desk staff. They were a little incompetent and cumulatively cost me 30 minutes of my short time in Madrid. If you can get a good price on this hotel, definitely stay there. For $300/400? Id look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good but pricey hotel”
Reviews.Author: AAMiles
Reviews.Content: Lovely, classic hotel very near the Prado, shopping, and the Sofia Reina. The rooms are standard but very clean and nice. The restaurant is under a beautiful rotunda. Food is surprisingly very good. Service is good, although speaking Spanish helps. Everything is very nice, if just one step below superb. AC works sporadically, shutting off at night when you might really need it. I loved the location, across the street from the Prado. The hotel seems to be in the heart of the city, and is steps away from great nightlife and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: pmetka
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 nights stay in a premium room , Rooms are ok but not amazing and I would say decoration is quite old for my taste We only tried the BB and it was really good with all you require for a full american breakfast Fitness room was good and open 24h which is usefull location is perfect 2 mn walking distance of the santa ana plaza where you can find very good local tapas and bars ! however If I had to go back in madrid I would go in another hotel ie URBAN hotel , same location , but far more modern style and with a roof swimming pool ! very apealing when it starts to be hot !

Reviews.Title: “Glad we got a good deal”
Reviews.Author: LizzieG
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal for the Westin Palace through expedia, and having heard that this was one of the "grande dame" 5* hotels in Madrid we decided to go for it for our mini-honeymoon weekend break. On first glance the hotel appears to be exactly what it claims: a 5* elegant, grand hotel in an excellent location. However, our impression was that this grandeur is becoming increasingly faded, especially in the public areas and corridors: faded, worn out carpets and peeling wallpaper. Aside from the bedroom (very clean, wonderful shower and very comfy bed) and service (great generally but see below) this is more of a 4* establishment. We came directly from a stay at The Dorchester Hotel in London, and the Westin Palace was notably inferior. My husband had emailed the concierge ahead, unbeknown to me, asking for flowers and champagne in our room on arrival. Nothing was there when we checked in. He spoke to the concierge simply to make it clear that he didn't want to be charged and the concierge apologised profusely. Later that afternoon champagne and flowers duly appeared (along with a cake that declared "Happy Anniversary"...it was our honeymoon!) for which we were not charged. We felt that although this was a little glitch they more than made up for it. Oh, and we asked for a recommendation for somewhere to see flamenco and were directed to "Cafe de Chinitas". It was geared completely towards tourists and a total rip off (200 euros and we weren't drinking!) and not really the genuine, gritty flamenco that we were looking for. They also recommended "Thai Gardens", which was a wonderful Thai restaurant - the best I have ever eaten!

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GottaLottaMiles
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Westin Palace Hotel on a family vacation. Our experience was completely positive and we would gladly stay at this hotel again. The rooms are small but well-furnished and modern, with comfortable beds. At night, the rooms were dark and quiet - good sound and light-proofing. The hotel is well-situated for seeing central Madrid, with most of the major sights a short walk away, and plenty of restaurants in the area. The hotel breakfast buffet has a large selection of hot & cold food, and is a good deal for folks who like a big breakfast on vacation. The front desk staff was polite, helpful and friendly. Our most positive experience here was on the first evening of our stay - we stopped in the lobby for a drink before bedtime and left a digital camera at our table. The next morning we asked at the desk and we got the camera back. Nice to avoid losing our camera on the first day of the trip! Not much to be disappointed in at this hotel. The TV channel selection (if you don't speak Spanish!) is sparse, but that's true everywhere we went in Spain. The shops inside the hotel aren't very useful but there is plenty of shopping just a few blocks away. Overall a very good luxury hotel choice for a Madrid vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Old Times Atmosphere Modern Facilities”
Reviews.Author: anzio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel four nights over the Easter holidays. We have two kids, 13 and 18 and were given interconnecting rooms without problems. We booked trhough a web agency and got an excellent price for 2 double rooms incusive of breakfast. The hotel is luxurious, the staff very helpful and the location superb, right in the centre of Madrid, close to all museums and shopping life. The rooms were big and the bathrooms too, which is quite rare nowadays. Very clean and with all in room facilities. Breakfast was excellent, both if taken in the room (always arrived on time and hot) or in the restaurant. I woud certain reccomend the Westin for a visit to Madrid and hope to go back soon. A TripAdvisor member from Rome, Italy

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubby21
Reviews.Content: DH and I just stayed at the Westin Palace on our 3 day stay in Madrid. We stayed there because we were able to use Starwood points to stay for free. (We generally use Starwood points and stay at 5* hotels in Europe, so we are used to hotels at this level). I checked this site before booking, but knew that unless the reviews were awful we would stay because it was free. The reviews we read criticized the hotel for two main reasons: cost of everything in the hotel, which we anticipated, and criticisms that the staff was not helpful or nice. We found the former to be true but not the latter. Everything at the hotel was, indeed, exorbitantly priced, especially considering the weakness of the dollar v. the euro. But we had planned for that (we brought instant oatmeal and hot pot to have breakfast in our room. We discovered that we didn't even need the hot pot because there was a hot water urn set up near the elevator on our floor with instant coffee, tea, milk etc available in the morning). Service in the hotel, on the other hand, couldn't be better. The staff was gracious and helpful. When I asked at check-in how much to tip the bellman, as I usually do in a new city, the desk clerk told me it was included. The doorman asked us where we were going each time we wanted a cab and then would give the cab driver directions to the location, and he did this even tho we did not tip him. The concierge made reservations for us for dinner at a kosher restaurant that he suggested and then suggested another one. And the next night he asked us how we had liked the one he suggested. (in a city like Madrid, for the concierge to be aware of kosher facilities is quite unusual). Everyone we encountered in the hotel was nice and helpful. The room was clean and beautifully appointed. There was coffee on the floor available in the morning and huge bowls of fruit available all day. The location of the hotel can't be beat. You can fall out of bed and get to the Thyssen museum, the Prado and the Reina Sofia are a short walk away. The business center was open at whatever hour we needed it. The only drawback to the hotel is that there are some steps into the hotel and from the lobby to the elevator (about 8) that can't be avoided. If you have problems with steps this could be a real issue. We loved the hotel and would go back again. If you can afford to pay the rates, or if you have points to use, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay with a Captain on Board”
Reviews.Author: Torero
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Westin Palace in three weeks and because we noted an improvement in various aspects we thought it was appropriate to write new comments about this property. If you have ever wondered if TripAdvisor comments are of any use then believe it. At the Palace there is a Captain on board, the General Manager. How do I know? Well, after my previous stay I wrote a review in TripAdvisor. I stated some problems we had, but that weren't bad enough to complain to the Hotel Management directly. Turns out the Palace has a service monitoring TripAdvisor comments and it also appears the General Manager makes an effort to correct flaws when he spots them. When we arrived on our most recent stay, we were greeted with apologetic comments regarding our previous stay (A note had been posted on our computer file) and we can honestly say this time all was perfect. Not only that, but we had found a great Easter deal on the hotel website for a deluxe double with breakfast for 245 € /night. Service from all staff members was attentive and impeccable. Yes, at times it seamed they were overburdened. Despite this, they did their best to satisfy every request ASAP. The breakfast buffet in the Rotonda was plentiful with a great choice of foods for all tastes, American, European and local. One criticism here regarding the Orange juice. It tasted as if the skin had been squeezed with the pulp, much too bitter for us. We also visited the Gym on the 6th Floor. It is quite large with wonderful equipment. The Westin Palace is a non smoking hotel in its public areas. There is a lounge reserved for those who wish to indulge in smoking while enjoying a cocktail. There are many meeting rooms available for business events. The property is extremely luxurious and very well kept. The rooms are spotless, spacious and very comfortable. I just wish the internet connection were included. The closest Metro Station is not Atocha or Sol as mentioned in a previous review but Banco de España. As you exit the Hotel, cross the avenue San Jeronimo and take the street right across called Marques de Cuba. The metro is at the end of that street on Calle Alcala, about three minutes away. Based on location, property and service, the Westin Palace is a wonderful treat you can offer yourself. And remember there is a captain on Board so if you run into any difficulties try mentioning it to staff members at reception and concierge, for I am convinced that management policy is to satisfy their guests in every way they can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: PlatHunter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location with nice rooms and lobby. I had numorous problems with the service including check in, service at the bar and during check out was charged for services that was to be included, which the manager later removed. I originally planed to stay two nights but after the poor service left after one night to another nearby hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a Madrid vacation”
Reviews.Author: Simbadog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the center of Madrid for all excursions. (technically the center of Madrid is about four blocks up in Plaza de Sol. The only issue is the closest metro stations are a good hike away at Atocha and Sol. The hotel was clean and quiet. We stayed on the sixth floor the Starwood floor. We had to wait an hour to have a room ready but that was fine because we were still in our room four hours before the 3pm check in. The hotel is not cheap we had a bottle of water and two cups of coffee when we were waiting in the bar/restaraunt area. It cost twenty euros my wife took 3 bottles of water and a soda out of the mini bar $42.00 american dollars charged to the Credit card. There is a Starbucks and a VIP convience store in the hotel building. So if you want soda and coffee go outside the building. There is a Dunkins accross the street from the Atocha train station. (big hike for a cup of coffee.) Besides extra costs which you expect with a five star hotel our stay was wonderful. We had fun being the Loco Americans walking around in 55 degree weather in tshirts and light jackets when most of madrid was wearing heavy coats and scarfs.

Reviews.Title: “reassuring comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jewelleryjohn
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this grand old hotel at the end of feb. We chose the Palace because although we prefer larger hotels with impressive lobby's and good sized public areas, they have to have a presence and not be featureless/uninspiring. This hotel certainly didn't disappoint. When I arrive at an hotel the first impression is very important and sets the tone for the stay. If I look around without feeling the "wow" factor then its unlikely I'll relax and enjoy my stay. Well, the Palace has the factor and then some. It is situated in a busy area, close to several museums, a lovely park, plenty of shops, and importantly only a few minutes from the array of tapas bars in Plaza Santa Ana. The hotel has a buzz, there are people coming and going which is great if you enjoy people watching. As you enter the lobby you look up towards the extremely impressive Rotunda which has a wonderful domed glass ceiling. This is where you can enjoy a drink - it's very relaxing - and also have breakfast and an evening meal. Beyond the Rotunda are several function rooms and a chinese restaurant. I wasn't impressed with the food but my wife thought it was excellent. A case of depends what you choose ? Beside the Rotunda is a decent size bar which looks a little too much like a gentlemans club. All wood panels and green leather chairs. The service from the bar was the only disappointing aspect of our stay. We were overcharged for wine on 2 evenings, waited an age to be served and I almost collapsed when I saw our bill - a coke cost 7 euros (wine was cheaper.) Breakfast is something we always look forward to in european hotels: salami .parma ham,salmon, cheeses etc and although these were offered the breakfast experience just seemed to lack something although the service was attentive and efficient. I had originally booked a premium deluxe room but on checking the day before we left I saw the room was only around 35 sq mtr which is a little small. I called and reserved a junior suite and when we entered the room and saw the expression on my wifes face I was pleased that I had. The room overlooked the street and fountain and had a fantastic bathrooom. If funds allow consider enjoying one of these rooms. The only downside to the room was the noise at the weekend from emergency vehicles. As for the staff, everyone was polite and we were acknowledged and greeted by all. The concierge were very helpful but check-in was a surly affair. Although we don't plan to return to Madrid as we had time to see all we wanted to, if the Palace was transported to another city we would book without hesitation. It felt good to arrive, comforting to return to and sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fading beauty”
Reviews.Author: misdirected_baggage
Reviews.Content: A classic grand European hotel. Although the lobby is lovely, it's a constant whirlwind of activity and the staff appears overtaxed. Unavoidable steps make it difficult to haul baggage without assistance. The lobby bar is harried enough to make service difficult to flag down (we finally left after waiting for 20 minutes, or so for a drink). Concierge recommendations were, well, spotty. The deluxe rooms, however, are well appointed and comfortable. Overall, a fair value for the money, but the Palace could be much more.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, convenient locations for museums”
Reviews.Author: ctfl
Reviews.Content: For our last two days of winter vacation, we decided to spend them in Madrid after spending 7 days down in Marbella. The Westin Madrid Palace Hotel is an elegant building with detailed architecture, very conveniently located near the museums (across the street or just a few blocks away) or a 10 to 15 minute walk to the main plaza areas like Puerta Del Sol, Calle Mayor, etc. This is probably one of the most elegant hotels we've stayed in. The Westin self parking underground garage was difficult to locate as the entrance was on a one way street. We had to drive down some small streets to locate and enter that street. Actually, the bigger pain was the underground parking garage itself. The garage is very small (maybe 50 cars max?) and the spaces even smaller! Even maneuvering (can't call it driving in there because it's that tight-you can't go fast unless you want to take out the bumpers or mirrors!) our mid size rental car through just trying to pass through the columns required driving at a crawl,inching back and forth to avoid scraping the car!. I even got out of the car to help negotiate the hairpin turn in the lot. We found the best spot we could-one where we could drive out of without inching back and forth to avoid hitting the columns or walls. Then we left the car parked there until we checked out. How tight could the parking spaces really be? I saw one of those mechanic floor jacks and my husband said the valets probably needed it to move the cars into the tight spaces or to get them out! Yes, there is valet parking available for slightly more than self parking. To do valet, Westin doesn't have a real driveway. You pull up right onto the sidewalk area in front of the hotel steps and you'll see the valet and doorman. Self parking was about $30 USD a night and valet may have been closer to $50 USD/night. So if you don't want to hassle with self park or don't want to test your driving/parking skills, valets extra cost may be worth it. Also, driving during the evening rush hour in downtown Madrid is challenging with the scooters cutting in and out, pedestrians crossing on red lights and the taxi lanes. The parking was the only real negative about the hotel, but the hotel is an old building so you can't really fault it as it wasn't designed with modern parking in mind. Check in was professional, efficient. We were upgraded to a large corner Junior Suite, as he's an SPG platinum member and they had availability. Very nice, elegant suite with a separate master bedroom with tv in a armoire and a large walk in closet with a safe. A sitting room with sofa, arm chair coffee table, tv and mini bar refrigerator in the armoire, work desk. One full bathroom with separate tub, shower and toilet room with a frosted glass door. Two white Westin robes and slippers to use. Amenities included Molten Brown soaps, shampoos and lotions, toothbrush, mouthwash, razor. Second bathroom with toilet and sink only. The suite had very nice elegant details like crown molding, chandeliers, etc. Nightly turn down service included the chocolates on the beds and some small rug they put down on both sides of the master bed. Maids were friendly. Concierge gave us a map of the local area when we asked. There is no SPG club room at this hotel. The 6th floor is supposed to be the Club Room floors, but the only Club level amenities offered is a self serve espresso machine and apples. I think we were on the 3rd floor and according to the elevator symbols smoking is allowed (and we smelled it) on one of the floors of the hotel. We didn't eat any meals in the hotel but went out and found small local restaurants nearby. There is also a Starbucks right around the corner. The hotel has a workout room on the top floor and we took a quick look at it and the equipment looked in pretty good shape, but no one was using it. No swimming pool here. Just a note that if you do take one of the streets from the Plaza Del Sol area towards Gran Via, be careful if you've got little kids and don't want them to see, as the area is a bit seedy with porn shops and prostitutes leaning against the buildings and trees waiting for business. This was mentioned in the Rick Steves' travel guide book and even for our short two day trip, found the info and maps from this book to be pretty helpful. Also watch out for the pickpockets and scammers. So the Westin Palace is a beautiful hotel, elegant rooms, great location for visiting museums and close to the plazas. Just that everything is really expensive (food, parking, internet, rooms) here, especially with the dollar to Euro value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: plainchoc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Madrid....what a fabulous city. We stayed three nights at the Palace and we had a wonderful time, the room was luxurious, spotless basically everything you would expect for a 5*. However the prices were very excessive , 6 Euros for a tea, 12 Euros for a piece of cake and when I did decide to have tea I couldn't get a waiter to serve us, so we went round the corner to Starbucks for half the price!! The location is excellent, and the breakfast which was included was good too. There are good tapas bars around the back of the hotel so you don't have to walk to the Gran Via everytime you go out.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Toni66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Westin Palace Hotel Madrid. I booked this through Lastminute.com. I would have been disappointed if we had paid the going rate. Location was great, breakfast ok, service in the bar area was good although they ran out of Ron Bacardi on our last night which, for a 5 star hotel is not very good. We had one complaint about our room and the noise that was generated, from what sounded like a water boiler and we were moved straight way. They billed us for use of the mini bar which we never used but immediately withdrew it from our bill when we bought this to their attention. Would probably not stay here again but would definitely return to Madrid, as a beautiful and very vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: NathanC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Palace with a few colleagues as we were hosting a client breakfast at the hotel. For me the plusses were that the hotel has a sense of occasion, is well located and the breakfast tasted great. I managed to get away to the Prado for an hour to see the nineteenth century exhibition which is well worth it. Also, the hotel is a short walk from Plaza Santa Ana which is a good spot for some tapas and a beer. I wouldn;t recommend having a beer in the hotel as a coupel of beers each for my client and I set me back €36! The room was well appointed but I couldn't help thinking it was a bit worn around the edges. The door and the panelling in the bathroom were clearly showing some wear and tear. Also, for a five star palace hotel, I was a little underwhelmed with the service. Given the room rate and that we were paying for room hire for the breakfast, I was surprised that our waiters disappeared for half an hour when we could have done with some more coffee and that checking out at reception seemed to take so long. In short, it is a very impressive looking venue with an excellent location but I think the service and attention to detail isn't quite at the level you might expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Karuthers
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly on business but am equally comfortable being here for a leisure trip. The Palace (as it is still known to taxi drivers) may now be part of the Westin chain but I think it has succesfully integrated Westin's custtomer service skills with its own Iberian personality

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RFJC
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in early December with my wife. It is a beautiful hotel which oozes grandeur of a bygone era. The staff are really helpful and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. For me it has the premier location of any hotel in Madrid - right on La Castellana facing the Prado with the nightlife centre of Plaza Santa Ana only 5 minutes walk away. The only suggestion I can make is make sure to request a recently renovated room at check-in. All in all a fantastic place to stay and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Four fabulous nights in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: rlm346
Reviews.Content: We spent four fabulous nights in the Westin, a Starwood hotel, after arriving in Madrid from the US. It is located on Paseo del Prado in the museum district in front of the Neptune fountain. The Prado and Thiessen museum are within a block & the Reina Sofia a few blocks away. It is walking distance to all the sights we wanted to visit. The plaza mayor is about a 20 minute walk. We reserved a Premium Deluxe Non-smoking Room with a City View. Our room had two oversized double beds that we pushed together into a virtual King. The 5th floor room had two large windows that looked down and opened onto the fountain. The comfort of the bed (called a heavenly bed) even rivaled the view. The bathroom and closet space was also excellent. It was a fabulous room. When we checked in they were going to give us a a queen bed (they don’t have Kings) without a great view but we pressed the attendant for a better room and we are glad we did. The service was excellent and the concierges were always helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that they charged a substantial extra free for Internet access. Most of the hotels we stayed in did the same thing. It is a bit annoying given the price point of the hotels and I’d strongly recommend the management consider changing that policy. We were able to get a relatively good price using a AAA discount but it was still an expensive hotel (300euros). To us it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel except for the bed”
Reviews.Author: Miami78
Reviews.Content: Pros: Service- requested transformer for laptop and wine opener and was brought up quickly by the staff; Location: Close to the metro, we went to and from the airport in the metro for 2 euros each way, no need to take any taxis since hotel is close to a wide range of sites; Great Value: We got the hotel on hotwire for USD 220 with taxes included. Cons: Bed was not five star level; we looked underneath the nice covers and it look like it was 15 yrs old...definitely NOT a Westin Heavenly Bed

Reviews.Title: “Grand palace hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jon Potter
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in a lovely courtyard room on the starwood preferred floor (room #682 on the top floor). The room had a lot of cupboard space and also included a single arm chair and side table and a desk and chair. There was a mini bar (which was a bit warm for our liking) but no coffee and tea making facilities (unfortunately not the norm for europe). The bathroom was roomy with twin basins, an excellent shower (in bath) and a separate toilet. The courtyard facing room meant no view but made our stay very quiet. The hotel's public areas are particularly stunning and very palatial. The buffet breakfast (served in the lounge area under the gorgeous glass dome) was excellent with loads of choice and great service. There was wi-fi internet access available but only in the public areas and for a fee. The business centre had computers with internet access but again only for a fee. Housekeeping / room service was a little erratic and not what we'd expect from a top hotel. There was no compendium in the room and we weren't given the full complement of towels, our newspaper, nor free water (starwood gold entitlements) each day. There were no business facilities provided for the starwood preferred guests although there was a half hearted attempt at providing morning coffee and tea in the starwood floor's lounge area by the lifts. This didn't quite work as the cups were tiny (not usable for tea really, only for espresso sized shots of coffee) and the water was luke-warm at best. The hotel's location is excellent for sightseeing, being close to the museum triangle (a 10 min stroll to the Prado) and close to the tapas bars in last Huertas. Overall we enjoyed our stay despite our minor complaints but we would probably try another hotel when we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, nice rooms, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: scooby19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Palace for 5 nights that included New Year's Eve. The location could not be better in Madrid, a true walking city. Steps from the Prado, a brief walk to rail road station that gets you to any other point you desire and with in a few steps of other nice properties such as the Ritz. The hotel is certainly grand with lots of nice places to lounge. The glass domed restaurant and lobby lounge is beautiful. The service requires strong eye contact! The hotel is largly non- smoking with all but one floor being non-smoking, a definite plus in a country that still is very much a smoking place. Most restaurants allow smoking. Some have a non-smoking section, but really is meaningless when there is no physical barrier. They have a really nice roof top gym with a good assortment of fitness equipment. There is a hair salon and a Loews shop on site as well as an art store -- also there is a Starbucks that is ALWAYS packed! Hilarious! We had a couple of opportunities to eat in the hotel -- breakfast was included in the room and was held in the domed glass lobby lounge buffet style. Very, very good. The biggest surprise was how exceptional the Asian restaurant on site is. .. it is beautiful and the food is sensational as is the service. If you don't smoke.. get there early. The bar lounge is very active, but comfortable with service staff who are whizzing by. We also had New Year's Day brunch at the hotel -- it was really great. There were hundreds of tiny single dish apps that must have taken an army of chefs hours upon hours to create. Just magnificent. A great selection of local foods were also presented. The draw back of this hotel -- the concierge service is awful, unfortunately. They want to send you to the touristy spots only -- I tested this theory a couple of times and sadly, they really did not seem to care one iota about guest needs. They seemed not to have ANY clout in getting tickets or reservations --even when the request was made a month in advance of the visit. They were not knowlegeable about what was open when or take the time to check -- the answer was always "it is possible" -- oh well, yeah thanks!!! The preferred guest floors were full but we did get a very large room with seating area in a quiet section on a non-smoking floor. The only difference with the room we booked was free coffee near the elevator and the type of amenties (Molton Brown was offered on the preferred floors). There is no club level here although they say there is when you book! The reception desk was ok -- the guy who checked us in just seems miserable in general..all other staff including all waitstaff etc. were very helpful. It could be just this time of year, I suppose but this property is a Starwood Luxury collection property ... so five stars should mean something. The bathrooms were very large, robes need to be retired -- the bed is heavenly... as is promised by the Westin. Stay at the Westin for the location and forgive the one or two grumpy staff -- the rooms are clean, large and very comfortable. We might opt for the Ritz next time, but wouldn't cross off the Westin it was overall a pretty pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, Luxury and Fun at the Westin Palace Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: SisterMoon_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in May of 2007 and we just loved it. We were using our Starwood points to stay and I was concerened about noise as it is in the Center of Madrid. When they put us on the first floor, I was really concerned, but when we saw the room - WOW! We were upgraded to a suite (room #123, as I recall) and it was done in blue and gold and white and it was incredible! The HUGE fluffy bed was like heaven and the bathrooms (yes, TWO of them!) were gorgeous. My husband and I had to holler to each other this suite was so huge. They also had a great sound system which I enjoyed the classical music. Too bad we didn't have any of our own CD's. I felt like the Queen of England staying here, with a gorgeous view of the Neptune fountain right out our window, and it really wasn't very noisy at all. We did have a slight problem in that they had a cold snap right before we arrived, so they air conditioning got turned off in our room. However, the staff was great and got the maintencance people to fix that, no problem. With our "American AC" going at full power, we were really in heaven then! HA! The GIANT buffet breakfast is not cheap (I think it's E33 per person) bu twell worth the price and you don't have to eat again until dinner, the food is so plentiful and lovely. The cupola dining room is super elegant and we had drinks in the lovely bar a few times. The bar waiters were fun, playing little games with us and even though we got the trivia questions wrong, they gave us the prizes, anyway! So this is a wonderful facility that is elegant and luxurious, but also fun to stay at and we would stay here again when we return to Marvelous Madrid! Oh, and don't miss Rincon de Esteban Restaurant, a few blocks away - the food is wonderful and the waiters are the best. Also, there is a little Cerveceria just behind the Westin that offers delicious tapas for very little money. I think it's calles the Fat Man or something that. Try these and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: travelwithkids_7
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Palace a couple of years ago on business and loved it, so when my wife and I went for a long weekend getaway to Madrid, it was our 1st choice. Check in was easy and the room was great, although last time I had a room facing the front of the hotel, this time it faced the side and at night (near mid-night) we could hear the sanitation workers removing garbage cans. The staff were helpful and we got a good dinner recommendation from the concierge (Asadir Fronton). Otherwise, we mostly wandered around and found our own restaurants so less reliant on concierge. The hotel lobby and rotunda restaurant live up to expectations. The hotel is in a great location and walking distance to many of Madrid's best sites. We took a day trip to Toledo on the RENFE - but suggest that you book tix for the 30 min train ride in advance - there's a travel agency around the corner from the Palace that can do it, as trains were full. One disappointment is that we planned to visit the Prado, esp the new wing on Sun morning, but learned that the museum (maybe all museums in Madrid) is free admission on Sun, so there was a huge line. Instead, we left the line, walked to Retiro Park where there was an interesting exhibit in the Crystal Palace and then to the Museo Reina Sofia. We would definitely stay at the Palace again, although would pay for a city view .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel while on vacation. The Palace is a nice hotel. My only caution with this hotel is not to talk to the old man at the concierge. Beyond his attitude, he sent us to a horrible tapas bar.... every time you asked him a question he seemed bothered. The other men at the concierge were helpful, but not the old guy. As for the rooms, I was upgraded to a suite so my room was very nice and large. The bed was very comfortable as was the sofa in the living room. The room temperature was very comfortable and adjustable. The work out facility is very small and there is no pool at the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance to the train station. A great find in the area was a restaurant called El Rincon de Esteban... steps away from the front door of the hotel. We had our best meal in Spain at this restaurant. It was not cheap, but it was well worth the money. If you have a problem with smokers arrive early as it is very small and the room becomes filled with smoke with one or two smokers. A problem we had with the hotel was at the hotel restaurant. Its in a beautiful room and the room was quite busy; however, once we were seated not one person said hello to us or attempted to take an order from us. After fifteen minutes we left... the hotel was not apologetic. They had a too bad attitude about the situation. Overall, I would recommend staying at this hotel for its sleeping arrangements. Its a nice hotel in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: newhorizonsny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Palace in Madrid for three nights in December 2007. The hotel is beautiful, the room was huge and the bed was very comfortable --- especially compared with other European hotels. However, I have to completely disagree with the comments about how great the service is. We had worse service in this "5" star hotel than any of the other hotels we stayed at in Europe. On more than one occasion 2 door men stood around talking while my wife and I had to open the door for ourselves. We called guest services 4 times during our stay, each time the service was poor. I was told that an electrical transformer and a scale were not available (even though the hotel literature said it was) because the person answering did not know what they were - she asked me repeatedly what a scale does / what purpose does it serve. When I got frustrated enough to go down to the lobby and ask the concierge for assistance she was visibly annoyed at having to assist me. When we were checking out I had to call guest services 3 times to have someone come and help me with my luggage (it took 45 minutes to get someone to bring my luggage from the 3rd floor to the 1st floor). If the elevators were not so tiny I would have done this myself as there is no reason this. Also, my wife and were on our honeymoon and my american express travel agent made it a point to indicate this in all of our reservations (it said it on all of our travel vouchers) and the Westin is the only hotel we stayed at that did not acknowledge it in some way. So while the hotel / lobby was beautiful and the location was great I will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A top-notch hotel and not overly expensive”
Reviews.Author: Mantelstone
Reviews.Content: Having received an excellent rate through Hotwire, it was definitely a pleasant and very enjoyable stay at Westin Palace in Madrid. The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated and with the proximity to Christmas they did make an effort to set the season feeling alive with small touches. The room is spacious with most expected amenities and a good-size, very fresh marble bathroom. The only downside was the the room was not the newest and had most probably not been renovated for a long time. They did offer an upgrade to a larger and more modern room type, but for an extra and not too insubstantial charge. Have unfortunately not had the pleasure of staying at its main competitior (Ritz), but if you get a reasonable rate it is definitely worth a visit in a beautiful European city who's charm really comes alive during Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid's finest hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merhba
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best place in Madrid. On my first visit 2 years ago I stayed here and I have decided to stay here for as many times I would come back. Madrid is amazing, and this hotel adds to its greatness. The service is supreme. The food is fantastic. The rooms are super comfortable. There is not one thing that I can fault. The features are great. In a class and style of its own. Well done to all the staff and the management who ensure the best in both charm and service.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cannytraveler
Reviews.Content: A most beautiful establishment inside and out. The less renowned of the 'Old Spain' Madrid hotels.... The Ritz being the other. First class service at all levels and very good value for money. Lovely rooms with enormous wardrobes. Great bed and usual Westin appointments. Despite a large conference in progress this in no way affected us ......delegates were kept well away from private guests. We ate twice in the attractive restaurant which was formal but the staff were very attentive. Prices were reasonable and it had good local dishes on the menu. There is also an Asian restaurant which was frequented by David and Victoria Beckham during his time at Real Madrid...say no more! Very good location close to Prado and within easy walking distance of centre of Spain...the Plaza del Sol

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Palace, Great beds.”
Reviews.Author: perrystreet
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace was gorgeous. Its large but still charming. Decor is ornate. Very close to Prado Museum which is amazing to visit. You can also walk to plenty of restaurants and other attractions. The beds are very very comfortable. Rooms are on the small side but typical of city hotel. I'd highly recommend it. It was easily one of the nicest hotels I stayed at in Spain. I paid about 200 USD/night on Hotwire. A tip: its actually pretty easy to figure out which hotel it is on Hotwire if you are feeling daring. Just look at the number of reviews, rating and amenities. One bad thing: food was absurdly expensive at the hotel and I'm used to NYC food prices which are ridiculous. Even the mini-bar beers and waters were more than twice the price of another 5 star hotel in Toledo. Not to worry though, there are loads of restaurants and tapas bars in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Love Birds !”
Reviews.Author: gmorrow
Reviews.Content: Great location in the historical center of Madrid. Beautiful building inside and out, the atrium bar serves champagn in the afternoon for guests! Staff a little stuffy but very nice. Bed typical of Westin Heavenly beds. Very cozy. Highly reccomend if you want to cough up 300 eur. Great alternative is Vincci SOHO hotel just upstreet (100 eur) for super location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this Spanish landmark. it is in the middle of everything. Front desk service is excellent and concierge has been there for decades so they know there way around Madrid. Room was very clean, Westin bed as usual (good) and the room service quality is very good. Expensive but good. The hotel is large, long halls for the rooms and some steps to get to elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahdzp
Reviews.Content: We love the Palace, the location is very good, you can walk almost everywere and the rooms are very comfortable. We have been here before and for sure we will go back. The service is very good, we asked the concierge for some reservations in advance and we always got very good tables because of the hotel. It maybe more old style but if you are in Europe I think is perfect. The Rotunda area is so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Escaramujo
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of Starwood hotels and all its brands. I am also a seasoned traveler and have experienced many, many, Starwood hotels in my life. I am a Starwood Gold member. From this view point I have to say that the Westin Palace in Madrid does not reach the Standard that Starwood has for all their hotels. I will start with the positive: Nice Lobby, great hallways,great location...feels like a Grand Hotel when you enter. Now my experience: My reservation made many months in advance was not found (reservation with starwood points) even though I had the confirmation in my hand and the points were deducted from my account. After more than 45 minutes waiting and several phone calls, my reservation was found. I was given a smoking room (reserved non smoking). Then I was moved to a non smoking room after complaining. The room was very standard. No heavenly bed or linens and just a small Queen Bed (felt more like a large full). After asking at the front desk I was told that this hotel does not have King beds (????), that they were remodeling the hotel because many americans request them, and only the executive floor has them. The mattress was outdated, pillows were terrible, and I was promised a change of room the next day. After no one called me with the answer, I talked to the chief of front desk after my second night. He wrote down the issues I mentioned and promised a change of room for the third night. I am still waiting for his phone call. That night we needed a Taxi. Every hotel of this category that I have been to, has Taxis waiting outside or they can be easily called. I was told by the doorman to not even try to wait for a Taxi there, that it was better to walk to the near neptuno square and get one there. (great service, no?). So in general, the hotel is nice outside, average once you open the door of your room and not up to the Starwood standards, and mediocre in regarding to customer service. They just don't care.

Reviews.Title: “pretty decent”
Reviews.Author: ltjbukem
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the westin palace for four nights. don't expect any bellhop to come rushing at your cab, ready to take your bags for you. when we came no one offered to help bring our cabs up. indeed, in our four nights there we didn't notice anyone asking whether we stayed at the hotel as we walked up the door. the rooms were nice, dual sink bathrooms, toilet, bidet, shower and a nice bed, good closet space. our room faced the round interior overlooking the 'courtyard'. i put courtyard in quotes because i don't think any hotel guests are able to enter that area. the internet costs 18 euros a night, which was kind of pricey. there is free wifi only in the lobby, though. the concierge was helpful for the most part, offering to make us reservations at restaurants, letting us use umbrellas, giving us directions, etc. but the one night we wanted a restaurant reservation, they made us reservations at el rincon esteban, i think, which was three blocks away. this place is quite the tourist trap, so pls be sure that you let the concierge know you don't want a western-friendly restaurant. but if this is what you want, by all means... the gym is nice also and never crowded in the two times i went there. for cheap meals, go on calle prado and you will find three or four tapas places. go another two blocks and you will reach calle de las huertas and this place is famed in madrid for tapas bars.. if you get here on a sunday, drop off your bags and immediately head to the museums, because they are free. lines are long, but that's part of the fun. walk thru el retiro and head towards salamanca for some 5th ave-type shopping. the previous author was spot on about vips and starbucks. vips saved us a few times during late night, for getting drinks and snacks. we also had breakfast there two mornings. the starbucks is also good for java and for people-watching. i paid $162US via priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: OntheGoAgain_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palace for one night on a business trip. Service was impeccable. All of the staff spoke English and were eager to address any requests. As a Starwood Platinum member, I was upgraded to an exectuive suite. I was unprepared for how nice the suite would be. As you entered the marble foyer, you had a separate living room area, including a medium sized dining table. This was a great area to entertain other guests and associates. There were balcony doors that opened out to a view of the Neptune Fountain. The hallway to the right led past a guest bath, into the bedroom. This was quite spacious, with a full seating area, as well as the bed and desk. The bathroom suite (yes, multi-room bathroom) had separate shower stall, tub, and toilet. Altogether, this may have been one of the nicest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. There was a classic feel to the hotel, but had all of the amenities of a updated property. The room is probably due for an update (e.g. wallpaper coming up in the corners), but that's easily overlooked. Oh yeah, Molton Brown bath products. That clinched it. Most importantly, the hotel had outstanding service and a comfortable tone throughout my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: carolboca
Reviews.Content: Quiet, well appointed room. Fabulous breakfast. Best possible location. Concierges were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities; a few service problems.”
Reviews.Author: jbtexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Palace as a part of a large business meeting. The hotel has an excellent location. The Thyssen and Prado museums are within five minute walks, Retiro (park) is another five minutes UP the hill behind the Prado, and Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor are about 10-15 minutes away UP another hill. So, all in all a great location, but be prepared to climb a bit. The only location drawback is that you are about a 7-10 minute walk from the nearest metro stations - Banco de Espana, Atocha, Sevilla or Sol. The hotel itself has excellent facilities. The rotunda lobby is ornate and beautiful. The hallways on the guest floors are wide and well lit. The breakfast area is well laid out with a wide selection. The rooms themselves are very nice. The bathrooms are probably the best part with twin sinks, and a separate room for the toilet and bidet. Towels are plush and unlike many European hotels, there are facial wash cloths. The room itself was spacious, but there was only one arm chair in the room. We would have preferred two chairs. Our room was room #649 which was south facing onto an alley with no particularly redeeming view. There were two problems we encountered. One was the mattress was badly in need of replacement. We could never get this scheduled, although the hotel did try. The other was air conditioning. Our air conditioner would come on, throw out cold air, get to the desired temperature, convert to fan only operation and never go back to throwing out cold air, no matter how warm it got in the room. We tried twice to get it fixed, but as we don't speak Spanish, we could not adequately communicate the problem. So, while we could hardly say we loved our experience in the room, we'll assume we were outliers (heard no complaints from others in our group). I am rating the hotel as excellent as the facilities themselves were superb and assuming that the problems we encountered were atypical. We did walk across Paseo del Prado to the Ritz and our view is that the public areas in the Palace exceed the Ritz. If you want to save a few euros on dining, if you exit the hotel, and go downhill to the Paseo del Prado, in the basement of the hotel building but only accessible from the street, there is a VIPS and a Starbucks. VIPS is a family oriented cafe / convenience store, but we found the food very satisfactory on our several occasions dining there. If you ask, they do have english language menus, but the Spanish language menus are well illustrated enough that with even the most rudimentary of Spanish, you should do OK. The only drawback is that you cannot order off the lunch menu until as I recall 1:00 pm (if not 1:30 pm). As for Starbucks, you know the drill. Certain maps show that there is a Planet Hollywood in the same building. If that was once true, it's closed now.

Reviews.Title: “Total luxury”
Reviews.Author: CasB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace in late August 2007. Unlike other comments, we found the concierge to be very helpful and the private tour he arranged for us was of a very high standard with an extremely knowledgable guide. The reception staff were very firendly although the "new" computerised system did seem to throw a few of them! Checking in took quite some time although we did arrive a little early so finding a vacant room was a bit of a challenge. The lobby with its sweeping staircase to the most amazing glass domed area was spectacular. The attention to detail and the cleanliness of the public areas cannot be faulted. We saw people on 2 ocassions over the weekend polishing the brass stair rails! The rooms are very pleasing on the eye and the bed was "to die for", I really didn't want to get up! Breakfast was excellent with all the usual selections, egg chef and even cava if you want it at that time of day! We dd not eat there in the evening as there are so many fantastic places to eat close by. The Julian de Tolsa had come highly recommended - we were disapponted in the service and the lack of selection although it was clearly a favorite of the locals it did not really make us want to go back. For a special treat (it was our wedding anniversary) or for some pure indulgence I would recommend this stunning hotel - great location (Starbucks around the corner if you need your fix!), attentive staff and the most amazing fescos and stained glass we have seen in a hotel. One last hint - the botanical gardens were a real dissapointment, badly manitained and very little of interest (could be the time of year) I was tempted to get a hoe and do some weeding in some places, it really is not worth paying when you can go to the Roayl gardens for free and see some of the most beautiful flora and fauna in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Profesional Staff”
Reviews.Author: ceciliacastelli
Reviews.Content: Besides being very well located, this hotel offers excellent service. At our arrival porter immediately helped us with our bags and took car to garage without delay so we could immediately proceed to check in that was fast and friendly . The room was not very large, but it was cozy and nice. Breakfast restaurant was very nice as well as menu. I am sure that having little time to spend in Madrid, it was the best hotel we could have booked. You really enjoy more a place when you arrive to a hotel like this. We would gladly return to this hotel if we would visit again Madrid

Reviews.Title: “One of Europe's greats”
Reviews.Author: mktozd
Reviews.Content: The Westin Madrid is one of the great hotels of Europe and from the moment you enter their gates you will know why. The service is very good from check in to check out. The best part of the hotel is the grand lobby which is nice to sit in and enjoy the comings and goings. Highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, fancy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jannazg
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace hotel is a very fancy hotel in a great location in Madrid. The hotel is not modern, but has an old school luxurious feel and charm. It is a large and bustling hotel with great rooms and bathrooms. The food and internet is very expensive but the property is one of the best in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, average concierge service”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Palace for 3 nights. The hotel itself is wonderful. Nice lobby, restaurants and rooms.
