The only thing that disappointed me was the front door/concierge service. After checking out, we brought our luggage down and there are 10 steps between the elevator and front door. No one helped us with our large 3 bags. There was only one doorman who was helping someone else with directions so we hailed our own cab and put our luggage in ourselves. This happened when we arrived as well. I don't blame the doorman, as he was busy with another guest. I just wish that for Friday through Sunday nights (probably their busiest days) they would employ more than one doorman or concierge person.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Palace!”
Reviews.Author: starwood6589
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night/4 day stay at the Westin Palace. Checked in at 1 am the first night and check-in was quick. Location is great and extremely central. Right across the street is the MuseoThyssen-Bornemisza. Also, a Starbucks is around the corner and a convience store/restaurant VIPS is close for snacks and magazines. We thought the location was perfect for walking to the Prado museum and Retiro Park. Lobby was nice but the hotel wasn't stuffy at all. The Rotunda restaurant is very pretty but it didn't seem worth the cost to eat there. Westin Workout was on the 7th floor accessibly through the staff elevator or the stairway on the 6th floor. Complementary earbuds were available for the TVs on the treadmills, stairmasters, and ellipticals. Westin Workout was open 24 hours a day. Rooms were on the smaller side since it is an old building in the middle of a city. Bathroom was large and Westin beds were very comfortable. Overall we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and dated although the superb service.”
Reviews.Author: telis
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed in this hotel 3 times this august( 2007). we had all the times a premium dlx room with exterior views. the first time we went there we booked hotel limo transfer which was very relaxing and comfortable way to get to the hotel(the driver did not speak a word in english but this is very common in spain-very few people knew english). the hotel overall it is very impressive.check-in was quick, professional but very formal not at all welcoming. the lobby is stunning-crystal chandeliers, classical antique furnishings etc. the first time they gave us a room on the spg floor (6th floor cause we are spg members). the corridors were grand! the room itself was very tastyfully furnished with classical decoration but the furnitures were not in a very good condition (lots of scratches etc). the room was of good size it had a queen heavenly westin bed with high quality linen (very comfortable-real heaven!) two side tables, a large desk/dressing table, a t.v. cabinet with the mini bar and an arm chair with a table. it looked somewhat empty(they could have one more armchair). the bathroom was all marble with seperate toilet and bidet, but it had only bathtub and shower together (in such an expensive hotel they ought to have separate shower), the amenities were molton brown. the view was on the parliament. the service was superb. you could ask for anything from slippers to toothbruses-just everything. the soundproof of that room was very good. the airconditioning was very good. room service was excellent and breakfast was more than o.k. but nothing special in terms of food but in terms of setting was like you were eating literally in a palace! on the 6th floor there was also coffee and tea making facilities in a lounge just infront of the elevators. mini-bar prices was the most expensive i have ever seen in a 5 star hotel as well as the telephone bills! the second time we were given a room with incredible views to neptune's fountain on the second floor.again the room furnitures were not in a very good condition like the previous room we had. this room was slightly larger and had a sitting area as well thus seemed less empty than the previous one.the soundproof in this room was not that good-you could hear noises from the corridor as well as from above and the room next to it. the third time we were given a room with views to neptune's fountain on the first floor.this was the most dated room but with the very best view. all the rooms had 3 telephones and internet connection plus several services through the t.v. set.the location is the best-close to everything. generally it is a very grand hotel it certainly gives you a great feeling but even as they claim that was renovated they did not do such a good job. i believe it is nice to stay in this hotel for the experience but only once. why we stayed 3 times? we had already prepaid! next time in madrid most probably we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Ever get the feeling you've been cheated?”
Reviews.Author: synapsid
Reviews.Content: Outstanding in every way - luxury around every corner, unbeatable location, incredible breakfast buffet - but boy, do you pay for it. All you get for the price is the room (and breakfast, if you book a package that includes it). Everything else comes at a *high* price - phone calls to the tune of 2 euros per minute, internet access for something ridiculous like 8 euros per hour, 12 euros for a glass of house wine in the bar. There's no reason a hotel like this can't include some of these amenities in the price - even if that price were a little higher. It was annoying after booking an expensive room at a luxury hotel to be nickel-and-dimed for everything else. The complimentary 0.5 liter bottles of water you see on your way out seem almost insulting. Overall the hotel itself is just fantastic, but I couldn't help but wonder if other hotels - half the price and half a block away - might have been a better value. As for the room - the bed is extremely comfortable, the bathroom and its amenities are very luxurious. Close to the museums and Plaza Mayor. Cabbies don't know it as the Westin - you need to tell them you're going to the "Palace". Stay here for a very special occasion or if you are a millionaire.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it..would go back”
Reviews.Author: lucdev666
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. There was always someone waiting to help you at any time of the day. They even held our bags for us as we traveled throughout the rest of spain and then came back and picked them up and our way back to Madrid. Overall the hotel was very luxurious and the breakfast buffet was top notch for european hotels

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend at the Palace Hotel through Priceline at the bargain rate of £90 per night plus service charges. As a Starwood Preferred Cardholder, I was allocated a room on the 6th floor, facing into the hotel. The room was great and just what I expected from such a classy hotel. The public areas are vast and designed to impress. Reception were friendly, spoke perfect English, and offered to help me with my luggage. Preferred Guests get a free newspaper, coffee in the morning, and fruit all day. Service was impecable and could not be faulted. Will definitely return to the Palace

Reviews.Title: “Westin Palace Madrid, A great stay for this family of 5”
Reviews.Author: dealyb
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 5 days at this hotel and found it to be a very nice place to stay. We did stay in the section being renovated, but the noise stopped at 7pm each day and we were out during the day so it did not matter much to us. The rate we got included breakfast and we found breakfast buffet to be very nice. Lots of selections. the rooms were clean, comfortable and the staff was very pleasant. (we speak spanish, so that probably helped) the hotel is right near the Prado museum and convenient to the metro subway system, which we used often. you are within walking distance of restaurants, museums and a very nice park Retiro, which I took my six year old to several times. There is a starbucks next door in case you need your fix. There is a business center, and you can get internet in your room if needed. I would definitely stay here again. we had 2 superior rooms with an extra bed for the 6 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jewelianna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. It's located right by the museums, within walking distance of Plaza Santa Ana and Puerta del Sol. The service at the front desk was excellent and the concierge was very helpful in finding train times and dinner recommendations. (in English) The hotel bar is under a beautiful stained glass dome in the center of the hotel. The room was large, clean, and luxurious, with a view of the street and fountain beyond. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The bathroom was completely done in marble and there were robes hanging on the back of the door for guests. The only problem with our stay was the hotel employee who came by to check the mini-bar at 8:30 in the morning every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pili123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 days at the Palace 10 days ago. We had stayed at the Palace for our honeymoon 22 years ago. The hotel is my favorite with excellent service, great breakfast, and the best location in Madrid. You can walk just about everywhere, take the metro, or plenty of taxis outside. The service is excellent. I love the looks of the hotel and the rooms have been upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum Starwood Preferred Guest member, I almost always stay at Starwood (Westin, Sheraton) hotels. I stayed here using points. Great decision. Conveniently located hotel, friendly reception desk, everyone spoke English, relaxed in the bar, beautiful common areas and hotel room. Very quiet. Starbucks just outside the building. City tour bus just oustide the front door. Down the street from the Atocha train station. Free coffe and fruit in the morning. Free newspaper. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A True Five-Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: Scot in America
Reviews.Content: The Palace is one of Europe's great hotels -- beautiful, historic, great service, excellent food, and an air of gentility. The rooms are great, and the people were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Excellent, but avoid the Executive Suites”
Reviews.Author: Gonzo8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palace three times over the last several years, with my most recent visit in June. I stayed in a junior suite a few years ago, which was excellent, so booked one again for my most recent trip. Upon arrival, I was upgraded to an Executive Suite, which sounded great, until I checked it out! It was big, but strangely configured, with a large oval living room, and a strange ante-room/ hall way connecting the living room to the bedroom, and really old, uninspiring decor (peeling paint, tired feel, drab bedroom). I asked to move to the junior suite I had booked, and was told it was unavailable, which annoyed me. They finally moved me to another executive suite, which was much better, with a very nice bedroom and bathroom, but still some issue with the living room set-up. It was still not set as good as the smaller junior suite, in my opinion (see below). The hotel overall is great, with a good small gym (but no pool), a really nice breakfast buffet which is served in a beautiful room with a glass domed atrium. The building itself is a classic old place . The staff was really helpful (except for one bad steer by the concierge for tapas - La Truja was pretty lame!) and overall it was an extremely enjoyable experience. Hotel location is great - across the street from the Prado and other great museums, 10 minute walk up to the Puerta Del Sol, with a host of bars and restaurants and old shops on the streets between. Great town, Madrid. By the way, on the way out of Spain 2 week later, I stayed at the Palace again for 1 night, got a junior suite, and it was absolutely great. Clean, nice decor, king sized heavenly bed, well laid out, etc. Get the upgrade (you know you want it!) but for my money, don't go with the executive suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCfamilyguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic from start to finish. Making reservations was a snap, they guaranteed us connecting rooms with the kids, they met us with special kids' packs for our little ones, and had top notch service. The rooms were fantastic, truly beautiful, old world, but modern and well appointed. Great bathrooms and COMFy beds. We loved the gym and the Starwood Guest floor (where we stayed). The Atrium restaurant had fantastic service, though the first night the food was excellent and the second night was not very good. The location of this hotel can't be beat. You are literally across the street from the Thyssen, across the Paseo del Prado from the Prado, around the corner from the Reina Sofia and a few blocks from the Parque Retiro. We had no complaints whatsoever about the hotel -- this was a marvelous place to stay and we would not have wanted to stay anywhere else. Thank you Westin Palace, you are doing it right!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDublin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay in this hotel and we were loathe to leave it!!We stayed for five nights and are already planning a return visit. The rooms are spacious and luxurious. The location is perfect and the service you receive is top class.We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a luxurious city break

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cropwell
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the service was excellent and not too stuffy. We arrived at 9.30 after a very early flight from Luton to find that they had our room ready and waiting although the check in was not until 2.00pm. We had booked and paid for the most basic room so were pleasantly suprised that we had been upgraded to a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the Neptune fountain. Room was very spacious even allowing for a roll away bed for our 10 year old son. The public areas of the hotel are very elegant especially the Rotunda dome where the breakasts are served, the breakfasts are excellent- but very expensive ! approx 30 euros so I booked with travel republic for a rate that included breakfast. As a special treat we booked a table in the Rotunda reataurant on the Saturday evening and were not disappointed. The setting is beautiful and very luxurious with very good food which is well presented. Whilst not cheap it is would put many a London hotel to shame for value for money. All in all probably the best hotel we have stayed in, the only facility lacking being a swimming pool but with a hotel built in 1912 this would not be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected - nearly 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: DonFTL
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights at the Westin Palace in Madrid. I've stayed in many Westin hotels and this one is almost too nice to be labeled a Westin. The Palace Hotel is a perfect hotel for Americans travelling to Madrid (all staff members speak english) for either pleasure or business. (note the Starbucks right next to the building) The place *could* be converted to a St. Regis if they upped the service levels a notch. This hotel seemed to attract alot of Americans and Brits but still remains a grand Spanish hotel. Pros: Rooms - The RENOVATED rooms are excellent. The decor is absolutely beautiful with fabric covered walls and a terrfic marble bath. The included buffet breakfast was well done and we looked forward to it each morning. Neutral - Service - the staff was friendly and we had no serious problems but it wasn't what you would expect in a true 5-star hotel like a Four Seasons or St.Regis hotel. This is a large hotel and the staff seems a bit overworked - also it is difficult to give that personal type of service you would experience at a traditional 5 star property. Think 5 star property with 4 star service. Cons - Rooms - the UNRENOVATED rooms are actually pretty bad and are more like a 3 star experience. We had 2 rooms one was renovated and was absolutely beautiful - the older one was a completely different room from the older very beat-up unrenovated rooms. Standing in the older room made me feel like I was in a completely different hotel. Bottom line - a well known swanky and beaufiful large hotel in a good location in old Madrid. I would highly recommend this property but with a warning to NOT stay at this hotel if you can't upgrade or confirm a newly renovated room. Currently they are finishing the renovations on the 5th floor - I believe the 7th and 6th floor renovatations are complete. (our 5th floor room was renovated and 4th floor was not).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Fizzy-MoonPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of a conference package & was unimpressed for a supposedly 5 star property. Granted the foyer, meeting rooms, breakfast rooms, hotel staff, etc. were all of a high standard but the hotel room itself was in need of repair. Our lamp did not work, the tv worked sporadically & the wallpaper was peeling. The room was spacious, however, & the bed itself was ok but you do expect more out of a hotel rated this highly. The best part of the Westin Palace is the location - right opposite the Prado & within easy walking distance to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Palace was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: errant
Reviews.Content: We didn't mean to stay at the Palace. We were originally booked at the Hotel Villa Real across the square. However, we switched because we didn't like the Villa Real. The staff was fantastic. We explained our situation at the Villa Real to a patient and kind fellow at the reception desk. He immediately put a room on hold and took the time to show it to us to make sure we'd be satisified. We were. One small snag -- when we were putting our valuables in the hotel safe, it locked accidentally (his key got stuck as well as ours). We were in a bit of a panic because our passports, credit cards and other valuables were locked inside. It took about an hour to get the problem fixed. How did the Westin Palace apologize for this? They upgraded us to a very large and luxurious junior suite (655) on the 6th floor. It was spacious (it even boasted a little walk-in closet!). It was beautifully decorated. The bathroom was massive and the shower fantastic. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept on. It was .... perfect. Oh. And they threw breakfast in for free too. A great choice of things to eat -- and in such a beautiful room with a gorgeous dome of stained glass. Stunning. Oh, and they gave us a bottle of sparkling, chilled Cava on our final night, plus some chocolate bars for our teen. They went out of their way to make us comfortable and happy. FANTASTIC service. The Palace is expensive. Beware the $22 Gin and Tonic! But it is beautiful. And you feel pampered. We left Madrid feeling relaxed and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: londontravellista
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in centre of Madrid, walking distance to museums/shops etc. There is a wonderful local park some 15-20min walk if you have some extra time. Our room was excellent although looking a busy road, but double glazing and heavy curtains ensure a good night sleep. The breakfast was excellent and the lobby/bar is quite grandious. Well kept hotel and good base if you visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of its name”
Reviews.Author: drewsusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early May and found the hotel living up to its palacial claim: It is one of the grand hotels of Europe. Its public spaces are among the finest examples of traditional elegance one is likely to encounter. Its location across from the Thyssen and very close to the Prado museums make it exceptionally convenient for tourists. Service was impeccable, with an appropriate mixture of formality and friendliness. I have noted that there has been some criticism of rooms amongst reviews of the hotel; we found our quarters attractive, in perfect condition, consistent with the rest of the hotel. We appreciated internet access through the television, as we had not carried a laptop with us. I should also note the excellent restaurant, Asia Gallery. We both loved it and count it as one of the finest dining experiences we have had recently. The breakfast buffet in the rotunda was top notch as well.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, Just OK”
Reviews.Author: morevacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palace in April 2007 and overall it provided a "so so" experience. I was at the Hotel Urban a few nights earlier, and frankly, the Palace loses hands down! 1) Location: perfect location for all of the major sites...art, food, drink. There is even a Starbucks around the corner from the hotel if that's your thing. 2) Check-in: horrible, horrible, horrible. After waiting in a tremendous line, we were given our room. Amazingly, as we walked in the room a lady was in her robe on the couch frightened by our entry..she actually yelped. Strike 1. We explained to the front desk what had happened...with no apology (not even to the poor lady) we were given a second room. Where's are luggage? Strike 2. The front desk claimed it was in the room...the concierge claimed it was on the way up. 30 mins or so later, I went back downstairs. Well, they lost the luggage. Strike 3. I had to look through piles of bags to find my bags. No apology, nothing...I was an inconvenience. Also, the bag guy gave me a look like I should tip him. In summary, check-in takes about an hour or so. Pretty cool, eh? 3) Facilities: I enjoyed the "dome bar" - - had a fun time sipping a couple of pre-dinner drinks and a night cap. As noted by other reviewers, the hotel does offer a taste of luxury and old world beauty. The breakfast was a nice touch and reasonably good. 4) Room: A little blah...but it had everything that you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Obviously very clean and all the usual amenities. I just wish there was something more exciting about the place, but that's just me. 5) Service: I guess my opinion in this regard may be skewed from check-in. Nevertheless, why can't the staff smile? Not sure if this is a policy decision or if they are all just that miserable? Oh well. I will admit that the word must of spread about my check-in experience and the manager sent my girlfriend and I a bottle of wine..a nice peace offering. Overall, we had a blast in Madrid. We just wished that we would have continued to stay at the Hotel Urban or tried another hotel for our final night. The Palace didn't do it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: HT1
Reviews.Content: Spent four days here the week after Easter as part of a group of 10. Excellent rate from 1800hotels.com much cheaper than the starwood website rate. Hotel is impressive, very centrally located and well appointed. Could not say that the staff were unfriendly but at the same time they did not blow me away with friendliness. Rooms were traditional in style but good. Breakfast was excellent. Drinks and food were expensive but nothing more that what would be expected from a five star city hotel. Would recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wakeboarders
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. We booked through an auction website and received 3 nights, one dinner, breakfast every morning, madrid cards for 24 hours for 699.00 us dollars. If we did not book this deal, I would not have booked this hotel. The rooms and beds are very comfortable. Robes for your use in room. We could hear noises from above and the hallway. Breakfast was very good with large selection. You could have made to order eggs or pick from buffet selection. Our included dinner we had to order from a feature menu of only pork items which we really did not enjoy. It came with a bottle of wine which was decent. Although the rooms were nice, I would not consider them great value for the price. There is a VIP store right downstairs where you can purchase snacks, water, beer, etc and save some money because the mini bar prices are very expensive (as normal in high end hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Winner in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SoCoMass
Reviews.Content: Loved the Madrid Palace and would definitely re-book. Room was gorgeous - we stayed on the top floor (6) in an SPG preferred guest room (through AmEx) and couldn't have been happier. Our room was a quiet and peaceful retreat amid the busy city. Our room looked into the hotel court yard, which may have cut down on some of the noise. Service was excellent and overall pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and noisy”
Reviews.Author: LifeisGOOD58
Reviews.Content: Westin Palace is majestic and in a wonderful location. Very close to El Prado and the Von Thyssen Collection (great museum). Check in service was very friendly and efficient. We had a huge suite. Unfortunately, it was somewhat worn and the bathroom shower tile was old and somewhat moldy looking. The biggest problem was that we were on the 2nd floor. One night there was some sort of party and we heard extremely loud music until around 4:00 a.m. It sounded like it was in our room. On a positive note, they did not charge us for that night, but still I would be wary about staying there again unless I was on a high floor. I worked with one Concierge who was incredibly rude - wished I remembered his name. The other Concierges were terrific. The buffet breakfast and lunch at the hotel is great. I would recommend staying there because of the location and the lobby/restaurant area is beautiful. I walked by a modern hotel that looked nice - Hotel Urban, also in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Adore”
Reviews.Author: atm801
Reviews.Content: Stayed with two girlfriends for 3 nights on a trip to Spain. Hotel staff really took us under their wing and gave us endless amounts of help/suggestions. Location is fabolous, everything in walking distance (some walks longer than others). Mick Jagger stayed 2 doors down from us! Bathrooms gorgeous. Room itself the same. Very clean. Hotel breakfast delicious.

Reviews.Title: “magnificient madrid”
Reviews.Author: nicanriogh
Reviews.Content: The Westin hotel is in a great location, near metro and around the corner from bus stop and Open top bus tour. A taxi from to/from airport will cost approx €25.00. The hotel is old world elegance and I found the staff to be courteous and professional. The bar prices are on the expensive side but the bar and lobby bar are a great place to people watch. We ate in the Asia Gallery restaurant which was lovely and very reasonable, breakfast was usually busy but offered a good choice of hot and cold dishes. Visitors to the hotel should be aware that renovations are currently underway but found that this did not interfere with our stay. Also one more thing for all you smokers out there! This hotel has smoking rooms on second floor so be sure to mention this when booking as the public areas in the hotel are all non smoking. However, the Asian restaurant does have a smoking section should you wish to avail of it. Overall I enjoyed my stay in Madrid and at the Westin and would definitely return to both in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CSRRye
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of various hotels in Madrid I was concerned that I would not be able to find anything suitable. After great deliberation between the Ritz and the Palace we choose the Palace and I feel that it was absolutely the right choice. To begin with I cannot understand what other reviewers are complaining about in terms of the service. The concierge was unbelievably helpful and the service at the bar and at breakfast was fantastic- overall the hotel gets a perfect score for service. With all that said the hotel is slightly tired- there was paint chipping on the doors in the bathroom along with a tear in the lamp shades in the entrance hall to our room. However, we were told that the hotel will be going through a renovation soon, so hopefully all of this will be rectified. I am very pick about hotels and I was so impressed with the service that I was able to look over the low points, and I can say that I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: AvrilQT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last weekend, having found a 3 nights for the price of 2 deal on the Starwood website. We'd been delayed at the airport, our luggage had been interfered with between the plane and the carousel (it took 45 minutes for the luggage to arrive), and the taxi driver couldn't drop us at the hotel because of a demonstration in the city centre, so we were a bit disgruntled by the time we eventually arrived, but as soon as we stepped into the lobby, we started to relax. What a beautiful first impression you get - the lobby has an air of grandeur that you can't fail to be impressed with. The front desk staff couldn't have been nicer. Unlike other reviewers, we had no issues with waiting for service either at the reception desk or at the concierge desk, but I guess it depends on the time of day or time of year. We had booked a premium deluxe room, but when we arrived to our assigned room, we discovered that we'd been given a lovely junior suite (no idea why, but I wasn't about to complain). We had a lovely sitting area with comfortable sofa and its own TV. The minibar was also in this room, although we didn't make use of it, because it was so expensive - the price list is hidden at the back of the room-service menu. Mahogany double doors led into the bedroom, which had a second TV, and a comfy queen-sized bed (although I'd agree with the reviewer who mentioned that the pillows are a bit too soft). There was also a walk-in wardrobe. The bathroom was beautifully done in marble and had a separate bath and shower, and double sinks. One nice thing I noticed was that rather than the usual 2 big towels and 2 tiny hand towels, our bathroom had 4 huge towels and 2 fairly large hand towels, as well as the bathrobes - much better!! The public areas downstairs are gorgeous! The bar has a real old-world atmosphere, and the rotunda is just spectacular. We ate in Asia Gallery on the third night of our stay, and I can highly recommend it, even if you're not staying in the hotel. Amazingly, it wasn't all that expensive (considering the fact that a glass of 7-Up in the bar cost €7). We chose one of the set meals for two, which consists of soup, mixed starter, half a lobster each, scallops, quail, duck and dessert, and it was only €50 each. The staff there were wonderfully attentive, and the decor in the restaurant is just so lovely. Breakfast was included in our stay, and it was a fairly impressive spread, with pretty much everything you'd want at a breakfast buffet (oh, apart from the fact that there was no milk on the table for tea/coffee, but I think that's just the continental way of doing things). There were plenty of staff members milling about, ready to refill coffee cups and fetch anything you wanted. Make sure you don't do that thing of going down for breakfast 5 minutes before service ends, though - as soon as the assigned time is reached, everything is cleared away in about 5 minutes, so you could find yourself facing empty shelves. We did see some people complain about the noise caused by decorators, and I know they were at work in the rooms above us, but we're lucky that both of us are heavy sleepers (and are used to sleeping through city noise), so we pretty much slept through it. The one thing that this hotel is missing is a spa/beauty salon and a pool, which is all the more noticeable by the fact that there are brochures in the rooms for Westin Spa hotels elsewhere. I know if I want a spa hotel, I’ll go to one somewhere in the countryside or near the sea, but sometimes it’s nice to escape the city for an hour and have a facial or a swim. If I was going back to Madrid, I’d definitely stay in the Westin Palace again, and I’d have no hesitation in recommending it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - apart from the 8am renovations!”
Reviews.Author: CYLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for three nights during a well earned short break in Madrid. The hotel is in an ideal location within walking distance of most attractions, and some excellent restaurants. The staff were all very helpful and efficient. The accomodation is very spacious, and well equiped, although some areas required some re decoration. The lobby area / bar and restaurant are all stunning. Unfortunately, on our first and second days, we were rudely awaken from our sleep by extemely loud renovation works taking place directly above us. On the first day this began at 9am, and 8am on the second. We complained about this and to be fair, the response of the management was very fast and generous and could not be faulted. This hotel probably deserves a higher rating, but depriving us of our sleep during a short break is a serious matter.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel, service not great”
Reviews.Author: m-it1978
Reviews.Content: The Palace Hotel, is in a perfect location, just across from the Prado hotel. The hotel itself is impressive and the room couldnt be faulted (twin), but i was not impressed by the service., reception staff excluded however. Staff at breakfast were anything but helpful, which was also the case for the staff in the bar and the concierge. This just put a dampner on the stay, if the luxury of the hotel was matched with a similar level of service i would have no doubt about returning to stay, but as this was my first visit to the city i will be trying a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but the service has slipped”
Reviews.Author: PDXviajero
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace is elegant and nicely appointed, albeit stuffy. I love the dome and the long corridor hallways. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are luxurious. Having said this, the service has slipped since my last stay a few years ago. Some of the employees spoke informally with myself and other guests, and were not always very responsive to requests. It is indeed a beautiful hotel that is very famous, and is worth a stop-in for a cocktail under the dome. The location is excellent. I do think you can do better in Madrid, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: sugaraki
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Madrid for a weekend so a central hotel was an obvious choice. The westin is a bit pricey. Yet the hotel is very impressive and it offers access to all major museums as it is next to the museum area. Also you can walk to plaza del sol or plaza mayor. The reception and the restaurants are more than nice, especially the breakfast area. I wasn't particularly impressed with the twin room we had but noone can argue it was a comfortable room. The bathroom is very nice but nor really spacious. I definitely encourage you to book this hotel for a pleasant holiday in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Madrid. Worn but decent”
Reviews.Author: SFjoe
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay using my Starwood points for a room at this property in Madrid. I am a platinum Starwood member and try to use points at the nicer properties because they are so expensive and especially in the European locations. What I liked best about this property was the location which is excellent. The Prado was next door as was the modern museum of art on the other side of the square. There is a Starbucks located in the same block for decent coffee and a pastry. There is a Spanish version of Dennys called VIPS which you can get food cheaper than most restaurants but it is not very interesting just filling. What I did not like about the hotel is that they gouge you for everything. A small bottle of water was almost $7. The rollaway was $50 euros a night and a cup of coffee in the hotel was almost $5. Stay away from the overpriced and not very interesting breakfast buffet which is 22 euros. The concierge made lousy restaurant recommendations where the Tapas food was not only terrible in quality but high in price. We made a point of returning to let him know that it was a poor recommendation and he thanked us but the next day I returned for another reason and overheard him giving out the same recommendation to another customer. Typically this means they are getting some sort of kickback to steer you to certain places to eat. Avoid the concierge for anything but directions. The rooms walls were thin and we heard everyone’s door open and close as well as the room above us. We were in a superior room which was spacious but a bit worn. Rather so-so. The rate for this room was over 500 euros a night and I would have fled after the first night but we were using points to stay there so I did not mind. It is a decent hotel to stay in if you can use points and absurdly overpriced for the prices they charge for the accommodations you get. Our queen size bed had seen a better day since the springs tended to squeak when we got out of the bed. We faced the square which was kind of cool but the constant street noise meant you kept your window closed. In the end it was fine because we were using points but this hotel is not worth what they are charging for a room.

Reviews.Title: “grande dame!”
Reviews.Author: pa2
Reviews.Content: Very discrete and grand hotel in most center part of Madrid. The two options are the Ritz (no relation to Paris Ritz) and Palace. The Palace caters more to business travelers and wedding parties while the Ritz is pure glamour and celebrity. The Palace is across the street from the Prado, Reina Sofia , and the Thyssen museums. The rooms are the most spacious for any European and Madrileno capital! The recently renovated Rotunda is worth seeing and having a breakfast buffet or lunch. The service is professional and reserved. I would recommend this hotel for its location and grandeur. One can even cross the street for drinks and dinner in the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Palace- centrally located”
Reviews.Author: tom-ny
Reviews.Content: I began my first 2 days in Spain at the Westin Palace hotel.Centrally located within the "museum triangle" , you will be able to explore most of the sights of central Madrid easily from this hotel. Regal in appearance, the architecture is classic and elegant. The stained glass domed rotunda restaurant serves as the hub of the hotel and is beautiful and inviting. Having said that, it is ridiculously overpriced. A small diet coke runs 7½ Euros ( appr. $ 9.00 US) . The breakfast buffet, while complete, is also well overpriced. Room service- welcome to the home of the $25 (mediocre) hamburger. While I do not mind paying for an elegant, well appointed hotel, the surrounding atmosphere should justify it. While the hotel is indeed the epitomy of old world charm, the physical space lends itself to creating a lobby area that is busy and very active at all times, and not a place to relax on the provided couches. The concierge station is well trained and pleasant, but never seem to go out of their way. The front desk staff again are pleasant and ammenable, but not overly welcoming given the status, reputation, and accompanying price of the Palace. One chooses a 5 star hotel not only for its location and amenities, but also for that extra pampering that is expected when paying a premium price. The hotel, while certainly a comfortable place to return after a day of sightseeing, seems to be missing that "je ne sais quoi", that undescribable quality or attribute that seperates a 4 star from an amazing 5 star hotel experience. The hallways are certaily nice, and appear to have double the standard hotel hallway width, with mounted wall sconces outside every room, and upscale carpeting, somehow evoking what one might imagine the Titanic hallways to have looked like. Each guest room has a bell in place of having to knock on the door, as well a hallway visible light that notifies staff of a "do not disturb" status in place of a paper doorknob hanger. The rooms are decidedly masculine in feel. A wall sized dark wood armoire is large enough to store all of your luggage items, including a double width hanging closet. The bathroom is large and comfortable with double sinks, a large counter area for all of your toiletries, and a toilet and bidet in a seperate- carved glass door enclosed room. The tub-shower combo shows some wear and tear. The bed IS very comfortable as advertised, and the surrounding furniture is fine. The location cannot be beat, and right outside the front door is a Starbucks and a VIP restaurant/store, as well as having the most famous museums across the street,and the Grav Via area a short walk away. The lobby bar is a quiet oasis away from the hectic lobby, decorated in dark wood paneling conjuring up a gentleman's club feel. An enjoyable place to enjoy a ( very overpriced) cocktail as a break from your sightseeing journey. In conclusion, if you are able to get your room here for a decent price, certainly go ahead and you will not be dissapointed. If you are paying $300 a night ( as I did) , you will probably find yourself wanting more from the experience and from this hotel where its reputation precedes it. For the price, I strongly recommend the Park Hyatt Villa Magna as a more sedate, luxurious choice. Located in the upscale Salamanca district, it is also conveniently located to most tourist sights in a much quieter, park like setting. Restaurant "El Teatriz", located close to the hotel, is a wonderful place for an elegant dinner in a renovated theater turned into a restaurant ( appr. $ 80 US per person for dinner) .

Reviews.Title: “Palace at a Price”
Reviews.Author: Ormstein
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay somewhere nice for our 20th wedding anniversary weekendin September 2006 and I always fancied the Westin Palace from when I stayed in Madrid on buisness trips. I booked through the Starwood website. The hotel is well and conveniently situated in central Madrid near to the Retiro park and the museum quarter. It is a grand old building, with fine appointments, although it is starting to show its years of use just a little. The entrance hall is very grand, and the concierge very efficient. Our check in was very efficient, with a friendly and helpful counter agent who upgraded our room when she heard we were on our anniversary visit. Our room was small ( even upgraded) but beautifully appointed. We were a little disappointed that the much vaunted " heavenly bed" was only a double, not a queen or king size, but it was opulently covered and quite comfortable. The bathroom and shower room was exemplary - it is a pity that one has to pay for a five star hotel in order to get such lovely and enjoyable facilities. The view from the small window was of the Plaza de Las Cortes - a bustling traffic roundabout and the retiro park beyond. After a reminder from me, the staff bought up the sparkling wine and flowers I had pre-booked for my wife. The delay did not spoil our visit. A quick look at the minibar and room service menus caused us to laugh - a small jar of jelly candies at €7.50, and a Mars Bar €8 for example !! I popped out to the VIPS store on the Plaza to stock up on such items for a tenth of the price instead ! The restaurant is very grand - airy and charismatic under a glass dome,but sadly also cripplingly bad value. Fortunately Madrid is well provided with fantastic eateries and we found several lovely venues over our stay, where we experienced wonderful local cuisine and ambience for realistic prices. The gym on the top floor is very well stocked with equipment, which seems to never be used. We were surprised that this lovely hotel did not have a pool however. Breakfast was fine, with a chef adding freshly cooked Tortillas Espanol to the broad and tasty buffet repast. All in all we had a fine stay, but less adventurous vistiors might have paid much more than they needed to for somewhat overpriced hotel services. To be honest our weekend was so lovely and romantic , we could hardly remember the hotel as anything less than wonderful, but the Westin Palace CERTAINLY played its part in the romance of our celebration weekend. Recommended to either visitors confident enough to seek out alternative eating and drinking venues, OR the very wealthy !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable hotel with a great concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Kellysan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 3 nights at the Westin Palace in Madrid. Our trip had an unfortunate start when my wallet was pickpocketed while walking around the neighborhood of the hotel. I immediately contacted the concierge and she jumped into action and helped me cancel my credit cards. She was extremely kind and helpful in a very stressful situation. She even sent us some sparkling water and a fruit plate along with a letter letting us know that she was there if we needed any additional help. She really came through for us! Our room was quiet and comfortable. We loved the heavenly bed and heavenly shower. We also had dinner at the rotunda restaurant and drinks at the bar. Service was outstanding and we would stay here again. Although, next time I'll wear a money belt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, So-So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UTLonghorn2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Hotel for 5 nights in October. The hotel location can't be any better: 5-minute walk from the metro station (which we took from the airport), across the street from the Museum Thyssen-Bornemisza, across the plaza from Prado Museum, short-walk to Grand Via, and short walk to most things you want to see in Madrid. The hotel is impressive with its architecture. Inside the hotel, you first notice the grand chandeliers, mural on the wall, and then you see the posh furniture in lobby sitting area. After the wow-factors, you see the long lines of people check in/out and at the concierge desk. When we got to the front of the check-in desk, the process took no less than 30 minutes and I have already presented the check-in clerk with the email confirmation print out, credit card, and passport. I really have no idea what took so long, she didn't ask any questions but just typed away on her computer. The long line in the lobby seems to be a common sight during out stay. Every time we walked through the lobby, there was ALWAYS a line. We hardly ever asked the concierge for help because we just didn't want to wait in line. We were put in a standard room on the 6th floor, the Starwood Preferred Guest floor. The room was definitely a great size, has been remodeled, window overlooking the Thyssen-Bornemisza museum, air-conditioning that's working, and lots of closet space. However, the queen size bed was definitely NOT your average Starwood bed. The mattress was old and lumpy, the pillow was more like someone stuffed some dirty towels into the pillow case, and the linen was nothing to write home about. However, the bathroom was very spacious, with double sinks, and the Westin double shower head. We didn't see an ironing board or hair dryer, so we called housekeeping to request the items. After three phone calls and no delivery, we gave up and never used those items during our stay. Housekeeping was somewhat decent in cleaning room, changing towels. But they never changed our robes during our stay. One good thing about the service is that they set up fresh coffee and tea every morning in the 6th floor lobby. Through out the day, there's fresh apple in the 6th floor lobby as well. We didn’t check if that was the case for all the floors in the hotel. Overall, the hotel is in a great location. But I am sure you can find better rooms and services in other 5-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Building, Cold Person”
Reviews.Author: dimsum
Reviews.Content: We booked the room from the Hotel web site before our arrival. When we came to the front desk, gave the staff our confirmation number and wanted to check-in, the staff refuse to help us checking in simply because he could not find any record in his computer. We said that it was the hotel's problem that the information was not shown in his computer, not ours!!!! His reply was he can't help. How can a frontline staff in a five star hotel could have such an unhelpful attitude when he was on duty. We were not asking for extra, we just wanted to checked in as we had already had the full payment pre-paid!!!!! Since I didn't have the confirmation letter in hand, I asked for using their business center so that I could access my email in order to have the confirmation letter printed out. He refused again and ignored us!!!!!!!!! Then my boyfriend broke his temper and finally another staff came to us. The attitude of this staff was completely different. She let us used the business center so that I could show her the hotel confirmation in my email account. We finally completed the check-in procedure and she appologized for the event and sent us a sparkling wine for free. The whole process took us almost an hour!!!!!!!! Other than our bad experience with the checking in, other things with the hotel was ok. But we will never go back to this hotel again or recommend it to our friend.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: bluemax9595
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz and were thoroughly disappointed. We then moved over to the Westin which is across the street. The location is central to all the major galleries. Everything was great and a better value. The rooms and the entire hotel have been renovated. The beds are oh so comfortable after you have been walking around Madrid all day. The bathrooms are huge. They have double sinks with marble countetrtops. The rooms are quiet. The buffet breakfeast was great also. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: Vien
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly has one of the best locations you can imagine, just 2 minutes from prado in the center of the city - which on the other hand makes it a noisy place. But with closed windows it is ok and aircondition is working efficiently and silently. The Palace is a beautiful old hotel with a stunning hall. Rooms are small as in most city hotels but testefully furnished. You can see that it is a chain hotel, rooms are as like as two peas in a pod - maybe a re-upholstery would do good. We needed nearly more than half an hour to check in and this seems to be standard because we always saw lots of guests waiting at the front desk - should not happen in a 5star hotel. The promoted "heavenly beds" have extremely soft mattrasses and are not new so tht we woke up with a bad backache. Smokers do not have an easy life at the Westin Palace as there are just two small rooms where it is allowed to smoke: one of them is a showroom for replicas open during the day from 11-16.00 and does not have any chair (!) the other one is used for parties and in the evening booked by groups.... in the restaurant, bar etc. it is strictly forbidden to smoke and there is no terrace or pavement cafe. I have seen elegant ladies smoking outside the entrance ....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - pure luxury!”
Reviews.Author: dreamholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in september. Fantastic location in a beautiful city. Our room was at the back of the hotel is it was nice and quiet. The standard of accommodation and the main hotel were really beautiful. Breakfasts were buffet style and fantastic! Have stayed in many 5 star hotels and i would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Fit for a Queen or King”
Reviews.Author: manhatter
Reviews.Content: A real palace- fit for a queen or king. What a feeling of luxury in the public rooms. The domed lobby/restaurant is fabulous. One of the best breakfast buffets I've ever had.Incredible assortment of foods and beverages including sparkling wine and amazing thick dark hot chocolate. Now, that's the way to start your day! Definitely 5 stars!!! Guestrooms were not as luxurious as the public rooms at least not the standard room that we had. In fact, it was in need of a paint job. The bath had chipped paint, the carpet was torn in the bedroom and there were dirt marks on the ceiling??? However, the bedding was very comfortable ! But definitely not 5 stars. Excellent location- Across the street form the Pardo, the Tourist bus, the Thyssen Museum. Helpful but harried concierge and door staff. Attentive service in the restaurant. Good gym faciltiy although a little difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fab Location, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: caramelgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday this month. The hotel is lovely looking, is in a great location and is pretty grand (although fairly over the top, reminded me of the Venetian in Vegas!). The gym is a total bonus and the terrace up there is lovely. Plus we had a great night's sleep on the 5th floor (it was very peaceful). The one thing that lets the place down is the service. There is always a queue to check in or check out (even late in the evening). Similarly a queue to see the concierge (who was not a cheery soul). Worst was the room service (they call it Service Express). My boyfriend had requested 4 days before arrival that flowers and wine be in our room upon arrival for a birthday surprise (very sweet of him!). They weren't there upon arrival. They weren't there after a prompting 'phone call. They took 5 hours after check in to arrive. And then it was separately. And when we had our Do Not Disturb sign illuminated- and were actually about to siesta. The message to accompany the flowers never arrived. The flowers were in an oasis stand, not a bouquet (as had been requested). And when we rang down for an iron it didn't arrive. So after 45 minutes (as we were getting late to leave) we rang again. Then we were told that they had run out. But no-one had bothered to call us. This is poor service. And it is frustrating because it is something that much cheaper hotels can, and do, get right. I think it is just lazy management (W hotel in NYC does not have these problems according to my boyfriend). I would recommend the hotel, but would warn you to be very wary of room service. We should have demanded that they waive the cost of the flowers. But we didn't as we were late (because of queueing for ages at the check-out, and because it is the kind of thing that sours a holiday).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, grand dame hotel”
Reviews.Author: Braindrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights using SPG points. As a Platinum, I was a bit disappointed to get a "deluxe" room overlooking the fountain. However, I did not push the room issue that much. The view was great and was very quiet when the window was closed. Upon arriving, we found a complimentary bottle of brut and red wine waiting for us. There is no Executive/Platinum lounge in this hotel. The room itself was a decent size with a "largish" bathroom and a dual sink. As with most European hotels in this category, there was a separate room with the toilet and bidet. The marble sink had actually cracked and was not level. This provided a problem with anything that was cylindrical in nature. The bathtub had a funky 3 knob system that took some figuring out. The air conditioning system is very adequate and surprisingly quiet for a hotel of this age. There was only a single electrical socket at the desk and 24 hours of internet cost 17 euros. My bed was only a queen although I asked for a king and a bit soft. It was advertised as a Westin Heavenly bed but was certainly not of the same caliber as N American Westins. Just under the hotel within the same buildling is a Starbucks and VIPS. We were at Starbucks every morning and VIPS sells very reasonably priced (take-away) drinks and food. The location is good if you're heading off to the Prado (across the street) but is about a 10-15 minute walk to Puerta del Sol/Plaza Mayor. The closest metro station was Banco Espanya which was about a 5-10 minute walk. Taking the metro from the airport to the hotel wasn't a problem. The service received was very good from the concierge (who booked tours for us via email before we arrived) and the room staff, which automatically replaced a burnt bulb and fixed a sink stopper without being asked. We would definitely stay here again if we returned to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with the family”
Reviews.Author: americantraveler100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palace for 3 nights at end of July with spouse and 2 kids (ages 6 and 11). Request was made for 2 adjoining rooms with one queen and 2 twin beds and request was granted. My room with the queen bed was very nice but the kids room had a stained rug and stained and dirty curtains. Bathrooms in both rooms were new and very nice. Breakfast buffet was included and was great. Great selection of food. Hotel was nice and the room was very quiet even though it overlooked the Neptune Fountain! Beds were very comfortable and shower was nice. Location was very central to all museums and restaurants. Walked to the Plaza Mayor for dinner 2 nights. We all enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to visitors.

Reviews.Title: “It really is a palace”
Reviews.Author: StevenAllen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights wrapping up a two week trip to Spain. We got a very reasonable rate from the Starwood website, including breakfast. Much to our surprise, upon arrival we learned that we had been upgraded to a junior suite on the top floor with a complimentary bottle of sherry and two sherry glasses. The room was very spacious and extremely well appointed; beds were very comfortable (they don't call them the "heavenly bed" for nothing). On the whole we thought the service was very good. Concierge bought us tickets for the Picasso exhibit; chambermaids were very responsive to all requests. There was one instance when no one answered at the concierge desk at 8:30 a.m., but no one's perfect. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous and well worth the expense.”
Reviews.Author: ReviewNow
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; superbly trained staff; safe for solo female travelers; food and bar out of the world. No better place to stay in central location near museums. Caters to a convention crowd during the week but weekends hotel filled with tourists from all over the globe. Absolutely exquisitely restored palace. Ask for a city view of the Neptune Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin but very pricey”
Reviews.Author: MidwesternerAbroad
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood hotel frequent stayers. We used points to stay 10 nights at the Westin Palace in April, 2006. Postives: Our room had a Heavenly Bed (down bedding, high thread count sheets, good mattress) and marble finishes in the bathroom. Showerhead was very nice with plenty of water pressure. We were given a smallish room on a Club level floor with views overlooking the plaza below (directly across from the Prado Museum and next door to the Thyssen Museum). The windows are placed high, but we were able to see an Easter week procession from the room.) I was happy with the room (exactly what I expected from a Westin) and loved the location of the hotel (convenient to lots of the tourist stuff and in a very nice neighborhood.) Negatives: both check-in and check-out were unbelievably long (people in line at check-in were red in the face and complaining), breakfast is like $45 per person per day (for a buffett that does not justify the price) and we often had to wait 10-15 minutes for a taxi when heading out for dinner. I recommend buying bottled water/drinks for the room at the VIPS and breakfasting at the Starbucks on the plaza. The add-on charges here are really steep so watch out! Americans are likely to find this hotel pricey for what you get (certainly there are cheaper Westin's in the states) but you're in prime Madrid real estate at this hotel and you're in Europe, which is just generally pricey overall.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you don't know what to do in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: WalterNC
Reviews.Content: The concierge, front desk and service express are so busy that they never answer the phone (or only do so after 20 rings) and the lines to wait to talk to them are horrible. The hotel is quite large and crowded, so even the wait for the elevator can be a long one. The concierge gives the same recommendations for dinner places so that virtually all the customers are from the westin palace hotel. The recommendations are not very good, evidenced by the fact that locals don't eat at these places. Location is good; Madrid is quite manageable with a good metro system and the metro stop is a 5-minute walk from the hotel. Both restaurants in the hotel are mediocre. The Asian Gallery touts a unique menu, but the items are similar to any U.S. carryout place and quite overpriced...25 euros for lunch per person.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RinTulsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while vacationing in Madrid. Location next to the Prado and the Thyssen is big plus. In addition, we had a room overlooking the square and the fountain. Rooms were large and clean and comfortable, breakfast in the stained glass ceiling dining room was pretty neat, staff was very helpful and polite. Beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “20 Years Later And Still Shining!”
Reviews.Author: architect95
Reviews.Content: 1986 to 2006 and the PALACE HOTEL MADRID is still a stellar example of superior service, spacious, clean, well appointed accomodations, beautiful public spaces, elegant without being overly stuffy. Centrally located to major attractions, GREAT Restaurant recommendations within walking distance and ease of use with banked "Starwood Points".

Reviews.Title: “Visually impressive, top service”
Reviews.Author: J_Robison
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the most visually impressive of several we visited in France and Spain. We had an inside room on the 4th. My hobby is construction and my eye appreciates the choice and placement of green marble and premium carpet flooring in the hallways. The lobby is huge with shops, salons, a restaurant and meeting rooms hanging off the periphery. The location gets you quickly into the old city core, the key museums and also to the southern train station. The internet rate on a basic room seems very reasonable for the location and luxury. Service was notibily precise and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My good girl friend and I stayed at the Westin Madrid for three nights in March. We were doing a tour of Lisbon, Paris, and Madrid. I am a starwoods preferred member and was able to stay on the preferred floor for non-smoking members. I really enjoyed the Westin and the rooms were great and larger than most European rooms which was nice for two females. Can't say enough about the rooms the location was also very nice and in a great location and within walking distance to everything which was nice. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in Madrid. I had done extensive research prior to travelling and between Yahoo travel and Trip advisor, most people recommended this place and the Intercontinental hotel which was slightly cheaper. Many people discourage travellers from staying at the Hotel Ritz (Not a Ritz Carlton property).I stayed for 5 days and my stay was absolutely average. I stayed in a premium queen room that was about 260$ a night with a promotion that was being run (25% off 5 nights or more). The lobby is beautiful but the rooms were small and the carpet was tearing in many places and in need of repairs--as is said in many reviews. The housekeeping woke me up many times, despite the "do not disturb" light being on. Additionally, the restaurants (one Asian and one Spanish) had good food but not exceptional and were very overpriced--there are much better restaurants elsewhere. The fitness center is up to date but small, however, the staff there is no where to be found and there is a smell of cigarette smoke at the fitness center check-in desk. The concierge was very good at recommending restaurants that were excellent. The location is excellent. It is walking distance to the Prado Museum and botanical garden behind the museum. The Banco Espana metro stop is about a 8 min. walk. There are many nice shopping areas nearby. In summary, it was an average hotel that is overpriced for what it delivers. I would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “loved the westin”
Reviews.Author: trespequitas
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed at this hotel during the second week of April, and we loved it. It has a great location, in front of the Neptune fountain, Prado museum and Thyssen Bohermiza museum. Atocha the train station is a 10 minute walk away if you want to go on day tours of nearby ciites. The attention was great and breakfast was very good. If possible get a breakfast inclusive rate, it will really set you up for the day with plenty of fresh fruit and a variety of warm dishes. The hotel is well worth the money you paid, specially if you can get a good internet rate. I can only critisize one thing, the room was not available when we arrived at the hotel because we were coming in on a transatlantic flight and arrived at the hotel at 10.30 am, we had requested early check in but the hotel was fully booked, true official check in is at three but this category of hotel usually puts service ahead of rules, we lucked out and had our room withing 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Old World Hotel; business-oriented”
Reviews.Author: SteveBazakas
Reviews.Content: My wife, two teenaged daughters and I stayed here from March 16-18. The hotel is on one of the main plazas, a very short walk to the important museums. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, and there is a Starbucks in the building facing the plaza. Be prepared for noise and traffic. It's a big city feeling. The hotel is in excellent condition. The lobby, common areas and rooms are very opulent. You can't beat the Heavenly Beds in the Westins. The service was very good and efficient, but somewhat cold. In general, I believe this is typical in Madrid, and in particular, this hotel caters to a business clientele. We only ate dessert at the hotel, and I don't think I've ever seen anything that expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Starting to crack”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, to be sure, but at these prices, there is no excuse for cracks in the walls with bits of dry wall missing. Not to mention the dangling light fixture in the bathroom with exposed wires. I would recommend trying another hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic in every way!!!!”
Reviews.Author: melgares
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Luxury Link Package for a five night stay and I have to say EVERYTHING was perfect. From the front doorman "Luis" to the service we received in the restaurant and bar "Miguel" everything was perfect. The food in the restaurant was absolutely five star quality. I especially liked the perfectly tailored suits the staff were wearing, every detail was perfectly orchestrated. If you want to thoroughly enjoy the sophistication and luxury that Madrid's finest hotel has to offer stay at the Palace. I also have to say the Ms. Molero the Reservations Manager was extremely helpful and went above and beyond to make certain our reservations were perfect. Thank You again for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in beautiful part of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Westin Palace is located in the most elegant part of Madrid, very close to the Thyssen-Bornemisza (right across the street), the AMAZING Prado, and the Buen Retiro park and its beautiful surrounding neighborhoods. I had only one complaint about our room: the curtains were disgustingly filthy -- stained and so dusty it made us sneeze! The rest of the room, though, was fine. It was spacious, quiet, and very comfortable. As for dining options, our package included breakfast, which consisted of a deluxe spread of cereals, fruit, cheese, ham, smoked salmon, yogurt, and pastries, all served in the beautiful glass-domed room. We walked to Santa Ana square for great tapas in the evening, and ate at the Thyssen for lunch (it has a wonderful modern restaurant with a good fixed-price lunch menu.) Stop by the Ritz, right across the roundabout, for a drink. It would probably cost as much as raiding the hotel minibar, and the surroundings are much more memorable! 300 euro per night, inluding VAT and breakfast, was a very good price for this part of Madrid. We would certainly stay in this hotel again. P.S. As all the guidebooks warn, the taxi drivers will try to rip you off if they know you're a tourist. The one who took us to the airport insisted on a huge supplement. Madrid should be ashamed of its crooked taxi drivers!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel....a little stuffy?”
Reviews.Author: C1981
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in a twin room at the end of February over the weekend. Service was very good and staff was very polite despite our casual approach to trip (there are alot of business travelers using the hotel). The dining area is really beautiful and the place drips with old-world character. The rooms were nice. A little tired maybe. Not quite perfect...i.e the curtains were grubby and paint was chipped in several places etc. But they were spacious and we had a small balcony which made a massive difference. Ask for a 4th floor room if you want french doors onto a balcony...great street views. Breakfast was great...anything you could possibly want, including smoked salmon and champagne! The hotel was very nice but i would chose somewhere with a more modern idea of luxury next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good but some reservations.”
Reviews.Author: travellingKoalas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights over a week-end and had booked a junior-suite. The arrival in the handsome foyer is somewhat let down by having to queue for some ten minutes to check-in, since the hotel can get very busy and there are only two over-worked receptionists. Some members of staff come to you whilst you queue, to offer you some complimentary refreshments, which is a nice touch, but it seems to me that they would be better employed behind a reception desk. Then, the non-smoking junior-suite we were given was very tired looking, and smelt like the inside of a smokers train-carriage, and the king sized bed we had requested, (and was confirmed to us) was no more than 1M60 in width. We complained to reception,(by phone to avoid having to queue again), and were given a very handsome junior suite on the fourth floor, which gave on the much quieter back of the hotel. This junior-suite consisted of a long beige marble-floored corridor which led to a very nice oval shape sitting room, a large bathroom with a window , a separate toilet cabinet, and a comfortable bedroom with a proper king-sized bed. The equipement was good, with two TVs, a CD player, fax etc...and nicely furnished too. But it was perhaps a little tired looking with small tears on the wallpapers, many cracks on the ceiling, and the large double picture-lamp had come off the wall, and was hanging by its electric wires over the head of the bed like some sword of Damocles. We mentioned it to house-keeping and a man came, took away the lamp, saying that he would returne to fix it and never did, leaving a hole in the wall with two live-wires sticking out during our whole stay. The bed was very comfortable, soft but supportive, but I disliked the pillows which felt like they had been half filled with cotton balls; your head just sank in them so you had to tuck them all the time. Another irritation was that when the room was cleaned the next day, we found a little card on the bed explaining that the sheets had not been changed, and if we wanted them changed tomorrow we should leave out that little card, and all because the Westin Palace had strong feelings about conservation issues.Right... This reminds me of the very expensive London Hilton which tells you, also on a card, that in order to maintain your privacy they have surppressed the evening turn-down service unless you specifically arranged it with them. Regrettably I notice more and more often that large hotel groups are making up lame excuses, to cut down on their expenses. The hotel was very well located if, like us, your aim is to visit all the main art museums, and the restaurants are not very far, a five euros-taxi ride will take you to the nicest ones. In the end I had to conclude that the hotel was, on the whole, good, especially since our stay was very good value. We used one of their many packages on offer where two nights would give you a extra third night free; at 450 euros a night, with the free night it worked out an average of 300 euros a night, for a large junior suite, with breakfast, right in the heart of a major Europeen city. Similar accommodation in central Paris, London or Rome would cost over double that amount. So my advice is, do choose this traditional palace hotel for a stay in Madrid, if you can get a good value package, and don't expect 'Four Seasons' type of service level since the doormen won't open the door for you and the staff in the public areas stay chatting together in small groupes and on the whole are neither very pleasent nor helpfull; (with one or two rare exceptions). Oh, and buy your own water since the mini-bar (with no price list) will charge 5 euros for a tiny 30cl bottle!

Reviews.Title: “the best in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great service, immediate check in , check out. attention from everyone. clean rooms. bathroom was beautiful. perfect location. i was there feb 8-14th for the ARCO exhibition. only one complaint. i asked for a suggestion from the concierge about where to get a good paella, and he directed me to a restaurant that was shut down for construction... $5 euro cab ride down the drain. but thats okay, everyone makes mistakes. this hotel was definately the best in madrid. better than the ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for Valentines Day in Room 181. It is very centrally located and therefore a perfect starting point to explore the city. We are quite picky when it comes to hotels and I must say the Westin is a real 5 star hotel, with excellent service, nice & spacious rooms and a nice royal ambient. Not that I was blown away, but definetly worth going.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palace”
Reviews.Author: profruth
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Westin Palace in mid January. This is an outstanding hotel with beautiful decor and an ideal location. The room was a good size and the beds were really "heavenly". The marble bathroom was pretty and came with a bathrobe. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would defintely return here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jwilli3470
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 night from Dec 7-17 2005. We do not understand the negative reviews of this hotel. The Christams decorations were wonderful, friendly staff, nice room with all amentities and fabulous beds. Fantastic location near the major art galleries. Affordable restaurants right next to the hotel. We would love to return to this hotel. They even did the bill in dollars so that we did not have to pay a credit card conversion fee.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, amazing beds!”
Reviews.Author: wired2theworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace for one night at the end of a 10 day trip to Spain in October of 2005. The Westin Palace sits directly across from the Prado Museum and the famous Ritz hotel. It's only a couple of blocks from the Retiro Park and the Reina Sofia and Theissen museums as well. We arrived around noon and were able to walk there easily from the Atocha RENFE train station (about 3 long blocks). We were allowed to check in right away, even though it was early. I'd asked for a room with a view and we certainly were not disappointed. Our room, on the 4th floor, looked out directly onto the roundabout on the Plaza Canovas and across to the Ritz. The room was enormous by European standards, with the Westin's signature "heavenly beds" and a fantastic bathroom. The room also had big, built in closets with a safe, tons of channels in English on the TV, and fantastic amenities in the bathroom. I was able to get this hotel on Priceline for about half of the hotel's website rate and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff is pretentious and snooty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here from Nov. 21-24th. The good: The location is excellent. Pretty much across the street from the Prado Museum and in a very nice part of the city. The Heavenly Bed is no joke. I found it more comfortable than our bed at home. The room was nice. We were on the 5th floor on the inside facing the courtyard in the middle. Actually there is no courtyard, the center of the hotel is where the atrium is located. The bad: The place is pretentious and I felt a bit young to be there(I am 35). Lots of businessmen in the hotel at all times of the day with their suits and ties on stuffing the place up. Went to dinner at the Asian Gallery(very good food if you can afford it!) and every man in there was wearing a suit and tie. The staff acted apathetic towards me the entire time we were there. It seems they are focused on the business people that stay there and could care less about the tourists. I asked the concierge to book me a dinner reservation and he never did it. I asked in the morning and never heard anything back when I came back from sightseeing in the afternoon. I called the front desk and the concierge I talked to had gone for the day and did not leave me any messages. I think if I was some business VIP this would have been done but, because I am a nobody American tourist that looks too young to be staying in their hotel I did not even get a response. Because we stayed there during the week from Monday-Thursday, the price we paid for the hotel was not nearly as much as they charge on the weekends. Which is good because I would have been really disappointed if I had stayed over a weekend and paid their normal room rate. This hotel is nice but, I will not be going back here next time. This hotel is for business people and travelers over 40 years of age.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but why the high price for internet access?”
Reviews.Author: woorob
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a great location. However, the staff is a bit on the snotty side and why oh why do they charge 17 Euros for 24 hours of internet access? Everywhere I have recently stayed has had free internet access -- including an excellent $50 per night hotel in South Dakota -- so why the outrageous charge here??

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was quite worried after reading the reviews here just before going and after having to queue for 15 minutes in order to check in upon arrival, without an apology, was thinking I should of changed to another hotel, however we did enjoy our stay. The Superior Deluxe room was spacious and airy on the 4th floor.
