But the service was very much a hit or miss event, when we asked for clean towels they did arrive promptly, but to get a top up of coffee at breakfast was another story, it seemed the waiters made a point of marching around not looking at anyone and after asking 3 times one morning for some hot water and getting our own cutlery did wonder if this should be a 5* hotel. The prices however certainly reflected 5* prices with a kit kat from the room being one of the most expensive we have come across at 7.50 euro's, hence we didn't endulge. This hotel is situated centrally and comfortable with plenty of character but the staff could cerainly do with some much needed customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Derrico
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here. Hotel is right in the middle of the museum district. Great location. Rooms are elegant. The heavenly bed is indescribably good after a hard day looking at paintings! Staff was polite and efficient. Only down side to the place, was that the hotel bar and restaraunts are very expensive, but that is to be expected at a five star hotel. (I ate elsewhere.) With priceline rate this was a fantastic deal, and I will be back if I can swing it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: skibuff
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Madrid for a couple of days prior to a crusie from Barcelona. The Westin Palace was an excellent place to relax from the trip and use a base for exploring Madrid. The Hotel is first class in every way. Our room was on the 6th floor and faced the street. The windows were well insulated and no street noise was noted, even with a demonstration down the street at the Plaza Neptune for during the Parliamentary discussions over Catalonia. Flashing our Palace key to the police wisked us through the crowd. Pays to stay at a top notch locale. Furnishings were classic and well done. The room was in excellent condition and the "Heavenly Bed" was just that. The bathroom was large and had every convinience. Drinks and eats in the rotunda dining room was a real treat. The stained glass roof is beautiful and a sight to see. Room service was prompt and excellent. We asked for some ice and within three minutes, a huge bucket and glasses appeared. I highly recommend the Palace as first class place to stay in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Beautiful hotel, Got a really good rate in their web page! Will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and outrageous prices”
Reviews.Author: Seckel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Palace for four nights. I thought the hotel's public spaces were impressive and elegant. The same could not be said for the room, however, which was small and rather dark, with an uncomfortable bed and sheets and towels that were not changed unless the guest requested the service. I have never experience this in any luxury hotel in Europe. Room service was terrible: one evening we ordered ice at 7 p.m. Forty minutes later, still no ice. A call to room service who assured that it would be there "soon." A half hour later, still no ice. At 9:30 we cancelled the order and at 10:30, there was a knock on the door. "You ordered ice?" Prices were outrageous with 12 Euros for one glass of Tio Pepe sherry in the lounge and indifferent food at other times. The final straw occurred when the hotel charged 131 Euros for a collect call...the operator at the switchboard said "You're not the first to complain about charges like this." Fortunately, we moved to the Ritz, which is lovely in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Palace”
Reviews.Author: ry75atlanta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in September. The Hotel common areas are nice, but the room as nothing special. The room was small and definitely showed aging, while the bathroom was not especially clean. The "heavenly bed" that I am accustomed to with other Westins was not even close what is expected...it was very soft, squeeky and not very comfortable. I was very disappointed with this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Duena of Madrid Hotels”
Reviews.Author: CS-London
Reviews.Content: During our holidays in Madrid we have stayed twice at Westin Palace Hotel, famous for its magnificent facade. During our both visits, we have booked premium deluxe rooms on the 1st and 4th floors. Mudium size rooms, but elegant, with fantastic views of the Neptune fountain and the Prado Museum. This hotel is located right in the heart of the Golden Triagle of Art. It has a specious entrance, with period furnishings, tapestries, and ornate light fixtures. Its magnificent Rotonde Hall, features a breathtaking art nouveau glass dome, illuminated by a sparkling crystal chandelier. The hotel's La Rotonda restaurant, offers a la carte menu with live music. Generally we have found this restaurant very good for international cuisine. After dinner we had drinks and cocktails at the hotel's El Bar, which is decorated in pure English classical style. The Westin Palace Hotel is itself a work of art, the impression of timeless style.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: flamingokid8862
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Hotel Sept. 11-13. The location is great, across the street from the Prado and walking distance to most of the sites in Madrid. The lobby is impressive and we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, particularly the concierge. We ate at the Asian Gallery restaurant and was very pleased with the food and the service. Room service and the bar were quite pricey though, so be prepared for that. We also ate at the nearby drugstore/restaurant VIPS, which was very good with very reasonable prices. We had no complaints about the Palace, the room was spacious and clean. The hotel itself was a little stuffy for our taste, but overall a good experience and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “palatial rip-off”
Reviews.Author: tikvica
Reviews.Content: Westin palace has a great location. It is located in the center of the city, 2 minutes walk from Prado museum. And that, I guess, is the thing they charge. It is nice and clean, but I guess it's the kind of style that elder people prefer, with yellow wallpapers and old brown closets and desks. I guess they're so obsessed with cleaning, because you can hear the staff literally all the time in front of your room, and they don't bother to read the "please do not disturb" sign on your door. It is very unpleasant when they wake you up almost every morning, getting into your room, without even knocking sometimes! The food is verrrry low quality - noodles overcooked, nothing is very fresh, and everything is far from tasty. And the prices of the room service are so high, you feel dizzy every time you feel hungry. And not from the hunger. They don't refill the mini bar, so if you feel like a coke, they charge it 7 euros, plus they charge 5 euros for bringing it to your room! unbeliavable! 15 euros per film on VOD, 17 euros internet daily charge! that is one of the biggest rip-offs I've ever seen! Staff mainly does not speak english (except for example the concierge), so if you want to ask for something like... bottle opener (which we didn't have in our room), you need both your hands and legs to explain it. Overall - wouldn't like to stay there again. There are much nicer hotels in Madrid. Heavenly beds, though...

Reviews.Title: “very nice but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: DrMo
Reviews.Content: We went to Madrid to see the eclipse. An eclipse which all of Madrid were aware of apart from the Westin!. The staff were charming but did not go out of their way. The rooms we were in had just been redecorated and were a good size but the air conditioning was pretty non-existing - we sweltered in our "heavenly bed" so much we ended up sleeping on top. The power shower and little extras were nice. Breakfasts were generous - smoked salmon fabulous - but depending on who sat you smokers and non smokers could end up mixed. Definately nicer than the Ritz where we also spent some time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
Reviews.Content: The Palace is one of those Grand old City Hotels. I have to say following the reviews on here I was expecting a lot worse. I was pleasantly surprised. All staff were impeccably polite & helpful. Starwood have there hands on this place, the beds were indeed heavenly, so comfortable I didn't want to get out of them. Great meeting spaces and glorious lounge. I tried the iron test, it took three calls to coach room service into bringing an iron which made me late for an important drinks reception, but that's my only negative point.

Reviews.Title: “Not much of a palace”
Reviews.Author: TAmemberSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Let's start by the upper side: Great location, fancy lobby, magnificent breakfast area and excellent breakfast buffet. Reasonable rooms. Service cold, but not unefficient at all. On the other side, the in-room boradband never worked, and the internet access on the business center was € 8.00 per 20 mins! The food was no more than reasonable, although pricey. In a city where it is impossible to have dinner before 10 pm, the bar closes excatly at 1 am. The concierge wasn't very helpfull and the font desk refused to cash travellers checks in Euros. Three times I crossed the street for a drink at the Ritz, which seemed to be quite superior.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say awwwww?”
Reviews.Author: la40
Reviews.Content: The hotel was GRAND and the best sleep I've had in a long time away from home. Starwood gets a thumbs up for bedding, the showers and overall pleasantness of the staff encountered. The restaurant is pricey, but the food was FAB!

Reviews.Title: “Service and Food is Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 'The Palace' for business for most of September. To be fair, the hotel is in a great location and it is a classy place. HOWEVER, I was dispappointed by the concierge and some members of the reception who were not very attentative and/or disorganised, which on at least two occasions, caused me a great deal of irritation and distress. The other disappointing aspect of the Palace was that both the breakfast buffet and room service food is sub par! Stale bread and canned aspargus in a sandwich does not consitute good food!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Aug. 12-15 and had a wonderful stay. Great location, very helpful front desk and concierge. They helped us get from Madrid to Toledo, since the train tracks are under construction, and assisted with buying tickets for the bullfight.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: bdiuro
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 22 day vacation and had an opportunity to stay at the Westin Palace in Madrid, Spain. It's name is perfect because we felt like royalty during our stay. The physical structure is magnificent. There is a beautiful dome in the center of the hotel where breakfast, lunch, dinner or tapas is served. Our room, standard, was tastefully decorated. The mattresses on the bed were wonderful. We never wanted to get out of bed. The bathroom was great. All marble. The tub/shower was a nice size and the shower curtain came out like a semi-circle so your body didn't stick to it as you were showering. It was in the perfect location. The Prada was around the corner; the Tourists buses were also around the corner. Plaza St. Anna was in walking distance for wonderful tapas and pasteria's. And for those American's who need an American fix, Starbucks is also around the corner. We were celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary and I mentioned it as we were registering. That night the hotel left us a wonderful bottle of champagne and chocolates! The concierge was very helpful as was the Reception Staff. They suggested wonderful restaurants and places of interest. If you go on their web page they usually have specials. We took the breakfast and it was well worth it! We will only stay at the Palace if I should go to Madrid again! You can never go wrong with a Starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “below par for a Westin/Starwood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, half of bottle of wine in the mini-bar drank with the cap back on, hair in the bathtub, room smelled, looked like it had not even been cleaned. Three times during my stay the staff just walked in my room without knocking! Staff and concierge just plan rude and unhelpful. When I complained they could have cared less. Last night I ate at the Asia Gallery. The food was good, but I felt like I wasn't wanted. They tried to take my plate away 3 times before I had finished. Will never go back again. I never felt so unwanted at a hotel, like I was a burden to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The service was excellent, the rooms were beautiful as was the entire hotel. The location is GREAT! We were able to walk to the Prado, Plaza Major, the Palace, etc. The work-out facilities were very nice and never crowded. Each station had its own TV. The food was very good. We had several meals here and the breakfast was outstanding. As usual, the "heavenly beds" were great. I wish I had their beds at home. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not up to par”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights The hotel is in a great location. The doorman is a little scuffy. we were impressed with the public areas.we checked in and found the room nice no but no view whatsoever...we waited and hour and a half for our bags and we were very upset as I needed them. While we waited we discovered the light was falling off the wall and the music speaker was malfuntioning...they did not have an iron in the room and the one they had was in use...unexcusable for this expense!! They did fix all the problems promptly and I feel that the problems at this hotel are the managements fault.. there is no pool or hot tub either....as others have said all inquires seemed to be an annoyance for them. service is indeed spotty..the food was just OK not really up to Westin standards...the ritz is across the street ...the Westin needs to take an interest in upgradeing this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Disappoinments incl.”
Reviews.Author: timberlady
Reviews.Content: Although considered one of the best hotels in town, one is surprised by the unfriendly, impersonal service. The concierge feels sort of bothered by you and has a sour face. As gold members of Starwood we did NOT receive an upgrade, and had a tiny room, which was nice furnished , but without space. The location is great, so is the lobby where one has breakfast . Still, for my next visit I would choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Palace a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lylach
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 3-night stay at the Westin Palace during our honeymoon May 27-30, 2005. Curb appeal of this historic hotel is fantastic, especially when you see it from the Plaza de las Cortes. The location is fabulous, a few minutes from the Prado and Thyssen museums. We walked everywhere from the hotel, but there is a metro station practically right outside the door. The Madrid Vision tour buses have a stop right across the Plaza, so we literally saw the city and only had to walk across the street to do it. Our room didn't have a great view, but we loved the room nonetheless. The bed was SO comfortable, since it's a Heavenly Bed. There was a lot of closet space as well as an in-room safe. However, I was surprised to see that the shower was not separate from the bathtub and that the shower curtain was pretty flimsy and blew in on me when I took a shower. The toilet and bidee were in a separate "room" off the bathroom, but only behind a frosted glass door, so not very private if someone is getting ready at the bathroom counter. Also, the temperature was very hard to regulate. It was VERY warm in our room and didn't really cool to a comfortable temperature at night to sleep because it was so warm outside. The corridors were also VERY hot to walk down, with seemingly no ventilation. There is no ironing board and iron in the room and you have to call Service Express to have them bring you one. When we called, all of them were in use, so we had to steam our clothes in the shower to try to get out the wrinkles before going out for the evening. They finally brought one to us right before we walked out the door. We didn't dine in any of the hotel restaurants, so can't review those. We grabbed a light breakfast and coffee from the Starbucks that is located on the Plaza de las Cortes and walked to a cafe or restaurant for tapas and dinner every night. The Conceirge was very helpful with giving directions to different places that we inquired about. Overall, I definitely recommend this hotel to others to stay at while in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Marky London
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this hotel and yet again we had another excellent stay. Quick and efficient check in, friendly and helpful staff, spacious and faultless room with great bed and view, good buffet breakfast and all for 180 Euro a night (endless weekend rate). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Madrid over the weekend and enjoyed the city. The location of the hotel is perfect. We got a nice room overlooking the main street. The rooms are very spacious and the atmosphere of the hotel is lovely. We loved the wonderful lobby and the romantic bar. The hotel itself is very big. The only problem we dicovered is, that there are only 2 - 3 staff at the reception and you will have to wait to check-in or check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerNYNy
Reviews.Content: I just have to say that I completely disagree with the previous reviewer. "They are really trying...". I do not know what he means with that phrase but, for his information, the Palace has been opened since 1912... is not a recently opened, chain-like hotel. It is a charming European hotel!!! I am sorry to say but, during my stay, the only disappointing feature were the open mouths of some newly-rich persons coming accross the Atlantic eating the breakfast buffet as if it were the last piece of food on Earth... Service was excellent (all trained waiters with years of experience). Location is amazing and enviroment is a plus. This is not the Marriott... It is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Still dealing with jet lag”
Reviews.Author: Kitty-2004
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the states last night but wanted to let you know of what my views of the Westin Palace. It was on a luxury link package with room and dinner included. We stayed during the terrorism conference which couldn't have been busier. The staff was less than helpful. The room was tiny and thought we might have had some prestige being SPG members. Wrong! Room didn't even have 2 nice chairs to enjoy the small table for drinks. Room overlook the street with all the motor arcades that came in and out and in and out. It was never quiet. It is a very pretty place but I feel overrated. We stayed 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Madrid hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TarheelBred
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 9 day trip to Madrid with our two children. We stayed in the Westin Palace for two nights and we absolutely loved it! The hotel itself is beautiful, both inside and out. The beds are precisely as advertised- heavenly. After a long overseas flight to Madrid, they are much appreciated. The service was impeccable. And, the breakfast buffet in the morning offered something for everyone including typical Spanish food as well as scrambled eggs and bacon. All of this taken together with the prime location of the hotel (the Thyssen museum is literally right across the street- the Prado, a block away) really does make the Palace a prospect that is difficult to beat. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful westin”
Reviews.Author: mh16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for the ARCO show and I agonised over the choice of hotel for ages. Do we go urban funky or oldy worldy? In the end I chose the Westin Palace - and was very very glad I did. The only tiny tiny hitch was that when I checked in my requested fountain view room was not available (sigh: this always happens to me) however I was more than happy with the room and the breakfast was just fantastic (and served til late which is important in Madrid) I tested the patience of the concierge service many many times and they were faultless. It made it so much easier to get around. The location is great - you can walk just about anywhere. The bar itself is gorgeous sitting under the stain-glass dome. We had a nightcap there every evening. The waitstaff could not have been more helpful or professional the whole time. The room was very comfortable but oh the joy of the bed! Like sleeping inside a giant marshmallow (heavenly indeed). And my bathroom freebies - I mean accessories - were more than generous. Madrid can be difficult - and there is a huge choice of accommodation. I didn't find the Palace impersonal or too business-like for a holiday but it is a very large hotel. The benefits far outweighed any problems. eg just being able to jump in a cab and saying "palace hotel" and being taken straight there. The restaurant Cenador del Prado is 3 minutes away and worth going to as well. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: koala
Reviews.Content: We have stayed her one night in March. At arrival, while my husband was paying the taxidriver I had to take my own luggage from the cab. the bellman was too busy chatting to his collegue. No one who opened the door for us. Receptionist very unfriendly, did what she had to do and that was it. Impressive building, very classical. Small room wit all the basic facilities. At th SPG-floor. Makes it a difference ? Very less amenities, just shampoo, body lotion and soap. A/C did not work, very noisy street side, especially on a saturdaynight. Many drunk, young people shouting under our room. because A/C did not work we wanted to open the window, not possible because of noise. No make-up mirror in the bathroom. the didn't come for turn-down service so I had to ask for extra towels. We are SPG members but I did not receive one single benefit ! My husband was very ill, so I asked the concierge where the closest pharmacy was. She pointed one out, that was about 10 minutes walk. On the walk to this pharmacy I saw at least 2 other pharmacy's. Why didn't she pointed me these out ?? I had the feeling I asked to much. Breakfast was a very nice buffet but here also I had to ask for my second cup of coffee etc. No, for the money we have paid I know a lot better hotels in the world. We paid approximately USD 340 for one night including breakfast !! Next time while in Madrid we try the Ritz and I am sure there are a lot more nice hotels with better service !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, one of the best 5 star hotels I have ever stayed in. All the rooms have been upgraded. service is what you would expect from this standard of hotel. Great location -next to all of the main museums and the other top hotels where we dropped into for drinks. Will stay there again next time I am in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmartTraveller
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is classical and olde-worlde but what is so bad about that? Its also not cheap but that is not a crime. I'd swap the slickness of a "W" for the classy ambience of the Palace any old day plus scrape up the extra dollars I would need to stay there again. I spent a few heavenly days there..yes the bed was to die for and as I was severely jet lagged/exhausted, I spent considerable time in it! The room was fabulous - quiet and beautifully furnished. The location is also great - walk to the Prado or nip up the back of the hotel to one of the many tapas bars. I couldnt fault the service - attentive yet discreet. All in all - perfection. And no, I'm not wealthy - just discerning and I appreciate class, style and service.

Reviews.Title: “The long walk”
Reviews.Author: PatrickN
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel but the walk from the lift was nearly 150 metres to our room. Beautiful hotel with good food though the staff a can be a bit stand offish (especially the doorman who does not open the door for people wearng jeans) and aloof.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shevvy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in this lovely hotel and didn't want to leave. I had booked a very competive rate over the net and was expecting a shoebox room. Instead I was pleasantly surprised as it was a lovely room for the money. I didn't have breakfast included in the rate, but it was worth the price as it was very enjoyable to sit in the Rotunda and have the great buffet and people watch. In fact, people watching was the most enjoyable part of staying here as every time you came out of the lifts there was all sorts of things going on. I found the staff on the whole very friendly and efficient. All in all a very enjoyable experience to stay here and if I ever return to Madrid I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: mscarboroughusa
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed here in early November (we also stayed at the Alfonso XIII in Sevilla)- positives are...... great location near the museums- physically beautiful, including the rooms- restaurants (we only ate at ASIA, so I can't speak for the others, but both the service and food were great) negatives were...... concierge service was weak (although I did find (1) gentleman out of probably (4) that was friendly and somewhat helpful)- lack of king bed (they only have queens)- rooms can be far away from the elevator- overall- "above average" but I can't give an excellent rating unless the stay is pretty much flawless

Reviews.Title: “OK - Nothing else!”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Grossly overpriced. You are looked upon by most of the reception staff who probably make 25% of your annual income - never judge a book by its cover should be told to them. Broken tile in bedroom which was just renovated, but it could not be fixed as it was the weekend (reported it friday morning) and no one was avialable. As a SPG GOLD member, awful recognition and the WARM SMALL bottle of water on a HOT madrid summer day was rather tacky - ever heard of ICE! Breakfast - big and overpriced. if it was not included in my deal, head to the startbucks for good coffee. This is a hotel to say, 'I stayed here" like all the royalty etc, but NOT a hotel to return to if you ever visit. You can do much better in madrid. HOW do they ever class these hotels in Europe with 5 stars or even 4 stars compared to the best deals we get across North America & Canada. Only good thing about this hotel - the heavenly beds are to die for!

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: bobwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Palace for 5 nights at the end of October, on the whole I found it an extremely enjoyable experience, with just a few minor drawbacks. You cannot fail to be impressed by the entrance and the splendid "Rotunda", around part of which is the main restaurant. The food was excellent with an extensive and reasonably priced wine list (1996 reserve Rioja at 32 euros). The waiters became more friendly as they got to know us and their style of serving is very professional. It is a shame the breakfast staff are not as keen to provide a similar standard of service, a pot of coffee left on the table would have saved alot of irritation, instead of constantly trying to catch their eye for a top up...not a happy bunch. Overall though, a memorable stay in a lovely city ( The Madrid Vision buses offer a number of routes on different themes..13 euros for two days unlimited travel).

Reviews.Title: “Too old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Too classical. I prefere more modern hotels, but this one is supposed to be la creme de la creme amongst spanish hotels. If you like rococo, this is the place for you. Too expensive, although at great location close to the El Prado Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: denealio
Reviews.Content: Wow! As a Starwood Platinum member I'm likely spoiled by the amazing hotels and great service, but even the Westin Palace surprised me. As other reviewers mentioned, everything is top notch, and dont overlook the great gym, sauna and little sundeck on the top floor. The sundeck was a great place for my daily siesta! But on top of the hotel itself, the amazing part is the location. It's so close to the museums, shopping, busses, just about everything for a first time visitor to Madrid. (Just walk really quickly by the Planet Hollywood and Starbucks underneath the hotel.)

HotelInfo.Name: The Westin Palace Madrid
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza de las Cortes 7, 28014 Madrid, Spain
